His questions on the exams are not clear and the grading doesn't make sense. The exams are open note but that doesn't help. I would not recommend this class or this professor.

I don't know why there are so many people here rate him well, obviously, his class is difficult and hard to understand. PPT doesn't include all things, and his notes are hard to see clearly. His lecture is boring and messy, many times you don't know what he is talking about and want to sleep. Exams are heavy, grade only depends on 3 exams.
Good teacher. All tests were open note

Hands down the best lecturer I have had at Ohio State. The class seemed like a boring topic, but somehow Prof Doetsch was able to make every single class extremely interesting. Entire class graded on 3 exams, and all material comes from lectures. You can use notes on exams, but they tend to be little help due to the length. Unbelievable professor.

Dr. Doetsch is an amazing professor. He shows how the materialism of Marx actually is applicable to economics problems of the past and present. Not to say he is a Marxist- he does not inject polarizing politics into his lectures. A testament to the power of data. He is invested in his students and it was a privilege to have him as a professor.

Dr. Doetsch is the best professor I've had at OSU so far. He made the class super interesting and engaging. He was always seeking student thoughts on the subject matter and tried to make the content as relevant as possible, providing numerous contemporary examples of economic issues. There are few powerpoints and most info is written on the board.

Professor Doetsch is awesome. You definitely have to go to every class, because the class is 4 exams and 10 online quizzes, all based solely on his lectures. He's hilarious and kind of quirky. Go to class and you'll be fine. Work hard and your grade will reflect that.

Dr. Doetsch is a fantastic professor. He has very engaging lectures and makes the class fun and interesting. His tests can be difficult, but they are not impossible. Overall, I would recommend taking a class with him.

Dr. Doetsch is a great professor and his lectures are always very interesting. His tests are pretty hard though, harder than you'd expect. Homeworks sometimes don't line up with what we did in class so I personally had to use the internet sometimes to figure things out. Overall, would recommend

This was a great class, but you definitely need a solid background in economics before you take it. You are graded on three exams and ten online quizzes, so it's a to come back from a rough start. You have to come to lecture, and during lecture, you need to take detailed notes. Exams require you to basically memorize all content.

Definitely the most entertaining professor I've ever had. Very enthusiastic and interesting lectures, and he obviously loves teaching and knows Economics well. Tests aren't a breeze, but are always very fair, and he tells you exactly what to study.

one of the best teachers i had at OSU. You can tell he enjoys what he does. He's a fair grader and allows everyone to improve their grades through extra credit. Come to class and take detailed notes or you won't pass. He lets you use your notes on exams, but don't be fooled you'll have to study harder. I took 4140, will be taking 4130 with him.
He is a great lecturer, but the grade is 100% depends on 3 big exams. Just trying to memorize all and you will be fine. Hard to get an A but easy to get a B.

If you take good notes (don't type them out) and show up to class, getting an A is completely doable. He gives several extra credit opportunities. The labor market report takes a ton of time but it's actually pretty fun to work on and his grading is very fair. Great class with probably one of the best professors in the department.

His lectures are fun and you'll learn a lot. However, the only grades you have are based on tests and on test days he is not your friend. In fact, his tests are so jammed-packed with questions that he makes it next to impossible to get to every question. He sets impossible standards for getting a half-way decent grade.

I will definitely take his class again. Dr. Ethan's class is hilarious and inspirational, taking his students to the edge of the knowledge. Even though his exams may require some readings, A is not hard to get if you really pay attention to what he says in lecture. Don't always blame professor as if not working hard is not your fault.

Best Econ professor I have ever had. I found his lectures pretty entertaining and despite the challenging exams I would definitely take again. Exams were open note but I recommend only using your notes as a last resort because you will not have enough time if you rely on them.

SB teacher. Super nan. Good lecturer, but the hardest test I have ever taken. The longest report I have ever written. I don't understand why he can be rated so high on this website. His lecture is good, but he doesn't write down a lot of notes. You have to read the whole book to prepare the test and the practice doesn't help at all.

Doetsch is a very knowledgeable professor. His classes are very inspirational and interesting, which make students concentrate. However, tests are hard, and the whole grade is counted on the three tests. No curve. If you screwed one test, getting an A is impossible. That's not cool.

I would recommend every student take a class with Dr. Doetsch. He is an economics professor but at least one of his courses does not have a pre-requisite (Econ 3048 - Ethics in Economics). He is fair in his policies but unwavering. You must earn your grade but it isn't hard to do so. I also had him for 4130 and 4140 previously.

Dr. Doestch is very passionate about Economics and this really shows. I enjoyed listening to his lectures, but the exams are rather challenging. I took this class hoping for an easy A, but that was not the case. If you are passionate about Economics or are able to dedicate a good amount of time to this course, take it. If not, take regular!

Doetsch is easily the best professor in the department. His lectures are easy to follow, engaging, and sometimes entertaining. If you show up and pay attention to lecture, you'll pass with flying colors. Take any class of his that you can.

Probably the best professor I have had yet at OSU! His lectures are great, easy to understand, and he makes all the material very interesting. He is a tough grader, but he posts study guides, and makes sure to review material. He is easy to understand, and structures the class in a very logical way.

I took Doetsch's freshman seminar about wage because it seemed interesting and I heard great things about him online. It was by far my favorite class, and he was my favorite professor in my first semester at OSU. He learns everyone's name, is very organized, and grades fairly. There is only one short assignment a week, perfect for a 1 credit hour.

He is so knowledgeable and passionate. This course is not so easy for me but I really enjoy it. I gained a lot from this course even though I can hardly get an A. We love him so much! Some students even choose his other courses for they like him so much. Easy A if you can follow him during the lectures. No homework.
Gives any and all the information you'll need for the exams in lecture, with many many examples for each type of problem. Very helpful and responds quickly to emails.
Doetsch is very fair

Dr. Doetsch is the best lecturer I have had so far. He is really good at explaining textbook jargon by using easy to understand examples. The class was graded only on exams, but the lowest score was dropped so you could afford to have one slip-up. On low attendance days, he would give out extra credit, so come to every lecture!

Dr. Doetsch is great! His classes can be difficult but rewarding. You will certainly learn a lot. If you come to class, take notes, and participate in some discussions you will do fine. When I took the course, the tests were completely essay but graded on a rubric to see if you included key material to gain more objectivity.

Dr. Doetsch is very knowledgeable & I learned a lot from his lectures. His tangents are both informative & entertaining. He moved very fast in lectures due to time constraints, so stay awake and write quickly to keep up. 3 exams & 10 homework assignments make up the final grade. Rarely gives out extra credit, but when he does it's 1 point.

Great lecturer who always provides intriguing arguments with evidence for and against scholars' papers. There's 3 open note exams and no other grades so you really have to do well on them to get an A which can be a problem. If you simply go to every class and pay attention, you will do really well

No homework. No projects. Only thing graded in the class our three exams. He takes your best exam score out of the three and puts it in a second time to help your grade. Offers random extra credit points for showing up to class. Interesting lectures and genuinely interested in teaching students. All exams are open note and if you go you will pass.

Proffesor Doetsch is hilarious, and teaches a lot because of it. Don't worry though, his class was such that if you payed attention during the lecture you simply had to regurgitate it to get an A, there wasn't much thought involved. But you still learn a lot.

If you have the option of taking Dr. Doetsch's class, do it. He's a great lecturer and conveys material in a clear way. I had him for ECON 3048 and the class was both relatively easy and interesting. If you go to class and take good notes you'll be golden because all his exams are open note.

Great lecturer who makes class enjoyable. Very smart man and passionate about what he teaches. Assigns a fair amount of reading, but everything you need to know is in the lectures. Go to class, take detailed notes, and the exams won't be a problem.

In retrospect, this class was really easy. His three tests are all open note so all you have to do is go to class everyday and take diligent notes; write down everything he says. Briefly read over your notes the night before exams and refer back to them as needed. Not only easy, but extremely interesting. Go to class to get those extra cred points!

I recommend taking class with this professor. He is energetic, smart and hilarious. He is well prepared and is willing to help. If you attend his lectures and take notes, you will get at least a B, if not A. I was intimidated ny some negative comments about him before taking the class but I got an A-, so all you have to do is work hard.

I've taken 2367, 4130, and 4140 from this guy, and they all were awesome.  Best lecturer I've had at OSU.  If you are good at essay type exams this is the class for you!  That being said, you don't have to be an amazing write, as long as you can convey main points in coherent sentences you will be fine.  Take his classes, you won't regret it.
You'll love him on every day except for exam day.

one of my favorite profs at OSU! The material is a bit tough, but if you go to class, his lectures are really clear and extremely helpful. His exams have essays, and they can be hard. But most students do well in his class, and he's a great professor. Also, just going to class with this guy is fun, it's an enjoyable 55 minutes.

Also 2367 and 4130. Highly Recommended. His lectures are energetic. COME TO CLASS. He makes the material interesting and makes you think. He presents a theory and then completely tears it apart. He loves making jokes in class so there are always laughs. The in-class essay tests are no joke. Prepare. You work for what you get, but it's worth it.
Don't count on this guy helping you out in any way.

His clarity is nonexistent and also somehow is able to grade 200 papers in 2-3 days which leaves me skeptical. He grades you on how he feels that day. He makes it as hard as possible and tries to drown his students with information so students don't know what will be expected of them on the exams. He rounds down with his grades which nobody does.
Gives open note blue book exams that are still impossible to do well on because he is looking for one small detail of what we have learned through the semester.

One of the best ECON professors you can have. He is extremely clear with what will be on exams, he explains concepts well, and he makes class enjoyable at 8 AM. The economics and ethics class was extremely interesting and I would highly recommend it.

Amazing lecturer. Requires a lot of reading and going to class is very important - handwritten notes are allowed for tests! He'll make you work for your grade, but you'll learn a lot and he will make it interesting.
He is a really mean professor. You would not get helpful feedback from him and I do suggest that do not take his class. Great lecturer, but not a good professor.

I took econ 4140 and he is very good and clear about the topic he is teaching. good grading criteria. and not very hard test yet you understand the material. If you do not miss the lecture and took notes it should be fairly easy class. He is funny and yet clear about the material he is teaching

I took four class with Ethan and he is one of the best professors at OSU. The class is interesting. Exam is open note but the timeframe makes you need to familiar with most of the concepts. Great experience.
He is the best professor ever! take one of his class and you will know

His exams can be difficult with the time restraint. Other than that he is a very good professor. Go to class and you will be fine. He teaches things in his lectures that are not in the book so actually go! I would definitely recommend his class!
Great lecturer.  Wants to be a professor and it shows.  Lectures are always entertaining.  Open Note exams, so take good notes and you shouldn't have a problem getting a B at worst.

If you need to take a 5000-level ECON course, look no further. The course is intellectually stimulating and fascinating if you're into it. Open notes for exams mean you do fine IF YOU DO THE STUDY GUIDE. Bonus is offered throughout. No reason to get lower than a B, and an A is attainable if you work hard.

Ethan is one of my favorite professors at Ohio State! He explains things really well and makes sure things are not too complicated. You don't need the book but you need to go to class. The exams were really fair and open notes. He also has an awesome sense of humor and I'm trying to take a class with him again!
Good lecturer although attendance is not needed if you get the book. Exams are all essay but you can have notes. The project requires a lot of work too but you have the option to work with a partner.

I took three classes with him. He is always well prepared for the material and his exams are all open notes, so you don't need to memorize too much. He is also very fun with a special sense of humor. Highly recommend him!

Best lecturer I have had at OSU.  Highly recommend him. Pay attention take good notes because both the mid-term and final were open note.  His style of teaching increased my level of interest in economics.
One of the best professors I've had. Good sense of humor and a pretty easy grader. The only negative is his voice is very load which sucks for morning classes.

Very cool guy. He has a sarcastic sense of humor but it makes the class much more interesting. You don't really need to buy the book or do the readings as long as you kinda pay attention in class and read over the slides a couple times prior to the exam and you'll be fine.  I would recommend him and you'll be in for a good class

Probably the best professor I have had at OSU. Now it was mainly a writing class so I cannot speak of how hard he would make exams, but he did not grade papers too hard. He is a really nice guy, helpful, and encourages class participation. I would take the class again if I could

Dr. Ethan is a nice guy. He is funny and always has energy to teach. He is easy to understand in class and follow what he is saying. However his exams are confusing. I would not recommend him, but if you must take him, its not that bad. Generally 3 tests for the whole semester.  Not mandatory attendance, but extra credit 10+ points.

summary_comment: Professor Chen receives mixed reviews; while some students praise his leniency, clear exam structure, and helpfulness, others find his teaching ineffective and confusing, with one student describing him as the "worst professor" they've ever had. Similarly, Professor Hui-Jun is noted for his helpfulness and provision of answers, which allows for high grades, but is criticized for poor lecturing and low-level instruction. Overall, his teaching quality varies widely among students.

Ratings.comment: Taking professor Chen for 4002.01 (couldn't edit course code in description). There's no reason Mr. Chens rating should be less than a 5/5. Super lenient. Course content is tough and he makes it as easy as possible. Exams are online as well and you get the whole day to do it. Great professor

Taking him for intermediate macroeconomic theory.  Originally signed up with a different professor but somehow got stuck with him.  To keep it short it is unbelievable this guy is allowed to be a professor at Ohio State.  He is actually so bad at teaching. It is almost laughable how bad he is. OSU needs to fire him this is so sad.
The worst professor I ever had. He don't know what he is doing.

He gives u homework and gives u the answers, and the exams are the exact same homework problems with the same answers. literally just keep track of the questions and answers and you should get a 100% in his class
Worst learning experience I have ever had

Hui-Jun barely speaks any English and was a terrible lecturer. However he gives you every single answer before things are turned in (including exams), so everyone should get 100% in his class. Nice guy, but terrible teacher.

This teacher is so nice, always answering my emails (questions) in a timely manner, helping me a lot in my studies and fueling my passion for economics! ! ! I'm going to take his class next semester, and it's really helpful for me! ! !

Never take a class with this professor, he is the absolute worst professor I have ever had. He jokes the whole time and then expects you to read at least 150 pages per week. He is not teaching an intro economics class. In fact, he told me he wasn't, although the course is an intro class. And don't ask for help or you will get scrutinized.

a genuine waste of my time. the tests and quizzes are nothing like the book or the lectures, you could go to every single one, read every single word, take and redo and restudy notes and still fail. quite literally impossible. he teaches the class like its a 4000 level and not an intro course

summary_comment: The professor's lectures are consistently described as dry and unengaging, with excessive detail that often goes beyond what is necessary for exams. While the class is noted to be relatively easy with a generous extra credit system and opportunities to drop assignments, many students find the teaching style ineffective and the presentations monotonous and difficult to follow. Students also report issues with the professor's clarity and engagement during lectures, suggesting a lack of enthusiasm and poor delivery.

Ratings.comment: Lectures were incredibly dry and filled with lots of useless details and information. Exams were extended response and had a high expectation for details that she would call out in her lectures.
Lectures are dry and unhelpful - better to teach yourself using the pricey textbook and homework. Luckily, the class is easy, and Unstuck ai can help with study prep.
Easy grading system. High extra credit with lots of chances of dropping assignments.

Hardly could hear when she spoke. She slurred her words and often cancelled class. Presentations have information but filled with so much useless information takes a long time to go through it and presentation theme is so boring, paying attention is difficult.

She just terrible, she just read trough her lecture and she stops a lot, a lot, she mumbled through a lot of things, She just a terrible at reading her lecture. She does not familiar with her materials. She asked to buy the books, and the book was written by her. The book is not necessary at all. She just make us to buy book so she can make money.s

She obviously did not want to be there. Loves trailing off and facing the board the whole time. Reads off the PowerPoint. Posts the slides without blanks filled in so you can't study anything you missed. If you miss something she says good luck with your notes. Uses 3rd party software for homework so it's not on Carmen. The class was easy though.

No respect. Rude, unaccommodating, boring. So hard to stay awake. Reads off ppt, doesn't post notes/go over hw. No fluctuation voice, slow, monotone "um...the trade deficit..was..umm" Like don't you know what you're talking about? Encourages people to not take the final even when grade could improve? Avoid taking w her.

Very nice person and very accessible, but not a good teacher. Lectures are droning and read straight off of dense, paragraph-filled slides while most of the class goes on Twitter. I really like economic history and found it hard to stay awake. Not bad if you're looking for an easy A (if you put in a little effort), but man it was boring.
ppt reader
Rude. Inaccessible. Acts like someone pissed in her cheerios every morning when you ask her a question. (I took this in the Fall when the weather is nice so no excuse for seasonal mood swing)

Easy class as she gives us like 12% of extra points. You need to go to lecture everytime to take notes and the tophat questions could be found on google, you just need to follow every question. She gives a great chance of dropping lowest grade of homework and test, so do well in the beginning you won't need to take final.
DO NOT TAKE HER COURSE! She never care about her students, even you tell her about your delimma and difficulties, she will not care about it. Just do not choose her course.

I taught myself through this class. If you dont go to class you will not get notes and no zoom for you even if you give a valid reason. Skips over notes and even after asked atleast 25 times she will not upload the notes for students to read them. If you missed them good luck learning from a textbook that you have to pay $75 for.

Does not care about students, reads off from slides, if you miss the lecture good luck trying to catch up, have to pay almost $100 for a textbook and homework, a lot and lot of homework, very test heavy, have to teach yourself, no help in office hours either, you can clearly see that she does not care even when giving the lecture

She's awful. Talks about how she needs to randomly cancel class to tend to her sick daughter but then when a student needs accommodations she could not care less. If you email her she will never respond, so good luck. Test heavy, TopHat heavy. Lectures are pointless, reviews for exams are useless, Molly Cooper is clearly in it for the paycheck.

BAD good professor at all. No care for students understanding and not understand any of your reasons if you miss something. YOU HAVE TO PAY for textbooks and homework. FOR HOMEWORK!! almost $100 and not use textbook ever. dont know what she is teaching and you will have to teach yourself if you want the grade for hw bc she wont cover all material.
If you do tophat questions, you will pass.

Does not care for students. Also does not seem to understand the material that she is teaching which makes it difficult to follow and understand. Seems to try and figure out the material being taught as she goes.

Probs one of the worst professors Ive had. Never went over hw or math and felt like she was never prepared for the class. Taught myself tbh, the book barely helps w the hw that she never goes over or teaches. Got a good grade but thats all me, and the extra credit and the stuff she takes out of the grade book helps too.
If true extra credit is not shown until the final week, whats the meaning of the freaking extra credit?
The worst professor I had ever met in OSU. And she totally worth for the score rated.
If you do well on the tophat, midterms, and you do the packsacks each week, you should end the course with an A- or A and you will not need to take the final.

Shes hard grader. She and the TA had double standards on grading exams. They even grade the multiple choices questions differently. So be ready to hold on to your luck if you take her course. Zero motivation to teach. Not accessible at all. She DOES NOT care about her students. She had bad attitude when student ask her questions.

I had Molly Cooper for ECON 4140 (Economic History of the Americas). The course consisted of Top Hat, weekly Packback, two midterm exams, and a final exam. The course was conducted online, and the midterm exams and final exam were proctored via Respondus. Top Hat questions were due before the start of lecture, so class attendance was not mandatory.
Bad attitude when you send email to her. Doesn't want to help student at all. Have to write essay during exam and really tough grade you will get. Borning lecture and barely can get any curve.

HORRIBLE JUST NO MORE WORDS!!!!!!! BORRING LECTURES AND ZERO MOTIVATION TO TEACH. SHE GRADES THE EXAMS AS AS IF EVERYONE IS A GRAD STUDENT. PLEASE DONT TAKE THIS CLASS OR GET READY TO WRITE A WHOLE ESSAY ON EXAMS. GOOD LUCK

First, molly's class is very boring and you don't need to go to the class. She gives you a review one week before the exam, and choose some question from the review to the test. I don't know why she always gives us the review just one week before the exam, for the final, 20 long questions on the review are very hard to remember in 1 week.

Do not take this class she is a terrible professor and does not care about her students. The people that rated her as a good professor do not know what they are talking about, she is the worst professor I have ever had. Her lectures are like going to a movie in the 60s no one wants to see that anymore as they are extremely boring and look hideous.

Horrible course. The exam for this semester has some changes and become even harder than before. Even though most of exam answer can be found in Internet, you have to take lots of time to remember and the worst thing is those answers will not help you get A, or even A-. DONT TAKE THIS COURSE.

Molly was quite possibly the worst professor I have ever had at OSU. She cared very little for her students and graded her tests using extremely specific criteria. The homeworks were also poorly structured becuase the homework questions were just the questions at the end of each chapter. Each chapter being anywhere from 15-45 pages.

She is a tough grader but fair. The reviewer below me doesn't know what they are talking about because we have only gotten out of class early like twice. Exams are all extended response so prepare to read a lot to prepare.

She is, hands down, the worst professor I've ever had at Ohio State. She doesn't care about her students, only about her paycheck. Class usually lasts about 20 minutes and she drags through it like she has something better to do. She hates seeing her students do well and grades so harshly with no explanation. DO NOT take ANY class with her.

either you take 4 tests weighted 25% each or top 3 tests for 60% and a 40% final. She gives a comprehensive review a week in advance to prepare, have of the material ends up on the test. Interesting class if you enjoy history and mildly like econ

Absolutely horrible professor. Clearly does not teach because she enjoys it but because its what she gets paid to do. Her lectures are awful and you will get nothing from them. She makes you buy a textbook for over $120 that you will not even need. However, the class itself is pretty easy.

Cooper's lecture is boring while you no need to go to each lesson as long as you can make sure you will review her PPTs before exams. Homeworks all based on her book so you have to buy her book, but the only top score will be counted in your score. There is a lot of content to memorize, but exams are still very simple.
Taking 4130 will be the best decision you ever made

Even I got an A for sure, I still wish no one in the future should choose her class, she does no deserve to be a professor, force you to buy her fxxking stupid textbook, stupid unhelpful HW, and after all, the exam that will do nothing but waste your time to memorize her boring PPT.

She forces you to purchase her book, which is very poorly written, and you have to use it for the homeworks. (Where you have to pick out specific information that is hard to find) Lectures consist of her repeating notes off slides and getting out as fast as possible. It seems like she just doesn't care at all and is just there because she has to be

This class was incredibly dry and essentially useless.  We covered little to no information that is not basic current events.  The lectures were a joke and you just have to show up to answer Tophat questions.  There are many papers but they are really short and easy.  There is one big final paper and a big group project - both are relatively easy.

Molly's a decent prof. I had her for Econ 4130 & 4140 - got a B+ in both courses. You're not graded on a ton of things (both classes were homework, a few quizzes, a midterm and final and I think for 4140 we had to write a small paper 5 pages), so try to do a solid job on everything b/c if you tank one thing (especially a test) it will hurt you!

Dr. Cooper is by far my favorite professor in the Econ department. You can tell she really cares about the subject matter and her students. Very easy to relate to and explains the material in a fun way.

Not a particularly difficult class but if you take a class with Molly, at some point you will become frustrated with her. She has a temper and is very monotone and boring during lecture. Homework is easy but her exams are challenging because the grading is volatile and extremely specific. Hopefully you have exactly what she wants.

The amount of work i have put into this class is insane, especially since i only got a C+... we are expected to memorize 15 answers to long essay questions that are given a few days before the exam, which is extremely difficult because just figuring out the specific answer she wants is impossible. Also, the homework is very difficult and tedious.

Every midterm has 7 questions taken from a possible bank of 15. she gives you the questions beforehand but doesn't say which ones will be on the test. In order to get an a on the test you must memorize every answer. does not post notes, and just sits up in front of class reading off of a word document, you take notes on your computer.
Lots of writing in this class, but I've become a much better writer as a result. She's a tough grader, but Dr. Cooper is very good at preparing for potential graduate school writing.

Got mad at students for being late 1st day. I've done every homework assignment and have yet to receive a 100% on an assignment. She gives you exam reviews Of 15 essay questions and you have to memorize 7 of them. She loves specifics and examples. Lectures are boring and types the notes during class. Disrespectful to students with questions.

She gives you 10 questions and asks 5 on the exam, but it is not necessarily easy memorizing 10 essay questions. You need to go to class for the notes and the questions are straightforward its just hard to get a perfect score on all the questions and she does not curve the class.

This class is the most straightforward class I've taken at OSU. She gives you 10 essay questions, you need to memorize 5 PERFECTLY. The lectures make me want to eat a knife, but you really need to go in order to get the notes because the exam questions are answered in full during lectures. Easy A if you try at all. Find online version of the book.

She is the worst teacher I have ever had at Ohio State. She is not resourceful. Only thing she does to teach is write on a word document and you copy it. Her grading is ridiculous. If you ask her a question she feels like your wasting her time. WORST TEACHER EVER. If you sign up for her course, drop it right away!!!!!!

In lecture, Dr. Cooper stands behind a podium and types additions to her lecture notes. The only way to copy them all down is to copy them into your notes on your laptop. She gives out Exam Reviews 2 days before the exam which consist of  10 essay questions. 5 appear on the actual exam and if you don't have exactly what she wants, you lose points.

Terrible class EVER! DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! She does not assign any homeworks nor take attendance. Her test was so tough, you need to memorize everything from her lecture notes, which were not posted online, literally  you need to memorize 20 more pages notes for her tests. She gives 4 mid terms plus final. The worst class I have ever taken!

I think Molly really lacks a passion about what she is teaching. Her tests are tough in that you have to be EXTREMELY specific. The class is easy if you have the time to memorize 10 essay questions for each test & you have to get the notes from class to do so. The homework was pointless & didn't help w/ anything and you have to buy HER book for it.

Worst teacher at Ohio State. You think this class is going to be really easy but it's the complete opposite. Takes off points from your tests even if you give an answer straight from the notes. If you ask why she took off points she gives no explanation. Zero passion to teach and not helpful whatsoever. Shows up, reads off a word doc, and leaves.

Her lecture notes are typed into a word document while she reads them off. For me it was hard to keep up because she went pretty fast. She does pause to explain things, though. For tests, she gives reviews with 10 possible questions and picks 5. Do the reviews, memorize them, and you should do well. Make sure to attend class, she doesn't post notes

The most boring, monotone lecturer I've ever had.  Never have I sat in a class and thought the teacher had less interest in the class than the students did.  Tests an be easy if you take the time to study because she gives you the questions that will be on the test.  Go to class, take notes, spend a decent amount of time studying, and you get an A.

Honestly if you don't get an A in this class there must be something wrong. Show up, fill in the guided notes, fill out the study guides (which are the exact questions on the exam), memorize the study guide word for word. Boom. I thought she knew the subject matter well and could answer any questions you had relating to it in class.

hi this class is easy and simple and she makes it easier by giving you notes. do not forget the lecture and notes all the question are answered in the lecture and do not by the book at all I did and never used it its waste of money

Grade is 6 position papers (2-3 pages about current economic issues) which aren't hard and a 10 page final papers, with some participation points mixed in. If you are a good writer you will do well. She gives a lot of feedback about your final paper so that isn't too bad either.

WORST professor EVER!!! I thought it should be fun and easy. Molly Cooper showed no passion to the class. Getting a really low grade even I did well in the midterms. Tried to ask questions and she was mean and helpless. The grades were not fair because I got points deducted even I memorized the notes. Don't take her class!!
Turrible.  Just turrible.

This was the worst class I have taken at Ohio State. Molly Cooper should NOT be a professor at this University. I attended every class, actively took notes, and studied, but for the first two midterms I got a C and D. I went to her office hours one time and she was no help at all on helping me understand what kind of answers she was looking for.
It was a hard class. Although you memorized almost every point, you will also lost points without explanation. Not Recommended.

Thought the class would be interesting prior to taking it. I couldn't have been more wrong. All she does is read the notes out loud as she types them; then she gives exams on notes. You can answer exam questions literally word-for-word from the notes and still lose points without any explanation. If you're an Econ major, take a different elective.
Worst Teacher. Boring topic. Bad exam, helps you nothing.

Molly Cooper is probably the worst professor I've had at OSU. She would pull up a word document and then read as she typed, and that was her lecture. It was mind numbingly boring. I can't even express to you how boring and awful this class was. I am an econ major and I look it because I thought it might be interesting, worst decision I've ever made

She is boring, and will occasionally mark points off your work without much reason or consistency.  However, you stand a very good chance to get an A/A- if you do the work and show up to class (attendance is not mandatory, per se, but she does use an online quiz thing to give "attendance" type points).

If you want an easy A, take this course (Freakonomics) and don't ever attend class. She distributes test answers a few days before the tests as a study guide, then selects a few of these. Her lectures are boring to the point of nausea and she isn't understandable unless you sit in the first row. I hated this class with a passion.

She makes the class very easy. Copy notes off the board and your good. However it is obvious that she barely knows the subject matter that she is teaching. She is a disagreeable person and for some awkward reason has a hard time keeping a steady loudness when speaking to the class. Easy A while dealing with a horrible teacher.

Do not even bother buying the textbook.  Go to class and religiously write down everything she says.  She will give 20 possible essay questions for each test and choose 10 randomly.  Answers come straight from the notes, so answer the questions first and then memorize.  Easy A as long as you take the time to memorize a night or two before.

Dont get book. Just 3 midterms and a Final. Pure memorization. Really easy class an 8th grader could get an A. Only work done was doing study guide couple days before exam and studying it bc she picks 10 questions from that. Take if you want an A, up to you if you want to learn anything from it.

She reads directly off of her Word documents in class. There are study guides with all the possible questions for the tests, but no one got a 100% on either midterm or the final. That seems impossible to me if she teaches the material well enough.

I took her for Econ 515 and Econ 516. I got a B in 515 and B+ in 516. Nice lady. Has lecture notes on Carmen but there are large gaps b/c once you get to class, you will be writing a lot! Skim notes after class and read the book as needed. She gives you study guides and exams are online, so you can have your book and notes with you.

Absolutely terrible. Avoid at all costs! She is a terrible lecturer and her tests are 100% essays. I left every midterm thinking I got an upper 90%, only to receive low 80's a week later. She is inconsistent with her grading almost to the point that it's illegal.Took this class with a friend and would have same answers and get different scores.

Unlike some prior reviews, this teacher did -not- give questions in advance and wanted answers that were directly from lecture, not existing in hard-copy anywhere. Future court stenographers did the best. Top this with a unusually monotone, sleep-inducing delivery. Wow. Lost my 4.0gpa to this class.
She's not that interested in the class, but she makes it easy. She rarely goes the whole time. take it for an easy A.
Pretty easy stuff.  Class rarely went to bell.  Kind of boring.  Exams all essay and I would say that writing more BS is preferred to getting right to the point of the question
Very easy class, she hardly ever goes the full class time and is sometimes done within 20 minutes. The study guides give you the exact questions in advance.
The class is boring, she seems bored giving the lectures.  She just reads her outlines.  But the tests are really easy b/c she gives an exact study guide of whats going to be on the test

Print the lecture notes and show up to class ready to write as much as you can. Write a lot because she gives you the questions to exams and they come directly from the lecture notes. You do not need to purchase or read the textbook at all. If you need assistance go to office hours and she will help. This class is purely memorization.

The grading system is a little unfair, though she does curve the class.  The exams are basically memorization tests.  Go to class, however boring, and take notes and be able to memorize them for the tests and you should be fine.

Everyday I showed up to class with a positive attitude hoping to learn something new and everyday I was slapped down into apathy.  Her outlines make no sense.  I can't read her handwriting.  She mumbles to the board instead of lecturing to the class.  She has no command of the subject.  She is horribly uninspiring!
Very good teacher, exams are short answer questions and an essay. But very helpful teacher just pay attention in class and you'll do well. Her quote is "I only give questions not answers"

Class is basically framed around issues in 'Taking Sides'.  You write 5 2-3 page papers and one term paper.  As long as you go to class for the debates, you will have more than enough to write a paper.  She is good grader also.
Her notes are so unclear that you're better off reading the two books and ignoring her notes. The only benefit is she gives you all of the possible test questions the week before the exam.
okay, teacher. likes to laugh at her own jokes

dr. cooper is nice, but it doesn't make up for the low quality of teaching. yes, the tests themselves are easy and yet the class average turned out to be a C. Manner of lecture was dry, (flat out boring) and seemed not to want to be in class at any chance she got. Reads her prepared notes almost verbatim and doesn't elaborate one bit. dissappointin

Prof. Cooper does not care about teaching this class. She posts low-quality outlines on the Internet and reads them word-for-word in lecture--with no elaboration. If you seek elaboration from her after class, she misses the mark again. Watch 'Guns, Germs, and Steel'--a PBS documentary--but do not take this class. You will be disappointed.
Good class not to difficult just a fair amount of work

Teacher has a wide base of knowledge but does not teach it in a way that would make someone already not interested stay away from economics forever. Exam questions are precise and given before the test which is nice but the information never quite stuck with me from the class so it made it slightly hard.

She may not be the best professor in economics but she certainly is the easiest.READ THIS.. HER MIDTERMS COME FROM THE REVIEW QUESTIONS SHE GIVES 4-5 DAYS BEFORE THE EXAM.SHE GIVES 20 QUESTIONS IN THE REVIEW FROM WHICH ASKS 12 ON THE MIDTERM.its and easy A class. Dont miss it.
Pretty easy... a term paper, 3 two page papers and a group presentation/debate. Good choice for 2nd writing course

Read this very carefully.  She may not be the best prof, but she makes the class extremely easy.  If you want an easy A, take her.  If you want to be enlightened and would like a challenge, take Accounting.
I could learn more from a rock.  Seriously, i mean she is the worst lecturer of all time.

Absolutely the worst lecturer ever!  Unless you enjoy trying to look around her to see the overhead while she stares at it and reads direcly off of it DON'T take her as a prof!  Seriously, she just sits on the corner of the desk within arms reach of the projector and reads from it.  every once and awhile she'll turn around and read from the screen.

She didn't give a huge workload for a second writing course.  She offers to review all papers before the due date so you should end up with a decent grade if you take advantage of this.   The lectures are just for listening purposes, don't take notes unles
I had her for 515 and she is very straight forward.    You just have to do the assignments and you will be fine.  She is really nice and really reasonable, too.

Notes were not the best, 367.02 was definately the better of the two classes and the one she seemed more suited for. 515 notes were very lacking and tests were pretty tough. 367.02 was a lot of writing. Both classes could be extremely boring.
She is nice, semi workload,only 1 term paper, 1 presentation and 4 2-pages paper.  free to go to class.
She is a really nice person.  The class seems pretty straight-forward and for the most part easy.  I don't think this class is boring at all.
Material was semi-boring, outline notes online, if you actually go to lecture, she writes detailed notes on board.  Very easy material, very easy A-B, no studying necessary, just go to class.
Class was boring. She is fair and helpful.

Her notes are online but there is nothing to them. It is almost pointless to go to class because she either reads directly off them or talks too fast to write anything down. She gives you all the potentail questions before hand but its difficult finding the answers to them because her notes are slim
Easy class, lecture notes online.
No Comments

Not a very good lecturer at all.  One of the most boring classes I've ever had.  She made the material even more boring by simply summarizing it in class and then at the end she would ask stupid questions to a half-dead room of students.
She is terrible but class is easy. Worst lecturer I've had but I got a high A and only went to class to take exams.

summary_comment: Professor Xiaomin Bian is generally considered a poor teacher, known for her dull and lengthy lectures that lack enthusiasm and real-world application. Students find her classes monotonous and often recommend skipping them in favor of self-study using the textbook. While some acknowledge her knowledge of the subject matter, her teaching style is widely criticized for being unengaging and ineffective.

Ratings.comment: well, i wouldn't recommend this instructor. she's not difficult conceptually (it's just micro). but she's not a good teacher. she feels like a total academic with little if any real world experience. and i didn't feel like she enjoyed teaching - it was a grind for her and the students. use the book and skip the class or you'll be so bored.

It would be hard to recommend Xiaomin Bian. I had her for 202. She has no enthusiasm for the subject. Her classes are a grind - dull and long. Truthfully, I'd skip the lectures, follow the text and take the tests. And be glad when it's over. She's not a good instructor and the classes are dreary.

Professor Xiaomin Bian is an ok teacher. I believe she knows economics pretty well but her lectures are quite dull. She primarily drives towards math solutions and you can sometimes forget the point. Like you know how to follow the steps but don't know why it matters. She's nice though - not mean and grades fairly. Just dull.

My class with Xiaomin Bian was canned lectures. Her lectures were long, dull. Her material was taken directly from 2 prominent textbooks. We had 3 office hours per week. If you like to study on your own and are just paying for a credential, she may be ok. If you expect your teacher to teach, it's a fail. She is a mediocre lecturer at best.

Prof. Bian knew her stuff but man, sitting through her lectures was torture. She rambles about the simplest concepts forever and then I would be missing concepts during the homework and quizzes/exams. If you take her, I recommend going over the textbook before you watch her lectures. Or maybe just skip the lectures and read the text.

It feels like Professor Bian did not care about teaching this class at all. The pre-recorded lectures from last spring felt impersonal and met the bare minimum amount of teaching. Although the work was not hard, the lectures were EXTREMELY long and time-consuming. Overall, I recommend taking this class in person with any other professor.

Although it technically had a scheduled meeting time, she made the class asynchronous. I didn't watch any lecture videos and just read the slides by myself and did fine. Do the practice problems she posts and you should be good. I spent maybe an hour max on this class every week.

Class is asynchronous with pre-recorded lectures probably from last spring. Lectures are long for no reason and can get boring. Her class consists of quizzes, homework, and exams. Unlimited attempts on the homework, but only 1 attempt on quizzes. Exams make up the majority of your grade with 2 midterms and 1 final but not very difficult.

I don't recommend taking this class online. The professor posted pre-recorded lectures from last spring, so there was no student/professor interaction. The lecture videos are very long, so plan your time accordingly.

Prof Bian is solid. Even though this class was asynchronous, I learned quite a lot. Weekly quizzes and homework, and two exams throughout the semester; all assignments were very fair and very related to class material. Lectures are LONG, and can get boring. She gives tons of extra practice though and explains difficult concepts in helpful detail.

One of the toughest classes at OSU, the professor teaches very complex material but does not go over how to graph nonlinear functions and equations. Overall, if you have a lot of time to spare to teach yourself take it. She is nice but has a hard time to simplify the information down.
Easy A. With many practice questions and samples related to the exam and quizzes. Curves a lot!
Ms. Bian is a very good lecturer but makes the content very difficult for her students. She goes very quickly so be sure to read chapters earlier. Most averages are 60% or lower.
Her lectures are amazingly helpful if you listen. Respect students and give fast feedbacks.
GOAT. Care about students.

The course is hard but the professor helps a lot in understanding. She is nice and patient and willing to listen to students' comments. Quick and good feedbacks. Fast grades submission. She gives many extra credits. I would recommend.
This is a conceptually challenging class, but professor Bian cares a lot about helping the students understand the concepts and adds many extra credit points.

She is great! I really learned a lot from her. She sent her own slides every week and those are clear. Grades submissions are finished the day exams finished. She loves teaching I think. Really recommend her.

Xiaomin is extremely excellent in explaining materials. She has slides for recitations which are clear and nice. I learn much more in her recitation than the instructor's lecture. She replies emails in a minute and submits grades no later than the day the exam finishes. Her explanations are inspiring.

summary_comment: Dr. Levin is highly intelligent and caring but struggles as an instructor, particularly for introductory courses. His lectures are often abstract and difficult to follow, and his advanced knowledge frequently exceeds the course level. Students recommend relying heavily on the textbook and supplementary resources for understanding the material.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Levin is hilarious and has a brilliant mind for economics, however this serves as a hindrance for the class. His knowledge is often too advanced, and he tries to apply this advanced knowledge to a basic microeconomics class. Very cool guy but not someone you desire for an introductory course.

His lecture style is very abstract and 3/4 of the times you won't know what he's talking about. Course isn't terrible if you have the book and study guide, but the book is extremely old and hard to find. He is very caring, but not the best lecturer for a simple microeconomics class.

Super intelligent person, but not a great teacher. Doesn't teach clearly and often gets very confused. However, he is funny and applies heavy curves. Course is very heavy on the textbook, which you really have to read. Grade is based on 4 assignments, with 70% of the final grade being based on the midterm and final. Not overwhelming though.

Dan is a very caring professor, however, he cannot teach and only rambles. He gave a very high curve at the end of the semester, but my advice to get an A would be to read the textbook and watch econ review videos on youtube. It is possible to get an A, but I was not able to since I did not read the textbook for the first midterm, so READ!

Dan has a very heavy and hard-to-understand accent, but it doesn't matter because everything you do understand is nonsense. Get ready to teach yourself Micro with the textbook, because the lectures don't help at all. Attendance is not mandatory, and I do not advise going.

Really funny guy and likeable guy. His lectures can be pretty boring. You do not need to go to lectures but he'll get mad at you if you ever ask for help. 4 grades: 10% for problem sets 20% for 10 page term paper 30% Midterm 40% for Final exam. READ THE BOOK, USE THE STUDY GUIDE. Should be an easy A if you put in a little effort.

His lectures were pretty much useless and it doesn't matter if you show up to this class because all I did was read the textbook. Only show up if you have questions or need to turn stuff in because he really doesn't lecture and goes so off topic and most things he talks about aren't on the exams.

Dan is a caring professor, but has a thick accent that hinders his ability to get his lectures across. This makes things difficult as the two exams (midterm and final) account for majority of the overall grade. There is a weekly homework that can vary in length and is mostly useless come exam time. Term paper is mostly completion.

Dan is extremely smart and passionate about passing on his knowledge of economics. However he struggles to communicate his expertise to introductory economics classes, often rambles and didnt cover everything we were supposed to. He has an accent but its not too bad. Tests are pretty easy, theres weekly HW and a paper that was fun-ish.

Dan is very nice. He does have a thick accent, but it doesn't take long to get used to. He does tend to ramble on about certain things, and lecture content isn't always clear. As long as you go to lecture and read the textbook, this class isn't hard. There were 2 exams, homework assignments, and a term paper. Dan really cares about his students

Not my type of teacher. Hes old and has a decently thick accent, which combined make his lectures almost impossible to follow. He loses his train of thought very often and doesnt complete problems or answer questions. The book is your savior and if you dont read it youll hurt. Furthermore the class is based on 4 grades.

I have mixed reviews. Class is not super hard but it is based 70% off two grades (midterm and final). A term paper and some homework make up the rest. Really smart guy but bad teacher. Lectures are pointless and you really don't learn everything. Take notes from the book he assigns you and study that before the two tests and you will be fine.

Dan Levin is a great guy who has a strong passion for teaching economics.  However, he is not good at it AT ALL.  Long hard-to-follow lectures, spent mostly rambling on useless topics that won't be on the two tests (which make up 70% of your grade).  READ THE BOOK, but I still advise going to class if you want any hope on the test essay questions.
Dan is a very interesting guy. His lectures are very long but if you study the study guides and pay some attention in class, you will do well. He has a pretty cool story

Definitely a very intelligent man.  Lectures are hard to follow and tests are very difficult.  On the bright side, he put a large curve on our tow tests (midterm and final) and ultimately i believe the final grade was curved as well.
Great professor, would take again

Dr. Levin is a great professor, but is sometimes hard to understand and his lectures can be confusing.  I had him for Econ 2001.03H, intro into microeconomics.  He covered complex material that was not necessarily on the exams, but the concepts he used in lecture were largely on them.  The term paper was the hardest part. Start early!

the lecture was terrible. extremely unclear of what the materials were. he also does not give out instructions on homework and assignments, and just vaguely tells you to do whatever you want. absolutely a waste of time.

As a business major with a strong interest in economics, I really loved his class.  You definitely need to use the book a lot to do the practice problems to clarify what you go over in lecture.  There aren't many grades (just a midterm, a final, practice problems, and a ten-page term paper.  If you do the work and read the book, you'll be fine.
Hard to understand.  Loves economics and likes discussing it, but is hard to follow when he is trying to teach or explain it.

His lectures are the biggest waste of time; he goes completely off the book and his lectures honestly confused me even more. If you haven't taken econ before, you'll have to teach yourself the entire class from the bookstudy guide. Two tests make up 70% of your grade. He is impossible to understand also because he has a very thick Israeli accent.
Very knowledgable, grades fairly. Slight accent and tendency to go on tangents. Overall good professor.

Lectures were extremely difficult to follow-he has a thick accent & tends to ramble. That said, tests were completely reasonable if you read the book--mostly tested basic concepts. Was a fairly easy grader overall. Wouldn't take by choice, but DEFINITELY A PASSABLE CLASS. [6 problem sets (10%), ten-page term paper (20%), midterm (30%), final (40%)]

Was a very nice guy, and definitely there to help if you need it. However, must agree with some previous comments - he can be difficult to understand, and he does go beyond the book often in class. Tests are straightforward - if you now the concepts you'll be fine. I did learn a lot. Take it if you're willing to do some work.

Would not take his class over, regardless, I learned a lot.  Had to read the book to learn most of the material.  In class he goes over more complex examples that are not relevant to H200 and never tested for.  Do not take unless you have to if you want to get an A.
great teacher

nice guy, cares a lot, but very confusing. strays away from book a lot, doesn't give concrete notes, never know what's going to be on the test. it's not so much hard as it is random and you don't know what to expect because he says one thing and you read about another.

He is a very nice guy and a good teacher. The class was a little boring but he has a good personality and is pretty funny. I liked him a lot even though I didn't really like the class. He seems to care a lot about you and help you do well in his class.

Dr. Levin's accent is not a problem at all.  The Novel he has you read is very interesting.  Lectures emphasize exactly what is on the exams.  Exams were extremely easy and straightforward. If you attend lecture you don't even need to study to get an A. He assigns problem sets and you receive full credit just for handing them in.

It seemed like he really wanted us to learn but had no idea how to teach.  I really think he is a good person and will help If you go to his office hours, but I couldn't even understand him and nothing he said was helpful.  Reading the book is the only thing that helped me in this class.
Lectures, Tests, Term paper all confusing and he offers no help.  Strict grading.  Hard to understand.  I would reccomend taking a normal econ with another professor.
He is a very nice guy but his accent makes it hard to understand what he is saying.  His lectures are extremely confusing.

I can't agree with the previous comments.  Mr. Levin's accent does offer a slight problem, but helps you keep attention on what he is saying.  Do the readings, or go to class and you'll do fine.  The book/research paper wasn't too easy, but decently interesting.  I would recommend him if you actually want to learn something.

Prof. Levin is very smart. He is dedicated to his area of study and will help you, but you must go to him. He was sometimes hard to follow in class, but he was always willing to stay afterward and discuss with you. I talked to him several times after class, sometimes about things not directly related to the lecture even. Good for critical thinking!
The textbook for this class was okay, but his lectures were very hard to follow. He was also very unhelpful when telling the class what to expect for the exams and how to write the term paper.
Awesome professor!  Cool research!  Glad that I took his class!  However, the class requires a lot of work... term paper, reading a book, and problem sets.  If you can get past that, you'll be fine.

If you want a "slide" GEC, don't take this class.  If you're interested in learning more, and caring more, about economics than you ever thought possible, take it.  Take notes, go to his office hours, and really think about concepts, and you'll

He knows his stuff too well, which makes it hard on the rest of us. Incredibly difficult to get him to explain anything clearly, although I must say I did enjoy the novel we read and the term paper that accompanied it. If it's not a GEC, avoid it.

Quite possibly the worst class I ever took. He can't explain anything and doesn't even grade his own tests. 1 midterm, 1 final, and a 10-page paper on a really boring econ novel. An absolutely terrible experience. Avoid at all costs.

summary_comment: Professor Ruddy is known for being challenging and monotonous, with inconsistent grading and a dull delivery that struggles to keep students engaged. While some find the class manageable with sufficient preparation and engagement, others criticize his teaching style and lack of support, deeming the experience largely negative.

Ratings.comment: Read other reviews thinking Ruddy was going to be chill and I was going to cruise through this class. False. Definitely have to study to do decent on the exams. ALSO genuinely maybe the most boring, bland, and uninterested prof I have ever had. His voice is so monotonous, I was fighting demons to stay awake. Inconsistent grader also. Do not take.

Extremely nice and knowledgeable professor. The class is very streamlined with only a few homework assignments and a course-long group project. Exams are very straight-forward, if you study the practice exams and study guide he gives you, an A is very doable.

Pretty easy class, you won't have to go to lectures. Tests were pretty easy if you review the slides and the fantasy football project is very easy as you'll only have to write one short paper. I'd definitely recommend if you're working towards an econ minor.

Baseball econ is worth taking. Really enjoyed the content, even if the textbook was a little hard to read. Reading assignments are key, field trips were great. You get a lot of information about the sports clubs at OSU. Engages with you if you engage with him.

The best econometrics teacher you could get - difficult subject matter but definitely dumbs it down well. Not haughty or high strung, makes lots of jokes and tells some funny stories. Reachable outside of class, has one group project. If you've taken some stats this class is a breeze, get ready to regress education on wage.
Ruddy Da GOAT fr!!!!

The class was rather monotonous and difficult to pay attention since he goes on tangents a lot during class. The class itself is easy but I honestly learned more from Datacamp than the actual class. The final project can be fun if you get a good group.

Honestly horrible when it came to helping students out. Didn't realize that students deal with hard times and refused to accept any late work or give you an extension. The fantasy project was pointless. Didn't really feel like I learned anything considering his lectures were all over the place and boring.
Dr. Ruddy is a great prof. He is really funny. I had several classes with him. If you do homework assignments, read the textbook, study for exams, and come to class, you will do well.

Professor Ruddy is unique. He may seem monotonous, but once you overcome that, the class becomes interesting.  The fantasy project was annoying at times, because of the constant upkeep with teammates and assignments, but essentially a well-written paper with good analysis will get you an A. Pay attention in class because that's what's on the exam.

Professor Ruddy definitely cares about teaching and about sports. Lectures aren't the most interesting, but not surprising for what's basically a statistics class, plus he brings in other easy/interesting in-class activities. Semester-long research project takes up the most time, but it all builds to make the final paper/presentation very doable.

Took 2 of his classes and will be taking another in fall. 4 homeworks, can get 120 points on out of 100 - easy to do if you start 2 days early, could do in 1. Exams are straight up and you know what youre gonna get. group project was reactively easy if you have a collaborative group. Couple extra credit opportunities.  Would recommend for elective.

Took 2 classes from ruddy and will be taking another in the fall.  Super willing to work with you and gives you plenty of hints on what you need to learn for exams.  He dumbs down econometrics very well.  As long as you start homeworks & studying 2-3 days before they are due they are super doable.  Great professor for a usually tough class.

Absolutely impossible to learn from lecture material. Practice exams do not have answer keys. Cannot learn from one exam to the next. Memorization of graphs from lecture repeated on exam. Semester-long projects (Fantasy) have almost 0 effect on your grade due to exams being worth a ridiculous amount.

If you are thinking to take econometrics, you should take it with Professor Ruddy. He always helps with homework and old exam questions. All of his class notes are made available. Overall a very good professor.

This course is graded on weekly homework assignments, two quizzes, and two non-cumulative exams. The course was conducted in-person, with an option to attend the class online. Attendance was not mandatory, and all notes provided during class were posted online. Very little knowledge from ECON 5410 was required during this course. Overall, not bad.

I have taken three of Professor Rudy's classes. If you don't get an A then I don't believe you tried or went to class (so easy with a small bit of effort). He is very caring too, he will probably recognize you if you take multiple of his classes even though they are large lectures. I'd recommend them all.
Great professor and will answer almost any questions

Professor Ruddy is passionate about sports, data analysis, and his students' success, and it makes the class very enjoyable. You will have a group research project and presentation but the material of the class is not all that challenging. Highly recommend to anyone interested in sports, especially baseball nerds like myself.
Great class. Ruddy can be dry but the class is very straight forward and the exams are not tricky. He is very accessible and passionate about sports analytics. Definitely recommend.

Dr Ruddy might be a good instructor. But the lecture is very boring, and I cannot learn a lot throughout the whole semester. The content is incomplete, many things in lecture are unclear and even not covered. However, the homework is time consuming but easy, and the exam is also easy.

This man does make sports a bit boring but its the EASIEST Econ A I have ever gotten. If you have ever taken a stats class before, you could probably get away with never going to lecture and still getting an A. Fair warning though there is a semester long group project which is more annoying than difficult.

100% recommend for Econometrics. The material & class is straightforward- he uploads practice exams, practice quizzes, and old projects as guides, and always spends an entire class doing practice exam material with the class. Opportunities for extra credit and curves exam (no textbook either) and always emails you back with HW questions.
Baseball Econ was a fun freshman seminar. The field trips and opportunities offered were very enjoyable. I look forward to taking additional classes with Dr. Ruddy in the coming years.

Dr. Ruddy is very helpful in office hours and replies e-mail very fast. Homeworks and the project can be challenging, but you can work with classmates and go to office hours. Exams are not difficult, but you really need to do the old exams and the practice materials though. Lecture can be cconfusing and boring, so take good notes in class.

Dr. Ruddy gives a lot of practices and sample exams, which are awsome for exam preparation. He is also very helpful in his office hours. Very fast e-mail reply. However, the lectures are kind of boring, and he doesn't put notes online. The material in this class is very hard, but not impossible. Overall a very solid choice for Econometrics cources.

Dr. Ruddy is without doubt one of the best professors I've had the privilege of taking. This man is total factor productivity incarnate; whereas other professors think they are of quality if the distribution of exam scores is negatively skewed, not so here. He makes mathematics accessible and inspires love of mathematics while challenging students.

I have taken 5 classes with Dr. Ruddy. Econ 4001.02, Econ 4831, Econ 5410, Econ 5420, Econ 6731 Dr. Ruddy is an amazing teacher. He genuinely cares about his students and wants them to do well in life. It is true he does not post notes online but if you ever have questions he would gladly open the notes for you. I totally recommend him.

I took this class because I love the NBA, but I don't think he makes the NBA so boring. He doesn't put any notes online, so go to the boring class is the only way to pass the exam(but I really want to sleep during the class). You can find many professors whose course is interesting with easier exams, so ignore his class.

Ruddy is the most painfully boring professor i think i have ever had. I took his sports class because sports are fun, but he found a way to make them boring and uninteresting. Doesn't post any notes online so being present (and staying engaged and awake) at his boring lectures is key to passing. He means well, just doesn't realize how bad he is

Attendance is not mandatory, but notes are not posted online so it would be difficult to do well in the class without attending. Very helpful and quick responses to email questions about weekly homework. Tests include some questions from previous semesters' exams and practice quizzes. If you understand the notes, tests should be rather easy.

Really good experience w/ Prof. Ruddy. You come to class and take good notes, do the assignments and an A is completely feasible. He was very helpful in office hours and was pretty gracious with the grading. Very generous and kind, though a bit awkward (not really a bad thing). The class is pretty straightforward

He gives a lot of practices to make sure we are prepared for the exams. Grade is curved. Go to class. Professor Ruddy teaches very slow in 4001.02, so I can handle the material although it is hard. Tests are based on practice problems. Overall very nice experience.
Ryan is a great professor and he is super helpful in his office hour. The material is quite difficult but the exams are not.
Ruddy is awesome! He is very helpful in office hours!

He tests you on topics he barely covers in class and expects you to basically figure out how to do most of the topics on your own. Went to office hours once and waited outside his office for 30 minutes waiting for him to finish "chatting" with a student about school and life, then when I finally got to ask him a question, he just confused me more.

I had him for ECON 5410 and I don't recommend him at all. I have a lot of credits in this department and he is the teacher that I like the least. His homework is every week and a pain. Your ability to take good notes is highly warranted. His exams are difficult. Students, there are paths with lesser resistance, especially when you need to graduate.

I had Ryan for honors micro. Great professor, however definitely a difficult class, especially if econ doesn't come easy to you. He is willing to help students and explain answers, and made class funny and somewhat interesting.

This was Ruddy's first semester teaching the course and you can tell. The lectures are all over the place and hard to follow. A lot of your grade depends on group projects that are graded relative to others in the course. The course is not what I was expecting and have no clue what to study for the exams. Ruddy is a great guy for a Michigan Alumn.

To the reviewer below me, its Micro Theory I have no idea what you were expecting. Its supposed to be a difficult course. Ruddy is awesome, he is willing to work with you and has very fair grading. Exams are difficult, but he is reasonable on the final and homeworks and practice exams prepare you well. It is what you make it.

This class is very easy if you've taken any basic stats classes before. Dr. Ruddy gives clear expectations of what you need to know for exams and the practice exams are very similar to the actual ones. His lectures are boring as he's pretty monotone. Should be easy to get an A with an average effort.

Nice guy, but very dry. You MUST go to lecture in order to pass though. Everything is graded very clearly and he does give partial credit for long math problems so as long as you put forth some effort into doing your work that class isn't that bad.
As long as you go to class you'll be fine.  Ruddy is a nice guy, kind of dry, but a decent professor.  He is very clear with what is expected on tests and projects, no surprises at all in his class.

Ryan is an easy professor. His tests were simple, and all other assignments had clear rubrics to follow. Most of the points come from the exams. The only downside is that is lectures may be the most boring ones I have had to sit through at Ohio State. He posts all notes online so if you miss some it is not a big deal though.

SEI.Subject: ECON
SEI.Class Name: Sports Data Analytics and Economic Analysis

summary_comment: Professor Litt is highly regarded for his humility and approachability, though he occasionally struggles with organization. His classes are known for having no homework and relatively easy tests, with an option to drop one of three midterms including the final. However, some students find his lectures somewhat slow-paced and wish he were more punctual in uploading materials.

Ratings.comment: He was so humble and approachable, although pretty disorganized at times but it never really effected the students

Professor Litt is solid. No homework, but lectures sometimes felt dragged out and a bit slow. Tests we're quite easy and lets you drop one of the 3 midterms (includes the final to be dropped if your class hits the response goal on the SEIs) Litt could improve on is his punctuality, says he'll upload something today but does it like a week after.

summary_comment: Eric is considered average by students, known for reading directly from slides and failing to engage the class in an interesting manner. While some appreciate his detailed knowledge and helpful office hours, many found the lectures unhelpful for exam preparation and complained about the difficulty in understanding the material. Overall, his teaching style and exam questions received significant criticism.

Ratings.comment: Terrible teacher who just reads off slides.
I did most of my learning in Friday recitations with my TA. Eric is pretty average at what he does but I think he is the best choice for E2001 at OSU, for better or worse.

You have to go to office hours if there's anything you're confused about, which is both a testament to how helpful his office hours are and how lost you're going to be during lecture. Dr. Gibbons also requires you to buy a textbook you won't use just to do homework.

Eric definitely knows the subject inside and out, however he fails to engage the class in a subject that could easily be interesting. The majority of your grade is made up of exams, which he provides measly resources to study for.

Lectures were boring and there was no real way to study for the exams. There were three midterms and an optional final that could replace any or all of the midterms. Seems great but you don't know how to study for it, I just went over the three midterms and looked at the textbook (that worked out ok). I shouldn't have to teach myself the material!!

I think he's a good nice guy, but not a great prof. The lectures were just copy and paste from the textbooks and while explaining topics he would over complicate them. Reading the textbooks would help but it was still confusing so lots of my friends and I struggled on how to learn and study in this class.

Lecture is him reading a slideshow anyone can find online for free word for word. His explanations make you question if he even knows economics. Then, he creates the most irrelevant test questions to ensure he keeps his average test score below a 70. Just not a good professor at all.
Lectures were fine but he really just read off the slides and didn't explain the material/concepts well. He doesn't really seem the most approachable person.

eric gibbons is the best microeconomics teacher at osu to my knowledge especially when compared to Jeffrey Buser. the tests are really easy but there's just alot to learn for every uni. the homework is really good for helping you learn everything but 69% of your grade is the exams but the final exam can only bring your grade up

ehhh, kinda class. Very poorly set up class. 3 exams make up the majority of your grade with no curve. Average professor but it is pretty difficult to learn because the lecture is so big. Requires a decent amount of work outside of class to do well.

This is not a hard class. Go to the lectures, go to the recitations. Pay attention during the lectures and engage in the material. You will have to study outside of class to get a good grade. I recommend at least 3-4 days of solid studying before the exams because they are decently hard. Eric Gibbons is a solid professor who tries his best.

THIS WAS FOR INTRO FOR ECONOMETRICS 

overcomplicates simple topics, assumes everyone knows everything already, gives 0 resources to study outside class.

He is a solid professor. Lectures can be boring but he teaches well. Class is graded on homework exams and quizzes. Exams are somewhat hard but with extra credit and homework is isn't too hard to get a good grade. Recitation attendance is mandatory but lecture is not. Overall, won't be easiest but won't be hardest course you take.
Probably the worst professor in all osu

Lectures are standard and not super interesting, but he drops a midterm, a decent spread on what's graded, and gives extra credit for attendance. Midterms and finals are only multiple choice and can have some funky wording. Just go to class and pay moderate attention and you'll be fine. Pretty decent overall.
Worse professor ever

He gets the job done. I had him in a 70 person lecture so he used a chalkboard to explain the concepts. Not the most engaging fellow, but I understood his explanations well enough to understand the material. Homework is minimal with just Pearson assignments. All tests are multiple choice but he only provides free response practice Qs on Canvas.
