Professor Gibbons was not a good teacher. He was not good at relaying the material. I could never seem to understand the way he taught the material even though I attended class. He was rude and disrespectful to all the students in the 600 person class, he didn't fully answer questions, and just read fast off the slides.

Gibbons is a solid Micro Prof. His lectures are boring, but I would go for the tophat as it is easy extra credit. Recitations have quizzes that are a little annoying, but if you keep up on the reading and pay attention in the recitation, you'll be fine. Just read the textbook for the exams and do the practice problems after each chapter.
Not very engaging, recitation is what saved my grade

Decent professor, most of the lectures are just him reading off slides you can easily find on Carmen. Homework is through Pearson, which you have to buy. Up to 5% extra credit for attending lectures and one or both midterm grades can be replaced with your final grade if it is higher. Very strict on late assignments and will not round grades up.

Not a super hard class, taught the slides well and never really interacted with him. Didn't even read the textbook, just studied with the information provided in class. Able to drop one or both midterms for the final grade so really all you have to do is study your ass off for the final and you are fine. Also gives 5% e.c. for going to class.

I can't even with him. Worst professor I've ever had. He insists on making everything so much more complex than necessary and the most boring speaker I've ever heard. Very by-the-textbook professor, but doesn't have a solid way of effectively relaying the information to students in a way they'll understand. Get ready to teach yourself everything.

SEI.Subject: ECON
SEI.Class Name: Current Economic Issues in the United States

SEI.Subject: ECON
SEI.Class Name: Current Economic Issues in the United States

SEI.Subject: ECON
SEI.Class Name: Cooperation and Conflict in the Global Economy

summary_comment: The professor primarily relies on McGraw-Hill for teaching and assessment, providing minimal direct instruction or support. Students find the course largely self-paced and asynchronous, with strong emphasis on exams and little assistance from the professor. Office hours and TA experience suggest the professor can be helpful and knowledgeable, though the overall teaching quality and student support are considered lacking in the main course.

Ratings.comment: Literally only taught through McGraw-Hill and there was no assistance from the professor at all. No lectures were recorded and you were expected to teach yourself the entire course through the website. Strongly suggest against this class unless you want to pay for the class and then repay to get the book/classwork on McGraw-Hill.

This class is really weird. He was my professor but hes basically only there for announcements and telling the class that you can set up zoom appointments if theres anything you want to clarify. Thats it. Course is taught by McGraw-Hill Connect. MH connect also makes the exams. You might wanna read the textbook in order to pass

The coursework is done through McGraw-Hill so he doesn't teach anything. It's 100 percent Asynchronous course with most of the grades coming from the exam. He doesn't allow any sort of notes from the class to help you in thexam and requires to install a proctorio to spy before taking the exam. Makes it really difficult for you to pass the class.

He definitely is a ridiculous professor, and he didnt teach anything. When you ask him questions, His answers are very unkindly and impatient every time. The class average grade of the final exam was 58% which is worse than F. Moreover, He does not curve any grades, even you got 89.99% that you still will receive B+. STEP AWAY FROM HIM!!!

I just don't know where to begin. This course was 100% online. Sergei was very clear on grading and expectation from day 1. States, if you earn a 89.99% won't bum up grade or curve. More than 50% of coursework is exams. The final was brutal and unexpected. Completely uses the mcgraw hill system so be ready to learn on your own. Fast email replies.

I hated the course material, but Sergei was super helpful at office hours and really knowledgeable! I finished the class .5 points away from receiving an A- and he added the extra .5 to my grade so I could get that instead of a B+
Had him as a TA for macroeconomics. Learned far more from him then our professor. Knows what he's doing and is great a conveying the messages.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his clear explanations and comprehensive lecture notes, which are supplemented by recorded lectures for easy review. He designs homework assignments that effectively teach concepts and encourage practical application, though they can be time-consuming. Students appreciate his willingness to help and his genuine interest in ensuring understanding, though some find the material challenging and the exams can be unpredictable.

Ratings.comment:
(Adv Course, # I took not listed)

Extremely good professor. Great lecture notes, explains clearly without skipping on intuition, and (at least my semester) recorded all the lectures so they were easy to go back to and review. He also designed his homeworks in a way that actually taught the concepts and gave opportunities for practical application.
i like him very helpful. exams are very very easy

If you have to take Econometrics, this is the professor you want. He goes out of his way to make a somewhat difficultboring subject matter understandable. He seems to really care that students understand the material. Homework assignments are time consuming, but the exams weren't too hard if you go to class. I would his class again.

Jason is a really smart professor. He is patient and willing to help the students. The HWs are a little difficult. However, if you work hard, you will get a good grade finally. I think some people think the class is tough because the Economictrics is tough. If you have to take Economitrics, choose this guy!

I was ahead of the chapters at the beginning and received a 96% on the 1st midterm. By the 2nd midterm I had a D & on the final I got a C. I had trouble staying on top of all the chapters we covered but made it a point to do all the homework assignments even if I wasn't confident about them. He is a kind grader and sweet guy! Overall grade was a B-

This may be one of the worst professors I have had at OSU. He is a brilliant man, but has a tough time conveying the material to the students. His exams have a lot of material that is not on the review. He makes subjects more complicated than they need to be. The first exam is the easiest so take advantage of it. He is willing to help tho.

Good teacher for what is a boring subject. 2 midterms and a cumulative final. 1st midterm extremely easy. 5 HW's that are somewhat challenging but manageable. I'd recommend going to class b/c some of the topics can be challenging and unclear. Definitely the guy you want if you have to take econometrics.
great

summary_comment: Dr. Lavetti is highly regarded for his dedication to student success, often curving grades significantly. His lectures are engaging, and he provides valuable insights into complex economic models. While the course material is challenging, students find it rewarding, particularly for economics majors.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Lavetti has been my favorite prof so far in college. He cares a lot about his students and he wants everyone to succeed. Reading the textbook was very helpful in this class as some of the models are very intricate and dense. This is an excellent 5000+ class for econ majors.

Lavetti is amazing, but Econ 5860 is the hardest class I've ever taken in college. The models presented are DENSE. However, if you're an Econ major, this is a great 5000+ credit to take. While the material is impossible, he curves the midterm, final exam, and final grade heavily. My B- got curved up to an A come final grade time.

Mr. Lavetti was awesome. This was easily my favorite class ever taken at OSU. The material is tough, but he gives a HUGE curve. I originally got a C on the midterm and it was bumped up to an A. Lectures are very interesting and he knows what he's talking about.

summary_comment: Dr. Plakias is known for her easy grading system and comprehensive review sessions, making it possible to achieve high grades with minimal effort. However, her lectures are often described as long and boring, with some students finding it difficult to stay engaged. Despite the dry content, she provides ample practice through weekly homework assignments and offers EXTCRD for attendance, which helps students prepare effectively for exams.

Ratings.comment: It's super easy to get an A in this class. You can tell that the professor does care about what she teaches I just found it a little boring.
Lectures were long and boring. Content wasn't explained super well.

Dr. Plakias is a really nice person, but the lectures are long and boring. Hard to stay engaged sometimes, you'll find a lot of people sleeping. Totally not her fault that the content she teaches is really dry, but she gives a lot of review material and sessions before each exam. Studying a few days in advance is a must for each exam.

Very easy class. She gives one hw assignment most weeks (sometimes none), but they are very easy to do and match with her lecture presentations (that she uploads). The exams are similar to these hw assignments, so they are a good place to study. She also offers EXTCRD for the people who attend class. The content was also pretty interesting.

Plakias is so nice and her class was very easy. Weekly homework assignments were helpful & allowed you to really learn the material for the exams. Exams were also easy. Lectures were kinda boring, but she does a good job breaking the material down. Drops the lowest exam grade, so if you do well in the class, you don't have to take the final

Dense lectures but she tries to break them up a bit. Weekly homework which basically requires you to go over the slides/notes again. Tests only cover material on homework, so reviewing those are a great way to study. I found attending lectures very helpful to complement and clear up some materials on the slides.

There are homework problems that are done (typically) weekly. Then there are exams (drop lowest). Make sure to do the homework with someone else in the class and then make sure they are graded appropriately! She does not cross check between herself and the TAs. You are better off learning the material from the slides then going to class...

summary_comment: This professor receives overwhelmingly negative feedback for his teaching quality, with students describing him as the worst teacher they have ever had. The course workload appears to be significantly more advanced than an introductory level, leading to confusion and complaints among students. Students strongly advise against enrolling in this class.

Ratings.comment: I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS CLASS. He is the worse teacher Ive ever had. If you think this is an intro course, be prepared to do senior work. I have a friend who is taking the same course, different teacher and are learning totally different. We reported an assignment to the Econ department and they said it was too hard for intro. Dont take this.

summary_comment: Dr. Logan is highly regarded for his extensive knowledge in economics and engaging lectures, making him an excellent choice for advanced coursework. His classes are demanding, requiring consistent effort, including six papers and multiple exams, but students generally find his grading fair and curving beneficial. While the workload is significant, his teaching style and clear guidance make it possible to achieve good grades with dedication.

Ratings.comment: If you are a student getting ready to graduate and need to fill in the 5000 level criteria you are doing yourself a disservice if econ 5140 w/ dr. logan is not one of them. He is a great teacher and very knowledgeable in econ. It is a lot of work e.g you have to write 6 papers minimum. The exams are curved. If you put in the effort you'll get a B.

Dr. Logan is an absolute beast. He brings undeniable Economics expertise to every class, loves his students, and has deep knowledge of history, demographics, mathematics, the list goes on. You will learn and be exposed to new methods of analysis in his class. GOAT

Professor Logan is a great guy. However, he has very unclear grading criteria and your final grade depends on 3 exams and 4 papers. If you're an econ major, this class is fine to take, but it gets frustrating as the content is incredibly dense and the grading is kind of unclear. Super likable guy though.

Dr. Logan is the best lecturer Ive had at OSU. There are 3 exams, 4 writing assignments, attendance is mandatory. He lectures the readings in class as if you havent read them. He gives study guides, an old exam, and a review session for exams. If you go to class and do the exam reviews you should be able to pull a B or A. Interesting material!

Dr. Logan was a great lecturer. He is clear about what you will be graded on and makes class enjoyable. Attendance was mandatory in our class and technology was not allowed. Take notes, study off the material he posts on line, and write the papers. You will get a B or better just by putting in the time.

Sassy in his lectures but very knowledgeable. One of those you never forget. So funny and a great teacher. Material will be somewhat hard and he's not the easiest grader but take him for a high level econ class. Will always relate subject matter to something funny. A lot of work but show up and work hard you will succeed.

He comes off as someone who's going to grade hard and he's pretty sassy. The test aren't bad his curves on them are money an 80 is an A. There is no textbook, but he assigns a lot of readings that you have to read. Only bad part is the papers, which are just tedious. He is an easier grader tho and you only have to do 8. For a 5000 teacher TAKE HIM

The class is some what challenging but as long as you do the reading you will do fine. class consist of 2 midterms and final.  All test questions are in essay format. i thought he graded fairly. also you will be required to write 4 papers, the papers are a reaction to assign readings, he give you the option of pick the paper. barks hard, bite soft

Logan is strict on following his syllabus. The whole class was planned out almost exactly to what he syllabus says. He had all the readings planned out and is an excellent speaker. Also, super hilarious! Would definitely take a class of his again. 4 papers each 4 pages, 2 midterms, 1 final. All tests were ext response ques. right from exam practice

Class is definitely interesting. The course material can be a little challenging, however, it is not impossible. The difficulty is not a result of his teaching, the material can just be confusing. He always makes his lectures interesting as well as entertaining.

Getting an A in his class is simple: go to class takes notes and read(he lets you miss 5 without any reason or grade deduction which is 2 more than most with attendance) He is extremely knowledgeable about the information he teaches (it all comes from research he has done or is interested in)  if you don't like him its because you're lazy

Dr. Logan is an excellent professor. He is genuinely interested in the subjects he teaches and in his students. Econ 4830 is easy if you always come to class, take good notes. The pop-quizzes are open note and he has great review sessions before each of the exams. I highly recommend taking any of his classes! Great Professor!

He challenges his students but isn't that what school is for? Does an excellent job explaining a complex subject area. Elite review session combined with attendance and solid effort will get most students an A.

Meh. He is a relatively easy grader, but the subject material is pretty dry imo. He does hold review sessions before exams which is cool. 8 unannounced open-note quizzes, drop 3, 2 midterms, and a final are the only grades.
Great class.  Great teaching style. Go to class and do your work and you'll do fine.
I don't like him and his class. He is horrible instructor.

If you try to drop the his class and you discuss about it if he tells you don't drop don't buy it he will change his mind end of the semester and he doesn't look like your professor any more he is like .he is cruel without little mercy and cold blood professor.
He is a horrible professor.

Attendance is mandatory, so if you attend class and take notes, you will pass easily. He gives you practice exams that are usually 3/4 of the real exam, do the questions and you will easily pass the midterms. The paper is a lot easier than he makes it seem, his bark is way worse than his bite. He's a very fair grader on the paper and tests.

I wouldn't suggest ESL students to take Dr. Logan's ECON 4553. He is a good instructor, but he doesn't use textbook... Besides, he has relatively higher requirements on academic writing I think. I only got C in the midterms. However, this class is interesting. He is a humorous teacher.
Excellent professor. I learned a lot. He challenges you but is a fantastic lecturer. One of the best professors I've ever had.

The class is difficult, but the exams are fair. More effort is required and is worth it: the end result of the lectures and the material is the  gaining of an invaluable perspective.  When you really listen, Dr. Logan is brilliant.  He has a very pragmatic viewpoint both on history and on economic reality.  Advice: he can be sarcastic at times but simply ignore it and due your best
somewhat interesting material...but not very helpful in teaching style

I had this professor for Econ 515 and Economic Demography and he is great! He is really smart , enjoyed every one of his lectures. I learned a lot from him and thought about things I have never thought before or never thought in such a way.

The syllabus and his introduction make him sound harder than he is.  He is a nice guy and a fair grader.  He may sound rude because he responds negatively to stupid questions about course structure (eg: is the final cumalitive?).  The paper is easy, no focus on writing style just find a topic with numbers to support something.
Exams are all essay, but not too difficult. He explains material clearly and will answer any questions you have.

Knows his subject a little tooo well... by that i mean he has a lot to say in every lecture and since he doesnt give handouts u gotta write like a maniac... Review sheets pretty much cover everything so they arent the most helpful... but if u study u shold do just fine... decent grader... turned out a lil more intristing than i thought it would be

This class was way better than I thought it would be.  Learned some interesting stuff.  Can be boring at times, but he tries.  Prof. Logan covers a lot in every lecture so you are writing all the time and have to pay attention, but he gives you review sheets for the exams and if you study it you ace the exam.  Fair grader.
Ok class.  Not totally boring, but not exciting either.  A good GEC class if you are a business major.
ssoooo annoying. hate this class. enough said

His bark is louder than his bite.  He says he grades very hard, but he doesn't really.  His lectures are dry (reads them word for word from a paper), but he is very informed on the topics.  He does not encourage questions.  He was not very helpful with the paper, even though he requires you to meet with him twice about it.
The class based entirely on journal articles, exams were fairly difficult, the research paper was the most intense I have been assigned in 3 years of economics.

no notes provided - only downside to the class.  exams are fair and straight forward if you know the material.  all essay - but that gives you more opportunity to get a right answer.  knows his material very well - had to keep up with his lectures b/c he talks so fast but pretty interesting.  a lot better than i expected the class to be

doesn't Use Powerpoint or anything good, uses overheads, be ready to take a lot of notes, hard grader, all exams are strait up writing... BLUE BOOK.  not too bad would be better if he used powerpoint or something not just crappy overhead!

Very good lecturer. Can make you worry sometimes about exams but just wants you to be prepared. Makes the class as fun and interesting as it can be. Not easy but very fair if you do the work. Along with Poast, the best Econ instructor I've had.

SEI.Subject: ECON
SEI.Class Name: Economic History of the United States

SEI.Subject: ECON
SEI.Class Name: Economic History of the United States

summary_comment: The professor is generally effective, though his initial communication in English can be challenging. He is knowledgeable and lenient towards the end of the course, but the grading structure, particularly the heavy reliance on the final paper and presentation, and the lack of early software instructions, make the course difficult. Students recommend considering other instructors for this course.

Ratings.comment: I took his class, and while he wasn't exactly the best English speaker. He answered all of my emails and was lenient towards the end of the class with grading. Tough it out in the beginning, and it gets better towards the end. I also suspect he was the smartest graduate student since he got assigned another hard class in the Fall.

60% grade from Final Paper and Presentation; No clear instruction on how to access the software required at beginning with the instruction is only provided til almost midterm; Revised deadline when one week later than schedule without dropping any assignment, making lots of HW for the last 5 weeks; Recommend to take ECON4400 with OTHER instructor.

summary_comment: Based on student comments, Professor Senad Sinanovic is widely regarded as a poor instructor, particularly for undergraduate students. Many find his lectures difficult to follow and condescending, with some noting that they would prefer to learn from the textbook or previous semester recordings. While a few students appreciate his clear communication of course expectations and his efforts to support student success, the overall consensus is negative, citing issues with lecture quality, grading, and accessibility.

Ratings.comment: Genuinely the worst instructor I have taken a course with. You are better off reading relevant sections of the textbook(which is great) than attempting to parse through anything he says. Condescension is pretty par for the course in economics, but the amount of disrespect he shows towards undergrads is ridiculous. Good topics, terrible teacher.

Understands the field of economics very well and uses current examples. Extremely generous with grading through extra credit assignments and the potential to drop one midterm. Used AU20 semester Zooms as lecture videos. Attendance only required in 1st class. Exams were slightly vague but never unfair. Communicates course expectations very clearly.

Genuinely cares for success of his students, knowing fully the difficulty of the course material. Can move fast in lectures but very accessible outside of class. Usually 1-2 assignments a week between a problem set and worksheet. 3 exams and we got to drop our lowest score. This is a tough course but Senad gives students a great chance.

He did not even try to simplify the course for our level of knowledge. Condescending and talked over our heads. He had nice energy in class, but I would not take his course again. Maybe econ wasnt for me, I dont know

I know there are a lot of mixed reviews regarding Dr. S, but I did not have the best experience with his class. The quizzes & exams were very difficult and the lectures were quite boring and could be unhelpful. The weighted grade distribution isn't fair (IMO) either. Getting an A is really hard.

Professor Sinanovic is probably the worst professor I've had thus far at OSU. He uses previous semester recordings for lecture, he is awful at explaining the material, and words his quiz and exam questions TERRIBLY. Avoid at all costs. I'm basically learning Econ from Youtube.
This professor doesn't deserve to be paid. He puts out old lecture videos, takes weeks to grade simple things, and doesn't respond to his emails. Worst professor I've had.

The material taught in this course is not hard if you'r knowledgeable in statistics. But Senad is definitely one of the laziest teachers Ive ever had. Even during a pandemic, he refuses to make time for his students to have full live lectures, but rather, post recordings of lectures from previous semesters which creates much inconsistency for exams

His class is doable if you put the work in. Going to office hours and asking questions helps tremendously. I've heard that he is one of the easier econ professors, and I would have done better in this class if I put more effort in, so it wasn't too difficult.

This was a difficult class but not impossible. He is tough but fair, and wants to see you succeed. Don't be afraid to ask questions and go to office hours! I asked a lot of dumb questions this semester but he was patient and helped me understand. Also - don't put the project off to the last minute. Took a lot more work than I expected.

He goes over things so fast and expects you to just know it. His questions make no sense.. you barely have time to think about what you read and his explanations are like assume this even if its not in the question but then somethings youre wrong if you assume. unless you already have experience in economics FOR THIS INTRO CLASS dont take it

Dr Sinanovic really cares that his students learn the material. Sometimes he comes off demanding but thats because a lot of the stuff he teaches is difficult to learn and he knows it takes a lot of practice. I can absolutely say I learned a lot from Dr Sinanovic.

I really liked Dr. Sinanovic. He made lectures really interesting and easy to understand. Very engaging and good at connecting things to real life. His tests were kind of difficult, but if you understand the graphs he shows, you should be good.
Avoid at all costs

Expects you to learn almost 70% of the main ideas, and practices of the course on your own and how to apply them. Tests are not terrible unless you are literally reading every chapter, watching all the review videos, and completing all the practice tests and quizzes CONSISTENTLY. If you miss a chapter or just don't care enough you're screwed.

He expects you to teach yourself 80% of the course and he should only cover 10-20%. His exams are way harder than what he goes over in class. He never shows you how to apply the new concepts to actual problems. I do not recommend taking this course with him.

Hes know his stuff but doesnt know how to teach to students. Expects that we taken economics prior to this course and that we are experts. Exams are confusing and had to be regraded several times. Go to office hours is no help as he criticize you for not knowing a topic. No recitation. Dont do it.

He explains basic concepts but never shows how to apply this to the problems on his exams and quizzes. It makes figuring things out incredibly difficult. He admits that his European style of algebra is very different from American math so the one time that he has walked us through a problem, it was very confusing and did not help.

Senad is a great teacher. He clearly wants his students to learn. He is very helpful in office hours. If you have problem with the materials, just stop in his office hours. His exams are very similar to the practice and homework questions. I would take him again.

This professor thought he is Ph.D and do some Shabi Caozuo every time. Guys, do you ever see a sample with 160 questions? 6-8 videos every week and 2 hws on sapling every week, all count for credits. I don't know why he asks us to watch the MRU videos which do much more better than him and he asks us to go to the class. He finds Cunzaigan everyday

Professor Sinanovic is accessible during office hours and really cares whether you understand the content thoroughly. The prerequisite for ECON 4400, which is STAT 2450, have most of content overlapped. So if you took STAT 2450, this course is barely easy. He is not that good in explaining things very clear but you can understand what he is saying.

His class is a lot of work and relatively hard, but if you put in the work and participate hes one of the best professors you can have; hes very passionate and knowledgeable in Econ. Hopefully I can get him again!
Very difficult class.

This PhD's class is harder than other Econ 4400 not only in the exam but also has heavy homework and project. His exam have a lot of content cover many knowledge points and also have so many questions. Before the exam, he will not give you any sample and he usually make mistake in his slide, sample questions in the class and homework answer.
A really difficult class

He's a good professor. ECON in general is hard so you have to put forth some effort if you want a decent grade but he gave us multiple chances for extra credit throughout the semester and also curved some tests if the average was low. Lectures are nothing special but he tries to make it a little fun.

He is a good professor and seems to care about his students but he definitely makes you work for your grade. Going to lecture is extremely helpful. If you get behind/ don't stay with the material you won't get a good grade in the class. The midterms and final are worth most of your grade.

Prof. Sinanovic is one of the best, if not the best professors I've had at OSU so far! He truly cares about the material and his students, and will explain things you don't understand. His accent may be difficult to get used to at first, but it isn't so bad. Lecture heavy, grade depended on exams, quizzes, and online hw. Gave some extra credit

I had him for Econ 2001. He genuinely has a passion for teaching and is really willing to help his students. I actually found the class fairly easy, but I was in the top 5% ignoring my terrible homework grades (which is my own fault). He does not take attendance but has in-class quizzes and questions for grades + lecture material is the exam.

Exams make up most of ur grade, but if you dont know what ur doing in class and fail an exam, most likely wont pass. Things you actually do good on only count as a small percentage of your grade. The way he explains material is confusing so you have to learn mostly everything yourself or go to a tutor.

This was my first economics class and it wasn't bad. Lectures are not mandatory but are useful. He really wants his students to understand economics and he wants to help as best as he can. There are 3 midterm tests (lowest score on midterm is dropped) and a final; 7 quizzes (2 lowest scores are dropped).

He is the absolute worst teacher I've ever had. Whatever you do, DON'T TAKE HIS CLASS. I've spend endless hours studying and no matter what I do there is no possible way to do well. His worksheets and tests are poorly worded and have many errors. I went to his office hours and asked him for help and he said there was nothing he could do for me.

Lectures are helpful with understanding of the material. If you show up to lecture, take his practice exams, and read the textbook you will do well in his class. His office hours are very beneficial and he is willing to make appointments if you cannot make his office hours but have questions. Also offers a review session for his exams.

Professor Sinanovic makes Micro Economics a nice and interesting course. He's friendly, and he is willing to help make sure you understand the material. He's great at office hours too especially before exams. He sets everyone up to get an A or high B if you do all the homework and quizzes. If you put the time in, then you'll do fine.

Probably the best professor I have had yet at OSU! His lectures are great, easy to understand, and he makes all the material very interesting. He is a tough grader, but he posts practice exam, and ask same or very similar questions on the exam. He is easy to understand, and structures the class in a very logical way.

Prof. S is easily the best professor in the department. His lectures are easy to follow, engaging, and sometimes entertaining. If you show up and pay attention to lecture, you'll pass with flying colors. Take any class of his that you can

Spelling errors on class presentations, and tests. Mistakes made when reviewing test material, errors on practice tests, incorrect information presented then tested. Office hours don't seem helpful, he's quick to go over material and quicker to misspeak and imply student error for confusion not haphazard presenting/teaching. Don't take this course.

He goes over the basics & material but doesn't show how to apply it to real problems, which are on the quizzes & tests. Homework online every week, quizzes 1-2 times a month, sometimes gives homework in class (he spells stuff wrong on the homework he creates), & half my class is failing. The Econ Learning Center say they get his students a lot.

summary_comment: Professor Li is challenging to follow during lectures, often described as dry and hard to understand, with many students finding it necessary to supplement with external resources. Despite this, he offers substantial extra credit opportunities, making it possible to achieve a high grade with sufficient effort. However, several students warn against taking his class due to the difficulty of his lectures and the lack of helpfulness from him during office hours.

Ratings.comment: Professor Li, was hard to understand and boring in lecture. I found myself supplementing his lectures with youtube videos - Jacob Clifford. However, he designs the class that almost everyone can get an A if the effort is there with extra credit opportunities, it's a decent amount of work though.

No hate to Li, he is a great person, it is just hard to learn during his lectures. They usually seem dry and hard to pay attention since he's just reading off the slides. However, he is a fast responder, and will bump grades if needed. He cares, but his lectures are just hard to pay attention in, and this class is lecture heavy.

impossible to understand. lectures are full of material that will never be touched on or explained. can barely hear him during lecture and is very hard to follow the powerpoints because its just random bullet points and no explanation on how they interact or affect anything. not to mention the final being the hardest final ive ever taken. avoid

Worst Professor or teacher I have ever had. His lectures are full of pointless/poorly worded things. To pass, you need to read the book and teach yourself. Extremely difficult quizzes and will not help you much if you ask.
Although his lecture is hard to understand, he gives us lots of extra credits which is helpful for the final grades. Its not hard to get an A if you attend the lecture.

He's very kind. He gives 20 credits for the attendance and SEI, which is helpful. Quizzes are group quizzes, and there are totally 7 homework, which is not heavy. He is accessible and very patient. It's not difficult to get a great grade.

Do not take this professor. He is hard to understand and reads directly off of the slides. Went to his office hours and he was very unhelpful. Homework is not hard but there are some very specific questions. Also never responds to emails. There are much better professors for this class. Avoid
Class is unclear and exam don't have different versions.
Nice experience in total

Overall the class was fairly easy. The homework and tests were completely doable and overall it was easy to get an A. Additionally, there was lots of extra credit offered which helped. I thought he was nice and always willing to help!
very hard to understand him but he seems nice. Attendance is extra credit. 7 homework assignments, 1 midterm and 1 final. Uploads all notes to carmen

summary_comment: Zheyu is a dedicated professor who provides helpful resources and extra credit, genuinely cares about students' learning experiences, and is willing to answer questions outside of class. However, her lectures can be abstract and disorganized, leading to unclear communication about exam content, and some find the material difficult to follow, especially without additional self-study. Overall, it is a challenging class that requires significant effort.

Ratings.comment: Zheyu is helpful outside of class, has useful practice exams/HW Solutions, is willing to answer questions, and genuinely cares about your experience in the class. Plus she offers awesome extra credit! But, there were abstract lectures & unclear communication on what will/won't be tested. Solid teacher but expect to put in a good deal of work.
So far the worst professor I've had at OSU, one of the hardest lectures to follow. To succeed study the homework. Prepare to teach yourself 95% of the time.
the textbook and her lecture material are on two different planets. Very hard to understand. Does not employ any calculus for a class that should be calc based.
Hardest class. The lecture is disorganized. Her explanation is very abstract.

summary_comment: The professor is highly knowledgeable and challenging, known for making econometrics accessible while requiring significant effort from students. Lectures are described as somewhat dull, and she employs tricky exam formats and strict rules, often refusing additional support close to deadlines. Students find her effective but warn of the difficulty level and competitive grading system.

Ratings.comment: Refused to post past papers and mark schemes after changing the course. Uni forced her to and put basic qs like define a good and basic algebra on the mock. Got a first in the end but did more work than any other module, including those i got higher % in. Also was my diss supervisor and refused to help in the month before, cos she was on hols
Great teacher
Her lectures are boring and she posts the homework 24-48 hours before its due so hopefully you didnt have other commitments. She doesnt really answer the questions you ask her either.

She tries to trick students during class and on the exams/quizzes. She has redicilous rules and makes the class much harder than it already is. Her exams and quizzes are moderate to difficult. She doesn't offer any bonus points and is very strict with the layout of the class. I wouldn't suggest her class to anyone.

Nesli is a great econometrician. She knows the ins and outs of the material and is very helpful when you seek her out.  The exams, quizzes, and homework are tricky but if you attend class and work hard, an A is achievable. Beware, the course is ranked which means that 10% of the class gets an A, 20% gets a B, etc.
She's obssessed with tricking students and baiting them in exams then teaching them how to avoid these baits and mistakes. Exams have different format then lecture notes, beware.
Econometrics is one of the hardest class for econ majors, but she makes it easy for everybody
Excellent econometrics professor..

summary_comment: Dr. Nencka is highly regarded for his dedication to student success, making complex econometric concepts accessible through real-life examples and practical R exercises. His classes are engaging and supportive, with a focus on clear understanding and practical application. Students appreciate his flexibility, humor, and commitment to ensuring their success.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Nencka really cares about your success in the class. He relates many concepts in class to real-life phenomena. Material is quite accessible, yet you get a good base of econometrics for an undergraduate level through practice in R. There is no textbook and you might want some reference material outside of class. All in all, take him

I love Peter. One of my favorite professors and a nice guy. He is super flexible and wants you to succeed and his class is pretty straightforward. He is also funny but in a quirky way. Like once I got a concussion on my way to the exam and he was so understanding and kind! Made this boring class enjoyable for me. Take him if you can!

He's a grad student so he wants to make sure he teaches well. Class is easy if you show up and you won't need the textbook unless you want to skip class every class. Overall he made it fun and taught interesting material i didn't expect

Made sure we understood before moving on and provided excellent feedback for every assignment. Easy readings, you will need book. 4 HW (and 1 EC to drop lowest HW), reading quizzes to encourage attendance, 1 midterm (do HW and you'll be fine), and 1 final project (sectioned off into mini assignments to make it manageable). Highly recommend.

summary_comment: The professor is highly knowledgeable and effective in conveying complex material, but students find him less supportive and available for additional help, suggesting a need for strong self-motivation and a solid grasp of the subject matter to succeed in his class.

Ratings.comment: Im knows what he is doing, but really isn't there for you. You better know what you are doing, or face a lot of problems.

summary_comment: Professor Roy is widely regarded as an ineffective instructor, with students finding his lectures dry, boring, and difficult to follow. Many complain that the material is overly complex and not well-explained, making it nearly impossible to learn without extensive memorization. Students also report that he fails to provide adequate support or respond to emails, and that the exams are disproportionately weighted, leading to low average scores.

Ratings.comment: Professor Roy lacks the ability to teach the information to a normal student. By that I mean that in order to actually do well in his class you better have the ability to memorize hundreds of PowerPoint slides. It is impossible to learn anything in his class. DO NOT TAKE
He doesn't know how to use canvas and grades assignments very poorly. Lectures are very dry and difficult to understand, poor teaching ability.

Easily the ABSOLUTE WORST professor I've ever had. He makes attendance mandatory, which DOES matter because there are only four grades all semester (attendance, MidTerm 1, Midterm 2, Final Exam). He constantly contradicts himself in his lectures. His lectures are extremely boring and confusing. He does not give any help. Does not answer emails.

Professor Roy made this class so much harder than it should have been. Exams are 75% of your grade and all of the averages on these exams were Fs. The lectures were terribly boring ,and the assignments did not help when it came to exams. I highly recommend finding a different professor if you have to take this class.

Won't answer emails Everything he puts on the study guide, most of will not be on exams Goes over topics one time and if you don't speak up loudly then he moves on and you are expected to have 100% mastery over them Easily the worst professor I have had and many will agree

This professor made the class way harder than it was supposed to be. The average grades for our midterms were both F and below averages. Also, he could really care less about being specific in lectures on the crucial subject matter in Macroeconomics. You really just have to cross your fingers and hope that you can guess your way to a good grade.

Flies through material, very few assignments outside of the exams so not much of a chance to redeem grade. Hard to understand and overcomplicates explanations. Does not give students a chance to even find the answer to a question before he answers himself. Very sweet person, but does not help the fact that I haven't retained a single thing all sem.

No worksheets , just board examples every so often. You have 3 grades in the class, midterm 1 & 2 + final exam. Also takes attendance. Can be hard to understand him. Lectures are boring and lengthy. If you are looking to learn and understand macro-econ I wouldn't recommend this class. Exams are hard; highest grade on exam 1 in my class was 14/20.

Prof. Roy was okay, at best. He was sometimes difficult to understand and contradicted himself quite a bit in his lectures. His lectures are pretty boring, but attendance was for a small grade. Most of the final grade (80%) came from the 2 midterms and the final.

This man is so hard to follow. Lectures were long, boring, unengaging. I absorbed little to no content during classes. If you dont ask questions, he glazes over complex topics. Macro Econ should be an EASY A, but this man turned this course into one of my most challenging course loads. Only take if you want macro to feel like pulling teeth

summary_comment: Professor White is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and clear expectations, making even challenging subjects like economics accessible and interesting. Students appreciate his approachability, helpfulness during office hours, and straightforward grading system, though some note that group dynamics can significantly impact the learning experience. Overall, Professor White is praised for his knowledge, engagement in class, and supportive approach to student success.

Ratings.comment: He's fairly intimidating, but incredibly good professor. I hated econ classes, but Prof White made it very interesting through his lectures. The class is very straightforward, the homework is very reasonable, and if you go to his office hours he is actually approachable and very helpful. Tests are very similar to homework. 10/10 experience

Prof. White is one of my favorite professors! There is a simple way to get a good grade. You go to lectures, participate a little, read a little, then you're fine. His tests are pretty straight forward. The group project sucks if you have a bad group but Bill is willing to help you out if theres issues. I wish more profs were like him. A real gem.

Professor's White's Government Finance in the American Economy is pretty straightforward: go to class, do the homework, and pass. There isn't much to it. He explicitly said considers it an AP class, so, it's designed to be fairly easy.

Dr. White is incredibly knowledgeable about the field of economics, and sometimes comes off as intimidating. That said, hes very clear with what his expectations are and as long as youre doing the work that he assigns and participating in the lectures.. you shouldnt have any issues doing well in the class

Professor White is an incredible professor. He gives very thoughtful answers to class questions and encourages students to participate. His class isn't very difficult as long as you pay attention to the material and seek help whenever you need it. As long as you respect him as a professor, he will respect you as a student.

I really enjoyed having Dr. White. His lectures were engaging and easy to follow, and the class as a whole was pretty easy. There weren't many tests, and we were given plenty of review material for the exams we did have. He's an easy grader overall!

Lectures were interesting & pulled in examples from recent history & he put a lot of emphasis on asking questions/participating in the class discussions. He also always had personal anecdotes that he would tell us about related to the lectures. Not hard to do well if you show up, participate, & do your work. Super interesting class & good prof!

He makes sure to call on people during class so make sure you go. This class was mainly based on group work so if you don't have a good group that will help you, you're basically stuck doing the work yourself. The grader grades really weird and really doesn't offer an explanation of why points were taken off.

I really enjoyed Prof. White's class. He's very knowledgeable, with vast personal experience that he draws upon during class to synthesize what we've learned. His assignments aren't too difficult IMO, as long as you're comprehending the topics from lecture. Always struck me as accessible & eager to help. Taking another class w/ him this semester.

Professor White gives long, boring lectures that don't go in depth about understanding the material but instead provides a bunch of random real-world applications. Tests are difficult, even after putting lots of time in to study. Added a ton of assignments at the end of the term that shot my grade down low, after putting in final. Do not take him.

Lectures aren't very engaging, which isn't helped by the fact that the content itself isn't very exciting for most people. He also takes an entire class to say climate change and air pollution aren't really problems. He's clearly not an environmental scientist and no one took him seriously. He was upset when students laughed. Truly ridiculous.

I cannot say that I loved the class, but Bill himself is a good professor. The 3 exams are worth a combined 85% of your grade, and unfortunately, the practice exams do not line up well with the actual exams. There is a textbook, but you'll never use it.

Terribly disorganized and disproportionate amount of work for an "easy A", which it is turning out not to be. Grades were not inputted until the last week of class, which makes it hard to know how you're standing in the class. Boring content, mandatory attendance, really did not learn anything. There are much better options out there to take.

Not worth it for an easy A econ elective. Disproportionate amount of work, and the class content is much less entertaining than you go in expecting it to be. Certain classes are mandatory, his lectures are dry, and there is an excessive amount of writing involved. Look into other options.

Most boring class I've ever had to sit through. The material is incredibly simple/easy (if you've taken principles) yet he somehow makes the tests impossible. His MC questions are all trick questions and they're very often incorrect, don't be afraid to contest his answers. Also, you get a participation grade in a lecture of 200+ students

Lecture could sometimes get boring but overall solid professor who made the material very easy to understand. Tests arent bad and usually had an average of around a 90% which is pretty good. Definitely can do well in this class and learn a lot! Also looking back I wish I had stressed less about the term paper because its not a big deal.

This class was awful. Lectures are long and dry. And extremely hard to pay attention to. Gives out practice exams that are MUCH easier than the actual exams! Final is worth 35% of your grade too. Have pop quizzes that can help as extra credit though. Bill talks way too fast and its hard to even take notes in lecture. Overall, would not recommend!

This class consisted of 2 midterms, about 5 homework assignments, and a final. Participation is not required, but there are 5 pop quizzes that count towards extra credit. Bills lecture can be very long and hard to focus on. A lot of times the tests were harder than the practice exams posted online. Talks super fast, and hard to even take notes!

Honestly the rudest, most disrespectful professor I've had here. Easy A but not worth having to take this guy's class again. Opens the class bragging about his education, which doesn't really matter since he can't teach.
Overall pretty eh teacher. Midterms are not related to homeworks and barely related to the class. Studied hours and hours to get mediocre grade.

While Bill White's class is mainly long lectures, it is possible to get a good grade. Bill uploads all of the lecture slides to Carmen, which is nice to review before a test. Attendance isn't mandatory, but there are 5 in-class quizzes which count as extra points towards your final grade. Neither the homework nor the exams were extremely difficult.

Dr. White's class is very lecture heavy, but if you review the notes, it is possible to get a good grade. It is a bit boring, but he is generally fair. The homeworks are graded harshly, but the exams are not horrible. He does not take attendence but there are 4 in-class pop quizzes that count as a participation grade.
the most awful professorever, no respect, give boring lecture,

Lectures are boring and his voice is annoying. Speaks fast and you'll need to go to him to get him to explain some concepts that he glazes over. His questions come out of the teacher manual that goes with the textbook and oftentimes, he has realized that questions and the possible answers are plain wrong. Don't be afraid to contest your grade.

Bill White was a great professor. He is always was prepared for class and his lectures were very structured. Some people consider hi s lectures boring but I think he does a great job presenting the material. He is always there for help, not handouts. His homework is a large part of the grade but they are challenging. Study the powerpoints for exams

Super nice guy! Powerpoints are easy to understand.. Midterms are straightforward (second midterm is slightly challenging). Class is boring but thats Econ for you and he gives bonus points for pop quizzes that you get 100% on for simply turning them in. Super clear on grading criteria. Easy A-/B+
Boring lecture and awful teacher
He gave low grades though you study hard
No clear criteria for grading

I really enjoy William's lectures. He is very kind and caring. I'm not an economics major, but he has made this class interesting for me. I would definitely take him again. He gives five random quizzes and each one you take adds 1% to your grade which is easily my favorite thing any professor has done.

Easily the most boring professor I've had at OSU. Lectures are so useless it is impossible to attend his absurd participatory class. Material is striaght forward, but he will have test questions with answers that "he feels is most correct." Hopefully will never have this professor again.

Lectures couldn't possibly be more boring. He's very interested in what he's teaching, but if you're not then good luck. I passed without ever opening the textbook. He puts all the slides online but if you skip you will miss the pop quizzes which could really help your grade

His lectures are boring but if you attend and then look back at the powerpoints later it will begin to make sense. He knows his stuff but doesn't do a very good job at relaying that to the students without putting them to sleep.
Gets to the point and test material can be found on online lecture slides. Study a little and the class is not hard.

William knows his stuff. He is very smart, and has real world experience. You need to go to class, because he clears stuff up. As long as you pay attention, he gives good information about real world economics. It can be boring, but he gives extra credit quizzes towards the end of classes, and these are an easy 10 points as long as it is completed.

I'm not sure why he isn't rated higher, his class was the single easiest A I have had for my business major, I literally got a 99% in the class. He wants everyone to get an A and makes it extremely easy to do so, it was truly a cake walk, but we still learned a lot about the underground economy. If you're looking for an easy A, look no further.
Amazing lecturer! Example goes beyond textbooks, and explain all the material clearly and logically. Always willing to help after class.
Super Awesome dude. Makes the class enjoyable (at least he tries). Super Caring but strict. Knows his stuff

Dr. White is a super nice guy, a great teacher, and sorta funny.  He has tons of super applicable real-world experience and tells cool stories occasionally.  He is very helpful during office hours and clearly cares about students and economics.
He is a solid teacher and an awesome guy with a crazy amount of real-world experience.

Go to class! I know he can be boring, but I went and then copied the notes from the powerpoint later.  PS, the homework is super important, so do well on that, and you'll be fine. Plus, he drops the lowest homework, and gives extra credit. Seriously, some test questions come from the HW. Also, go to office hours! He gave away some of the answers.

Dr. White clearly cares a lot about his students. He is very willing to meet with you and the class itself isn't bad if you just pay attention during lecture. The homework assignments help prepare you very well for the exams. He also gives quizzes that are graded based on completion and count as extra credit, and his final was open textbook!

He's really nice and if you ever need help don't hesitate to email him or go in for office hours and he will be more than willing to help you. expect homework, they're hard but helps you prepare for tests. Quizzes are only for extra credit.  Great teacher overall. If you actually put in efforts you will for sure get an A. It's really not that hard.

I personally loved Professor White. This Freakonomics course was a great informal intro to economics for someone outside the department. There is quite a bit of writing but it is based off of opinion and relating it to the lectures. Class was fairly easy, A on the midterm without studying, low homework scores dropped. VERY helpful in office hours.

I would gladly take a class with him again. While his lectures aren't particularly entertaining, you can tell that he cares about the subject and his students. His exams aren't difficult as long as you go to class and pay attention. He also offers pop quizzes that just count for extra credit. Reading the book is not mandatory.
His organization is terrible and also had very boring lectures.  He wasn't clear on what he wanted from his students.
He's hard but gives out many extra credit. also the homework are helpful for the exams.
There are better professors that a university should hire. This guys isn't very clear on what he wants from the students in class. I think he might be at his early stages of teaching or something.
Terrible teacher, he also is extremely unorganized and has his students teach the class so he doesn't have to.

Mr. White was very clear and concise. Econ professors are usually very vague about what they are going to test you on, but Mr. White did a great job on preparing his students for the tests. Participation isn't mandatory. Four HW assignments and a few pop quizzes that don't count against you, he uses those points as EC.

summary_comment: Professor Negrete is widely regarded as ineffective in his teaching methods, often failing to clearly convey economic concepts and instead relying on students to read the textbook independently. Students find his lectures confusing, his exams difficult, and his questioning style vague and unhelpful. Many advise against taking his class unless absolutely necessary.

Ratings.comment:
A good guy at heart, but just cannot teach to save his life. 

You'd be better off just reading the textbook and not coming to class because all he does is write the definitions on the board and talk in circles. Asks weird and vague questions both in class and on his exams. Stay away if you want to learn the material and don't want a headache.

Prof. Negrete is a good guy and means well. That being said, bro could not teach a dog to sit. I've taken Econ in the past and had a pretty good grasp of the material, but the way Negrete teaches it makes it so confusing, and he asks weird, ambiguous questions. Impossible exams, hard to understand, etc... Would not recommend

Worst professor I have ever had. I did not learn anything from his lectures. Just read the textbook. Extremely inconsistent in grading and completely unclear criteria. Easy class, easy homework but you don't learn anything. Somewhat of a nice guy personally, but DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS.

He knows what he's talking about but cannot teach it. Obviously very passionate and a kind guy, but cannot convey the information to students who haven't interacted with economics before. Only take his class if you either NEED to or are great at economics already.

Don't take this class if you don't like reading and watching videos. He has a project due in the beginning of the third week class, which requires about a hundred pages reading. He plays videos during the lecture which is meaningless and boring.
Professor Garcia is just a genuinely nice person. It really warms my heart that he really sees us as individuals and how he always reminded us that grades dont define us as human beings.

The worst professor I have ever had. He has an accent. Prepared to study all the things by yourself after class. He was not sure about the things he talked about, either, such as the quizzes.. Attendance is mandatory. You cannot skip class, even just one class.

His accent always makes me feel confused and he makes wrong on the answers of some exam or quiz. Some questions of exams aren't related to any of the material he teaches if you want to get A on 4002.02, ignore his class.

I liked Mario's class! Very intellectually stimulating and definitely a tough class to teach but he tries his best to put it in words that OSU students can understand. If you work hard and come to class its an easy A and he specifically says this multiple times throughout the semester. Just make sure not to get cocky

Mario was my TA for economics. I think hes a graduate student. He has an accent but hes understandable. Hes very willing to allow makeup quizzes and cares about students. He was knowledgeable and prepared very thorough review sessions. I would take him again.

summary_comment: Professor Goel is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods, engaging lectures, and strong commitment to student success. Students appreciate her clear expectations, supportive mentorship, and passion for economics, though some find her class evaluations and teaching presence occasionally disruptive. Overall, she is seen as an inspiring and caring instructor who helps students develop critical thinking skills.

Ratings.comment: Very lucky to get her as my Econ51 prof! All things are take-home so mentor sessions helped. She has online lectures (content) we watch at home and then come to class to discuss more on them, do practice problems, etc. which I found was very time-efficient and helpful. She's straightforward during office hours. Cares about her students!

Professor Goel is hands down one of the most inspiring professors I have ever had during my time at Pomona. She loves her students and clearly is passionate about their growth and learning, both inside and outside of the classroom. Super comprehensive lectures, fair grader. You will learn a lot.

She is the best! The amount of effort and concern she shows for her students is unreal. She makes classes engaging and fun and will make you think critically about everything you've heard in the media about trade. This is a great class that combines theoretical models + reading empirical work and writing a research paper in the end. Recommended!
Great professor!
Professor Goel was very straight up about what she expected from students and what she expected was very reasonable. She also has quite a sense of humor and loves interacting with students.
She is a great Econ Professor! Definitely take her for an intro course at Pomona

Shouldn't be teaching. Wasted half the class worrying if the class was learning as well as they could and brought in people to evaluate her teaching skill with the students.  Just plain annoying; do not take this class if you want any motivation to go to lecture every day.
She's a nice TA who's willing to help, but sometimes confuses herself to the point she gives us a wrong answer and has to be corrected. Also, needs to speak up.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, demonstrating deep expertise in his subject matter and delivering clear, engaging lectures filled with detailed and humorous examples. He ensures fairness in assignments and assessments through thorough preparation and practice materials, making him an excellent choice for students in 2001.

Ratings.comment: He is an amazing teacher. There is no doubt he knows the topic very well. His lectures are clear and he gives many detailed (and funny) examples for otherwise difficult topics. The homework and exams are very fair, and he prepares students well with practice exams and questions. I really enjoyed class and believe he is a wonderful option for 2001.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his clear and methodical lectures, which are designed to ensure thorough understanding. He offers a manageable workload with infrequent but challenging homework and exams that, despite their difficulty, often receive generous curves. However, some students note that exams do not always align closely with homework material, and the professor's availability is somewhat limited.

Ratings.comment: One of the best professors in the department! His lectures are super methodical and easy to follow and shows every step to make sure you understand everything. Homework is few and far between and not too difficult if you go to classes. Exams are only half of your grade and allow open notes. Highly recommend over any other intermediate professors

Attendance isn't "mandatory," but he gives pop quizzes to motivate people to come. His lectures are very clear and he knows the material well. 4 tough homework assignments, and 4 Exams, with averages ranging from 40-70. His exams really make you think deeply about the material, but he does give very generous curves to reward you for your efforts.

Clear lectures but exams were very difficult and short. Homework material did not relate much to the exams. Professor seemed more interested in his research than teaching. Only had one office hour a week and missed 5 classes without getting a substitute. Large curve.
Great professor, clear lectures. Exams are difficult, but there is a generous curve. Recommended for BS Econ majors.
good!
No Comments

summary_comment: The professor is generally perceived as having poor teaching skills, with many students finding his lectures dry and difficult to follow, especially due to his limited proficiency in English. Students struggle to learn from the class materials and often rely on external resources. Despite some positive feedback regarding accessibility and test curving, the overall experience is negative, with high dropout rates and low engagement in class.

Ratings.comment: Terrible professor, dry lecture, everybody dropped after the first week and you can barely see anyone in class after the first midterm. which is totally understandable. The material wasn't hard, but he made it so hard to understand. You can barely learn anything on Class.

Its so hard to keep up with the lecture english is not his strongest suit. Homework are extremely challenging and they are not covered in lectures. Slides are not well organized and cannot be used for exam prep.
Make sure you do the homework and understand each question, some of it will pop up on the exam! Overall good course and professor
He was a great professor; he was very accessible and helped me throughout the course!

He take quiz in the end of classes, and he would never told you when he gonna take the quiz. The exams are not hard but you need to take care of all class material. The average for the class is C. Unbelievable.

He is such a sweet guy but there lecture are extremely boring. It's so hard to understand him and when you really try to pay attention you don't know what he's even saying. There are short pop quizzes that are just like the homework. Tests are heavily curved which is the only way I will pass the class.

The man clearly knows economics but his style of teaching just didn't work for me.  Take notes, do the homeworks (his tests resemble the homework questions), study the quizzes (many questions copy/pasted onto exams), and make sure you read the book  Class heavily curved

It was almost impossible for me to pay attention in class, just due to how boring his lectures were. Even when I did put in the effort to actually listen to him (a lot of effort), it wasn't easy to understand him since he doesn't have a strong command over the English language.

Dr. Lam is a great person. As a professor though he is tough. The difficulty of the material increased at an exponential rate. Lectures are long and dry with no depth. Tests are pretty hard but if you RTFQ you should be okay. There is a short answer portion worth 25% of the test grade so get ready for that. Very nice and has lots of office hours.

Seems like a nice guy but I learned absolutely nothing in this class. The most mind numbingly boring lectures imaginable that do not even help with he exam. Relying on the curve to pass. I would not recommend at all.

In 4 years at OSU, worst professor I have ever taken. I am an A/B student and this class is just bad. Very boring lecture that does not help you at all. Pop Quizzes are difficult. Exams are difficult with averages in the D range. Only because the Teacher does nothing to help you. Rely on doing homework to help you with tests.

terrible instructor his lectures are extremely boring all he does is stand up and read from a powerpoint there is no review for exams. one thing i liked about him is he post quiz answers online and  include most of the questions on the midterms  and final. text book is not need, he post all power points online.

He fill up the board with his notes prior to the class starts. No sufficient time for students to take notes and trying to understand him when he talks. also, he admitted in one of his classes that he published a paper knowing there is a mathematical and statistical error in it because no one else notice it.

I audited this class. Prof. Lam was extremely well organized, and an expert.  Lecture notes were provided. He explained concepts clearly and with much insightful into the economic reasonings. He tended to lecture as if it were a big lecture hall instead of interactively raising questions even though there were only about 15 students in the class.
GOOD TEACHER!

I don't understand how anyone could have rated this guy as a good teacher. It was one of the most terrible classes I've ever had from a teaching standpoint. He is hard to understand and his teaching consists of copying his notes up on the board. The optimal strategy for a good grade in the class is to get his homework assignments and memorize them.
he is very good
No Comments
has a systematic approach, tries to give his intuition. a little bit hard but gives you a taste of graduate research.

He doesn't actually teach anything - he just re-writes the theorems and definitions from the textbook on the blackboard everyday.  His explanations are unclear and the homework assignments coer material that isn't taught in the class.

summary_comment: Professor Bellner is known for his dedication to his students, though his classes are challenging, particularly due to difficult exams that require extensive preparation. Students appreciate his care and effort to support them, but find the content can be dry and the exams tricky, necessitating thorough studying and utilizing available resources.

Ratings.comment: Great guy, the exams are hard so study for them
Great guy, the exams are hard.

Exams are very difficult. Studied both exams for over 6 hours each and did terrible on both. The questions are highly specific and obscure. It almost seems like he is trying to fail students or make the class more difficult than it already is. In both exams, I hadn't seen the information from the course for 30% of the questions. Thanks Bruce!

Professor Bellner is a nice guy, but the content can get dry. The exams are tricky, so be sure to study hard and utilize resources like the textbook and Unstuck AI to prepare. If you put in the effort, you can do well in this class.

Even as an online course, you could tell this guy cared about his students. Was appreciative of discussion board posts, and gave exam study tips. Not an overly difficult class if you put in the work. Highly recommend

Good lecturer and cares about his students the content was pretty dry and was brutal to follow at 8am but he posts his lectures so i was able to go back and review the content at my own pace which helped a lot homework was pretty light with only 3 assignments a week but the exams were sneaky tough definitely be ready to study a bit

I would suggest taking this class in person if possible, it's not as engaging online. Weekly readings accompanied by warm-ups, quizzes, and simulations, with biweekly discussion posts aren't too hard to keep up with. The two exams are worth 60% of your grade and he doesn't round or give extra credit so you gotta do good on those.

Pretty easy to keep up with, a chapter or two a week fairly short just take notes and the homework and quizzes will be easy. The tests are worded strange sometimes and kind of confusing. Bellner was cool he sent out weekly reminders.

He is extremely nice and even for an 8AM lecture, he is enthusiastic and tries to make the course engaging. The material wasn't extremely difficult, there was just a lot of it. Attendance is graded so go for easy points and the homework was pretty simple too.
Prof. Bellner was a solid professor, but the class itself is sneaky tough. Two exams are pretty heavy, and some of the exam questions are a little odd. Overall easy B hard A, but Bellner is solid.

Dr. Bellner really showed the he cares about his students even through an online setting. That being said, the course is going to challenge you, especially the exams, as both are worth 30%. It's really hard to get an A in this class but if you put in the work then you'll be fine. This class is definitely an easy B but difficult A.
Good professor, study for the exams as they count for a lot of the grade.

Bruce is such a nice guy and a great lecturer even at 8am.  Unfortunately, the content for this class is pretty boring and there is a LOT you memorize for the exams. I found the exams to be tricky, but if you study you'll do fine. I got an A studying my ass off for the midterm, and then a B- on the final because I barely studied. Easy B, hard A!

Professor Bellner was a super nice guy, but his lectures were a snooze fest. Your whole grade is pretty much based on two exams that were way harder then I was expecting for a class that every business major must take. You have a lot of easy homework assignments each week, but they really do nothing for your grade.

Overall, not a bad class. Take the exams seriously though because they are weighted pretty heavy considering the fact that the only other assignments were easy Pearson quizzes. Overall, I think he's a nice guy and cares about his students. Sometimes his lectures were a little boring but nothing unbearable.

Prof. Bellner is one of the most under rated professors at I've had while attending OSU. He is very passionate. Top Hat is required during his lectures (80 min long X 2). I'd avoid taking his early morning class as sometimes his class is repetive/monotone. Exams (60% of grade) are straight-forward and contain a lot of questions from prior quizzes.

I took the 4 week summer session and it was pretty smooth sailing. Bellner seems like a nice guy and he grades in a timely manner. It's really easy to pass the class even with less-than-stellar midterm/final grades as long as you complete all other assignments.

Only real way to succeed in this class is to read the textbook- there is no way around it. The textbook explains the material better than his lectures (not really necessary to watch them). The online textbook does allow you to copy & paste, which is nice if you type your notes. The midterm was quite difficult, but the final was not nearly as hard.

Whoever said the exams weren't like the quizzes was lying! For the exams rewatch the lecture videos and practice the quiz questions. You must study. There should only be two or three curve balls on the exam. I never read the textbook as everything he says in lectures is in there. Sadly ended with a 92.5 and there is no curve :(
Actually a great guy, I would *optionally* take another class with Prof. Bellner.

The only complaint about this class would be the exams. The questions are nothing like the quizzes. HOWEVER, if you really read the chapters and study the material FROM THE TEXTBOOK, you'll do just fine. If you don't do too well on the exams, go to Dr. Bellner's office hours to go over the exam, he's very supportive and will help you succeed!

Bellner is super nice and cares about his students, but 8 am lectures made it hard to focus. IB was a pretty straightforward class with weekly assignments and two heavily weighted exams. He was accommodating and allowed me to take them a day early. I didn't do as well as I should have on those, but nonetheless he's a solid professor.
This class is extremely easy. The layout was also extremely organized. You'll do perfectly fine in this class if you put in even a bit of effort.

Lectures were straightforward. If you put in a little bit of effort studying the lecture materials for the exams, you will do just fine. Just make sure to know all the different theories and what they mean. Pretty easy class honestly.

Assignments besides the 2 exams are all super easy A's ... only thing that might bring your grade down is the exams but even those are relatively easy compared to most courses. No complaints for Prof. Bellner
Super nice guy and ends up adding a curve. Exams are somewhat difficult but all other assignments are easy and quick.

8 a.m's are not the way to go, but he does take attendance and TopHat quizzes every lecture, so there's some motivation. Lectures 50% material that's important and 50% fun fact stats, so the book is important. LearnSmart assignments are a huge help with midterm and exam as well.

Prepare to do lots of mandatory, online homework for this class, but it's beneficial. The homework really prepares you well for the exams. I actually wish all the business classes operated this way. His curves are generous on the exams. Overall, International Business turned out to be an easy class if you just do the work.

Bruce is a pretty good professor, I took his online IB class and I really enjoyed it. You have to watch about 3 hours of lectures every week and about 1 hour of homework. You do not need to read the textbook but you should know the vocab for the exams. Overall, I liked Bruce as a professor especially online, but it was not as easy as I was told.

Bruce is an awesome person who really cares about his job and his students. His exams are weighted heavily and require alot of excessive reading. You basically have to memorize blocks of texts which is really annoying. Although that sucks, Bruce does his best to make it the best class it can be.
Very easy for a fisher class. Tests are multiple choice, but somewhat tricky. Read the textbook and do the weekly assignments.

One word, boring. Dr. Bellner is very interested in this course but having it at 8am really killed the vibe. He also took attendance which sucked. Lectures are boring and you really don't need to go unless he is taking attendance. Exams are pure information regurgitation with a little bit of information you have to read in the book. He curves.

Good teacher & gives you a reasonable amount of material to be responsible for on the exams. The only issue is- the exams are super hard. random questions are pulled from the book when we werere Required to purchase the book.

He's such a nice guy and he is clearly always thrilled to be there every day. He loves the subject and teaching.
