It was unfortunate that this class was at 8 am and on south campus (far from the business school) because it meant not a lot of people showed up to his lectures. I think the 80 min lectures make it hard to focus.

Easy quizzes/activities that are very just completion based and you just have to make sure to stay on top of. Other than that, 2 exams where if you watch the lecture and do his study guides you should be fine.

Bruce Bellner's class was fairly straightforward. If you watch the lecture videos, you should get at least an A- in the class. There was a textbook, but you do not need to read it. The lectures cover everything you need. I would say, however, the exams are quite difficult, but if you study adequately, you should do pretty well. Would recommend

Lecture is only graded on three exams and attendance. Lectures are incredibly boring as is the whole class, why this is required to graduate is beyond me. When maybe half the class shows up every lecture you'd think it's an indication that no one care about the class.

Exams aren't hard if you study a little bit; all from slides, don't really need book. Attendance taken by TopHat. A few group projects throughout the class but nothing super time-consuming. Overall, a pretty easy class if you put in the work.

Very easy class. 3 group case write-ups, 1 group presentation, some online hw weekly but easy. Try to take the online lecture version, then class only once a week. Need to show up for tophat code but don't really need to pay attention in class. 3 MC exams, pretty easy if you memorize slides night before. Easy grader on group work. Really caring

Bruce Bellner was great as a professor for a senior class like 4490. He was very thought provoking and really cared about students. The class was very easy overall, but as kind of Fisher's Senior Capstone, I was okay with that. Bruce Bellner still allowed students to learn and think about strategy in business and I really enjoyed the course overall

Definitely take 4490 with Dr. Bellner if you can. You can watch lectures online or in person. In class recitations apply concepts to cases. Pretty easy grader. Each group does 3 case write-ups and 1 presentation. Exams are pretty straightforward. HW assignments are also pretty easy. For the most part, this was a fairly stress-free course.
Very passionate about teaching and truly cares about his students. Well spoken, knowledgable and understanding. Enjoyed having him as a professor.

Bruce is fairly laid back. Takes attendance for every class, but lectures are pretty boring and everything he goes over is on the slides. Just re-read the slides before the quizzes. Can find the book as a pdf online. Biggest downside is all the cases to read. All the questions for the cases are done as a group so not too bad. One group project.
If you can take this online, do it. Professor is very nice and timely in responding to emails.

Genuinely nice but not a good professor. Lectures are useless but you have to go for attendance credit. All of the coursework is generated by Pearson and takes forever. He also takes forever to return grades. Take a different professor if you can.

Nice guy but not a great professor. Insanely boring and hard to stay alert during class. Everything needed to pass is put online (including lectures) but he still makes attendance a decent portion of the grade. Exams are easy but quizzes are very detailed based off of chapter readings. Avoid him if possible

Bruce is a very good professor however, if you can, avoid taking him for International Business. The class is much harder under him than other professors. The online quizzes are very difficult and count for a lot.

Overall easy class. He is a fantastic nice professor who grades easy. Expect a few group papers and a presentation which aren't that hard. Just feels like busy work. Exams are really easy as long as you go through the online slides and chapters a few times. Would recommend taking him over anyone else. Also a fantastic resource for real life

Mr. Bellner is probably my favorite professor to date. He has a very contagious sanguine attitude, creating a laid-back atmosphere. He appreciates you being there and giving it your best effort. Very light coursework. Very kind grader. He's cool and down to earth. If Bruce Bellner is teaching a class you need, TAKE IT! NOW! He's the best, really.

Bruce is the best professor I have met at OSU, he is nice and interesting. He really cares about how his students doing. Easy grader but you can learn a lot from his class. I also take his 4597 in this semester, also is a great class. Take his class, you will not regard! Thanks Bruce!
Don't blow off this class because of all of the easy things you hear about Bruce. Lectures are boring and too hard to pay attention to, not a lot of points available in the class.

Bruce is funny and extremely intelligent.  I took Underground Econ (4597) with him and it was a blast.  The material was pretty easy and we always had fun in class.  The only downside to Bruce is that he is pretty unorganized and doesn't give clear guidelines on his assignments.  But it wasn't too awful because he was a fair grader.

Bruce is a great guy and really cares about students. He isn't there to trick you or hurt your gpa. He puts all the test questions on Carmen so if you study those you will get at least a B in the class. Also gives an easy extra credit assignment worth 5% so do that if you want an A.

Absolutely love Professor Bellner. Easily the best professor I've had at OSU &  his 4597 class is awesome. Super easy grader, and very laid back. This class offers real world application and is interesting AF to be honest. Did not require much effort at all. Lecture attendance isn't required until presentations start.. You will love this class.

he tells you exactly what to expect and the date its due. Directions are clear cut and he grades easy. he isn't too worried about grades he just likes to teach and get everyone into learning what hes teaching

He is a very nice guy.  His lecture can be boring but make sure you show up to get 10/10 on participation/just sign in. Large lecture. DON'T waste money on the textbook. I did fine with just reviewing the slides he posts at the beginning of the class. I actually enjoyed him and would definitely take him for other classes.

Very easy GE course as long as you stay up on the notes. Almost never attended lecture as the only thing he does in class is read the powerpoints which are available online. All the HW, quiz and exam questions are pulled straight out of the test bank so theres no excuse to not do well. If you do go to lectures they are a little dry.
It was one of the best lecture I have ever taken, it was so interesting, inspiring and practical. Professor Bruce was such a nice guy too. The class is the coolest class ever!

I am really tired of the vague instructions. There are totally 5 essays, one presentation, and 2 quizzes (thank god he dropped the last one), to be honest, this is the most hard working class i have ever done. The workload is ok, but just the instructions are too vague and you have to work really hard to follow them. The quiz is extremely detailed.

Ok, I took macroecon with him and the underground economy with him as well. For both classes, he is a lazy teacher. Here are whys: 1. Test are straight out of test banks 2. Doesn't talk much about ppt, but the quizzes are 100% based on ppt. so go figure if the lecture is necessary. He take attendance for lectures. I don't like this type of teacher.

This class is somewhat harder that other gen eds. His test are literally straight out of the test bank so if you just know the answer to the test bank questions you can get a 100%. Lectures aren't that necessary but he's a good guy and they are interesting. The recitations are  pointless, don't bother going the recitation after the exam.
Amazing guy and an amazing lecturer. Always there for the students and made economic topics easy to understand and more interesting. Definitely would take again!

Very good lecturer on an interesting topic. Covers material slowly and is very clear. No textbookoutside reading. Lots of group work and the 2nd half of the semester is just listening to group presentations. 1 research memo, 2 short papers, 1 presentation. Attendance grade matters. Not many assignments in the course. Cares a lot about students.

Professor Bruce is a rarity, he is always available to students and always willing to help. Reflecting back on this class you learn alot through the research paper he has you complete and the presentations you listen to every week. Nice, genuine person that really makes learning interactive, everyone should take his classes.

I took three class teaching by him. Econ 2002, 2367 and 4597. All of them are good. You can learn a lot and get easy A at the same time. He is very helpful. Just 3 paper  need to submit and actually it is the same one you extend and modified for three times.

Bruce is the best macroecon professor at Ohio State. I didn't go to class at all, I only read the book. Which is fine because his lecture slides are made from the same company as the book and don't teach anything new. All of the possible test question are also located in the test bank. Don't forget to do the extra credit. It can boost your grade 5%

He is a great guy and really cares. Exams are not too bad but you need to study the provided material and book and understand the concepts to do well. The Final was harder. Recitation with the TA sucks and hurt my grade the most. He is very chill and makes it known that he only gives clear cut questions and is not trying to trick us or hurt our GPA

Interesting class! There is a group project, a 10 page draft paper, a take home midterm, and a final 15 page paper. The majority of the semester was listening to groups present their projects. Gave attendanceparticipation points at random times. Watched an interesting movie. He's an easy grader. He's such a sweet guy, always talks to students!

I probably went to lecture maybe 5 times all year and will easily make an A in the class. He posts all lecture slides online as well as a test bank that he draws every test question from. Not to mention the EC assignment worth 5 percentage points in the end. If you can choose your macro professor, take Bruce.
Nice guy, easy class
He's the dude that you want for Econ

Great guy. He was recitation teacher for senior capstone which accounts for 60% of the grade.  Gave minimal effort and was able to get 59.5 out of the possible 60 points. Take him if you have the chance.  Interesting discussions as well.

Very easy class and a great teacher. Strongly recommended. Extra credit is given. Not much time needed except for studying a little before exams and some easy homework that does not take long. If you just read the chapters you do not even need to show up to class as class presentations are straight out of the book. Reading the book got me an A
Although most of the lectures are more or less a reading of the power point slides, Bruce makes the material easy to understand and does a more then fair job of preparing you for exams and quizzes.
Very nice guy. Knowledgable and easy to understand. I think he makes a point to make the lectures interesting, especially when covering boring material.

Very kind man. Very knowledgeable about economics, and loves learning new things. He wants you to be creative with your work - write and present something that will be new and fascinating for him.  The class was excellent, and if you try, he will reward you. He does not grade harshly. Highly recommend.
Bruce was one of the nicest teachers Ive had who always had an interest to help the students outside of class. If you have to take an ECON class try your best to get Bruce hes great

He is very knowledgeable and willing to help very student. He also want to communicate with you beyond the material in the class. If you are interested in finance and economics and want to have an international perspective, take him. If you want to go deep into economics, do not take him.

Bruce is seriously one of the NICEST men I have ever met. He's very passionate and wants all of his students to learn and do well. I wish I would have taken the time to get to know him better. If you put in a little effort he was a very easy grader. Lectures are straight from the readings, so attendance isn't important except for participation.

Bruce is one of the nicest professors I've ever had. He's so interested in finance and the economy and is incredibly helpful whenever needed. I highly recommend him as a teacher. Attendance is worth very little, so you don't really need to go to class. Really easy

Great Professor! Although the class is made up of about 500 people he really seems to care about the success of every single student. He's a very nice guy and will help in any way possible. Class is appropriately difficult. He makes all possible test questions available for studying online so study those and the notes and you will be fine.

This is my second issues of contemporary world class and this class definitely has more work load.(reflective paper,draft paper,presentation,final paper,& more) My other 597 class only had extremely easy quizzes that will guarantee you to get full marks. It's not hard but If u are looking for an easier 597 class, I would not recommend this class.

Bruce is the man.  Lectures are clear and concise.  He's genuinely interested in the material which never hurts.  Exams are pretty easy if you follow along with the material.  He provides a study guide for each chapter and puts those questions directly on the exam.  Definitely would recommend.
Easy professor. Interested in what he teaches. Nice guy. Very easy class.

Kinda cheesy sometimes, but he explains things pretty well. Moves through the slides way too fast to write some of the stuff down, but the slides are straight from the book. He gives you a schedule of what he's doing each day, so I'd say take half an hour to read before lecture. You'll get a TON more out of it and it'll be a lot easier.
By far the best professor I've ever had!

Great professor! Follows material from book strictly. Exams have built-in bonus and help boost your grade. 3 MTs and 1 final exam (pretty easy). Rec. attendance = extra credit. Easy tests and homework. Do the reading and this is an extremely easy class. I ended up with a 105%. Remember there are NO grade exceptions, bumps, or curve.

The only classes you need to attend are on the days right before each exam, when he gives a study guide with everything that will be on the test. You don't even really need the books because the exam answers come straight from the Freakonomics study guides on Carmen. He's very nice and clearly loves this course. Extra credit available. Easy A.

This was the easiest class I've ever taken. He's a really nice guy, but there are NO exams so there is literally no incentive to pay attention to lectures, but attendance is taken so half the people there just play computer games. We had a short movie response paper, a final paper and draft, and the easiest group project I've ever done.

The class was broken down into an essay which could stem into your final paper, draft, group project, current event article summary, and attendance. Watched 3 interesting movies. He's very approachable & understanding of your problems. Books suggested but not used. Loved the class, would take another class with him :)
Great prof. Looks straight up like Kenneth from 30 Rock.

Professor Bellner is one of the best I have ever taken at Ohio State. The class is extremely interesting!!!! Bruce goes above and beyond to help even out of Econ class. He is very intelligent. Ask him for book recommendations, he reads many books.
Class is very straight forward. No homework. 1 extra credit. He's worth changing your schedule around for to get into his class.

Bellner is a great professor.  He makes sure that he goes over all of the information on the tests.  There are never surprise questions on his exam that you didn't go over in class.  His exams are pretty easy and a lot of the questions are from the test bank that he posts online.  Take his class!
Very nice guy & great professor. He's very helpful and seems to enjoy his job. I definitely recommend taking his class.
AMAZING! Best professor I will most likely ever have at Ohio State. He is a very genuine guy who loves his job.

This class is overall pretty easy. Tests are pretty straight-forward and not difficult. Going to lecture is pretty boring and pointless because he reads straight off the slides that are online. I never went to class and it was still really easy. Bellner is a real nice guy and is always willing to help you out.

AS FOR THE ATTENDENCE, YOU DONT NEED TO GO TO CLASS AT ALL, EVEN RECITATIONS. JUST MAKE SURE YOU SHOW UP ON EXAM DAYS AND TAKE THE EXAMS. Everything is ONLINE - POWERPOINT SLIDES, LECTURE NOTES, PRACTICE EXAMS ETC. CLASS IS A BIT HARD IF ECON IS NOT YOUR STRONG SUBJECT BUT BRUCE IS A NICE PROFESSOR. TAKE HIM!

SUPER nice guy. I don't particularly like econ, and hated 200 so expected the same.. but hes a great teacher. Very easy to listen to and you can tell he genuinely loves teaching the material. He actually made me not hate having 830a class at hitchcock! very helpful, i would (and have) recommend(ed) him =)

He gives you all of his lecture notes and supplements so you really dont need to go to class.  Reads directly from slides, really boring but easy class.  Study Testbank questions, his exams are nearly identical questions

Proff Bellner is a really nice person. He is very helpful. His classes are intresting. There is a long paper to submit at the end of the class but he will work it out in such a way that by the end of the quarter you have a great paper with not too much of an effort.
Lots of group work.  One big paper.  Good 2nd writing class.
The guy is great, he really cares about helping out his students and strives to make his class best for everyone. Really just a generally nice guy.

Not the most interesting subject in the world but his tests are pretty easy.  Homework isn't for a grade, your only grade is 3 tests but he does give extra credit.  Posts all powerpoints online so you don't have to go to class.  I'm taking him for 201 next quarter

He's a really nice guy in person, but by far one of the worst teachers I have ever had. He spends the first 25 minutes of class rambling about useless nonsense and then spends the rest of the class confusing people with horrible examples and other irrelevant speeches. I only went to his lectures because my TA barely spoke english-- way to be OSU.

I found the class to be extremely easy!  I didn't buy the book and didn't go to more than a handful of classes and got an A.  Essay exams are the only grades.  Lectures I saw just read off the powerpoint... so I did the same and just slept in.  Good choice for an easy GEC.

Go to class, read the book, know the material. The prof is awesome but he expects you to do the work. Do the extra credit! It matters and makes a difference. Powerpoint is boring but Econ isn't a super exciting subject to anyone outside of Econ. It does change your perspective, it does help your life decisions.
Bruce is Cool! :D   if u can get the practice exams from ur TAs, it makes things so much easier :)

the lectures are realllly boring and he goes through the slides quickly- but he posts the powerpoint online so you dont have to go to class. the test questions are very in-depth and there are a lot of concepts (not just definitions to memorize), so you have to study alot to do well.

Bellner is a nice guy, but this is the most boring class ever.  All his notes are online, and he literally just reads straight fromt he slides.  It's an easy A, especially if you can get a practice exam from your TA.

I took 201 with Bellner because of the reviews on ratemyprofessor.  DON'T TAKE THIS GUY!  My roomates are in other 201 classes and they are 4x as easy.  Bellners Midterms are 75 questions each (in depth questions) and the other 201 professors give 25 question midterms that are MUCH easier.  During lecture all he does is read his powerpoints.
Awesome guy. Lectures are all online for econ 201.

Really nice all around guy but the lectures were verbatim from the reading and powerpoints that could easily have been found online.  If you get a practice exam for the class then it helps you a lot on his tests.

Bellner seems to be a nice guy but his lectures are extremely boring...my suggestion, dont go to lectures but do all of the reading then do your best to find a practice exam, also Myeconlab (online course guide) can be very helpful for studying for tests.
Fairly knowledgable and good at explaining concepts.  Friendly attitude.  I found his lectures very boring, though.
very good prof... very helpful

I loved professor bellner.  Read for the exams though, because he likes to talk about current events in class rather than textbook stuff- which is cool if you actually want to learn.  If you really aren't into econ- just read and skip class.  If you enjoy econ even a little, you'll love his class.

Lectures are really boring... He reads straight off the powerpoints... His exams for Econ 501.01 were not the easiest ive sat through... Gave a mix of multiple choice and essay questions... Though an easy grader (for the essay answers) and reaaaaly nice fellow.

He is a realllly nice guy.  I went to every single class the first half of the quarter and did really good. Second half of the quarter I didn't go at all and did the same. He reads straight off of the powerpoints.  Just read the book and take the online quizzes. EASY CLASS IF YOU JUST TAKE A LITTLE EXTRA TIME TO READ.
Easy exams, don't go to class EVER, just read the book.

Bellner is really nice. He tries to make the concepts easier to understand. His lectures are straight off the powerpoint online but make sure you read the chapter the night before you go to lecture, you will understand especially if you're not an econ type of person like me
He was a nice guy, and the class discussions were good, but the tests were based off the book not class. if you like econ go to class for the discussions, if not just read the book.
Very boring
very boring and tests were a little rough, no bonuses or anything

Didn't like the lectures too much. This guy is great, and quite funny.  He might repeat Murphy's Law, oh 100x or so--but you'll get used to it. (Thought he never taught prior at OSU-main campus.. but not sure)
I wasn't really happy with this teacher.  I just thought he know the material, yet he didn't communicate the subject enough. His tests were fair, however and easy.

SEI.Subject: BUSMHR
SEI.Class Name: International Labor and Human Resource Management

SEI.Subject: BUSMHR
SEI.Class Name: International Labor and Human Resource Management

summary_comment: Professor Verma is widely regarded as ineffective in her teaching approach, primarily relying on reading slides without engaging students or making the material accessible. Students find her lectures monotonous and unhelpful for self-study, with no scheduled office hours and limited interaction. Her grading policies are seen as harsh and inconsistent, with one student noting a significant grade improvement despite struggling throughout the course.

Ratings.comment: This was an in-person class that was moved online to almost every single lecture. The material she teaches in class is not accessible to review on your own time. She also does not have scheduled office hours, they are only accessible if you email her. The class is also graded by only 1 midterm, 1 final, and 2 problem sets.

This is by far the worst professor I've ever had.  She clearly has no idea how to actually teach or make information digestible.  All she does is read off slides or drone on in an incredibly boring way.  I wish I never took her but I had no choice. Not to mention for an in person class she has moved every lecture online where she is ever worse.
The worst instructor I've ever had at OSU. She never cares whether students understand or not.
My grade was below 70, but the professor raised me to a C+. I love this professor.

I've never had anything below an A- in any econ course at osu until I had professor verma. Extremely tough exams combined with incredibly dull lectures. She seems like a very smart person but definitely lacks teaching experience and a sound methodology.
Although she is smart, but I think she has no teaching experience. In the class, she just read the slides. She made this class super difficult.

Verma is a smart person but lacks compassion and empathy for her students. She also has no clue how to teach. She has an incredibly monotone voice, reads off the slides, and makes it incredibly hard to pay attention in class. She is wildly inconsistent with her grading polices. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. Worst professor I have had at Ohio State.

summary_comment: Professor De Jong is highly knowledgeable and engaging, using real-world examples to enhance critical thinking and incorporating a unique European humor into his lectures, which students found enjoyable despite the subject matter's potential dullness. His teaching style is lecture-heavy, and while some find his slides less helpful, most agree that studying a few hours outside of class leads to strong performance, with quizzes and exams being fair and well-aligned with the material covered.

Ratings.comment: Super knowledgeable, and his lectures are interesting. He routinely uses real world studies and data to relate to the material and that helps with critical thinking. He has a refreshing European dry sense of humor that the class enjoyed, as econometrics can get dull at times. Currently taking 5420, and sincerely miss his lecture style.
The weekly quizzes don't determine your grade
If you study for a few hours outside of class and don't skip lectures, I would be surprised if you got below a B+.
Weekly quizzes, 3 midterms and a final, and a final project. Tough class but he's great about answering questions, being fair at grading, and explaining the material.

I had Robert de Jong for ECON 5410 (Econometrics I). The course consisted of weekly quizzes, four homework assignments, three midterm exams, and a final exam. The course was conducted online, and the midterm exams and final exam were proctored via Proctorio. The exams were closed note and fairly representative of the lecture material. Great prof.

De Jong has a very interesting way of delivering his lectures. He calls powerpoints transparencies for one. He is very lecture heavy, and as such his slides do not adequately summarize what he speaks in class which is often all over the place and hard to understand. Class was harder than it needed to be.

Lectures are really hard to pay attention to, so boring. Class was not too hard as long as you understand the concepts. But, there's no partial credit on homework or test questions which means your score can go downhill quickly.

He was a really nice guy, he kind of ticks you on a few questions on the exams. He waits and gives you a term paper over Thanksgiving, don't procrastinate on writing it. Homework is really easy, good grade buffer.

He is a great professor but I wasn't quite happy with his grader. His grader hardly gives you partial credit for your long explanation in either homework or exams. Go to class, do the sample exams, meet him during office hour and you'll do great!

I was not too happy with the professor or his grader. His class was all toward learning an econometric program but he didn't want to show the class how to use it other than basics and then when I asked for clarification on a project he told me to figure it out myself and he wasn't going to hold my hand!!!! I was asking for a group of students...
go to class. Tests are straight forward.  He's a nice guy and doesn't try to trick you. Probably the easiest teacher in 444 considering the material

He knows what and how to teach. But this class is extremely hard. A lot of working needed. He really does not use textbook, but still necessary to buy. His teaching method is not very much boring. And his powerpoint slides are not very useful for tests.

Great class but very difficult. Robert is extremely intelligent but is able to clearly convey challenging topics in an easier to understand way. Go to class, pay attention, practice the concepts he explains and you will do well.

Class is tough, but the curve is rather generous. Test questions are all multiple choice or short answer, but are more about concepts and applying things, not just memorizing things, but there's usually one or two questions on some random fact. Read all the papers he posts. Either pay attention in class or read the book carefully.

Dr. De Jong made econometrics lectures about as interesting as they can be.  He explained what could be an overwhelming topic in very manageable terms, and yet at the same time did his best to teach us the most widely used, up-to-date and applicable regression methods.  His exams were fair with no surprises, and not too difficult given the subject.
nice guy.Handsome European knowledgeable Elite. very clear about his material. But since it is all about math, you need to a lot of work on your own after class.

This material seemed like it would be so hard, and this professor makes it so easy to get a decent grade in his class.  As long as you do the homework, which he actually grades but only assigns once every couple weeks, you can do well on everything else.  And he plans it that way.

summary_comment: Professor Kagel is widely regarded as inconsistent in his teaching quality. Some students find him engaging, knowledgeable, and challenging, while others describe him as disorganized, apathetic, and confusing. Overall, his effectiveness varies significantly depending on the student's perspective.

Ratings.comment: Easily the worst professor I have ever had. Apathetic to every portion of the teaching process. Incredibly disorganized and unprepared. Most in-class activities were botched by his incompetence. If you get this professor, do not hesitate. Drop the class.
Sarcastic, does not care for class nor for students. Thinks highly of himself but not others. Why have him still teach????

Professsor Kagel is a very nice man, but honestly I think he might be past his prime. He doesn't make sense. We usually come into class with half the homework done because he forgot to send us part of the data. He also makes mistakes with math and addition which makes this class incredibly confusing. Do NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

His practice exams match the format of the real ones exactly. He goes over homework the day its due, so if you dont know an answer you can just ask him and he gives it to you. The class was incredibly easy, but he also presented the topics in a way that kept my interest. Attendance is mandatory for in class exercises (participation grade)

Really knows his stuff and very funny. He is a great lecturer and is constantly challenging students. The paper was a bit tough but Professor Kagel turned it into a great learning experience. I recommend this class to anybody, very interesting.

This guy was funny. The book was really only used for homework and some reading, but overall it wasnt bad. He went over a lot of stuff in class, but it was hard to understand what he was talking about sometimes. If you asked questions he usually answered them, and he didnt put anything on the test that he hadnt gone over.
This man is absolutely insane, but in the good way. His grading policies are kind of weird, but if you argue, he'll change the grade. I probably deserved about a B, got an A-.
Very good class! I really learned a lot and it wasn't too hard.  Go to class, do the homework and practice tests and you'll do fine.
Rude, made fun of you for asking questions when you didn't understand whats going on. Doesn't explain anything, jsut scribbles on a board. Gets angry too. Very objective grading policy.
sarcasm is extremely funny (jokes about government, medical field, etc). will help in any way possible with hw. goes over hw at beginning of class if there are questions. NICE!

summary_comment: The professor is generally considered effective, with a challenging yet fair approach to teaching economics. Students note that while the material can be dry and the exams demanding, attending classes and putting in consistent effort leads to good grades. However, some find his teaching style and class content particularly difficult, suggesting that alternative professors might be preferable for those who struggle.

Ratings.comment: Amazing teacher all the other comments are heavily biased and wrong
Just make sure you know your algebra and differential calculous well, and like anything else go to class, pay a little bit of attention and you will get a fair grade.

Great professor! His humor was dry, but it kept me entertained. I had no appreciation for Economics beforehand, and I love it now. He rightfully made it challenging, but I just paid attention in lecture and was able to learn a ton and get an A along the way without much outside work.

Very dry material, so not really his fault. Had problem sets for Homeworks which were graded (fair grading on the HW's), but one midterm and one final. HARD. This class was really just hard to sit through. Thoroughly uninteresting. The prof. himself isn't so bad though. With decent effort you should be able to get a passing grade.
I would definitely reccomend trying to find a different professor. This guy is horrible. His class is absolutely painful to sit through and he puts no effort into helping students.
he is really really really useless. his test are hard. multiple choice and short answer. go to someone else for help if you dont understand the material.

bar none the hardest class i've ever taken, but don't worry too much about your grade because the curve is generous. don't leave the homework to the last minute because they take hours. he's serious when he says don't skip class.

I really enjoyed taking this class.  He has that kind of dry humor that only some people appreciate.  Overall, I though he was a good teacher, and even though his exams are tough, he does give out a good curve.

I liked this guy! Although I learned most of the material through the book, I thought Dr. Heubeck was funny and generally cared about economics and his students.  It can get pretty dry and dull going to class.  But the curve is amazing, I thought I failed the final and ended up with an A.  Definitely take him.
Extreme curve. Class is boring and all of the notes get posted online. You dont actually have to show up. Kinda full of himself.

There is so much hate on Heubeck for being boring. It's more the class itself. There's not much material being covered. When he goes off topic, it's quite interesting. Anyway, exams are easy if you use all the online help. It's not necessary to go to class if you read the book but it can still help. Likes to give Honors students a break on grades.

he'll put everything you need online.  midterm 40% final 40% problem sets 20%. no need to attend class other than for exams or to turn in problem sets.  Generous curve on exams. cruised to an A for the course. he spent the entire quarter fixated on a regression analysis program that came with the text.  econometrics is not supposed to be this easy.

He is very boring and I fell asleep during class a couple times in a 20 person class, but he didn't seem to care or maybe didn't notice. The midterms were pretty easy, the final was tough, but there is a generous curve.

Incredibly boring. Make your choice - either read the chapter or go to class. Everything he says in class comes straight out of the book. Lectures were long and boring and he never let us out early. However, the two midterms were easy and the workload in the class was light. Just watch out for the final. Curve was generous; a C became an A.

His lectures were interesting and he would keep things that way with humor.  Not the simplest of subjects, but that being said his exams were not overwhelming and he graded on a generous curve.  An enjoyable class overall, in which I certainly learned a lot.
I ENJOYED THE CLASS. VERY SMART GUY, AND HAS A SENSE OF HUMOR. TEST CAN BE HARD, BUT COLLEGE COURSES ARE NOT TO BE A CAKEWALK. I WOULD TAKE THIS INSTRUCTOR AGAIN.
lecture is imho quite bad, don't really know what he is talking about, not structured too well. grades are curved nicely, overall ok.

SOOO boring! He talks about real world examples in class but doesn't really explain how to actually do the homework problems and stuff that will be on the exams! Does a nice curve though, mandatory homework due on Tuesdays, ended up with a B. But do NOT take him! Makes econ more boring than it is.

Exams were fair.  The book was a bad selection, but if you go to class you dont need to read the book.  He had trouble clarifying things for people sometimes, just re-said what he already had, but a lot of people's questions were about the prerequisite math for the class.  If you realize game theory is important you will like this class.

You would think sports economics would be at least a little entertaining....  Nope.  This is one of the more boring classes I've taken, and I even took it with three of my friends!  He grades unnecessarily hard, and he is the most boring speaker I have ever heard.  You would probably learn more by just buying the textbook and reading it.
Very boring lecture but he tries hard.  I feel as if he is too smart to actually help students understand the material.  He posts all notes online.
Very boring. Slept in class. Didn't read the book. Did the online quizzes the day before and got A's on exams. Not much work is needed for this class. Seems like a nice guy though
Very dry. Put me to sleep whenever I chose to go to class. All powerpoint slides are online.

He is so boring, and the lectures don't really help to understand the material, as he likes to talk about current events instead of the material.  HOWEVER, if you read the book thoroughly, the tests are very easy and he doesn't grade very harshly.  He's pleasant, and obviously likes Econ a lot.  Just make sure you're ready to read the book.
Excellent professor. He goes out of his way to infuse the course with relevenat issues in economics, which makes a lot of dry material a lot more interesting.

His explanations and exam materials were clear cut with very few tricks.  He uses real life examples and random facts to elaborate a point, but sometimes it leads him on a tangent.  I wish there were more organized notes to follow, because he taught what came to his mind.  Overall, he is a pretty good teacher that is laid back and willing to help.
He just goes right out of the book so you can't see any very good examples, and he is always late to class. When i went in for help he didn't act like he was interested in what he was teaching
Completely boring and dry...no matter how bad you want to pay attention and learn he finds a way to make it impossible to do so. Dreaded the class everyday...
he is kind of disorganized and pretty dry in terms of his teaching style...be prepared to be bored. I didn't think his grading was too bad though...pretty fair
MIdterm grades low, hard to follow
class is unorganized. syllabus doesn't even have assigned reading. he comes to class and basically teach whatever comes to mind.

The man has a doctorate in economics.  When teaching introductory levels, only expect his knowledge to complicate things.  However, he focuses on topics that are more pertinent to realistic application or higher-level courses.

He is the one professor I will advise anyone NOT to take. He teaches you absolutely nothing and every class becomes completely off-topic. If you do end up with him, I would agree to say to just read the book and not go to class.
i agree with the above
Not knowledgeable about economics whatsoever. Read the book, don't go to lecture. Midterm average was a 48%. Office hours are useless, as is emailing him questions.

summary_comment: Dr. Hartman is generally considered an effective and engaging lecturer who explains concepts clearly, making the class manageable with effort. However, some students find her exams challenging and prefer alternative instructors for a smoother learning experience. On the other hand, others highly recommend her for her generous grading policies and helpful resources, viewing the class as an easy way to fulfill general education requirements.

Ratings.comment: Took this class for 4001.01. One of the worst professors at OSU. Can't explain concepts and expects us to know econ already coming into the class, even if our only time was a few years ago. Take my advice, absolutely horrible, just take the calc version at least there is a curve!
She is a kind lady but can sometime come off snappy, exams were difficult, top hat extra credit was always stressful to get turned in but helped me end the class with an A
She's so bad at explaining stuff, but the tests are easier than the classwork and homework. If you actually want to understand the class, then pick another teacher

Hartman is a good lecturer that really explains the concepts really well. The class consists of 3 midterms and an optional final exam with assignments on MyEconLab. As long as you somewhat pay attention and put in the work it's an easy A. There's also Tophat extra credit so take advantage of that during lecture.
Highly recommend, fantastic professor and lecturer. She provides a study guide of each midterm exam that are nearly identical to the actual exams.

Dr. Hartman is a very nice a great teacher. As long as you put in some sort of effort in studying the exams are not bad at all. There is also a group project and final paper but they are graded lightly.
Easy gen ed class.  Lectures were decent.  If you take notes and do the homework, you'll ace the exams.  She drops the lowest exam score, and there's 5% extra credit.

Dr. Hartman's ECON2002 class is manageable if you stay engaged. Lectures can move quickly, but her generous grading policies and Unstuckstudy make it easier to succeed. Worth taking if you need the credit.
This class was a piece of cake. Ez concepts and she is an awesome teacher. Up to 5% extra credit points at the end of the class. Practice exams match real exams. If you can take Darcy, do it.

The class was hard because Econ is hard. When you take the course online, there are many resources, but you have to use them to do well. I recommend taking it in person; getting extra help is hard if you take the class online. She drops the three lowest quizzes and homework assignments. There is also an extra credit assignment with 4% added.

Dr. Hartman is one of the most fair Macro professors you will have. I was in the 700 person lecture- she sometimes went a little too fast or didn't focus on a difficult topic for long enough, but her lectures paired with your recitation will give you all the tools needed. Also, the tests have insane curves and the lowest test gets dropped.

Was in a 700 person lecture. She usually taught too fast or didn't explain things in depth enough. Recitation was terribly challenging and exams were worse. Dont worry she curves, but it didn't help me not feel lost in lecture. Usually went home and taught myself everything again. super nice but I think the 700 person lecture worked against her.

Dr. Hartman is overall a good professor!  I was in her mega-macro section with around 700 students, but it was fairly easy for me to follow along.  If you listen and participate in class, you will be fine.  The exams are not the easiest but it isn't uncommon for her to curve them.  There is also a lot of opportunity for extra credit.

Dr. Hartman was an amazing teacher for the ONLINE section of 2002. She answers any emails/questions promptly and did a great job connecting with students even though they were online. She is very friendly and caring.

Dr. Hartman was overall a good professor. She gave extra credit, posted recorded lectures online, and dropped low exam grades, quiz grades, homework grades, and recitation grades. She went a little fast during some lectures, but that may have just been me. I was in a 700-person lecture, and she often stopped teaching to tell people to be quiet.

Took this online in Newark, so I have never actually met the professor. The class was very straightforward, read a chapter once a week, do the assignments for that chapter, and do a discussion post every 3 weeks. I am taking her again for 2002 next year, so I'm sure she is an amazing professor.

Darcy is a great professor! Lectures can feel boring and repetitive but as long as you go to class, follow what she writes on the screen, and take notes, you'll be fine. There are multiple opportunities for extra credit and you can drop an exam. Quizzes and homeworks are easy. I mainly filled out the study guides and created quizlets to study.

Dr. Hartman is an amazing professor. She tested out a new textbook this semester, but I really liked getting her insight into things and she made the content super easy to digest. Big extra credit opportunities, lowest exam score dropped, and lots of little completion assignments make it really easy to do well if you try.
5% percent extra credit + lowest exam dropped + best professor for macro

She clearly cares about her students and gives all the tools to be successful. She gives a study guide for every exam along with recorded lectures every week. She also gives a few extra credit opportunities.
stickin out youe gyatt for the jeff Bsuer aahhh HAAILL NAAHHH

Microeconomics can be a very boring and basic subject, so it was very good to have someone concise and engaging like Dr. Hartman as my professor. For a 3-credit class, the homework was light and the exams (which are unfortunately weighted 60%) netted around a B-average. Dr. Hartman provided many resources and was overall a very helpful professor.

Dr. Hartman is a queen. Getting a good grade in her classes is not hard. Show up to lecture, take notes, and pay attention and you can get an A. She offers a good amount of extra credit every semester. Pay attention to her syllabus, too! I took two of her classes and both dropped the final exam if you had a good grade in the course.

It would have been better if completed slides are given. I didn't like the facts that Check Your Understanding takes my point away. Also, If research paper is 3 pages long which also requires proper citations, it should have taken up at least 25% of your grade treated same as other exams.

I was .5 pts off from getting an A- in the class (feel weird posting since it looks like so many people got As), but Darcy was great. I STRONGLY recommend watching her online lectures. I literally watched one right before an exam and everything on the exam for that lecture was on there. I got 5 EC points from going to most lectures and doing SEIs.

Dr. Hartman was amazing! The online lecture videos were easy to follow and she explained every topic in depth. There was a textbook to go along with the course, but I did not find it 100% necessary--I only ever read it for extra clarification on topics and mostly learned everything through the lecture videos alone.

Hartman was amazing and a great lecturer. Use the textbook when studying as most of the exam questions can be understood if you read the textbook. Exams are taken in the same room as 700+ people so take online if this will make you uncomfortable but overall a really great class and definitely manageable if you put in the time and effort.

This class was difficult don't get me wrong. But, she actually taught the material. The first exam I completely failed, but I worked hard on the next two and didn't have to take the final. She also offers a TON of extra credit.

Great professor, but the subject is boring overall so people didn't pay attention and there was always so much side chatter. Makes it difficult for people who actually want to learn to focus. However, a lot of information in her lectures can be self-taught through online homework.

She really cares about her students and wants them to be successful. It is easy to get a good grade in this class. She definitely makes the lectures interesting and adds her perspective in her classes.

Absolutely love Dr. Hartman. She really helped me love learning about a subject I normally found boring. She made it super easy to follow along with class discussions. I definitely will take micro with her in the future, as well.
Such an organized class, which makes sense given how many people take it. Very responsive over email, lots of provided resources to learn in different ways

Her lectures are very helpful and she does a great job of going through the material at a good pace. The material can get confusing a lot, but she does a good job of explaining it and she encourages you to go to her office hours. She tries to connect with her students, even if it's over 800. Sit towards the front if you can.

Dr. Hartman is very nice and helpful when you go to office hours. The exams are a little harder than the homework but as long as you do the reviews you will be fine. The lowest exam score drops too which is nice.

Professor Hartman was extremely fun to learn from! Her enthusiasm and charisma made the course interesting and even fun to me. Conetent wise, it was not extremely difficulty. I found it easier than micro. There were also ample opportunities for extra credit, which I appreciated. I really enjoyed her class and would 100% recommend taking her!
Not a hard class but just a boring subject. Great professor overall.

if you take this during the summer (6 wks) its not easy. its very crammed and difficult. BI seriously cant be happier to have this class over with. with that being said, Darcy is great. exams are kind of tricky but you get two attempts. take it during the full semester, not 6 weeks and it will be a breeze.
Awesome person and professor. Take notes and study a decent amount and she's very willing to work with you to get an A. Plenty of extra credit available too.

This was held online or inperson. She offered extra credit through TopHat and I got 3 extra points at the end of the semester. She's pretty nice and I attended online. Exams were straightforward as long as you do the homework and practice questions. Exam 3 was pretty hard out of all of them. Your lowest exam score is dropped. HWs are dropped too.

Honestly the worst lecturer I have ever had. She talks so slowly and monotone it was difficult to remain awake. She uses prewritten notes that are posted on carmen and then rewrites them in class. On the plus side she does offer a lot of opportunities to improve your grade and attendance is not required, but I could not stand being in her class.
She's a great teacher who gives plenty of extra credit and lets you drop your lowest score. Lectures can get confusing so it is important to study a lot before exams. Study the notes she posts.
Never attended lecture and taught myself out of the textbook. From what I remember she was pretty rude and the lectures weren't very informative.

Darcy is a very good professor, in my opinion. She is a very lecture-heavy teacher so if you are able to pay attention she makes things very clear. She posts all of the lectures online and doesn't' take attendance. If you watch live she offers extra credit. There's online homework due bi-weekly that is easy, and 3 midterms of moderate difficulty.

Dr. Hartman is passionate and cares about her students. Even for someone who doesn't like Econ, if you read the textbook and pay attention at least somewhat in lectures, you will be fine. Lots of extra credit and could usually use notes on exams.

She definitely gives you the opportunity to succeed and really cares about her students. Sometimes her lectures can be a bit dry, but she tries to spice things up by having students present and bringing in guest lecturers.

Darcys fine. I dont like or understand economics, so keep that in mind. Attendance/Participation get you extra credit. Tests are multiple choice but hard. 50% of grade is just midterm and final exams. If you space out for a second, youll be lost. Shes a fast talker. But she knows her stuff. Take notes (tests are open note).

Darcy gets very sad if people don't show up or participate in class, but she's an absolutely sweet and lovely person, so please don't make her sad. Lectures are straight from the textbook, which allowed me to get pretty far in Candy Crush. Not an easy A, but definitely accomplishable if you put the work in.

Great professor. Sometimes goes a little fast through slides, but always uploads the necessary resources to carmen. Put in the minimal work, you'll be fine. Go to recitation, it's usually helpful. Prof. Hartman is a nice lady and is probably one of the most 'fun' professors i've had when it comes to personality.

Hartman definitely falls into the "chaotic good" category. Her lectures are basically just semi-confusing rants but the textbook is good and her tests are open note. She really does try to make her class entertaining. She also gives a ton of extra credit.
The lectures arent mandatory but she is entertaining so its not boring to watch. The exams are open note and the homework grades are really easy

Hartman is definitely one of the better Econ professors at OSU. Her lectures could be a little hard to follow sometimes, so I always read the chapters before class. Her exams were pretty fair (studying & attending class was definitely necessary). The group project & paper were actually fun to complete. She gave us plenty of extra credit too!
Not the most engaging lecturer but just read the book and do the practice problems on time and you'll be in the clear. Plenty of opportunities for EC and straightforward tests too.

As with most intro classes at OSU, it is difficult to reach Dr. Hartman. Although, she was very open to meeting with me outside of class when I contacted her. She was very nice and receptive during our conversation. The class is not super difficult, but I recommend reading the textbook. Students struggled if they did not read. I enjoyed her!

Darcy was solid, she explained everything very clearly. Recitation can be a mixed bag, it depends who you get. Make sure to do the hw assignments on time, they act as the only buffer against exams (however, they are easy) Basically, if you have darcy for macro, you'll be okay.

I really enjoyed Dr. Hartman's class. Was a 6-week summer class so it was self-paced, but she did a really good job breaking down all of the information in the lectures, which made the homework and assignments much easier. She made sure she was accessible to students. The paper was graded fairly and the 2 exams were not overly difficult.

Darcy was a great professor. She seems very knowledgable and teaches the class in a way the students understand the material. Exams do make up the majority of your grade, but you get to drop one exam at the end of the semester... so I didn't have to take the final.

Lectures can be boring but have good information you should know. Shes almost always willing to elaborate on subjects so dont be afraid to ask. Decent amount of work but you have a long time period to get it done and its more time consuming than it is difficult.

Dr. Hartman tried her best to make the class interesting despite the fact that it's an intro/GE class for most people. The tests are not bad if you pay attention to the lectures and do some studying beforehand. The online homework assignments are a little tedious but a great way to earn some easy points. She gives lots of extra credit too.

If you want to take Econ, TAKE DR. HARTMAN. She's the best professor you could ever take, that is if you put in the effort of course. She falls nothing short of giving you everything you need to succeed, you just need to work for it. Amazing lectures and gives out extra credit opportunities

She made the lectures optional for extra credit. She's not a great lecturer but she provides you with a ton of materials to prepare you for tests (an overwhelming amount IMO). Half of you grade is based off of two tests, which made it a very stressful class, but not too difficult.

Tons of extra credit opportunities, easy HW, and solid lectures. Exams make up 50% of your grade, but as long as you attend lectures and study, you will get an A. Great professor and great person all around.
I took the fully online class. Assignments/tests aren't too bad.

Dr. Hartman is a pretty decent professor. While she clearly wants as many students as possible to succeed in this intro-level course--streamlining & simplifying everything--I was personally somewhat disappointed as an econ student in its unchallenging nature. Also, her lectures do not cover everything so referring to the textbook is a must.

Overall a great class and I learned so much. The only thing that can be a little tricky are the tests. The material wasn't too difficult but if you have spotty internet or a slow computer and it crashes for whatever reason during a test, you're out of luck. makes sense since this class is known for cheating but can be a little nerve wracking.

Dr. Hartman is a good professor but her lectures are so boring. They are just screenshots from the textbook so its redundant to take notes on the pre lecture videos, textbook, and during the live lecture. A possible of 4 easy points of EC at the end, but 50% of grade is on midterm and final.

Dr. Hartman was one of my favorite professors. Her class consisted of weekly homework problems, a midterm, and a final. Exams were easy if you used her study guide. She gave us so many chances for extra credit. I learned a lot in her class and would not hesitate to take another class with her. Overall, do the work and there is no way you can fail.
Lectures are pretty dry, hw assignments are pretty helpful. Also gives many extra credit opportunities.

Took both honors versions for 2001.03 and 2002.03 and she is the best one. Exams are not too bad and she gives extra credit papers which helps a lot. Not a lot of homework and she posts all lecture notes right after class concludes. Highly recommend.

Dr. Hartman is an extremely caring professor. The majority of the class is long lectures that tend to be boring, however, the assignments are easy to do well on and she offers opportunities for extra credit. Overall the best economics professor I have had and if you take the time to get to know Dr. Hartman, the class is quite fun.
For the online class, there were two weekly assignments. The tests were somewhat hard, but she offered extra credit.

Good prof! There's only 3 exams and a final, but she drops your lowest exam grade. The lectures can be dry, slightly unorganized, and she can go a little quick. However, all lectures are posted online along with her notes. She gives extra credit for going to class. Practice exams help a lot with the exams; just study a little and you'll be fine.

Class is so easy, just study a little for the exams. She drops an exam and has up to 10% bonus on them. I didn't go to class so I can't comment on the lectures, but she seems nice and is more than fair.

She's a good professor however, she can be a bit dry a times and her lecture notes skim over a lot of important information without going into detail. Very easy to contact if you have questions over the material. She drops the lowest test score so most people don't have to take the final which is nice.

Great choice for Econ. Took online and grading was clear and was easily accessible if I had any questions. Several different things due throughout the semester but none are overwhelming. Do the assignments and halfway study for the tests and youll be fine

Dr. Hartman is a very caring professor. She wants everyone to get a good grade and offers a lot of extra credit. Tests arent too difficult, but can be a time crunch if you arent totally prepared. Online weekly quizzes and bi-weekly written homework There is a group project and a semi-interesting current events paper.
Lectures can be boring at times along with recitations, but overall great class. What you put in is what you get out.

For an honors Econ class, this was very easy. I felt like I learned a lot throughout the semester without feeling overwhelmed. I would take any of her classes that she offers. She is by far the best principles of micro/macro professor
I thought that she was a very good lecturer. I thought that they were fairly entertaining and if you did enough outside work, it wouldn't be hard to get an A.

I loved Dr. Hartman. Great prof and funny. Class setup is 4 exams, a quiz due every Tues., and a worksheet due in recitation. She drops your lowest exams and only keeps 10 worksheets. She also does tophat in lecture for extra credit. Lectures are basically her writing notes and you copying, but she also posts notes after.

Compared to other Econ teachers, shes the one to take. She offers lots of extra credit too. Lectures are boring and confusing, she doesnt do a great job explaining things, but you can meet with her or read the textbook and you will figure it out. Exams werent bad either.

She's not the greatest teacher but compared to most other economics teachers she's a superstar. She's very nice and willing to help and one of the few econ teachers without an accent. Overall solid class

Among the honors professors for economics, she is by far the best. Her lectures are a bit dry but she posts everything on Carmen and by reading Carmen material and online textbook you will be fine. Extra credit and 3 midterms with one being dropped. Accessible and helpful. Recommend her if you take honors economics
Unorganized, writes down notes as she speaks - tough to listen, doesn´t go into detail a lot

She isn't exactly a thrilling teacher, but she grades fairly and gives opportunity to understand the material. Lectures are honestly not important because she is so boring that you're not going to learn anything anyway, so just do it at home.

Although she is a likeable person her lectures and lecture notes are very unorganized in confusing. She also is left handed so it is hard to keep up with her writing as it is usually covered by her hand. Not the best professor but not the worst.

After taking this class, I realized Economics was not my thing. Although the class was a bit boring and somewhat difficult at points, Dr Hartman really helps out through multiple extra credit opportunities and simply being a nice teacher that is willing to help. The lectures are a bit monotonous in my opinion, but it's doable.

She is a really a good teacher, her class is organized well, she usually cares about students and she is very patient to answer students' questions. More important, she has many extra credits that you can easy to earn an A.

Darcy's lectures are not very interesting, however, she provides material on Carmen so you'll succeed in class. You can get up to 5% on your final grade with TopHat questions in class, and she adds two questions on every exam so you can get up to 8% added to your exam grade. Look at previous exams when studying as she uses similar questions!

Professor Hartman is definitely a lecturer and they don't really make sense unless you read the textbook or have former background knowledge of the information already. Her exams are okay, as long as you do the practice exam problems and UNDERSTAND the CONCEPTS. Definitely ATTEND LECTURE FOR TOPHAT. She's a good professor, just difficult to follow.

Darcy is a good professor. Very clear in her expectations and grading criteria. Lectures are not mandatory, but if you go and answer the TopHat questions each day, there's a chance to get 6% extra credit, which bumped me from a B to an A-. The midterms are fairly easy, and you can drop your lowest score between midterms/final. Definitely recommend.
Very easy class. Professor Hartman provides everything you need to do well on the exams. Attendance only counts for extra credit, and she posts videos of lectures and scans of notes online.

It's not that hard to get a good grade in Prof. Hartman's class since she provides plenty of extra credit. She definitely cares about teaching and knows what she's talking about. My biggest qualm with this class was that it was hard to connect lectures with recitation, quiz, and exam content.

I took the online version of the class so I cannot speak a ton about Darcy herself. I did visit her during office hours and she was nice/helpful. She posts online lectures, notes, narrated powepoints, etc. The weekly homework and quizzes are pretty easy as long as you read the material. There is a semi-long paper. The tough part is the two exams.

Had the pleasure of taking both micro and macro with Dr. Hartman. The large lecture hall format sucks, but videos of lecture are posted online, nice to rewatch or if you miss class. Try not to miss class due to extra credit questions every lecture. Exams are all multiple choice. Take notes, study given practice stuff, go to class, you can get an A.
Wasn't a super interesting class but wasn't hard either. Gives a TON of extra credit and drops the lowest test

Econ isn't the most interesting subject to me, but macro was by far much more enjoyable than micro. The tests are fairly easy & she posts many practice midterms for each. Lowest midterm gets dropped. Weekly quizzes that are fairly easy & the recitation worksheets count, so make sure to do them. TopHat extra credit is offered at the end& helps a ton

Dr. Hartman was a wonderful professor. She is very understanding and easy to work with. Some concepts can be challenging but her lectures are easy to understand, and she will take the time to help you if you are confused. You get to drop one midterm, and there is an opportunity for 5% extra credit--if you put in the work you will get an A.

Super clear and precise lectures. A little boring at times, but offered 6% extra credit at the end of the semester which made me end up with 106% in the class. Show up and take notes and it's an easy A.

Probably the most scatter brained person I know. Dont even both going to lecture because half the time shes just repeating/writing down what she said last class but in a different unorganized way. Tests are pretty easy if you look at her practice tests she puts online.

One of the easiest As I've ever received. Gives TONS of study materials for exams. She drops one exam so taking the final is completely optional. Taking notes in her class is extremely difficult because she is all over the place but I did learn from her. Definitely take her if you have to take macroeconomics.
Easy A
If you want an easy A take her. If you actually want to learn econ don't take her.

She is great! All the class materials are posted on Carmen. The exams are easy quizzes are easy. She's patient and well-organized. The attendance is not mandatory. There are many bonus and extra credits! Don't miss it!

Honestly, if you show up and answer questions in class, and do your SEIs, you have a 6% bonus. That tells you all you need to know. If you look at the practice exams you will at least get an A- since the questions are very similar (as are the answers). She isnt helpful, but she explains stuff moderately well and her class is easier than pre-K.

Darcy Hartman is a nice lady, but there are a few things that really annoyed me with her lectures. She goes way too fast and writes tiny on actual paper with no slides rather than on powerpoint. The paper lecture wouldn't be so bad except she's LEFT HANDED so you have to wait to be able to see what to write! Other than that, lots of extra credit!

I'm glad I took the honors section of micro. Hartman moves very quickly so you must always pay attention and write fast. One online quiz per week, six homework packets, three midterms (one dropped), a paper, and an optional extra credit paper. Get an A on every midterm, get exempt from final. Very fair course, and I found Hartman to be enjoyable.

As long as you show up to class and do the review materials before each midterm you'll get the grade you want! Easily the best choice for Macro at Ohio State. She also drops lowest midterm score, so most likely you don't need to take the final.

Darcy was a good professor, I guess. Better than most macroecon professors. Her midterms were easy (especially considering you can drop one or if you score above a 90 on all three you can skip the final). She gave a few extra credit points. BUT, you HAVE to go to this class. She does a lot of verbal and chalkboard notes, and doesn't post slides.
Professor Hartman posts a lot of great study material for each midterm. If you utilize this, you will do fine in the class.

This class was a breeze with Darcy Hartman. Her exams and quizzes are based exactly off the lecture slides. Tons of extra credit (even for just attending lecture and answering the Top Hat questions!) Drops one of your exams. She's an alright lecturer, and the ones who actually listen and ask questions seem to understand what she's talking about.
I thought she was an awesome teacher that really cared about her students. She posts all the lecture videos online and offers extra credit through Top Hat

I'm a first year taking macroecon and this class is a breeze. There are weekly online quizzes and graded recitations. Lecture is about 400 large and you have an opportunity to earn extra credit each class lecture. Easy content, not much memorization, some what math based.

I went to class, read the textbook and did well. You have 3 exams and a final and she drops your lowest grade. She posts review exam before an exam that are REALLY helpful for studying. Honestly, just put in the time reading the textbook and watching AC/DC economics videos and you will do well in the class. Not hard at all.

She throws out terms, formulas, and concepts without explaining them and expects us to know what they mean. She does the same lecture style for every class and I have to force myself to go. She is horrible at TEACHING she just flies through material and thinks we understand what the hell is going on. I have to go to tutoring for this class

Macro with Darcy was pretty easy. She structured the class very well and stuck to the syllabus. The lectures were often boring but informative. There are numerous extra credit opportunities provided. The exams are super easy (all multiple choice) and you drop your lowest exam at the end of the semester.

Unless you think you need extra credit, you don't have to go to lecture. She records them and puts them on Carmen, and material is easy to understand if you study it. Exams are very easy and one is dropped. Recitation assignments have little effect on grade. Don't bother buying the textbook because all information/concepts can just be googled.

Not a great professor at all. Teaching style isn't beneficial to any type of learner, she will keep you past class end time, exams are easy, but her grading scale is messed up. Grades get  curved down.
Absolutely ridiculous that 90% of your grade is from exams- definitely the worst professor I've had so far

You can receive up to 6% bonus just for doing the top hat questions and SEI. The tests were not super hard, and there were only 25 questions + 2 extra credit questions on each midterm. There are three midterms and a final, but the lowest grade is dropped. Recitation counts for participation, but they drop 2 of them.

Going to lectures gets you the extra credit through answering tophat questions, although,  the lectures are often confusing and rushed. She also posts her lectures online so if you can't go you can watch them later. I had to use outside resources to understand the material because she was not super clear when explaining topics.
Easy exams. But hard to learn. She makes everything more difficult to understand, and lectures have no logic at all.

So she makes these powerpoints that are unrelated to the test half of the time and in class she is either sprinting through the powerpoint, or writing on a piece of paper some random graphs that are super confusing but the tests aren't too hard and if you go to class, tophat is worth 5% extra credit
Grossly unorganized and scatter-brained. Really annoying and goes way too fast. Would not recommend.
She is a fantastic teacher.

Darcy was a decent professor. She lectures a lot and goes off on tangents frequently. If you go to lecture and/or read the book you should get an A easily. There are 4 exams that make up 90% of your grade and you drop the lowest one.

Pretty good professor very laid back & easy going, go to lecture and you can receive up to 5% extra credit,  tests are pretty easy and all multiple choice with two bonus questions on every test. Definitely would recommend Darcy if you have to take macro, also takes your 3 best test scores (/4) so you can get out of taking a final

I took this class online and found it to be pretty easy.  Not much homework at all, and the exams were similar in difficulty to the practice exams she posted.  She also offered over 5% extra credit in the class.  I would highly recommend taking this class online.

Dr. Hartman is a really nice person. She gives out extra credit for doing 5/6 of the homework assignments and sometimes for showing up to class when not a lot of people are there. Her lectures can be boring when she is reading off the PowerPoints. There is a group project and a paper, but as someone else mentioned, she is a lenient grader.

Professor Hartman makes it really easy for you to pass the class if you attend lecture. Even if you don't, she posts online lectures and powerpoints so that you can catch up if you miss lecture. Overall, she was always really happy when she was talking about economics and talked about current events that corresponded with curriculum well.

Darcy is a really nice woman who knows her stuff, but she is not the best lecturer. I went to every lecture and found that she simply read directly from the slides without actually teaching anything. I did well on the exams only because I learned everything from my TA and taught myself.

Prof. Hartman was an easy teacher who did not care if you came to class. Her exams were easy and she loves to give extra credit. There were group presentations and a paper but other than that most points came from exams

She is really good! She's nice in office hours, actually helps and doesn't seem annoyed. Exams are easy. 25 questions each. Offers up to 5% of extra credit. Speaks English. Personally I'm doing a lot better in macro than micro. She decided to switch to a $24 textbook from the $150--really awesome. Applies concepts to real world.

Dr. Hartman knows her stuff. There were 4 tests lowest one dropped. Those were 90% of your grade. Go to lecture and you'll do fine. Tests will test your understanding of the topic. She provides study guides, online aids, lecture supplements, and practice tests.
She is the worst. Do not go to class.
shes really boring to listen to. don't.

She appeared very disorganized and rushed through most of her slides every class. Recitation is required and is worth 5% of your grade give 5% extra credit. Don't go to class just read the book and you will be fine. Easy A.

Easy A. Never taken a more easier class. Professor Hartman gives so much extra credits! You don't need to go the lectures, just study the ppts! I did that and finished with a 98%. She gives a total of 3 midterms + a final and drop your lowest grates! :)

I went to lecture like 3 times this whole semester. She really does read off the ppt so you can just watch the podcast. She's a nice lady but I just wish she could explain a little more rather than just reading the ppt. But if you need help, I'm sure she'll be more than willing to help you. Its a easy class if you put a good amount of time into it.
She literally reads through the slides. I don't even listen because her voice is annoying. I think the online version is much easier because the review guide is the final exam. Super easy.

I wish I got paid to show up and teach the textbook slideshows that come standard with our access code like Darcy does. She rushes through the slides and just reads off of them. Lectures aren't helpful, only for extra credit. Exams are fairly straightforward and as long as you read the book/power points/ go to recitation you'll do just fine.

Amazing professor! Her lectures are consistently interesting (if macroeconomics interests you) and taking this class definitely helped me decide on economics as my business specialization. Her exams are relatively simple and straight-forward, so as long as you make a reasonable effort, an A is definitely attainable. Definitely one of my favorites.

Makes you do one group project and one research paper, but she's an easy grader. There are three midterms but if you ace them all then you don't have to take the final, otherwise your lowest exam grade is dropped. There is extra credit opportunities. I never bought the textbook and I aced all the midterms and got an easy A.

Her lectures are pointless. I got an A for the class with only reviewing from ppts she uploads. She basically reads off the ppts during the lecture, which makes her lectures extremely boring. Gives extra credit and bonus questions though along with super easy exams.

Really nice lady. Don't bother going to lectures because she has to speed through the power points and they are online anyways. Read the book and go to the Econ Learning center for help. All of the midterms are easy and the extra credit questions do come from the lecture. Make sure to do all of the online quizzes and homework too.

Midterms are super easy as long as you read the material. Lectures are extremely boring and unnecessary - if you read the text you won't need to attend. However, extra credit questions on the midterms are over facts she  mentions during class that you likely would not know otherwise. Overall, the class is very easy and not much work is needed.

Took the online version of this course. Pearson online was used for the textbook/homework/quizzes. The lectures and slides are very helpful and straightforward, but there were many conceptual questions that were answered in the textbook only.

ECON2002.01 (Macroeconomics) is a college class taught at a 6th grade level. Every midterm is a joke. I made a quizlet from the study guides (the folders are called "OSU ECON2002.01 Midterm 1, 2, and 3" respectively if you want to use them) and got an A every time. Skim the textbook and you'll be fine. Lecture attendance is not mandatory.

I'll admit it, her lectures aren't the most interesting. However, she's very helpful when you reach out to her and she doesn't try to throw you any curve balls on her tests. If you're looking for an easier econ class, Darcy is the way to go.
I really like this professor, she is funny and she generally gives good feedback
Enjoyed thoroughly.

Dr. Hartman is a great professor.  She is very interested in our current economy, and she regularly prints out articles of things going on in the real world and we read them in class.  There were 6 homework assignments that you do for extra credit.  There is one group project and one individual research paper, but she is a lenient grader. Take her!

She means well. The class is easy enough. Aced all the midterms and did not have to take the final. She does go very quickly through lectures and her ppts contain a lot of text. Very difficult to take notes in lecture. Make sure you read the book and go to recitation. Overall though, you'll be fine with Hartman. No reason to switch.
