For lectures, she speeds through the Powerpoint slides, but they're on Carmen, so lecture is virtually pointless. Recitation is mandatory and also useless. As long as you review the slides and read the textbook, you shouldn't have much of a problem. The midterms are super easy and there are extra credit questions.

Nice but, Lectures are boring and PPTs not helpful. IF YOU READ THE TEXT you do not need to go to lecture. She drops your lowest midterm score. The final was REALLY easy. There is weekly online homework and quizzes. (Quiz answers are online sometimes or directly from textbook.) Recitation is mandatory and not helpful. Just read the text for an A...
Difficult to listen to because of her somewhat monotone voice.
Everything is pretty much straight from the book. Midterms aren't that bad. Lots of extra credit, easy A.

She pretty much just reads off the slides during lecture and her microphone isn't loud enough, so lecture is really boring. I didn't really listen in class and I just studied a lot for the midterms. Just do your homework, do the quizzes, go to recitation, & really study what she puts on the midterm reviews and you should be fine!

Dr. Hartman is a very approachable and kind professor. Her tests are fair and there is a lot of extra credit available. Sometimes her notes are a bit unstructured, so reading the book definitely helps. Overall not a terribly difficult class.

Darcy is a wonderful lady and very kindcaring. If you get an A or A- on the three multiple choice midterms you dont have to take the final. She is understanding and easy to talk to in office hours. The book is a must to do good. Read it. TAs are completely useless.

This class was an easy A with Darcy, her lectures are clear (even though she does move fast) and midterms are not difficult and grading for the class is easy. The final was just like the midterms! Take Macro with Darcy!

The class was a mess, she even admitted she wasn't prepared to teach an online class and did not like the program quizzes and ended up adjusting the course half way through. She does not provide help or feed back just one video per week where she does a very easy problem, nothing like the exams. DO NOT AKE THIS COURSE ONLINE.

She means well, but during her lectures she essentially just reads the class the slides provided by the textbook.  The pace of the class is very fast, there is not much time to take notes, but I guess that's okay because you'll have access to the powerpoints. I would not take another one of her classes.

She's pretty good for someone who has to teach 535 students, and she's personable too. My biggest complaint is that I don't think she turns up the microphone enough in that big hall. Sometimes she goes over material a bit quickly, but overall it's definitely manageable.

Means well, but class is mostly just her reading the slides that get put on Carmen. Biggest warning is this class has one speed: Fast! Don't count on getting all the day's notes during lecture, it won't happen. The class will also stay at this speed throughout the whole semester except for test days and the day right before.
Super easy class if you pay attention in lecture or study the book. Got As on all midterms and didn't have to take the final. She's really nice and her lectures explain the subject matter well.

Dr. Hartman is a great teacher. I think she does an excellent job of breaking down the material. This class is extremely easy if you give a damn and pay attention. Hartman is sweet and attractive in a Mother ILFy kind of way. All you have to do is take notes and go to recitation. I got As on all of the midterms and I didn't have to take the final.

She is boring and class is really long and useless. Online quizzes each week are easy. You have a paper to write.  Midterms are just alright; not entirely difficult, but not super easy.  Once again, she is very boring!

Excellent professor. She is very clear about her expectations and provides students with many opportunities to get a good grade. Her midterms are fairly easy and straightforward. Tries to keep lectures interesting for the most part.
Easy class. All you had to do was read the book and you can get a very high grade. Her lectures can be boring, but she is good at explaining if you need help.
Fun to work with and so hawt
Good professor to have if you are not majoring in Econ because she is pretty easy.  She is a super nice person but not an interesting lecturer.  Classes are pretty boring. fairly easy A.

Dr. Hartman is an awesome professor but an even better teacher, probably one of the best I've had in college so far. She breaks the material down and is more than willing to help students that need extra help.
If you can choose another teacher, then do it. She goes very fast and the classes are useless. You need to read the book all on yourself. and you need to write a paper.

This class was way harder than it needed to be. Felt like I had to teach myself the material many times. Quizzes are all online, homework is for extra credit, but her exams can be difficult. She also speaks in a really low voice so most times it was hard for me to hear her, let alone stay awake in her class. She's really nice though.

This class is super boring, but it's really easy. Her exams are pretty straight forward. She gives helpful practice problems online on an overpriced website that you have to buy access to for homework and quizzes. She's really nice and willing to help if you have any questions though!

She writes all the notes on the board during each class, which is helpful. But she goes SO fast. The entire class is basically writing a ton and not really absorbing much. You need to read the book and your notes regularly to stay on top of things. She gives 5 homework's for extra credit and weekly online quizzes.
This class was way harder than it needed to be.
Nice and likes the topic.  Can get boring but worth going to class. quizes and exams are worded difficult. reading textbook helps a lot

I went to almost all the lectures but it wasn't necessary. Homework (5 sets of practice problems) was very easy (not graded) and for extra credit. Easy online quizzes. I ended up teaching myself things because she wasn't always clear. Nice woman though.

She was an okay teacher. She did not really help much. Could be a little ditzy at times but had really  good fashion. I think she was easier than the other macro econ professors so i would suggest her. Tests could be difficult if you just studied the notes

Freakonomics is really fun and interesting, that being said Darcy has the strangest techniques I've ever seen. Her tests are all multiple choice and quizzes were EC but I feel like she wrote her questions while in a questionable state, they rarely made sense. I'd still take this class again though! Gotta love Darcy!

Freakenomics class was pretty fun. Class was interesting, with a pure mutiple choice midterm. Felt a bit like high school at times with some of the movies but she was overall a fun teacher. If you show up to class, you should pass

SEI.Subject: AEDECON
SEI.Class Name: Principles of Food and Resource Economics

SEI.Subject: ECON
SEI.Class Name: The Other Side of the Border: Immigration Economics

summary_comment: This professor delivers high-quality instruction, reviewing fundamental concepts of statistics at an appropriate pace and providing ample preparation for problem sets and exams. Students find the workload manageable with clear guidance, and the final paper phase offers flexibility. With consistent attendance and note-taking, achieving a top grade is highly attainable.

Ratings.comment: I have never taken statistics before, but he reviewed everything at a good pace. There are only 4 problem sets with a few problems and 2 exams that he prepares you well for. The last couple weeks you have a lot of time to draft a final paper. If you attend lectures and take notes, getting a high A is very feasible.

summary_comment: Professor Oostrom is highly regarded for her engaging teaching style and ability to make complex topics accessible, though her approach can be challenging and demanding. Students appreciate her support for hardworking individuals and her efforts to keep the class engaging, even if some find her initial teaching methods intimidating. Overall, while there are mixed feelings about the difficulty level, many students find her class both informative and enjoyable.

Ratings.comment: Super engaging, loved this class! It was pretty easy, if you showed up and did the practice problems.
She cannot teach.

One of my favorite classes I've taken at OSU. The content can be hard at times, but if you go to class (and pay attention), it's nothing too bad. Very interesting subject, and Dr. Oostrom does well to keep the class engaging. If you show up and participate, you'll do fine in the class.
She threatened me, and I am afraid of her. She is pretty mean.

Professor Oostrom is clearly brilliant. She demands a lot of her students and I think that can catch people off guard, but she definitely supports those who are willing to work hard. I learned a ton in her class.

Professor Oostrom is a great teacher. I enjoyed the topic way more than I thought I would! The class is challenging and at first I stressed a lot about the grading, but fortunately it's graded on a curve.
Professor Oostrom made the class a place I enjoyed to be in! She is a great teacher and I am so happy to had the chance to take this class

Okay. At first I was upset about the low grades, but everything is curved and she is one of the kindest and most helpful professors I've had. I appreciated the in-class discussions and the attempts to make zoom engaging.
Tough but there is a huge curve so even with 60-70% on assignments you can get a good grade. Made a meh topic (health policy) interesting

By far the worst professor Ive ever had. She doesnt know how to teach and the class average for every assignment was a D or F. Tests were ridiculously long. She does not show any compassion towards her students. Would give students attitude when they didnt understand what she was saying. Do not recommend a class with her. Your gpa will tank.
Believe me, besides this professor, you must have another better choice. The exam and grader are tough!
She is so confusing and it is not easy by any stretch to get an A in this class. If I could do it over I would have taken a different class.

summary_comment: The professor's lectures were ineffective for learning the material, with students relying heavily on external resources like online searches and readings to gain a proper understanding. The class structure was criticized for offering minimal support, focusing solely on midterms and a final without homework or additional practice, and failing to adequately prepare students for exams. The course materials, including slides and lack of assigned textbooks, were described as inadequate and outdated.

Ratings.comment: The professor wasn't the best at explaining the material in the lecture so I had to look up a lot of the terms and information online to get a better understanding. The reading helped me more than the lectures to be honest.

terrible class. offers little help and does a bad job explaining any topics. only grades class on the two midterms and the final. no homework or additional practice questions. does not prepare you for exams at all. slides aren't her own and are old. did not provide with a textbook we should buy or any reading material. i have learned nothing.

summary_comment: The professor is generally perceived as accommodating and caring, ensuring students pass with good homework performance. However, opinions vary significantly; while some find his lectures clear and inspirational, others criticize his lack of patience and effectiveness in teaching, citing difficulties in understanding the material without external help. Overall, the professor's approach is seen as insufficient for those who struggle independently with the challenging subject matter.

Ratings.comment: As long as you do well on homework and show an effort, he will make sure you pass.
Very nice Professor. Sincerely cares about his students.
Good to get exam points, Clear lectures, Willing to help students
He does not have the patience to teach.
It's not easy because you literally won't follow the lecture if you take a look at your phone. But the logic is not that difficult to understand, plus there is a huge curve.

It is not to deny that the lecture is a little bit boring. However, his lecture is inspirational, and we can learn a lot from his lecture if we focus on the lecture. Homework is pretty useful for us to get ideas about what the exam looks like. It is difficult to understand the material without the help of homework. logic is more important than math

HORRIBLE! Do not take this professor! Game Theory is very difficult content, and Yang sincerely did not help in the slightest. I am graduating this semester and he is the worst professor I have ever had. The content is extremely tricky, and he sincerely does not teach it. You have to try to teach yourself from the book and it is so frustrating.

This guy flat out sucks. If you're taking game theory, we will tell you the concepts to know but you're on you're own when it comes out how to actually apply these concepts to homeworks and exams. The class average of our first exam was a 65 which is ridiculous especially for an economics course.

Dr. Yang recognizes that this is a difficult course for undergraduates. He will give you a generous grade at the end of the term if you demonstrate your effort by doing homework, participanting in lectures. I received a lot of lessons from this course that will serve me throughout my career and life in general.

This was a particularly challenging class at OSU. The textbook and professor administering the class were not great choices. Lectures were often confusing and the textbook did not clarify much outside of class. Homeworks were few but very difficult. Unfortunately the weight of the midterm was 30% and the final worth 40%.

Just wanted to stick up for Prof. Yang. His lectures are identical to the textbook, but I thought this was one of the things that made the class easy. Tests were reasonable. Gives extra credit. Super nice guy.

I got an A, but that was because I was already somewhat familiar with the material. If you come in knowing nothing, it is unlikely Dr. Yang will do anything to help your understanding and you will have to teach yourself.

The lecture notes are verbatim from the text and there is no other place to look for help on the subject. The book/class examples are all very simple models and then the HW is so much more complex than the HW its stupid. Also, the final is worth about half your grade so hope you do well or the entire semester was pissed away.

Information Economics. I audited the course. He was very well prepared despite having a new baby in his family. He asked thought provoking questions; gave many helpful economic insights into the material. Very knowledgeable in this field. Very open and accessible to questions in class.

One of the worst professors Ive ever had.  Nothing made sense to anyone in the class and claims the tests are based off the homework, but I got 90% and 100% on the homeworks and failed the midterm (class average was 61%, which he said was good?)  Had to drop to save my GPA...take with someone else.  Otherwise its like an online class=teach yourself

His exams were so hard! You have to write all your answers on the blue book. There are some T or F questions but you still have to explain to get points. Class average for the mid term was 59% and 51% on final. He said the final was similar to the HW assignment which wasn't. I've heard Yod's exams are all multiple choices and much easier.

summary_comment: The professor is widely regarded as ineffective in teaching college-level economics, with students finding her lectures confusing and poorly structured, and her exams difficult and poorly worded. While some students appreciate her expertise in the subject matter, most recommend seeking alternative instructors or self-study due to her teaching style and exam format.

Ratings.comment: HORRIBLE. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND. Exams were horrid, but there is no final. I would personally recommend another teacher for this course. Did not learn a single thing. Waste of Money.

She isn't too bad, but I can't recommend her to someone else. She's seems nice, but she's inaccessible outside lectures. She does offer accommodations, and she's fair. But quite I couldn't understand her or my recitation leader. Apparently she will longer teach at OSU. As I am her last set of classes.

She is definitely an expert in economics, but she fails to understand the basic fundamentals of how to teach college courses. She is hard to understand during lectures and participation is taken every lecture on TopHat, where 50% of the points are accuracy. Be prepared to teach yourself. Exams are worded awkwardly.
Talks slow and notes are clear, her logic is wonderful. Not hard at all.

Worst professor at Ohio State. Lectures consist of her telling current events stories that have nothing to do with class or exam material. Homeworks are frequent and worth nothing. Exam heavy, all exam questions are worded horrifically and many errors in answer choices. Better off reading the book and never going to lecture.

Ida is a educated economist, but poor lecturer. She has open discussions on Carmen to ask any questions we have trouble on and for the homework you get multiple try's to complete it before the due date. Attendance is taken for lectures and recitation on Tophat, and exams are in person. Be prepared to read on your own, her lectures don't help.
She was nice but lectured are a necessity to attend other wise you will fall behind

She is simply not a good teacher. You can tell she knows what she's talking about, she just is a bad teacher. If the whole class got an answer wrong, she would get mad at the class. I think good teachers see that and understand it's because of their teaching if everyone gets it wrong. I used the textbook and received an A.

Ida is possibly the worst professor I've ever had. Lectures are practically useless. She is hard to understand and her teaching is all over the place. The class is not difficult at all, but you pretty much are all on your own and will be teaching yourself out of the textbook. Find another Econ professor.

if you have her- LEAVE. she's a terrible professor, and if you have issues, she absolutely will not solve them. she had never added me to my McGraw hill connect class, and I suffered because of that. she didn't even fix my grade. I wish I could give her a zero

her questions are horribly worded, she does not spend enough time on content. her lectures consist of 45 minutes going over the site and the last 10 to cram all the information from a chapter. Her questions on little homework and chapter quizzes are so poorly worded it costs people points. Complete waste of time, just read the book.

The class wasn't awful, but I definitely hated it. Went to lectures, but couldn't understand her & she didn't make any sense so I stopped going (she posts her lectures on Carmen). EC if you go to lectures, recitation, & if you buy the smartbook. I bought the binder version, read it, and did fine on exams (she drops lowest one). Wouldn't recommend
Hard to understand and replies on the text book too much. Also has a "my way or the highway" attitude. However, there is a good amount of extra credit available.

She is hard to understand but if you pay attention to the notes she writes onto the slides of her lectures then you will do fine. She also always has office hours and encourages students to visit. Finally, she has lectures online but will take attendance through an app on your phone.

She was a very nice woman. however I couldn't understand anything she was saying because of her accent. The lecture was boring and I started falling asleep so I eventually didn't attend lecture in the last month. I read the study guide and book and taught myself and did decent on the final.
It is very hard to understand what she is trying to say.

Horrible! So annoying to listen to and I couldn't understand her. You are competing for your grade, so you can fail the class if you have smart people in there. Read the book and so the study guides, the only way you can pass.
Very slow lectures that go straight from the powerpoint. Studying from textbook/study guide gets you more than attending lecture.

She has such a piercing voice it's hard to understand a word she says.  The lectures are always boring and are read straight from the powerpoint with a few hand drawn notes.  She never once used a hypothetical situation to show the idea she was talking about and left out a lot of key ideas from her lectures that appeared on the tests. Not Good.
You can't understand a word that she says. Don't go to her lectures because you will fall asleep. Study the review sheet before the test. The class is on a cure

summary_comment: Ida is generally considered a competent professor whose classes are manageable and not overly challenging, though her lectures can be somewhat boring. Some students find her explanations clear despite her accent, while others struggle with her teaching style. Her exams are noted to be tricky, and her grading is strict, with attendance contributing significantly to the final grade. Overall, while there are mixed opinions, many find the class easier compared to other instructors.

Ratings.comment: Sure Ida's class is boring, but she's decent and not hard to understand. I had Buser for Macro my first semester, and he was a better teacher, but his class was significantly more difficult. I got an A in both but it was easier with Ida hands down. . If you don't get at least a B+ its on you. That's coming from someone who failed micro in H.S...
absolutely horrible communication and so hard to listen to. Tophat's are brutal

Even though this is Dr. Mirzaie's last semester teaching at The Ohio State University, I think it is important to highlight the fact that she is by no means a bad professor as everyone has suggested.  Sure the exams can be tricky, but this is a college course and it should be expected.  I have thoroughly enjoyed my time in her class.

Prof. accused me of academic misconduct due to something that went wrong on my iPad. Despite showing video evidence, she did not believe me and canceled my exam grade. Exams are not open-note and lectures just copy from the textbook. Also a lot of group work for some reason.

Don't know why everybody hates on Ida. She speaks with an accent, but she takes her time to pronounce everything and its pretty easy to understand. She can get boring during lecture, but the class itself isn't that hard and she explains the concepts well.

She isn't easy to understand, no offense to her it isn't her fault that she is not from the US, but it makes her lectures hard to follow. But the class is fairly easy so you shouldnt have a hard time excelling as long as you have a basic understanding of Econ. I would say her grading criteria is tough, and she doesn't give you much room to mess up.

Not a very good lecturer and attendance is weighted extremely heavily. With both lecture and recitation attendance it added up to 25% of the total grade. You will do fine in the class if you read the online textbook and do the practice and quiz each week but expect to teach yourself the material you will not get much out of the lectures.

The only grades are Smartbook readings/quizzes and tests. Tests are only 25 questions. Makes you sit in assigned seats in a class of 540 students. She seems like a great person who does care about her students but she is not a great professor. Oh she also did not let me make up homework missed while I was in the hospital
Terrible teacher , not helpful and rude

When I first got my classes I looked up Dr. Mirzaie and all I saw was bad reviews. After seeing this it made me worried that the class would be very hard. Overall, Dr. Mirzaie is a fairly easy professor as long as you lay attention and do good work. Exams are easy but make sure to study.
Sometimes can be difficult to understand her, but make sure you show up to class for TopHats, those are worth more than they should be

This professor was very uncaring to her students. She isn't understanding at ALL. I was in a major car accident and I had SEVERE scars (that hurt during the cold) and doctor appointments (that made it hard to go to class at times) and when I talked to her about it, she said there was nothing I can do. That dropped my grade from a 94 to a 84.

Dr. Mirzaie is very knowledgeable about economics and did her best to answer student questions online or in lecture. The content was difficult, but it was very possible to do well with effort. Her attendance and participation TopHat questions were a good way to asses understanding of content and her online option made attendance easy/accessible.

Her lectures are pointless just read the textbook chapters she assigns take good notes and you'll be fine it's a pretty easy read tbh. Never listened to the lecture I just had it up for tophat credit so make sure you do that at least. Exam questions are a bit difficult sometimes because the English isn't always the best. Otherwise good course.

Dr. Mirzaie is completely uncaring and inaccessible outside of class time. I had many extenuating circumstances in which I was unable to attend class including COVID, mono, a surgery, and a fire situation. After talking to her about this, she refused to excuse any of these absences. After attendance was in, by grade dropped from a 93 to an 83.

Ida's lectures are not good as she doesn't speak very good English and she was extremely boring. I recommend just using the textbook to learn the material. Tests are easy and answers can be found on quilt.

Ida is not a professor I'd ever take again. I spent the entire course teaching myself all of the content while still being forced to attend lectures where she just reads from the book and complains about how the class doesn't understand the content and doesn't get the participation questions right.

Quite possibly the worst teacher I have had in all of my years of education. She's horrible. Her lectures are insanely boring and she goes on tangents where she complains about the class and the students. If you do go in person, expect her to be extremely rude. PLEASE never take her. She doesn't deserve a job here.

The worst professor ever! She doesn't know how to teach and doesn't care student. She just remove everything from the textbook and asks you to remember exactly the same words from the textbook when doing essay exams. And she never taught ppt in the class just showed bunches of youtube videos. The most irresponsible lecturer ever!

The least engaging professor I've ever had. She clearly knows nobody pays attention to her lectures and the only way she gets people to show up is Tophat questions (which account for a significant portion of the grade). 

Just awful. Avoid like the plague.

She's nice and receptive to questions. Most of the content of the class comes from the online textbook and its assignments. She also assigned a couple of group projects with a group you work with for the whole semester. If you do the assignments and put some time into the class, you'll be fine.

If you dont already have a solid understanding of economics, you might have a difficult time learning the content because it isnt taught very well. If you do know Econ well, its super easy to get an A in.

If you have the chance to select a different professor, you should try to. Especially if you are a business major and need to know the content in order to move forward. This class is pretty straightforward and easy to do well in, but many people stopped attending the lectures a month into the semester because they are very boring. Read the textbook

Professor Mirzaies lecture notes are very messy and hard to read, and there is a lot of content which feels rushed through. The McGraw Hill stuff goes with the online textbook and isnt hard. But the exams dont relate to to any material and you never know what to expect.

This class is on the tougher side, but honestly not too bad if you have a basic knowledge of economics. She gave an extra 2% on our grade at the end for completing SEI's. She does care that we do well, and exams are not too difficult. I barely studied and ended with an A. Freshman reading these bad reviews; you will be fine lol.

This Professor commonly just repeats the notes tied to the homework that is already due, so lectures are largely optional apart from participation point based in class questions. She also has very messy notes during lectures, which makes it very hard to follow along.

She's not the worst professor in the world but you cant have a teacher that can hardly speak English trying to teach complex subjects. She structures her class well for the students sake but its just too difficult to stay engaged when half the battle is trying to understand what she's saying let alone absorbing the material.
Her lectures were just so hard to follow, and the online format was difficult. She really knows her stuff, but she has a hard time communicating it effectively.

Ida was a terrible teacher. She can't speak English well at all which makes her lectures almost impossible to follow. I strictly learned everything from the textbook and didn't pay attention to lectures at all because I didn't know what was going on.

Even though it is online, your attendance is based on TopHat questions, which are generally pretty easy. Ida bases her exams on her lectures, so as long as you go to class, it should all work out well! I thought it was an easy course, but Ida's explanations could be confusing at times. However, it was usually cleared up in recitation.

This class moves quickly, however the key to success is reading the chapter each week. The lectures just cover the book but aren't well organized to easy to understand. She won't answer questions or go over something that wasn't clear, so the best way to understand the material is to read the book.

I believe that there are probably only like three people in the entire class that actually knows what she is talking about. Lectures are so incredibly boring that its hard to keep focused. I learn more when reading the book on my own. Just dont do it to yourself.

Terrible lecturer. Lectures dont teach anything as she just reads PowerPoint, and doesnt make examples other than what is in the PowerPoint. Very very boring lectures. Credit with TopHat. Would suggest steering clear of her classes if possible

Class is not very difficult, the book teaches a lot better than she does which makes it easy. Her lectures are a bit confusing and she does not teach the topic very well. The topics covered though however are not difficult and should not be a problem for someone with any basic knowledge of economics

One of the worst teachers I have ever had, teaches purely concept with numbers and figures rather than going in depth with example and relating to to students. You'll have no choice unless she quits, but wouldn't take her if I had a choice.

Shes a really sweet lady, however she is very disorganized in her lectures and I have a 60% and Ive tried everything to get it back up but I dont understand anything because of how she has explained these concepts. 1/10 wouldnt take it ever again. Im barely making it

This professor was so disorganized, so uninterested, and barely answered questions. Made intro to micro seem like the hardest course in the world. She would refuse answering questions in lectures. She is so disorganized in the lectures themselves. You can barely follow up without losing your mind.

one of the most frustrating profs ive ever had. was not willing to help me when i asked and was extremely rude to students. tests had questions that made absolutely no sense, and she refused to listen to student feedback. switch professors if you get her!!!!

I had Ida Mirzaie for ECON 4200 (Money and Banking). The course consisted of homework assignments, quizzes, Top Hat, five group assignments, and four midterm exams. Ida asked questions on Top Hat during lecture, making class attendance mandatory. The midterm exams were not proctored, but were closed note/book. Ida dropped two quizzes/homeworks.

I despise asynchronous classes. That being said, I would have strongly benefitted from having that to her. Lectures are early, long and boring (I fell asleep in half of them) and really just confused me more than anything. I learned more from the book and quizzes than anything. Tophat questions for participation which is stupid. Bad at giving help.

Ida was one of the worst lecturers I've ever had at the school. She is a smart lady but does not convey the ideas well. Luckily if you do the homework and make review sheets out of the exam prep she gives, you can get a good idea of what kind of questions she will ask on the test. Review Tophat and attend recitation because that will save the grade

Dr. Mirzaie, as a professor, can be very frustrating. The course is easy, but the exams are often riddled with vague and difficult to understand questions, likely due to the language barrier. When the exam average was below her expectation, she was adamant students did not study enough and that the questions were perfect. That was very insulting.

If you do all the homework and think econ will be easy for you, this class is cake. If you struggle with econ, this class will be miserable. You can't take anything away from Ida's lectures and she explains things in a way that makes concepts unnecessarily difficult. DO NOT recommend if you think you'll struggle with this stuff.

She has horrible lectures that are useless, you study the book more than her godawful lectures. She refuses to take accountability for low grades/test scores and just says "study more" (saying were stupid) Avoid this class if you can, and just her in general... Id rather be taught by a toddler than her.
Terribly messy power points with lectures all over the place. Doesnt respond to emails but instead tells students to re-read the directions and figure it out on their own.
Shes super boring and a pretty bad teacher, just rambled on during class and then asks top hat questions she hasnt fully explained.

Partway through the semester I stopped going to lecture because I realized my textbook reading/notes and recitation were enough to pass the class. Sometimes her scribbles during lecture would get me more confused so make sure to utilize TAs for the class and make sure you understand concepts not just specific situations.

Ida is a super sweet lady! However, her lectures were not mandatory and everything she said during lectures was a direct repetition of what we were expected to read out of the textbook that week, so not many people went because it was boring. But with that being said, if you read the textbook you will be fine.

There were quite a few helpful systems put in place amidst the pandemic but no room to mess up beyond those accommodations. I honestly grasped the material more when I just read the book thoroughly and didn't attend every lecture. It was nice having tests every two weeks rather than huge cumulative exams.
Not a good lecturer, however you can get most of the information from the textbook so I didn't attend most lectures.

Uses confusing phrasing on tests such as what is the far truth from ... ? Asks any take on this? after every slide. Tries to force discussions over things most people dont know about. Enters a zero grade on every assignment at the beginning of semester so you never know your actual grade. Worst Econ prof at OSU by far

She frequently had a mini test due Saturday, a quiz and homework due (sometimes 2 of each) on Sunday, then a Carmen quiz Monday. She had a test open on a holiday and didnt change it until multiple people emailed her. Enters zeroes for EVERY assignment for the whole semester so you never know what your grade is. SHE SUCKS

I took econ2001 with Ida 3 years ago, and I thought she was not a bad instructor. However, in econ4200, when teaching harder content, she is not a great instructor by any means. The lectures are extremely boring and confusing. We had SEVEN tests (which means that we have a test per two week), which was insane.

Although Dr. Mirzaie is a very nice individual with a fascinating background, I would have preferred another professor for this class. The online structure for this course was very unorganized, lacked clarity, and we were not able to see our cumulative grade for half of the semester.

Absolutely useless lectures. Her accent is very hard to understand, the notes are illegible and messy, and she just reads the textbook. Spend your time going to recitation, reading the textbook, watching YouTube videos, and practicing problems and you'll be better off, as the course content is difficult and confusing. Avoid her.

useless in lectures, cant understand her, notes are terrible. Recitations are just top hat questions that are designed to trick you. Class is beyond boring. Oh and she gave a quiz on the day of thanksgiving. take this class if you hate yourself.
COVID sucks and scheduling is difficult but giving an exam on the weekend of Thanksgiving is blasphemous and ridiculous. Avoid at all costs

Lack of proper note giving. In economics you need different colors and graphs and accurate notes. Her notes were no were near accurate. Spent half of the semester skipping lectures and learning on my own.

Hard to understand during lectures, and recitations aren't usually helpful. All the work is done through an online textbook which gives you all the information you need to know. Lectures are voluntary, and there are plenty of YouTube videos to teach the content clearly and to the point.
Its ridiculous how she makes recitation mandatory IN A PANDEMIC. WE HAVE LIVES AND THINGS TO DO AND A PANDEMIC OCCURING. Not flexible at all and this class just makes your life harder.
Very boring lectures that make you want to fall asleep and hard to understand her handwriting. Didn't need to attend lectures at all as long as you read the book

Her lectures really made no sense and she just read off the slide and made us do some practice problems. She didn't explain very well but it was ok if you read the textbook. She does drop your worst exam out of three midterms and a final.

Out of my college career I believe Professor Ida has been the worst and most insensitive Professor I've ever had and meet. My experience with Professor Ida has nothing but one of the most emotionally and mentally exhausting semesters of my life. During the semester I set up meetings with Professor Ida and she does not give u a genuine interest.

Hardest class Ive ever taken... and Im honors and took ap in high school. Content wasnt too bad just content presentation in class made everything so confusing. If you do all the readings and really study, you can get a decent grade still tho. Definitely not an easy A, or even an easy B. Ive had a 4.0 so far but barely got a B...

Not even done with the semester yet and truly one of the worst professors Ive had. Dont expect to learn anything from class- just read the book and teach it to yourself. Not to mention shes can be very rude. Dont recommend.
Decent lectures and easy exams, overall good class.
Although she doesnt believe in basic math (to her the slope of a vertical line is only infinity, and undefined is an invalid answer) she drops the lowest exam and homework from your grade.
Lectures are somewhat boring but one exam gets dropped and the class is curved. If you keep up with the online textbook, this class is pretty easy.
Dont go to class it wont help. Just learn by yourself and have tophat open during lectures. Lots of extra credit and lowest test gets dropped. Not as bad as people make her class seem.
Horrible accent and be ready to teach yourself out of the class. No curve or round up, but extra credit is given. However, you will have to purchase 80$ text book to get the extra credit.

Don't make the same mistake twice. As one of Ohio State's notoriously worse professors, if you were unfortunate enough to get her in principles, do NOT take for Money & Banking- she's even worse than she was in principles. If you have no choice, be prepared to teach yourself the material on your own outside of class. Tests aren't hard, & there's EC

Her accent's not that bad and she makes sense, it's just that when she writes on the board, it's hard to understand because she will frequently rewrite over her old work. There never seems to be a clear plan for each lecture either. Lots of in-class activities. It's not that she's mean, she just makes you feel bad for not knowing the material.

Easily the worst professor I've had here at OSU. Impossible to understand on top of being terrible at doing her actual job which is teaching. It's not a terribly difficult class so as long as you teach yourself the material then you should make out okay but try to avoid if you can.

not a good professor at all, luckily lecture is not mandatory and streamed online. i suggest learning on your own and having tophat open during lecture times so youre receiving credit for the tophat questions!

One of the worst professors Ive ever had. She uses slides to teach economics and skips from the 5th slide to the 17th slide back to the 2nd slide. Everything she says is very confusing and not to mention very monotone and boring. I also had a little trouble because sometimes she pronounces her words in a weird way.
no very helpful and her English is Terrible.
English not good. Mean as well
Seriously one of the worst professors Ive had. Shes unclear, wont help if you need it, if she does give you help shell act like youre dumb, and shes plain rude.

Has a bit of an accent, but she's a decent teacher. This class strictly follows the book, so you can just skip lecture/recitation (no attendance) and read the book and pass the class with an A. Really great grading policy, 3 midterms and 1 final but the bottom score is dropped so I didnt take the final. Show up to tests early though!!!

A prominent accent, deficient mic, illegible notes scribbled filling PowerPoint slides, overhasty speech all have resulted in the omission of crucial information and obstructed solid understanding of the content from lectures. The grading system will screw you. Someone may be an expert in a subject but that does not mean they are qualified to teach

Ida is a really sweet lady but her powerpoint don't go into depth on anything. Reading the book helped me the most personally and doing the online homework for extra credit also helps. Quizzes are really hard and the midterms and final are also difficult but use the book to help you out.
Ida is not a terrible lecturer but she could be better. A little boring at times but overall I enjoyed her class. As long as you pay attention and take good notes its an easy A.

The class material is very easy, but the lecture is exceptionally boring and unhelpful; so I did not go to any lectures for 3 months in the semester but still managed to get an A. The tests are extremely easy as long as you read the simple textbook before the tests.

Ida doesn't have the best lectures but the class isn't hard to make up for it. There are 4 tests (3 midterms and one final, but one of the four gets dropped), 9 online homework quizzes (3 get dropped and they are 5 multiple choice each). She offers extra credit for attendance and participation so it should be an easy A if you put in any effort.

Ida's lectures are unbearable. It is tough to understand her under her thick accent and she is not even slightly engaging during lectures. However, by using her powerpoint slides and the book, it is easy to obtain an A in the class. She drops the lowest four quizzes as well as your lowest exam grade (including the final), making the final optional.

I got a 5 on the AP Macro Exam, so Micro was a breeze to me, and I ended with an A without even taking the final exam. She does not explain concepts well, and it's extremely hard to understand her. She will skip around while presenting, so it's hard to follow. Go lectures for extra credit. Read textbook and watch videos, and it won't be that bad.

Ida is very knowledgeable about economics but it can be hard to follow along or stay engaged with her accent. I went to maybe 3 lectures and almost all of my recitations and passed with an A. Its really just about studying the things you dont understand and learning vocabulary. Recitations are a great way to simplify lecture material

Professor Mirzaie was great! With lectures, handouts, online homework, and textbook readings, any student who wishes to do well can do well. There are good extra credit opportunities and the lowest exam grade was dropped. Anyone who complains about not understanding her or her accent is being unreasonable. She is very coherent and understandable.

Even though lectures are online, go to class. Plus youll get bonus points. And recitations are extra credit too and you learn a lot from them. Shes hard to understand but going to lectures are definitely worth it.
Very dry lectures. Often contradicts her slides when she's speaking. Also very thick accent. Very detailed content but does pull some exam questions from the practice quizzes.

I enjoyed this professor, however she might not be for everyone. The grade in the class is determined by a few things, but she also offers extra credit opportunities. If you express your desire to learn in her class, she will be willing to help you.

I personally loved this class and this professor. Gave you plenty of opportunities to succeed and presented material in different ways until entire class understood. If I had time in my schedule I'd take her class again next semester.
The most dry lectures you will find and 90% of your grade is 3 exams that are all only 30 questions. Good luck not falling asleep.
Easy class. Light homework and quizzes. Extra credit. She has accent, but she is very caring and thoughtful.

This was honestly the worst class i've taken by far. For an entry level microeconomics class, it was VERY hard. After studying for hours every week, I still received grades much lower than I think I deserved. The class average on exams was 19 out of 20, and she didn't seem to care. Overall I would NOT recommend anyone take her courses!

For an entry level micro class- a ridiculous amount of work is required. With hours of studying I still received grades much lower than what I expected. Very unapologetic about the average being a 19/30, and a curve was promised after every midterm. There was no curve at the end, except from a 79 to an 80. A tough class and extremely dry lectures.
Extra credit isn't extra credit. It's not graded out of 0 so if you don't do it, it hurts your grade. But for some reason is labeled as extra credit.
Hard to understand during very boring, dry lectures. Read the book and do practice exams and you'll get an A easy.
She just stands up and lectures and isnt very engaging. Yes she puts her lectures online but the exams are always a lot harder than they should be. Having a good TA will help with this class alot
Bad pronunciation for foreign students also 90% GPA came from exams. BAD PRONUNCIATION!!!!!!!!
Lectures are dreadfully boring. I didnt pay attention during lecture but I just reviewed the slides she gives you and was able to come out with an ok grade. Not the best teacher, but not the worst.

A LOT of work is necessary to do well. It's necessary to understand EVERY concept she mentions in class as well as to read the textbook. Her accent isn't hard to understand. Not a great professor, but not awful either. Class is overall pretty boring. If possible, try to find another Econ teacher, if stuck with her, it's not the end of the world.

Idas class is hard, but not impossible. She has a very thick accent you have to get used to. In order to be successful you just need to thoroughly review and learn each chapter as you review them in lecture. Test questions werent always clear.. I worked really hard and ended up with an A- and also didnt have to take the final.

This is a very easy class you can watch lecture online and she uses TopHat for attendance. As long as you read the book its very easy. Also lots of extra credit. She is a bit hard to understand but that class is super easy comparative to a high shool course
Hard to understand, you have to study on your own. Nice person but not the best professor.

She would go over something for 5/10 minutes in handwriting when she has a perfectly clear graphic on the next slide. Youll get more out of just reading the power points than you will out of her lectures. You can drop any one of the four tests between the 3 midterms and the final.

It is extremely difficult to understand her lectures with her accent. The material is not difficult and she posts the powerpoints online. Be prepared to teach yourself. Lectures can be watched online so you can just wait until tophat questions become available to get extra credit for "attending" the lecture.

She is interested in the subject matter, but is super boring in the presentation of the materials day in and day out makes the hour and 20 minute lectures unbearable. Had to sign a sheet everyday for attendance so even if you can learn from textbook or power-points, you still have to show up. Thick accent makes it very difficult to understand.

Best part of this class- you don't have to go to class. She live streams all the lectures so you can watch them on your own time. The content is confusing and she's really hit or miss. Either shell confuse you or you'll understand it. If you buy the online textbook and do your own studying its an easy A (especially bc she drops lowest exam!)

The lectures are kind of hard to listen to, as her accent is very thick and sometimes hard to understand. In-person attendance is not mandatory, however you should watch lectures on line. Tests are very difficult even if you use all the resources available to you in order to succeed. There are four exams and your lowest grade is dropped. Do the EC!
She is boring but hard to understand but material is super easy. The recitation taught ne the most. Can earn bonus points pretty easy. Go watch crash course if you need help or talk to your TA.

Gives three midterms and a final and one of the test grades can be  dropped. Some people do not even have to take the final if they are happy with their grade. It is recommended to listen to lectures and take notes, read the chapters in the book, and do all of the practice problems and extra credit you can to to get the best possible grade.

Ida is a great professor, and she will try to make sure that you feel prepared for the test. She is passionate about the material and uses examples to make you understand it on a personal level. My friends who had her for lower level classes (e.g. Econ 2000) didn't like her, but I loved her for Middle East Econ (4537).

Her lectures are very boring, but she isn't that bad. She does have a thick accent, but it isn't too bad either. The class is only based on 3 to 4 exams and about 8 quizzes. DO THE EXTRA CREDIT, ALL OF IT. That is all...

Ida was an awful professor. First of all, her classes are insanely boring, as she talks in the same monotone voice for 55 minutes. Her slides and examples are so confusing, with unclear examples and sentences that don't make sense. Not to mention her thick accent, making her hard to understand, and her tests, which are so tough & borderline unfair.

She drops the lowest exam score, and every quiz is online. You don't need to go to lecture, because she air's each class online, but make sure to take advantage of the 5% possible extra credit. Tests are very tricky and it would be very difficult to get an A.

HEED MY WARNING. SERIOUSLY. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. ECON IS HARD BUT THIS IS RIDICULOUS. THIS ISNT BECAUSE I HAVE A BAD GRADE. ITS BECAUSE SHE MAKES ME CRY ALL THE TIME, DOESN'T TEACH, AND EVEN HER ANSWERS ON EXAMS ARE /////WRONG/////// YOU WONT PASS DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!!! if only i had such a warning!!!!

Accent was not that bad to me. If you pay attention the lectures can actually be quite helpful. The exams themselves were confusing, but if you prepare by doing the quizzes and reading the textbook you'll be okay. Incredibly knowledgable and approachable, I'd recommend asking her questions if you have any.

Horrible lectures. Try to get a different professor if possible. Ida bounces all over during her lectures, she doesn't allow enough time to write down what is on the slide, and she has a thick Iranian accent which can be difficult to understand. The only reason I passed this class was the textbook.

Her lectures were not that helpful to me personally. I took notes outside of class and went to her lectures with a basic understanding of the concept and just asked questions. Very easy grading system because you are allowed to drop your lowest exam grade.

Each professor makes their own exams, I took another teacher's exams to see if it was just her, and I aced the other's exam, but got mid B's on hers. Her exams are worded weirdly and often have trick questions. Also she expects you to make connections people in intermediate econ struggled with. Lots of extra credit opportunities however

Ida has a very thick Iranian accent, it is hard to understand her in lecture. But she presents the exact information word for word out of the book.. Go to recitation, the problems given are very similar to exam questions. She drops the lowest midterm/final. So if you do well enough on all the midterms you will not have to take the final.

Dr. Mirzaie is a very simple and knowledgeable person. She genuinely cares about her students. Top hat questions at the end of every class that count as extra credit. 3 midterms and 1 final. Lowest test gets dropped and you don't have to take final if you're satisfied with your grade. Tests are pretty easy if you read the textbook and go through power points. Online textbook is extra credit

She's a nice teacher and her accent isn't terrible, but the lectures are very boring and they jump around a lot. Also, there will be about 2 questions on every test that make no sense and she won't take them off even though 90% of the kids miss them so be prepared. There's also 5% extra credit in the class which is very helpful.

Her accent actually is not that hard to understand. But I really didn't learn much from her in the lecture, even I tried so hard to focus on what she said. she made me really want to sleep. but the ppt kind of works.

She's not a bad professor, but she is a little difficult to understand sometimes. She seems nice and genuine but she really just reads off the slides and puts them up on carmen. Top hat questions every lecture. DIdn't necessarily learn much from her lectures.

Ida seems like a very genuine, interesting person. Despite other reviews, her accent really isn't that hard to understand after the first few lectures.  The concepts are a little bit hard to grasp at first, but if you read the text and actually pay attention, they will make more sense. Office hours are helpful. Up to 5% extra credit.

Her accent is not easy to understand. I basically had to read the book and teach myself because her lectures are hard to follow. Recitations are for extra credit. There are 3 midterms and a final, but the lowest of these exams gets dropped. If you are happy with your grade before the final, you do not need to take it. There are also online quizzes.

If you want to read every single page of your economics book, please take this class. Her english is just ok and her lectures do not make sense so don't go. Recitation is worth extra credit and she offers Tophat extra credit which is nice. Just take the class since it is an easy A if you study.

Taking her in a 30-something person upper division class is the way to go. She's incredibly knowledgeable and passionate about the topic, and her office hours are very helpful. She even helped break down a topic I didn't understand in another class that happened to relate to the Middle East. You can get an A if you read and do all of the work/study

Amazing teacher and extremely knowledgeable . Gives small pop quizzes that count as extra credit on the midterm. Very good notes and a simple and interesting group project at the end of the semester. If you are an econ major take at least one class w/Ida. She does not play favorites but will help all of her students equally. I would take her again!

You are better off just reading the textbook, her accent in my opinion wasn't that bad, but she still is very unclear when she tries to explain things. Lectures felt extremely long. The nice thing though that the lowest midterm grade is dropped.

Such a ridiculous class. Yeah she drops one exam grade, but when you get a D on every one after attending every single lecture and studying for over 6 hrs each, that does nothing. TA's are so unhelpful not even funny. Not to mention her handwriting sucks, you can't understand her, and her PDF notes are impossible to take your own notes on.

I'm sitting in Ida's class currently watching Tasty videos online. Her lectures are so pointless that there is zero point in paying attention, I only go to class because she asks Tophat questions for attendance. She has a thick accent and bad handwriting so I don't know what she's saying half the time. Read the book and you'll be fine!!

Lectures are pretty useless. Read through the chapters throughout the semester and then again before exams and you'll pass. Definitely get the online textbook, she gives you extra credit for doing the online problems and they're really similar to exam questions. Homework problems are always different between the online and paper versions.
Attend lecture and be an active participant in recitations and you will succeed.
I cannot believe I passed this class.  She is horrible at explaining concepts on top of her thick accent.
She has I thick accent and is hard to understand during lectures. You pretty much have to teach yourself the content and her tests don't go along with the study guides.
I only go to lectures for the attendance points. I taught myself everything out of the textbook.

The book is incredibly helpful. Class is less helpful, but you can get up to 5% extra credit based off attendance (online attendance for most of classes through Carmen Connect) so still worth going. Exams and quizzes are all multiple choice and fairly simple. She's trying and she cares, but it is a HUGE class and she does have a heavy accent.
Somewhat hard to understand her accent. Class moves very slow, so not hard to get a good grade. Book not completely necessary but, I would recommend it.

She has a pretty heavy accent so she's kind of hard to understand.  Lectures are long and boring and you don't learn anything from her.  Read the book and go to recitation and you'll be fine.  She is one of the worst when it comes to accommodation.  She doesn't help out student athletes much less anyone else and doesn't care about her students.

Could not stand this class. Do not recommend it. She can't speak English so it was very difficult to understand her, you must solely rely on the textbook. I took this course as what I anticipated to be an easy GE credit, I was so wrong. There are only three exams in the entire course and they make up the majority of your grade with only 10% quizzes

She is hard to understand and even then she is hard to follow because she does not convey the material well in lectures. It is not a hard class, but you get no help from the professor. The class is layed out as 90% exams, 10% quizzes, and up to 5% extra credit.
Don't go to lectures. She makes the material hard to understand, but if you read the textbook and have a decent TA you will be more than fine.
The lectures are easier to understand if you read the chapter in the book.
The lectures are easier to understand if you read the chapter in the book beforehand. You get extra credit for attendance and two online surveys. Pretty easy and straightforward class.

Even though her accent is very heavy and it's hard to understand her, the class was very easy.  As long as you study you should be able to get a decent grade.  Also most of the answers for the online quizzes are on quizlet somewhere online.

hardly ever went to lecture. Read my book diligently, went to recitation for extra credit and practice. I realized early on that Ida does a great job at making the material more difficult and confusing than it already is. Her accent is very difficult to understand. go to recitation, read your book, and you will do well

Pretty easy class if you remember to do the assignments and online work. Lets you drop a midterm (or skip the final) and also drops a homework grade and a couple quiz grades. She wanted to use more technology in the class for attendance (polleverywhere) but she didn't fully seem to understand how it works

Ida Mirzaie is a nice professor, who really seems to enjoy what she teaches. She's a little hard to understand sometimes, but if you read your book, you will be fine. Dr. Mirzaie makes review guides before each of her exams and if you know everything on the review guide, you will probably get an A on the exams and in the class.

Ida has a thick accent that is hard to understand. The lectures are boring and hard to pay attention to, but she puts all the slides and lectures on Carmen. I taught myself everything, but the concepts aren't too difficult to grasp if you put the time and effort into it. Quiz and homework answers are online.

Although she has accent and class is not clarity, students can study by themselves from the textbooks and PPT. The quizzes  are harder than the midterm and final in normal. She gives 3 midterm and one final. During this semester, you can drop one of this four exams. I get the 97% in this class. Work Hard and it's not hard to get A

Dr. Mirzaie can be difficult to understand at times due to her accent, but she does seem to care about students. She provides everything given to you in lecture and then some on Carmen. If you read the textbook, do all the assignments, and take advantage of extra credit opportunities, you'll do fine.

She has the unusual, thick accent and it can make it difficult to understand her at times during class lectures. However, I think she genuinely cares about the students and if you make the effort to go to her office hours or ask questions in class, she's more than happy to explain.
Ida is extremely hard to understand. Your only major grades are the midterms and the exam. There is a curve. I would NOT recommend having her as a professor- switch if you still have the chance

Going to lecture is completely pointless. She is hard to understand and the recitation teachers are as well. You will need to completely teach yourself the material by reading the book or through the internet. PowerPoints are posted online with a generous curve and quiz bonus points. Attendance doesn't factor into grade lecture/recitation wise.

If you briefly read the text before lectures, this class is very easy. She spends most lecture time reviewing specific diagrams or ideas from the text. If you haven't read the text before lecture, you will likely be very lost; hence, the passing grade is something like 30 or 35%.

Clarity is very poor when she speaks. You will learn nothing in leature, just go for the bonus points and read your study guide. BUT super generous curve (a much needed one at that). She's very nice and knowledgable, just difficult to understand. You're gonna have to work hard for an A.

going to lecture is absolutely pointless as its impossible to understand her. She stopped offering extra credit for going which removed the last reason to go. Id definitely recommend taking econ with another professir but if you end up with her, just use the book and the internet to teach it to yourself.

Lectures are pointless to go to, and so are recitations. All class learning will come from teaching yourself reading the textbook and doing the practice exams. Grading is curved and should make the class easy as long as you can teach yourself reading the textbook.
Very knowledgeable about Middle Eastern economies (is from Iran), but has trouble communicating ideas. About half the course is oriented around a group research paper.
Ida is very hard to understand due to her strong accent. Only grades are the midterms and final. Class is curved and there's extra credit quizzes. Have fun reading the book and learning on your own.

You'll learn very little going to lecture. She is hard to understand but sweet. She'll spend a long time drawing a graph that's hard to read and then go to the next slide where there is a computer-made one and just skip over it. The TA's are hit-or-miss. Mine was decent but you do need to just red the book and do any review material she gives you.
Extremely hard to understand, to the point where lecture is pointless.  If you get her, plan on reading the book and teaching yourself.

She is tough to understand, and her TA's are even tougher to understand.  The only reason you should go to Recitation is to take the quizzes. Leave after the quiz bc you won''t get anything out of the remaining time. My advice: read the chapter before lecture. There's a website offered through the textbook, do the practice probs on it. I got an "A"

I could see why you wouldnt want to take her lower division classes, but upper division she is incredibly nice and accommodating, Not the easiest, but I was a graduating senior and didnt care much; 50% = C- Class Avg=B- at least (no downgrading) Invited the whole class to her house for dinner and drinks one night. One of the most thoughtful ladies.
Useless lecture. Even more useless recitation. Got an A purely by teaching myself. Don't even bother with micro if you're not a business or Econ major/minor. Find a better Gen Ed.

AVOID HER AT ALL COSTS. She is impossible to understand, makes no effort to help you understand her, goes way too fast in lecture, and her handwriting is atrocious. Her TAs are all useless as well. The extra credit for attending lecture isn't enough to make you want to sit through it. Just all around terrible.

Anyone who said she is a good teacher, obviously has never had one. Not only is she impossible to understand but her practice exams are nothing like the ones she gives out. I'm a Econ major and this was the most disappointing class I've taken thus far in my college career. Safe yourself the time and effort and avoid any class with her.
Cannot understand what she said at all and I learnt NOTHING from the course. If I have a second chance, I will NEVER take her class.

Ida is a nice prof who can be difficult to understand at some points due to her heavy accent but it's not actually too bad. If you study the book and use the study guide the midterm and quizzes aren't too bad. You just have to put real effort and studying into this class and it gets interesting.

Very thick accent and lecture is IMPOSSIBLE to pay attention in. You do get extra credit for going to lecture but it's almost not worth it. Study guide is a must because you'll be learning most of it by yourself. I'd try to find another professor to take Econ from.

Struggled everyday to understand a full sentence that came out of her mouth.  Her accent is extremely thick and she doesn't slow down to help you hear her.  I went to lectures and put headphones in and read the book and taught myself.  Definitely buy the practice problems book.

this teacher has such an accent that I had to learn all the material on my own. grades are 25% exam 25%exam 50% final exam. you get 3% for attending, and 3% for extra credit quizzes. this teacher SUCKS!! going to her class is pointless. even my TA fell asleep. and another said go to class and listen to music.

Microecon. She has a very thick accent, but makes and posts slideshows for each chapter online so it's very easy to skip class and study on your own. If you take more than 2 hours to study for tests you'll get an A, I'd recommend getting the practice questions book because her test questions come out of that. recitations helped
She is nice and all, but don't expect to learn much from going to class.

Shes nice and knows her stuff. That being said you can't understand a word she says or writes. You have to be able to teach yourself and read the book. Some extra credit. Overall I would highly recommend NOT taking her class. There are many better professors at OSU.

You have to learn all by yourself ok?Study guide!!!go buy it!!! Do you know how many people fall into sleep on her classes? If the attendance is not for the extra credits, no one would show on the class ok? This final breaks my heart seriously, i did well in the midterms and this final is way harder than I thought. How could she do this do us!!

She's the worst there's really nothing else to say. In terms of the class it's not that difficult and she gives some extra credit for attendance and there's a decent curve. She's the worst. Absolute worst. Boring, rude, demanding she is just awful.
She is awful to listen to due to her thick accent and monotonous tone, but if you can pay attention, you will do fine.

Despite the fact that Ida is hard to understand & going to lecture basically  worthless, TAKE THIS CLASS.  There's a very generous curve.  Attendance in lec and rec quizzes are both extra credit.  If you just read the textbook, go to class,   know that everyone is struggling, and stay above the curve, you'll be fine.

I don't agree with people who say this professor wasn't helpful. Going to class certainly helped me. She would draw graphs and explain them which helped a lot. Plus there extra credit and a decent curve for the class. She was willing to help students if asked. She may be a little hard to understand at first, but really isn't that bad.

Even as an econ major, I can't say I particularly enjoyed her class (Microeconomics.) Upperclassmen tell me her major classes are good, but she just does not teach well to a huge lecture. Her class was easy tho, especially with extra credit for attendance and quizzes and a curve.
One of the worst teachers I have ever had. You cannot comprehend anything she says.

I would not recommend taking a class with her. She is difficult to understand. She is a horrible teacher, and doesn't explain anything well. Anything that I learned in that class, I taught my self or from the recitation teacher. She just reads of slides, and you can't understand her hand writing. Do yourself a favor, and avoid her.

Really just quotes out of the book and reads off the powerpoint that she also puts online. Not good AT ALL at explaining things.  Every time I go to lecture I just get more confused :(  The only good thing about lecture is that you get extra credit for going. Recitation more useful than lecture! If you dont HAVE  to take this class, then dont!

i would NEVER recommend anyone to take this class: terrible teacher, she does not help you, i tried to go in for help- absolutely hopeless she says read book do practice problems, does not clarify anything, hard exams, doesnt even get through notes in class in time for quizzes on fridays honest. in order to pass be ready to TEACH YOURSELF

Had to teach myself from the text book, she's hard to understand, and really bad at applying it. She gives extra credit for attendance and is somewhat nice with grading (although the way she grades exams is really weird)

Go to class because you get 5% added on to your grade at the end. Also, read the book. All of the MC on her tests are from the book, and her problems are almost directly from what she does in class/on the worksheets she hands out.

I don't really think I learned anything from her class...She changed textbooks this time and seemed completely unprepared to adapt to it. She was nice enough with her grading, but overall the class was a bit of chaotic in terms of consistency, and it wasn't really a class you had to dedicate a lot of time to

Easy class. Attendance is mandatory however she offers extra credit if you go to lecture/recitation. I guarantee half the class would not show up to lecture considering she just reads off lecture slides but she knows what she's talking about and is very knowledgeable on the subject.
Great class, great teacher a must take for anyone interested in Macro Econ. Her tests were fair and the group projects were not to difficult.

Don't know why I continued to go to lecture - first, her English is quite poor, and second, half the time her powerpoint slides don't work - so she writes notes on the projector, and her handwriting is awful too!  If you take her class, expect to have to read the book in order to succeed.  If you do, you should have no problems.

Not an easy A, but she did offer 6% extra credit after the curve. While the course material is boring, she does try to show helpful videos in lecture. Recitations are pointless and I never opened the book and still received an A-

She expects you to really learn and actually be able to apply everything, yet she does a poor job of teaching in lecture and only 20% of the class will get an A or A- based on the way she curves.Don't take her if you just want an easy A
A very easy econ class to get an A in but if you actually want to understand it and be engaged with economics avoid at all costs.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. She is easy enough-- 3 tests, short presentation, and article summaries. We got 5% of extra credit for attending class, too. But she is THE MOST BORING PROFESSOR I've ever had. And don't plan on actually learning anything from her.

Ida was is  a good prof. but class was boring. Tests are split between multiple choice (from the book) and work problems (from the examples she does in class). Exams aren't difficult if you read the book. Go to lecture - you get 5% extra credit just for good attendance. She's helpful one-on-one also. Take advantage of current event discussions

most boring class i have ever taken! I fell asleep in almost every lecture and I've skipped a lot of the lectures because i felt they were so useless that i didnt even need to go I cant understand her very well english is very broken recetations saved me in learning the material lecture is all over the place and not very organized at all. bad prof.

She is very hard to understand and does not do a good job at getting the material accross to the students period. we watch a video one day in class and i learned more in that one video than the whole course. She speaks very broken english. If you take this class you are better off reading straight from the textbook. course is weighted.

Yawn...this class with Prof Mirzaie is a lullaby.  You will fall asleep or begin to do other work.  If you expect to do well you must read the book on your own and comprehend most of the information as well.  She shows examples on the powerpoint, but is all over the place.  I'd look for another lecturer if possible.

Prof. Mirzaie is the most boring professor I have had so far as a student at Ohio State. I felt as though I had to force myself to stay awake every class, but this did pay off in the end. Two tests and a final, and she goes over many of the questions on the tests in class. Use the book and study guide - in the end this separates the Bs from the As.

Ida, while not a bad teacher in the slightest, taught in a very boring manner.  Every lecture was just going over powerpoints on the overhead, and I'll admit I fell asleep about half a dozen times.  Nevertheless, she's very helpful and can put the needed concepts across, but expect to be using the book or your recitation a lot to cement the info.

I am an international student from China,  i don't recommend this professor for inter students.Pro.M has a heavy Iron accent which almost drives me crazy. i was trying to attend the lecture but i could not understand~!  the midterm is not that easy. u can choose better professor.

Class time with Dr. Mirzaie is almost unbearably boring, all class is spent looking at typed powerpoints and nearly zero interaction with us. DIdn't know anyone's name (strange for an honors class) and was not helpful during office hours. Got a worse grade than I deserved, midterms and finals covered material that wasn't covered in class/reading..

She's hard to understand, boring, and everything needed for the exams can be learned by simply reading the book.  She thoroughly believes that if you sit in the back half of the class, you are NOT paying attention. In fact, I wasn't paying attention, but still earned an A by cramming in the 4-5 chapters before each exam. :)

Man this class was boring.  Insanely easy, but boring.  She seems to expect this result too, because she gives you extra credit for coming to class.  I had no interest in econ, I just took it cause its supposed to be super easy (it was), and honestly, I don't know if I would recommend it because it is just that boring.
Despite her accent and frequent omission of grammatical articles, she communicates economic concepts quite effectively. I recommend. Also: getting an A is so easy a caveman could do it.

Great teacher. If you pay attention in class and ask questions you will learn a lot. Fairly easy to get an A but you have to study a moderate amount. She cares and wants students to learn. 5% extra credit for attending class.

If all you are interested in is passing the class, you probably won't mind Mrs. Mirzaie.  However, if you want to learn a lot about economics you'll be disappointed.  She is an extremely easy grader - 50% guarantees you a C - but only covers the bare minimum amount of material.  Her thick accent also makes understanding what she is saying difficult

Difficult to understand, grading system makes class moderately easy-but she has NO idea how to teach and expect to have to teach yourself from the textbook and study guide that accompanies it. Doesnt speak good english at all either, have fun and good luck trying not to fall asleep

Very straightforward.....read the chapters she tells you to and know the concepts and you WILL get an A in the class...and she curves the class so if you dont get an A you should have probably gone to CSCC

quizzes r super easy and count as extra credit. Mid-term 1 n 2 r harder than final. Hardly go to class. just read the book on my own and review ppt before tests. easy A. but she's not so clear.. and class is a lil bit boring... i like the TA though. her name is Sieber,Soo...nice and helpful.

Before this class I loved economics and was very interested in it. Now I dont want to take another econ class again. She made the class very difficult and I could not understand a word she said. She is always willing to answer questions though.

Attending the class defintely helps a lot for the exam. She explain the mateirals clearly in class. No need to do a lot extra works outside the class.But the exam and quiz are knid of hard.Participants give up to 5% bonus points. You have to finish a project before final. Seriously, no need to read the book.

Avoid this teacher. She makes this class way to difficult for a econ 200 course. She is extremely boring and hard to understand. The class avg on the exams is usually like a 60%. How....eva she curves alot. dont bother going to class you'll just fall asleep.
