Aubhik is incredibly smart and super funny. HOWEVER, he has a hard time sharing his knowledge, class lectures are repetitive and drag on and you felt as if you've learned nothing. TAKE NOTES and definitely read the book, it will help make clear things that Aubhik made unclear. Tests are based off of major concepts and are hard but doable

DO NOT take a class with Dr. Khan. He is funny and clearly knows the topics, but he is very, VERY bad at communicating the information with you. He will lecture all class, only to be corrected by a student at the end of class on a mistake he made at the beginning of the problem. Relied heavily on the textbook, but even that wasn't great.

is this dude honestly kidding? Have no clue how I received the grade I did because he doesn't put individual grades on canvas. Literally just got a notification on my phone that my grade was in and thats it. did not learn one thing just showed up. exams are easy if you study the previous quizzes but i would never take a class with this guy again.

lol what is this guy doing. honestly better off just studying from the textbook and then just show up to class for quizzes. the dude isn't confusing as much as he is redundant and unorganized. he kind of gave up midway through, stopped posting solutions on canvas; gave us 4 chapters to study in last lecture, none of them were on the exam. #feelsbad
Overcomplicated material, contradicted himself half the time.... terrible class, terrible professor

Stopped going to class and just used the textbook and I still didn't miss any material. Only went for quizzes. Pretty easy class that he makes unnecessarily confusing. Honestly don't know if we'll get through 1/3 of the syllabus, exams aren't bad if you study from homeworks and textbook. Funny, self-deprecating, poorly organized: Professor Khan.
Aubhik is pretty funny, but he teaches the non-calculus based section with a lot of calculus. You'd be better off taking this course with a different teacher.

You take 5 quizzes, but only the best 3 count. There is one midterm and a cumulative final. He posts homework online, but it is not for a grade. You have to attend lecture to understand the concepts. The quizzes and tests are all based off the optional homework. I would recommend taking this class with him; I heard other professors make it hard.

Really good lecturer and made micro pretty easy. Didn't cover much material though, only about half of the syllabus. 2 midterms and a final, all pretty easy. 5 quizzes, best 3 count. as he gives hints for exams. Don't need book other then to check info from lecture. DO THE HOMEWORK and the derivations he covers, all exam questions come from these.

Good guy, easy class. Kind of a joke though. I had him for micro, and you can tell he's a macro prof. Do the homework sets and understand them and you'll get an a, the tests are based off the homework not anything he says in class

Aubhik is a very entertaining professor. He's very funny and is always making jokes that make lecture enjoyable. He doesnt cover everything he sayshe is going to because he spends weeks on each chapter. But he makes it clear what he expects for his homework sets and exams. Overall he is a good professor and its not hard to get a decent grade

summary_comment: Mike is an outstanding professor for ECON 4001, known for his clearly structured lectures and availability to address student questions. He ensures fairness in his exams by allowing cheat sheets and maintains high standards while being supportive.

Ratings.comment: Mike was an amazing professor for ECON 4001! All of his lectures were very clearly laid out and if I ever had any questions, he made sure to make himself available to discuss them. His exams are very fair, and even allowed us to bring study "cheat sheets" to the exams as well. I wish he also taught ECON 4002 so I could take that with him as well!

SEI.Subject: ECON
SEI.Class Name: Industrial Organization IV: Empirical Research Methods

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as one of the poorest instructors at OSU, failing to effectively teach the subject matter. Lectures are largely irrelevant to homework and exams, making external resources like YouTube more valuable for student success.

Ratings.comment: Possibly the worst professor I've had in my four years at OSU. He has no idea how to teach the subject material. Lectures have little relevance to homework and exams. Youtube will be your best friend in this class.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her clear and informative PowerPoint presentations that effectively explain key concepts. Students find her midterms to be manageable, as they closely resemble the problem sets and practice exams provided. With a solid grasp of the material and consistent practice, achieving an A is considered quite feasible.

Ratings.comment: Her powerpoints are very informative and clear and explain all the concepts well which was extremely helpful. The two midterms were fairly easy; both were very similar to the problem sets and the practice exams that she puts out. If you understand all the material and do the problem sets/practice exams, getting an A should be pretty easy.

summary_comment: This professor is an enthusiastic young PhD student known for her willingness to foster open discussion and encourage diverse viewpoints. Her classes are described as relatively easy, involving weekly papers related to the week’s economic topic, followed by a final paper and presentation. Students express a desire for her to teach more courses.

Ratings.comment: She's a young PhD student who wants her students to do well. Always willing to entertain discussion and unpopular opinions. The class is super easy, with one paper per week relating to the economic topic of the week. One final paper and a presentation on the paper. Hope she teaches more classes in the future.

summary_comment: The professor for Macro Econ is generally viewed as ineffective in preparing students for exams, with one student giving him a 2 out of 5 rating due to confusing lectures, unhelpful homework, and low midterm scores averaging under 50%. Another student found the course more manageable, appreciating the economic principles taught but noting dry lectures, occasional frustration from the professor, and a grading system that includes non-mandatory readings and filler assignments.

Ratings.comment: I'm not the type to waste my time writing about a professor so i'm literally here to like you to please take a different professor for this class or if you can avoid this class do at all cost. One final project , 2 midterms. He literally doesn't prepare you for any of the exam and my class had an average under 50% on midterms.

Class: Macro Econ
- hard for no reason
- very confusing 
- makes his own test
- homework doesnt help, and the teachers had control over which program to pick for the students, the system he picked is not helpful at all
- overall 2/5

Solid professor. The discussions are not the most engaging but he tries his best to teach us the important Economic principles. The papers were easy. The readings were a bit long but they aren't mandatory

Course grade is decided by 3 essays, participation, and weekly free writes & grammar exercises which is kinda just filler to make sure you come to class. 2 of the weekly assignments can be dropped. The lecture is kinda dry and dull, sometimes he gets upset if no one answers the questions he asks the class. A bit nitpicky with essay grading.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for being very helpful and responsible, significantly enhancing students' understanding of economics and sparking their interest in the subject. However, some students find his lectures challenging to follow due to poor communication skills and note consistency issues, leading to difficulties with tests and homework.

Ratings.comment: very helpful and responsible, learned a lot from this instructor. made me interested in Econ.

Extremely difficult to listen to during the lecture. Literally has no communication skills. Very awkward. The tests and homeworks are not consistent with the notes taken. He is very critical on homework.

summary_comment: The professor is generally well-regarded for his passion and willingness to help students, though his teaching style can be challenging for some. Students appreciate his focus on real-world applications and are often recommended to attend lectures for extra credit, as the quizzes are relatively easy. However, some find his lectures repetitive and the class material difficult to follow, especially without additional preparation.

Ratings.comment: So bad, there is no multiple-choice questions for this history course which should be easy

not a fan.he leaves class early alot for "trips".will tell you he doesnt know if he will back for next class or not but wants your to go anyways.book is boring.midterms are very long(4essays,1pgfillin,1pgcalc,couplepgsshortanswer).lecture is just notes he took from the book.cant really understand

5 quizzes, drop lowest score. Really easy if you study his lecture notes. 1 midterm & final, almost all material comes verbatim from quizzes. Book is used for extra credit on midterm & final. Super nice, friendly, funny. Really wants to teach you useful real-world stuff! Highly recommended!

Funny, helpful, really likes to teach & have people learn real-life applications. Cares about students. Doesn't give direct answers when you ask questions. Easy quizzes. Attend lectures (extra credit) and you won't need the book for an A. Highly recommended!
This class is useless and it's bit hard to understand his talking and the class is boring also.

Don is a good Prof, he has a passion for what he teaches, and was working on his PHD in economics when i took the class.  he is friendly and is very willing to help. he really wants his students to succeed in class. he has a small accent but he is pretty easy to understand.  i will take another one of his classes in the future.
Taught nuts & bolts of regression.  Very passionate about what he is teaching.  I would recommend Yoo to anyone interested in taking this class.
No Comments

Dongwoo is a cool guy. Class material is not very dificult, but he explain it very well. He gives extra credit for everything, and the quizes are just for extra credit. Also most of the midterm and final questions come from the quizes.

summary_comment: The professor is generally considered personable and effective, with many students recommending her. However, some find her classes overly easy and less challenging than desired, and a few criticize her teaching style as repetitive and boring, suggesting that the material could be more rigorous.

Ratings.comment: A very good teacher, soma is personable and friendly. I would recommend her to anyone. Sometimes she made things a little too easy but then again thats nothing to complaint about.
Good helpful teacher, I would recommend her, sometimes made things too easy, but then again i guess thats not something to complaint about
the class is not very hard all you need to do is study hard the practice questions and practice exams and you will do well attendance is not necessary all notes posted online.

Thought she made it very easy. I took the 2 hour section at night twice a week and feel like I lucked out. Everyone who took econ during the day complained about homeworks, while she has no homework. I had a friend that didn't even go to class (just read her notes she puts online) and got like an A or B.

Her grading scale would have given someone with a 94.5% an A- and someone with a 56% a C. Furthermore, the class was only out of 100 points so one mistake and you go from an A to an A-. Horrible teacher

She might have been somewhat redundant with writing what she was saying, but that only reinforced her point. She probably does that because she is concerned that people aren't understanding her.  I thought she was a fine teacher.  The class could have been made a lot more difficult.  I thought that her teaching made it much more easier.

She means well and tries to help whenever anyone needs help, but she is just a bad teacher. She spends all of class writing exactly what she has in the notes down on the board. Extremely boring class. It's easy if you keep up. I recommend getting another 501 prof because she is tooo inexperienced and bad of a teacher.

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as challenging and difficult to understand due to his accent and teaching style, which often overwhelms students with information. His exams are extremely hard, particularly the multiple-choice sections where options are confusingly similar. Students find his lectures unengaging and often unnecessary, as they do not cover all exam material. Overall, he is considered one of the worst professors at Ohio State, and many advise against taking his class.

Ratings.comment: Like a lot of foreign teachers, the tests are super hard, has an accent and throw at you lots of information at once. Also boring. I understood him but a lot of times I was day dreaming in his lectures. He curves all the scores but this is not an easy A class at all.

I didn't think his accent was that bad, eventhough my native language isn't English. His exams are SUPER hard eventhough they're multiple choice, the choices ALL LOOK THE SAME! You can tell he is very knowledgeable but he fails to make class interesting and easy. If you just want an easy GEC course this class isn't for you.
Average on the final was a 53%! terrible professor take one of the other guys... not to mention lecture wasn't even worth going to since you can't understand the guy

The university NEEDS to fire this guy. Worst professor at ohio state by far. Impossible to understand, gives exams for the sake of failing students. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS... take dupor or for that fact any other professor that teaches econ. This guy needs to find a new profession

DO NOT TAKE HIM! He is the worst professor at OSU. I can barely understand him and he makes econ miserable. Lectures do not cover all of the material on the exams and asks questions on the exams that are backwards and impossible to get right. His average exam score was below a 60% and I would have been smart to drop the class when I had a chance

He is a horrible professor. He is nearly impossible to understand and only reads through his powerpoints (you can download off carmen). His exams are difficult and do not cover material that he covers in lecture. Expect to be tested on material that you do not learn in class. He should not be teaching. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS.

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as one of the worst due to poor communication and clarity issues. Assignments were often communicated at inconvenient times, and he frequently deviated from the syllabus without proper notice. While he effectively explains the material in class, his communication about assignments and use of class time are significant drawbacks.

Ratings.comment: Worst Professor I have ever had. His communication skills were terrible; sent us assignments at midnight when we had class that next morning at 9:00am. I emailed him numerous times and he responded once. Week before final added a whole chapter to the final that was not on the syllabus. Clarity was low. Read straight from slides and no recitation.
He was pretty good at explaining the material in class, but communication about assignments was very bad, and he wasted a lot of time in class

summary_comment: Dr. Mustafa is highly knowledgeable in economics, with advanced degrees from prestigious institutions, and effectively prepares students for exams through clear hints and examples. However, his teaching style varies widely among students, with some finding his lectures challenging due to rapid speech and unclear delivery, while others appreciate his depth of content and interesting examples. Overall, his tests can be difficult, and his approach to teaching and interaction with students is divisive, ranging from helpful to dismissive.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Mustafa has a great knowledge of what he teaches, and is a very qualified person for the job. He studied economics at Cambridge and got his Phd at The Ohio State University. His Econ 501 class is easy if you show up to class and pay attention, he gives lots of hints and examples on how to do homework and exams. Interesting examples in class.

If you read the book, then you shouldn't have a problem doing okay in the class. He's not a "nice teacher"; if you ask a question that he's already discussed/is in the syllabus, he can be a bit rude. He can go on pretty interesting tangents though

He was one of the hardest professors to understand.  He mumbled while talking extremely fast; not a good combination. He treats his class like we should already know all the material, which made his tests alot harder. He was very rude, and I did not appreciate his smug mannerisms during class.

One oF the worst professors  at OSU. If you find out you have him for a class, drop it ASAP! The only thing he told the class was "Read The Textbook". I'm not paying for college classes to be told this BS. Oh and he also isnt a economics professor but someone who works for the financial aid office. Unqualified and horrible. Avoid at all costs.
He is a good teacher, but his tests are almost impossible at times.

summary_comment: The professor is considered fairly good, known for clear and thorough explanations that ease students' understanding. He maintains an organized approach with a structured grading system and provides access to section notes and past quizzes online. Students would recommend his course.

Ratings.comment: A fairly good teacher. Easy to understand despite my fears of seeing "Bao." Very thorough in his explanations and tries to keep the content clear. Has five quizzes where best of four are kept (20%), two midterms (25% each), and the final (30%).  Posts section notes and past quizzes online and generally seems quite organized.  Would recommend.

summary_comment: The professor is considered a competent graduate lecturer, though his classes can be somewhat dull, particularly for required courses like IS 556. Despite this, students find him very helpful during office hours. Additionally, as a Teaching Assistant, he effectively explains course material in recitations, often better than the main instructor, and encourages full participation to earn credit.

Ratings.comment: Good Graduate Lecturer, however, class can be boring. IS 556 is a requirement for the World Economy and Business major so class isn't the easiest. Very helpful if you go in during office hours though.

He was my TA for econ & i thought he did a good job. Go to recitation and he will explain the material better than prof harrington. He goes over the recitation hw and shows how to get the answer (so there is no reason not to get 100%) attendance is taken, however in order to get credit for the recitation problems you have to go to class.

summary_comment: The professor's teaching is considered inadequate by students, with many warning to avoid his class due to extremely difficult exams that test material not covered in lectures. Students find his lectures basic but his exams challenging, with some describing them as having multiple-page questions and absurdly long multiple-choice options. While some acknowledge learning a lot, the overall consensus is negative, citing his unhelpful approach and vague explanations.

Ratings.comment: Avoid this professor if possible. He is nice, but his teaching is of elementary level. His exams are extremely difficult and everything he lectures doesn't help with it either. He lectures basics yet tests you on the extreme situations. Be ready for a 30+ page exam 2 questions (paragraph long) each page Multiple choice answers are paragraphs themse
tells the class the last 2 classes are the most important, then skips. M.I.A alot. bragged about how tough the test were. (my opinion) dont take
Study very hard for the mid-term, its difficulty will take you by surprise.
I would rather spend a month in a Russian gulag than take this class again.
The professor babels. Brags that his tests are impossible. and will smile the whole time.dont take this class if you can avoid it
Completely all over the place, he will babel at the board for two hours so prepare to take notes. His English isn't too bad but his grammar makes it hard to follow.

wouldn't take this class the qrt ur expected to graduate, as it involves mandatory attendance and lots of note taking. need to teach urself alot since proff is vague, esp if u have no interest/experience w/ dev. econ. 2 midterms no paper. short ans on midterm horrible, gave me a D, but no shrt ans on final! overall B+ in course

The midterm and final are ridiculous.  it was multiple choice but the questions were so long there was literally one question per page and probably 100 pgs.  theres like a 20pg paper do at the end of the quarter too.  however, i feel like i did learn alot about economics and the teacher is helpful if you contact him

I agree he's a tough professor but if you work hard you can definitely get an A. Before you take the class make sure you really like developmental economics. I love the subject and therefore loved his class.

Class if tough and boring! His lectures are skiddish meaning he's all over the place.Lectures are all note taking which is boring. Homework assignments weren't that bad but tests were very difficult. I also didnt like the fact that after he screwed up original date of final he wouldn't let anyone who scheduled flights early home take the final.

Do not take this class if you don't have to! Really hard tests and homework, long lectures, pages and pages of notes and no book! So if you miss a lecture you're in trouble! The TAs are not super helpful. Really long obnoxious paper due at the end of the quarter! Take the class with someone else if you must have it. If not, find another class!

summary_comment: Professor Tamon is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and willingness to help students. His classes are known for their straightforward structure, with quizzes based directly on practice problems and minimal attendance requirements. While his final exam can be challenging, students generally find his guidance invaluable, especially during office hours.

Ratings.comment: If you have to take ECON 201, take him.  This class is a complete joke.  You get extra credit for attending class and class is only twice a week, unlike most of the other 201 classes.  Quizzes come straight from the practice problems for each chapter.  Just read the book and you will be fine.

I like Tamon a lot! He's really helpful. Quizzes are SUPER easy, just practice the questions online and work on the math problems, youll be fine! His final is tricky though!!! Great teacher, def. recommend going to his office hours!

summary_comment: Professor Mohsen is highly regarded for his clear teaching methods and supportive approach, ensuring students are well-prepared for exams through comprehensive lectures and office hours. However, the class can be challenging and requires consistent attendance and engagement. While some find the lectures lengthy and monotonous, many appreciate his willingness to provide extra credit and curve grades generously, leading to a high percentage of A's.

Ratings.comment: Professor Mohsen is awesome and super nice! There is a review for each exam and there are no surprises on exams (meaning he literally discusses and goes over everything during lecture). You show up to class, take notes, do the homework (which is not very much) and you will easily pass the class and most likely get an A.

He's an awesome teacher if you're really there to learn. His office hours are amazing and he patiently takes the time to break down concepts until you understand. Exams were challenging with the class mean was around 65% across all three exams, but there was a large curve at the end and ample extra credit so those who went to class got A's.
Took the class to fulfill requirement. Lecture was really long and boring, monotone. He gives a lot of extra credit but can't teach. Read the note online.

He is one of my favorite teachers. The subject he teaches his hard so often the material is rather confusing. But he helps one on one. He gives bonus points if you need and he has a pretty nice curve where most people get As. Sometimes his accent gets in the way of his class but he will stop even if you look confused and go over the subject.

summary_comment: The professor is widely regarded as a poor instructor, characterized by boring and disengaging lectures that fail to effectively convey course material. Students find his teaching methods frustrating, with many recommending avoiding his class altogether due to the difficulty and lack of clarity in his explanations and exams.

Ratings.comment: Actually a horrible teacher. The guy makes you calculate your own grade by writing down your different grades on a piece of paper and then gives an equation to figure it out instead of just putting in online. He is stubborn and will not admit he is wrong in any argument and is the most boring teacher you will ever listen to. Missing 1 class A-

Honestly not that bad. The lectures were extremely boring at times, but the content was easy to understand. I recommend doing all of the practice tests, the online homework, and reading the textbook if you want an A.
Blau is nice, but gives very boring lectures. Exams aren't easy, but doable.
Class is very boring and the tests are nearly impossible. Midterm is 30% of your grade and so is the final. Would not recommend!

His voice is so un-engaging that I immediately disassociate when I'm in his class. I cannot pay attention in this class, it is so uninteresting, and he tries to make it interesting, but it's still so hard. The subject matter is extremely dry.

Probably the most boring class Ive ever had. No one listens and he skips through the slides so fast that you dont have anytime to write anything down. Seems to know what hes talking about but rude if you try to answer and are wrong. Very very boring and confusing lecturer. Overall horrible.

This class is hard for absolutely no reason.  The exams are absurdly hard and curved but not by much. Basically expects you to learn all of the information on your own and glazes  over tons of information.  The information presented in lectures is pretty much unrelated to any of the questions on the exam.  TAKE THIS CLASS WITH LITERALLY ANYONE ELSE

The absolute worst educator I've ever experienced. Exams are ridiculously hard. I went to tutoring and the tutors couldn't understand his problems.  Blau has terrible problems, and I mean that both ways.

His tests are insanely hard, expects you to already know a lot of the material coming into class. only have 3 exams, and he cancels office hours all the time. would highly recommend literally any other professor. Curves his exams, but still receive bad grades

Expects you to know everything coming into class. Says you don't need to know calculus although you need calculus to complete half the problems. Have to memorize hundreds of formulas. Graded on three exams. Cancels his office hours constantly and is terrible at explaining problems.
Hardest class I have taken at OSU. Re-arranges his office hours every week and you're graded on three exams. Get ready for tons of headaches and practice problems

Worst professor I've ever had, he flat out can't teach and expects you to come in already knowing everything. Skips steps and expects you to go back and learn it yourself. Get ready to fall asleep during his lectures

Lectures are long and a little boring because he just reads from slides but I'd still recommend going, there's really no way to make Econ fun. Just pay attention in class, do all of the available practice problems, and go to a couple of office hours and you'll get an A. I never bought a book

Thought he was going to be terrible based on the reviews, but he wasn't as bad as I thought. First midterm wasn't bad, second one was a little tougher, and the final was pretty easy. All you have to do is read the textbook (this really helps), pay attention in class & take notes!! It might be hard to pay attention, but it really helps.

First, let me say Professor Blau seems like a super cool guy. But, lectures are super long and seem like they drag on forever. He reads directly from slides (which are black and white) and doesn't make things very relatable for college students. It's rough, but with alot of work, you can pull out a D in the end. Goodluck willing yourself to come

Lectures long and boring. 34 of the students that show up fall asleep. Just reads straight from Power points which are straight from the book. More helpful to just read the book. Gives pop quizzes because he knows the majority of his students aren't there or are asleep. Skipped his own office hours without notice once. Confusing quizzes and exams

This class is hard. He lectures straight from information out of the book. I thought I was doing fine by keeping up with reading assignments and online homework, thought I understood concepts well, and never did well on exams or his unannounced pop quizzes. Basically, his class is way harder than it should be

The questions on his exams are extremely confusing.  His lectures are incredibly monotone and puts me to sleep every time.  And, he is terrible with technology yet attempts to incorporate it into the class and just annoys everyone.

Im a graduate student. I have taken countless classes and dealt with several teachers over the years. Dr. Blau is probably the worst teacher Ive ever had. Make no mistake, this course is hard. He regurgitates information from the book, while his tests and quizzes are very hard. I couldnt stand this guy. I would avoid taking his class at all costs

Did not enjoy this teacher. I think he was more focused on making his class difficult rather than trying to make sure you understand the concepts. His tests are conceptual-based, so there's no way of making sure you're well-prepared for his exams. Gave pop quizzes for an unclear reason. It's as if  to see if you can handle your grade taking a hit.

Worse teacher I have every had at Ohio State. Does not really help students clarify topics and you need to know every chapter that's on the test inside out to do well. I would suggest taking this class with any other professor even a foreign grad student would be better then this guy. Even students from fisher had difficultly in this class.

501.01. This prfessor is extremely hard. His lectures arent very clear yet for the exams you pretty much need to be able to copy the textbook down in the answer booklet. All exams are long answer essay questions that are graded extremely hard. i spent more time studying for this class than most other business classes but got a worse grade. beware!

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for his engaging lectures and clear explanations of economic journals. While the course includes only five homework assignments, two significant exams, and an unexpectedly challenging first exam, students find the overall grading to be fair and lenient, with a C requiring at least a 50%.

Ratings.comment: I really enjoyed his lectures. He talks about economic journals and you only have five easy HW assignments. Two exams that count a lot, obviously and I didn't know what to expect on the first exam and didn't do as well as I would have liked. For our class, he brought down a C requirement to 50-59, so, getting a decent grade isn't too hard.
Really cares about the subject and easy to listen to. Kind grader as well

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as one of the worst at Ohio State University, with students citing unclear lectures, a focus on rote memorization, and a lack of conceptual explanation. Many found the classes difficult and unhelpful for learning, with exams and quizzes often directly based on the material presented in lectures. Students generally advise against taking his courses unless they are prepared to teach themselves from the textbook.

Ratings.comment: Probably one of the worst econ profs at osu. Took both intermediate econ and financial aspects of international trade with him and did not get much out of the classes. His lectures are unclear and he basically tells us what will be on the test. Easy A cause of the latter, but intellectually, you miss out.

I've never seen a professor so incapable of teaching in my four years at OSU. His availability for office hours is one hour a week, which he usually cancels. Exams and quizzes are straight from the problem sets (he'll change numbers). If you plan on skipping class, just get the book because it's word for word what he puts on the chalk board.

Teaches above pre-requisites. Expected us all to know Calculus 3 , when the class was only supposed to be up to Calc 1. Copies the textbook on to the board, few explanations. Moves very fast. Worst professor I have ever had in my 3 years. You teach yourself with the book. Would avoid at all costs.

Overall, this was a waste of my money. He doesn't teach you anything. He copied and pasted the book onto the chalk board. He doesn't explain the concepts. He move so very fast and expects you to know exactly what he is talking about.

Though he may not be a great teacher, he seems like he would like to give everyone in the class an A.  He uses a lower grading scale than the standard OSU scale and he literally tells the class what is going to be on the exams/quizzes while he's writing it on the board! Buying the textbook is a waste of money, all you need is your notes to study.

Just one thing u need to remember: never skip any class. Everything on the test was based on lecture. Just write everything he wrote on the board and u will be fine. Btw, don't trust his TAs,they are just graduate students and know nothing about this course.

He's South Korean so his accent is hard to get past at first, however after you get use to it there isn't much difficulty understanding (took me 2 classes). He will tell you what style of question will be on the tests and quizzes but change them up a bit. His class is very hard, you will have to study and do practice problems. He knows his stuff!

literally cannot understand a thing he says, spends entire class writing notes he took from textbook. just repeats what the textbook says and does not explain concepts or anything. worst econ professor i've ever had. had to read the textbook to try and teach myself, and by then it was too late. test are hard too.

i got an A- in his class, this guy does not know how to teach, its that simple, he tries but that's as far as he gets. just goes to the board with chalk and writes down stuff moving from left to right, back turned. I taught myself the whole course by doing his practice problems and reading the book, if you don't have that drive don't take him.
Worst econ professor I've ever had. Tough grader. Boring lectures. Basically you're just copying lecture notes from the blackboard. Choose other classes if you don't want to ruin your GPA.
His teaching style is merely by writing out notes on the board without explaining them. He also grades very harshly. He is not interested in helping students who email him or ask him for help.
He simply doesn't know how to make lectures interesting. Copying lecture notes directly from the textbook... Not flexible at all and there's no incentive to go to class.
Worst professor I have ever had.  I have never seen someone so incapable of engaging the class.
Simply doesn't know how to engage the class in lecture. Studying just from your notes didn't seem to be enough for the exams and quizzes. Must teach yourself from the textbook.

He's not an AMAZING professor, but not a 1.0 in my book. His presentations are pretty clear, the struggle is knowing what to focus on for quizzes/tests. You may have to use the ELC, but honestly I haven't really not had to for a class anyway. I wouldn't go out of my way to take his class of course, but don't freak out if you have to take him.
Simply reads off slides and talks to the ground. Completely incapable of engaging students as an instructor should. His lectures are like an audiobook of the textbook. You must teach yourself.

I have never been more disappointed in a professor in my time at OSU. Less than half of the class attended lecture because he was so hard to understand. I would consider myself a pretty good student( over 3.5 gpa) but my only hope in the class has been trying to teach the material to myself and scoring above the average.

This is the WORST professor I have ever taken at OSU (and I've had bad ones). Attending class is a joke as he teaches straight from the book and talks to the ground. Teaching yourself is the only way to go. Averages are 50% and he thinks that is acceptable. Truly an awful teacher. STAY AWAY!

Probably the worst professor I have ever had. And ive had some bad ones.  Exams and quizzes are extremely hard. Avg is usually between 50 and 60. Cannot understand what he is saying so you basically teach yourself. If there is another prof teaching, take them bc is cant get worse than this guy.

summary_comment: This professor is not highly regarded for her lecturing skills, yet she consistently provides curve adjustments that benefit the students' grades.

Ratings.comment: Not a good lecturer, but she gave curves a lot.

summary_comment: This professor is exceptionally knowledgeable and passionate about the subject matter, making her teaching experience outstandingly effective for students.

Ratings.comment: She is literally amazing. Very knowledgeable and passionate about the subject matter.

summary_comment: Based on student comments, this professor is highly polarizing. Some students find her extremely difficult and unhelpful, citing unclear lectures, demanding assignments, and a lack of alignment between her teachings and course materials. Others, however, appreciate her approach to fostering independent thinking and consider her tests challenging yet fair. Overall, her teaching style and effectiveness appear to vary significantly among students.

Ratings.comment: One of the worst profs you will ever encounter in your entire life. SWITCH OUT RIGHT NOW UNLESS YOU WANT TO DIE. Doesn't know how to teach at all, literally how did she get a teaching degree???? Her lectures are not helpful at all and don't have anything to do with the readings.

Only class I had to drop at OSU. She's unclear and way too demanding at the undergrad level. What's worse is i felt like I didn't learn anything. Her lectures are rambling and she's not super prepared, which makes taking notes impossible. Then she assigned papers on stuff she didn't teach, then proceeded to grad them extremely tough. AVOID HER!

Worst prof ever. Don't understand anything she explains. Complicates even easy stuffs. Despite putting so much effort into this course, I did very bad even though I am an A student in other courses. Stay away from her!

her tests are by no means easy, but she is trying to make you learn how to think in an economic way. at the beginning of the year i was convinced she was a bad prof, but at the end i realized she is quite straight forward and doesn't want to dictate micro to you, she wants you to get some knowledge by yourself.
Hard.
this professor is so easy. eco204 is a complete joke, walk into test not even doing study guides and absolutely demolish the tests  anyone who fails should be executed
easiest class of my entire lifemer

professor is absolutely perfect. makes me forget i am even taking this class because i haven't received my marks in 6 weeks. she makes me forget about all my pain and sorrow and depression about the testing process. its almost like everything is completely optional and i love it - you write an essay, and its just for fun - no marks. no pressure.
Most useless prof

This course is called microeconomics, but what she taught me is how to write like an idiot. We do nothing in tutorials, practice problems are irrelevant, useless textbook, and she doesn't explain anything well. Nothing we do helps us understand microeconomics, but our exams are extremely hard.

The course material is very challenging but interesting. She is a good professor who always encourages and gives inspirational pep talk at beginning of the lecture. She deeply cares for the students and really creates an environment that is nurturing and fosters independent thought that was instrumental in making me who I am today! :) jk 0 material

Professor is very, very difficult. Section 2 of the test is worth 55% and questions are difficult to understand and answer. Totally ignores teaching and gives useless examples and wastes tutorial time.

It is true that a hard prof can improve your skills in a lot of ways(indirectly). But this so called experts should help, instead of challenging students. You can make a test hard, but do not make lectures unclear, tutorials useless, and ridiculous assignments.

Impossibly hard professor. She teaches at an extremely high level, expecting students to be masters in calculus and economics. Tutorials are irrelevant to the course, every question in a lecture, study guide, or 'exam' is different than anything you've ever seen. You can expect to devote 100 hours a week to the class and still not understand it.
She just make easy things complicated.
worst teacher ever!!!!

Wastes tutorial time by making us sit through "how to write" workshops rather than working through problems and applying the concepts. She assigns very irrelevant work, such as unconstrained writing which has nothing to do with the course. Her marking scheme is also not clear at all.

Worst prof I've ever seen so far! Had a hard time thinking how bad she is, can't even imagine! Lectures are difficult to understand; writes out impossible-to-understand long equations on the board. Problem sets take 90 minutes each question.....
Best teacher ever would not be where I am today without her.

To expand on the person below me... she JUST decided to send out SOME answers for 2 worksheets. All taken from other websites. Best part? She sent them out less than 24 hrs before the exam. Won't even be there for the final, never answers emails, has about 2 hrs of office hours. I've always been a 3.7-4.0 student and I'll have a C or D in her class

STAY AWAY AT ALL COSTS. She expects people in an intro class to be experts, provides no answers for homework because she "doesn't have time" so it makes it impossible for students to practice. Was online shopping when I was attempting to talk to her in office hours. AVOID AT ALL COSTS if you value your GPA. Worst class I've ever taken.

The worst professor I have ever had. She can be nice and helpful when she wants to be though. She is very unclear and the class is taught like an upper level major's course, meaning she expects you to be able to do way too much. Also, the grad students in the help center don't know how to solve most of the problems. Avoid at all costs.

I went into this class really interested in the subject, and excited, and she really turned me off. She has good intentions but she is a terrible teacher in that she doesn't teach us. We are expected to know things before class, and I was kicked out for not having done the homework because I couldn't understand it. Do not take her class

HORRIBLE TEACHER! Do not take her. She didn't actually "teach" but just expected her students to know certain information. Her examples were unclear. Though she aims to help students, she doesn't do well at connecting and helping them understand. She is NOT a good teacher and I would stay away

THE WORST CLASS I HAVE EVER TAKEN IN COLLEGE. I have a 3.7 GPA and struggled to get a B- in this class. The problem sets are impossible and her exams are nothing like the material covered in class or the homework. The final exam was 26 pages long. I would rather delay graduation than take a class with her again.

She is a tough cookie! You learn a TON of information. the class is challenging, however, she is available to help you if you are willing to work hard. Will not just give you an answer, if she did you would get the question wrong on the test. You will get a nice curve at the end if you work for it. Use her office hrs, read book, and go to class.

Excellent if you want to learn  economic theory and be great at it- not for you if you want an easy A or to not think much about economics. Do lots of practice problems- as if it's a math class. Very helpful professor in office hours if you ask the right questions (i.e. not for the answer). Superb course as long as you're willing and able to think.

Worst professor I've had at OSU. She "lectures" once a week, but it's really just a simple powerpoint outlining main concepts. Other two days are group meeting days which are utterly useless. You are EXPECTED to teach yourself from the book. Problem sets and exams are extremely difficult if you do not read the book and teach yourself everything.

This class is really difficult. Problem sets are due about every 2 or 3 weeks; no multiple choice questions in exams; her explanation is hard to understand if you do not read the textbook in advance; all the practice questions have no concrete answers. She is too smart to teach.

She was...ok. Made it VERY hard to get an A in intro to econ which is annoying. Very easy to get a B in the class, however (she used weird grading scale where everyone got B's). Reasonably clear and helpful.

Really liked the class.  Some material was difficult, but there was always plenty of extra review material.  Not an easy A, but not too tough if you're willing to put in the effort.  I would highly recommend the class if you want to learn, maybe not if you want to coast by.

This woman ruined my life. Her tests are inconsistent, the problem sets take a lifetime, no matter how hard I tried or how much I studied I could never succeed in her class. Worst class I have taken so far.

She's kind of hard to understand,  but is super clear about guidelines and material.  If you do the textbook readings homework, and pay attention, it'll be easy. She will make you apply your knowledge on stuff you've never seen, but just think logically and its not hard. It is a 500 level class afterall

I took her class last year, & if I take one of her exams today (w/o studying) I would get a B b/c I still remember everything I learned in her class! YES it was the TOUGHEST class that I ever took! But you'll LEARN A  GREAT DEAL from her classes! If you're looking for an easy A class, then DON'T take hers. If you really want to learn, then TAKE IT!

DONT YOU EVEN TAKE HER CLASS,I took the class last quarter,and there was too much hw you need to spend 6-8hrs on it, the text book is required and cost 250$, worst professor even, DOOOOO NOT TAKE HER CLASS IF YOU REALLY CARE ABOUT YOUR GPA AND EVEN YOUR LIFE!

Worst professor ever. her exams are 18 pages long (not kidding) and she expets everyone to fail. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS, EVER. she doesnt explain anything and she teaches as if its a graduate level class. she is unfair, doesnt care to give good grades to anyone, and too demanding for the second level micro class

This class was a joke. I got less than 50% on both of the 2 midterms throughout the quarter. She assigns WAY too many assignments that she can't handle returning in a timely fashion, so you don't actually know how you're doing until week 7. I spent hours on the Problem Set assignments and did terrible on them. Take 501, just with another professor

It seems like everyone has pretty much written this class off. It's unfortunate because it seemed like it could have been a moderately interesting class. I don't even know what to start studying for the final. Even if I do study there is a good chance I will still fail. At least there is going to be a curve!

I have put more time and effort into this class then any other class, ever, and I have no idea where I stand because almost nothing has been graded. I spend so much time in the Econ lab that I am on a first name basis with every tutor in there. Find another professor.

DON'T take her class!! The WORST professor I've ever had. She can't explain well the econimics. Sooooo many homework to do and the problem sets are soooo hard. The 3 exams are 15-18 pages long with no mutiple choice questions. The exam worth 200 points and the median of my class is 68.5 just AVOID her!!

can talk for days about how you should never take this class. she ruined economics for me. everything is opinion and she's always right. the first two midterms had an average in the 40%'s. the group problem sets take hours and are impossible to get correct. the tutors didn't even know how to help. not to mention she's got a horrible accent
just don't take her class everything that most people have described is true.
Dont take this class, She is the worse, I am doing well in this class and I still don't like it.  She is know help and give the most unclear answer

This woman will make you cry yourself to sleep at night. She is absolutely useless as a professor. I've never had so much work for 1 class. Each assignment that must be done in a group, takes a good 6-8 hours to complete. Her exams are 15-16 pages of written material; no multiple choice. The exam avg is 45%. And that's perfectly acceptable to her.
I could complain for ten minutes. Just choose another teacher. Keep your sanity.

RUN AWAY AS FAST AS YOU CAN!!!! This class is killing my whole quarter.  She CAN'T teach to save her life.  Very unclear and can't example her thinking.  She also believes True or False question are all opinion, and has no logic with them

So much work. Review questions at the begining and end of class, problem sets due every 2-3 weeks, 3 midterms, essays (grading 2 other students' essays ---also a homework), and yes, everything is graded on accuracy especially the problem sets. You are suppose to find a group to do them. Do so because questions are about 5 pages long single spaced.

Worst teacher that I have ever had in my life.  Exams are not even based on economics most of the time and it takes 3+ weeks to get anything graded.  Would've dropped this class and taken it a different quarter if I could.  Do anything you can to not take this lady.

She is the worse professor at Ohio State for sure.  She has called a few students stupid to there face and is unbelievable strict with her deadline but it takes her 3 weeks to grade a one page paper.  Any other econ professor would be better then her.  This is her 1st quarter at Ohio State and I hope to god it is her last.  RUN AWAY FROM THIS CLASS
The single worse teacher I have ever had, it takes about 3 weeks for the midterm to be handed back.

Hard class so avoid when you can. Exams are all hand written and difficult. Problem sets are long and hard. And she is a terribly slow grader. She also has unanswerable true/false questions. Take it with someone else!
her exams are long!!! be careful with only 90 mins...shes horrible

Do not take this class. She uses a 250$ book that all other 501 classes don't use. She is terrible at explaining herself. Her voice is like nails on a chalkboard, her accent is almost unbearable. Worst class I've taken so far here at Ohio state.

Spare yourself, seriously. In the four years of college I have never had a teacher so "wishy washy." Every answer is solved in a different way, so you never quite know how she wants anything solved. Finally, there is an excessive amount of unneccesary and unrelated work involved in the class. The tutors didn't even know how to solve the problem set

Shes a very tough teacher .She does beginning of class review questions and end of class review questions.Homeworks , essays, 3 exams! Shes very strict with submitting homework or any work right at the beginning of class! I dont particularly like her.She gives vague exam revies.Tough class!

Avoid this professor at all costs! The homework was unrelated to class discussions, and the tutors in the econ lab couldn't figure out the answers. She explains everything in a math-related way so it's difficult to succeed if you're not good at math.

summary_comment: Professor Nam Gam struggles with clarity in his teaching, often presenting material in a confusing manner and misinterpreting student questions. While the course content itself is not challenging, his teaching style makes it difficult for students to grasp the material effectively. Students recommend seeking an alternative professor for macroeconomics.

Ratings.comment: Nam Gam seems like a good guy, but he is impossible to understand. The material is presented in a confusing manner and usually doesn't answer the questions you ask him correctly as he misunderstands what you are asking. The class isn't hard, but some people just aren't meant to teach. Take another Prof for Macro

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his deep knowledge and effective communication, always providing clear and comprehensive answers. He responds promptly to emails, ensuring students have the support they need. While his recitations are serious in tone, they are incredibly educational and beneficial for learning.

Ratings.comment: He always knew what he was talking about. Answered emails quickly. A bit serious, but you'll learn a lot from his recitations.

summary_comment: Professor Dan is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and willingness to assist students. He provides comprehensive online materials and offers numerous opportunities for extra credit, making the class accessible and easy to understand. Students consistently praise his ability to explain complex concepts clearly and his dedication to helping those who struggle with the material.

Ratings.comment: He puts all of the material for the class online, so you can teach yourself the material if you can't make it to class. When you can make it to lecture, he has many opportunities for extra credit, making the class quite easy to pass overall. I wouldn't say that the class itself is an easy A per se, but Dan makes it so easy to understand & get an A.

Dan is the best! He really helped me understand the material. When I was really struggling with a concept, he would stay with me passed his office hours to help me. I'm very lucky Dan was teaching this class. I recommended it to all my friends.
I loved having Dan as a professor! He is super nice, understanding, and is willing to help his students get an A. Good lectures, but slides online so attendance isn't mandatory. Great class!

What a great prof. He gives out extra credit as incentive to participate, which helps your grade and you understand the material better. He is great at explaining concepts and giving tangible examples. I would want no other microecon prof teaching this class, def take him if you can.
Daniel is really nice person. Easy A if you study.
This guy is hilarious. Helped me a lot to understand the material.

Daniel was awesome! He was only the TA for this course at the time but I learned all the material from him. He held exam reviews for us out of his own time, and was always available to go over the material.

summary_comment: Lin Lin's teaching effectiveness is mixed; while her office hours are highly beneficial for gaining in-depth knowledge, her lectures lack engaging content, and her PowerPoint presentations are not helpful. Despite the challenging workload and exams, the class structure makes it easier to prepare through homework practice, and many students find it manageable and would take it again.

Ratings.comment: Lin Lin is not the greatest lecturer - however, if you go to her office hours for help on homework or material, you will learn a lot. The class was easy from my perspective because if you study off of the homework assignments (homework solutions provided after turn in date), you will have almost the exact problem structures on the exam. MEMORIZE!

Overall not a bad class. The homework is due every other week and consists of multiple choice questions and some extended response e.g utility function algebra problems. She goes over the homework in class and allows you to use your notes during the quiz (Quizzes aren't hard if you don't sit in the back and talk). Would absolutely take again.

Nice woman, but she cannot teach effectively. She has powerpoints with no worked out problems, and you can't read her handwriting when she uses the projector. There is an insane amount of homework and material on each test it is impossible to know everything she expects you to know for either. Will give an insanely short amount of time for quizzes.

summary_comment: Professor McCulloch is a knowledgeable but ineffective instructor, known for being boring and test-heavy. His lectures and slides are difficult to follow, and exams focus on memorization rather than conceptual understanding. While some students appreciate his helpfulness and the availability of online resources, the overall consensus is that his teaching style and exams make the class challenging and less engaging.

Ratings.comment: He is a smart man but a horrible teacher. Extremely boring. Test heavy. His slides are hard to understand. His lectures are pointless because he is hard to understand. His exams are very date heavy like when did this law pass rather than testing concepts. Memorise problem sets and quizlet questions and you shoule be okay but i say DONT TAKE HIM!

avoid. if you are okay with remember everything from lecture notes, take this class for easy A without even go to any single class and recitation. you will find that this professor only read his slides, and give vague explanation. if you are really looking for understanding the concept of money and banking, definitely avoid.

Prof McCulloch is a nice, intelligent and helpful man. He tries to make the class interesting. You won't even have to buy the books, he will upload them online and homeworks will also be online. Go to him after class if you don't get something. Exams are all multiple choice questions you just have to memorize a lot of details and you'll be fine.

8 words out of 10 in his sentence are useless. he uses his own book as textbook. didn't read a word of it. his slides are in handwritten form, abbreviations out of no where. ambiguous wording and answer for multiple choices in homework. TAs are nice. she TRIED to help. hard exams. make sure you do the samples. avoid if you can.

He is an okay teacher & gives you tools that you put to use in 642 which can be a much more interesting course (take it with de Jong). Grading is fair but I didn't really understand what we were doing it just became a plug and chug thing to get the homework done. Tests are similar to the old ones and keep/bring your old STAT 245 book, very helpful!

He's very boring. The textbook is useless. Lectures are useless. He posts all lecture notes online and then just reads off of them during lecture with no elaboration. TAs do the homework for you. I got an A without ever going to lecture and simply studying the day before each exam. Exams were very similar to old exams.

going to arps to do the hws sucks, so don't leave them to the last minute. work in groups so noone has to work too hard. he gives practice midterms and finals that are very similar to the real thing. super smart guy; he's written a paper on everything. occasionally makes really nerdy jokes.

Most annoying part of the class was having to go to Arps to do the homework in the lab. Understanding is not a requirement of getting a good grade because he gives practice tests and lets you use them on the midterm and final.  Average curved to B or B+.Never opened book, shouldn't have bought it.

His class is a waste of time.  I stopped going when I realized I was sleeping through them.  I read the book and the TA basically did the HW for us.  I did the practice exams, and that's really all you need.  60% of the questions are just reworded practice questions.  The rest... random things he says that you can guess if you follow the news.
Never really went to class..jus studied the homeworks and practice midterms and i got an A-. My TA always helped me out on the homeworks

umm hes pretty easy. um just do the practice exams because uh most of the questions are the same or just asked differently (least likely becomes most likely). uhhh class is boring. um hw is easy and your TA should do it uh do it for you. umm take him or osman. uhh you'll understand the ums and uhs if u ever have his class. umm solid curve on exams.

umm hes pretty easy. um just do the practice exams because uh most of the questions are the same or just asked differently (least likely becomes most likely). uhhh class is boring. um hw is pretty easy and your TA should do it uh do it for you. umm take him or osman. uhh you'll understand the ums and uhs if u ever have his class.

Teaching sucked. But overall pretty easy class. Lecture not necessary. Just buy the book and study the practice exams and you will do fine. Final wasn't as similar to the practice tests but still got an A- for the qtr. HW is 20% of grade and practically a gimme. Overall, awful teacher but grading was very fair with a pretty nice curve.

True- he is definitely not good at lecturing.  But really- can anyone complain about the exams- which ultimately make up your entire grade- NO.  They're practically identical to the practice ones.  Also, I think he's a hot old guy.  If I could mute him during lecture it would be nice. =]

Do not take his class unless you plan on teaching yourself.  I shouldnt have gone to class, because I always walked out wondering what the hell he was talking about.  "Ummmmmm.... Ehhhh.  Ummmmm..."  Dear god, I could never concentrate on what he was saying because I was too busy counting how many times he hesitated!!  He needs to take Bus Adm 499!

Don't take him unless you want to teach yourself. He's very smart, but needs to realize that he is often talking over the heads of his students. When he asks if anyone has questions, no one responds because we would have to ask what he just said for the past hour. Study old exams. He wrote the books and it is the same style of speaking.

Dr. McCulloch is very smart and one of the most distinguished members of our economics faculty.  He is incredibly well-versed in econometrics, but his lectures are very boring.  To his defense, it might be impossible to avoid being boring, and he makes what could be a very difficult class quite easy.

You have to realize coming into this class that it is going to be boring.  That being said McCulloch does a great job presenting the material.  Midterm and final are open book and notes.  He is very fair with what he expects you to know.  If you do your homework and somewhat understand them you should do fine.
Study the exams from previous quarters and read through the notes. His lectures are the same as his book and notes as well.
I never went to class, just study the practice exams, they are exactly like the tests and the weekly homework problems are done for you inrecitation. Easiet econ ever.
he is too smart for his own good, but if you go to class and make notes on his handouts, you can make sense of them. I have had worse classes
bumps to this class! he made difficult and interesting concepts very easy. the hardest part of the class was getting eviews to give the correct output. good prof with good TA's.
worst econ professor I had. He taught nothing. giving out a packet of hand written notes is a horrible excuse for teaching

This prof made notes for each class.  All you had to do is pay attention.  This really helped because the subject was pretty difficult.  Also, if you have a problem taking a test or getting notes, he's quite helpful and willing to change his own schedule t

Hands out notes every lecture so all you have to do is follow along. Tests are open book and notes. Too many notes to rely on them though but if you go to class and even just half listen you should get at least a B.
A bit difficult to follow at times, but open book/notes exams make it hard to get a bad grade.
he's hard to understand but it doesnt matter since he gives you the notes and you can use them on exams. organize your notes well and its a breeze
Nice guy, pretty clear.  Gives out awesome note and the exam is open book.  He tries to be funny, but I still fell asleep a few times.

Classes are sleepy time, but he hands out perfect lecture notes that make his homework and exams fairly easy-sometimes he may stick 1 or 2 super hard questions on the exams, but for the most part they follow directly from his lecture notes (exams are open book/notes, etc)

A piece of**** for the most part.  His book sucks and makes absolutely no sense.  It is hard to stay awake in his class as well.  Just take someone else, the curve is all that saved anyone for the most part.
He is one of the best prof. on OSU campus. I wish I get him for all my Econ classes

This course was aweful.  Dr. McCulloch does not seem to care whether or not students can understand his lectures.  Anyone dedicated to actually learning the material soon learns that he only tests your ability to organize your notes: exams were open notes
Great professor
No Comments

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as of poor quality, with students citing issues such as a difficult-to-understand accent, unclear explanations, and frequent mistakes during lectures. Despite some positive feedback regarding extra credits in one course, the overall consensus is negative, with students finding his teaching style confusing and ineffective.

Ratings.comment: I had him for recitation in microeconomics. I haven't been taught by a worse TA than this guy. He explains fast and there is a language barrier. Everyone in class does not understand his accent. Sometimes, he messes up questions and says: "Nevermind, it is confusing." He was really horrible, although microeconomics should be easy.

He was absolutely horrible. Worst economics professor in my 4 years as an Econ major. His lectures are slow and difficult to hear. Furthermore, expect to be tested on things he does not cover. Finally, good luck asking for an explanation as he often messes up the problems himself. It was a consistent theme to hear a student correct his errors.
I took his intermediate microeconomics and he gave us a lot of extra credits. I definitely take his class again.
Soft spoken and hard to follow

summary_comment: Jane's teaching approach was largely ineffective, relying heavily on a Cengage website for instruction and providing minimal value through her own lectures and recitations. Students found the class extremely challenging and self-taught most of the material. Additionally, the professor was unhelpful, offering few correlations between the practice problems and actual assessments.

Ratings.comment: Jane was an okay professor but she really didnt do much of the teaching. She pretty much relied on this website called Cengage to do the teaching. Her lectures and recitations didnt really teach me as well. So I was pretty much all self taught. This is a very tough class and I took it just for an elective credit. No curve

Have fun trying to pass this class. Between the 2 chapters of homework, practice questions, and one quiz due each week it will ensure that you are constantly doing some kind of work for this class. The lectures consist of a few practices problems which have little to no correlation to the actual exams and quizzes. Professor is not helpful at all.

summary_comment: Carol is an effective and clear lecturer, though her rapid pace means students must rely heavily on self-study. The course is rigorous with extensive out-of-classwork requirements and challenging exams. However, some students find the class dull and complain about unprepared test questions and slow grade turnaround.

Ratings.comment: Carol is a great professor. She is often very clear in her lectures so that there is very little confusion. However, my one critique is that she is speedy. We hardly spend time on any one topic before we move on to the next; if you miss something in the lecture, you pretty much have to look it up in the textbook. Other than that, she is wonderful!

This professor did a really good job teaching, its just the department for the linguistics classes make the professors follow a strict guideline. There is so much busy work for this class, outside research work, quizzes, popquizes, a group project, mandatory 3/4 page "study guides" for each chapter. Exams require a lot of studying from the book.

She takes ridiculously long to return grades, and she puts random things on the tests she never covers in class. Class is so dull, and she just reads off the slides which are on Carmen. I'm and honors student who went to every class and failed a midterm. Avoid her.

summary_comment: Professor Miyazaki is highly knowledgeable and genuinely cares about his students' learning, but his lectures can be difficult to follow due to tangents and broken English, making it crucial to sit in the front and stay engaged. While some students found his teaching effective with diligent note-taking and participation, others struggled with the class structure and grading, reporting low scores despite effort. Overall, opinions are divided, with some praising his dedication and content while others strongly advise against the course.

Ratings.comment: He can be hard to understand and goes on tangents so I recommend sitting in the front row. With that being said if you go to class and pay attention youll do fine. Hes wicked smart and knows a lot about the subject and is very willing to help students who ask for help. No hw but in class quizzes everyday so dont skip too often.

Going to class on lecture days is pointless not only because of Miyazakis broken English but, because you cannot hear him or read his writing. The way he grades his quizzes/exams allows students to receive a negative score. Did not learn a single thing, got a 10% on the final, but somehow still received an A- in the class. Do NOT take

Hajime's class is by far the worst class I've ever taken. He doesn't care about u & gives u negative grade on weekly quizzes or exams if u get something wrong, the lowest grade on final was a -29 that poor person was better off not taking the exam. Content is dif. from every other profs and can't be found anywhere but in class so skipping is no go
Class is impossible - Curved everyone by roughly 30%

DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE IF YOU CARE ABOUT YOUR GPA. During my entire undergraduate career, this was by far the worst course I've ever taken. Professor Miyasaki's lectures were incomprehensible and poorly structured. Students had no clue what was going on and were afraid to ask questions. This course was a perpetual source of anxiety. Beware!!

Miyazaki is one of my favorite professors of all time. I took him in the spring. Consisted of daily lectures until spring break where he just talks to you for about an hour. You then take a short quiz at the end of class on what he just lectured on, so if you take good notes, you'll do fine. After spring break is group projects. Final was an essay

Professor Miyazaki is a really caring person. If you are trying to succeed in the field of Economics, take one class from him. He genuinely wants you to learn, though his methods are head-scratching. Exams are very long for this class (46,36, and 26 pages respectively) and are fairly diffficult even if you know the material. Excellent material.
Do not take this class. He made it much harder then it needed to be and the tutoring center could not help me. Lots of other teachers are easier

1. His English is so broken that you wouldn't understand what he is saying 2. He takes points off in quizzes. 3. The Quizzes/Exams make no sense from the subject, and MUST be done exactly the way he wants, NO EXCEPTIONS. 4. That being said, just "memorizing" how to answer his questions will get you "good" grade.

One of the hardest classes I have ever attempted. I have a 4.0 GPA, and had to drop his course. You do get used to his accept after the first few classes though. He gives a pop quiz every week, and usually after a lecture on the material you learned that day in class. I could not find what we were discussing in the textbook anywhere.

the worst professor I have ever had in my life. class is very fast paced, and the tests are very difficult. He takes points off for wrong answers, so it's possible to get a negative score. It's hard to understand his accent. Only good thing is his posts past quizzes and tests online, but I thought they only helped me prepare for the final.
Great professor even it took my half semester to understand his speech. You can study something from his class.

Miyazaki is very intelligent in the field and is enthusiastic when he lectures. His accent takes some getting used to, so I recommend sitting in the front few rows. Tests are exactly like the practice problems in class so make sure your attendance is good. No homework at all, however there are pop quizzes in lecture. No textbook required.

Miyazaki was the hardest professor I have had in my life! My friends who have other professors for this course are passing and I have failed every exam, and many quizzes. Pop quiz every week! He takes off points when you get something wrong on exams, so a negative score is possible. The econ tutors didn't even understand what I was learning.

Professor miyazaki is not good at giving speech, and his pronunciations make his words even hard to understand, but one thing good, is he usually use the handwriting to give charts, and those charts and notes also can be viewed online. The test will be 80% use the same question as last year same period or older. Be ready to work hard in this class.

Professor Miyazaki can be hard to understand at times and goes on long-winded tangents about the economy at times. He uses only graphs during the lectures, but is very fair in that he gives access to all previous quizzes and exams so it's an easy A if you just put in a little time.

His lecture notes cover a lot of concepts, but he occasionally goes rogue and teaches of the to of his head. He's not really a good teacher, and his lecture and presentations are hideously ugly (black comic sans on an ugly yellow background.) Extremely unsympathetic and robotic. Get ready to hear him laugh by himself to his lame jokes.
This  class is incredibly basic if you go to class. He only uses Graphs. The quizzes are open  note,  and have the same info as the lectures. If you have lecture notes, you have quiz answers

He basically stands up at the front, and draws the same graph 20 times. No homework, but weekly quizzes require you to actually put in some effort. He words problems in a way that makes them difficult to understand - the material taught in class is incredibly basic, but he does make it confusing.

Avoid at all costs. Grading scale is as follows;    Answer worth 5 points;   correct answer +5 points, no answer  0 points, wrong answer -5 points.   The average for the final exam was -5. Yes you can score a negative on quizzes and exams. Very unclear, can barely speak english or read his handwriting. Do not sign up with the professor.

Absolutely horrible.  You can't understand him while he is talking or read his writing.  Gives random pop quizzes including the first class. Uses a lot of confusing notations and Exams are not the same as what we do in class.  The worst is that he often takes off points for missing questions.  Some kids got a negative score on one of our exams.

The guy is definitely hard to understand, but you get the hang of it pretty quickly. Class is divided into 2 parts: microecon concepts in the first half and presentations on real world issues in the second. He's (a bit boring at times, but) definitely smart as hell. Go to almost every class & it can be a straight A. Lots of extra credit!
He is to hard to understand, every class take quiz and attendance. Do not take this class.

Seriously, his class is very boring, no interesting! I totally cannot understand what he said, sounds like Japanese. And he did not care about student, I think he did not respect student well. 4 months class, he used 2months let student do the presentation. Do not take his class, you won't learn anything!Also every class take a quiz and attendance.

nice guy but not the best teacher.  he is hard to hear/understand and all he does is draw graphs.  best way to study by far is to go over the past midterms and tests.  the midterms are so similar to the practice so just memorize how to do the midterm problems.  he curves the end grade a lot.  didnt do much in this class but still got an A-.

I loved him! He uploads quizzes from the previous year and then the exams from the past two years. If you practice those and show up to lecture it is an easy A. Most of the quizzes and exams have basically the same questions on them. Last years final was practically identical to this years final. Just put in the work.
He really isn't that bad. Sot in the front and try and listen to his long boring lectures and you will be okay.

Professor Miyazaki is a very nice man! You can tell he enjoys talking Economics by the way he randomly gets excited when telling stories about different markets. In order to pass you must listen carefully to the lectures which are very hard to understand.  Be prepared! There was an exam the first day of class!

He is almost impossible to understand and, even though he does put in the effort to upload all of his TA's notes online, they are very hard to follow and his handwriting is very hard to read (meaning the professor's annotations not the TA). Avoid this professor if you can!

He is very difficult to understand, though if you sit in the front of the classroom you get used to it after a few lectures. He can sometimes be very confusing when explaining things. However, he has a lot of material online - he has the TA take notes which he uploads, as well as previous notes, quizzes, and exams from earlier years.

Comparing this to an AP/IB level economics course in high school, you could easily say that what he puts on tests certainly has nothing to to with economics. What he teaches makes sense if you have some economic background, but when it comes to his tests, he pulls all of the graphs and questions out of nowhere which leads to ultimate frustration.

I usually give professors the benefit of the doubt, but do not take his classes. He taught an entry level economics course like we all had advanced knowledge beforehand. If you can even decipher a word he says (which is unlikely), you may do alright. I think 90% of the class is failing until he enacts an enormous curve at the end of the semester.
He has forgotten more than you will ever learn. Unbelievable theorist. If you don't like his class its because you don't want to LEARN the material .

He is not a hard professor to understand IF you are listening. This being said, he will not call you out if you are talking, sleeping, or absent. Therefore, half the lecture hall is chatting and packing up while he is still lecturing, and he does not use a microphone, so students who actually care cannot hear him. If you listen, you pass.

Hajime is a nice guy, very intelligent.  With that being said he is not the best teacher.
