He does have an accent but you get over it after a few classes, the thing that bugged me was that he never used the mic.  His lectures are all about graphs, nothing else.  All the testsquizzes graphs, nothing else.  BIG curve though.

Really dont know what to say other than DO NOT take this mans class. He doesn't care if anyone understands, I failed every midterm and final and only got a B because he curves in the end so much. Most frustrating class I've ever been through.

Hajime's class was like unlike any class I have ever taken.  If you get 60's on tests you basically have an A.  He curves the class at the end so you have no idea what grade you have until you see the final grade.  This class was very challenging, but I am glad I stuck through the class because the end result wasn't as bad as I thought it would be.

He is a very intellectual guy that makes class funny sometimes. Although class is based primarily on graphs and applications rather than definitions. Unlike other economic classes you do not write essays. He likes to tell you when his "pop quizes" are going to happen. Heavily curves the class. My grades were D's and F's but ended up with a B.
Could not understand anything he said all semester. Heavy accent with pop quizzes almost every week. Grades on a heavy scale, which helps.

Dr Miyazaki is an extremely smart professor who is respected in his field. Too bad his teaching style cannot be said the same for. He uses graphs riddled with labels to teach all his lectures. If his class is the only one you could get, I'd recommend a tactical withdrawal for your GPA once you find out how horrible the class is.

First, u cannot understand what he is talking about. Second, Midterm exam is super hard to understand. Although the quiz is easy, but u do not know when u will take quiz, if u go to class occasionally.

DROP THIS CLASS WHILE YOU STILL CAN. His econ class is unlike any others- it's entirely graphsshadinglabeling. Class avg on assignments is a D. Although he gives a very heavy curve, I had a 50% in the class, ended with a B-. If you go to his office hours and are RESPECTFUL he will help you. Be a suck up. Also read the annotated notes he posts.
Very strong accent, not helpful at all. Does not use a microphone in the large lecture hall.  Very rude and the tests are over material we've never been over before. Avoid him at all costs!!

this was the worst possible way to start off my freshman year. he mumbles into the board, and even when he faces the lecture hall, you can't hear him because he doesn't use the microphone. no one has a clue what he is saying, or what is going on. he is rude when you ask question. 90% of my stress comes from his class alone. don't take this class.

Thickest Japanese accent I've ever heard, plus a tendency to mumble really badly. I basically taught myself by reading the book and just trying to understand concepts from the graphs that he drew. Good luck on quizzes and tests, he is the only professor of Micro that avoids MC completely and instead makes you apply concepts w scenarios and graphs.

Class was in a big lecture hall. He didn't use the microphone and is difficult to understand. Once he turns to the board or the projector, there  is no turning back. People raise their hands and then get irritated and drop them after five minutes. His handwriting is sloppy and small on the board, I found it hard to read.  Tests are 40 pages long!
Worst teacher at Ohio State, by far. I'm an economics major and this class was impossible and not even relevant. You can't understand a word he says, avoid at all costs.

Draws graphs entire class but hardly explains. Very hard to follow lectures which everything is based off of. Said he rarely gives below a c- so heavy curve but an awful professor. Got mad at students when questions were asked and said he teaches every course like it is a graduate level course

Easy to get lost with graphs.textbook useless,all notes-based.easy quiz+exam if studied the notes.not easy to enter 90+ for punish points for wrong answers. serious about academic, knowledgeable.seems rude but not at all.do not assume he looks down to your question, he values it very much and wants you to participate in thinking and answering it!!!
Worst Teacher I have ever had. Really bad accent and really worse attitude towards questions. Worst ever! Never choose his class, you will regret to die.

Hajime's micro class is quite different than from others teacher of the same course.  All of his grades are quizzes/exams.  No multiple choice. Strictly open ended/drawing diagrams.  He gives you the same material as his grad students but doesn't say that til the end. Bad handwriting. Strong accent. Averages on exams in 50s and 60s. Hefty curve.
Very Great!!

Regretfully, I had to take his class few years ago. extremely bad accent, and terrible peaking. Bad personality and terrible attitude. The worst teacher I ever had. You must not critique him or you will have a very low grade. Not interested in assisting his students. Just bad all the way around.
very funny, although it does take a few days to get adjusted to his very heavy accent. Still well worth my time, and I got a pretty easy B+
Very hard to understand, talks to the ground and the board more than the students. Extremely condescending and rude when asking for help. Material is dated.
All information was based on incomprehensible class notes. He was very rude when you went to ask for help.
good class
HORRIBLE!  Unless you understand a language consisting of Q^ and Q~ and want to take a class that is based entirely on the same ****ing graph, then don't take this class!

Lectures only on the topics "he" understands, but expects all the topics from you on the exam.  Lectures are unclear and unorganized. Study packets do not help much on exams because he pulls questions from leftfield. Likes to step on people and belittle women.
I think he is terrific in terms of basics, but am not sure how good he would be in an advanced course. I feel he should focus more on the advanced stuffs in his graduate classes.

In my opinion, Hajime is an awesome teacher. He is fluent with the materials and uses many pedagogical techniques to make materials come to life. Meantime, no objection that the materials may seem a little dated. But the important thing is that he cares about the students. A plus overall.

It's not that he doesn't know what he's talking about, he just doesn't know how to teach it.  His accent is really bad, so understanding him at all is difficult.  His tests are not really over what he covers, he's all about curveballs.  Study hard.
he is the worst prof i have ever had.  this class was so stressful i got hives during it...he is hard to understand and gives very difficult exams. watch out for his "epsilon" twists.

If you don't want to be an economics major, he doesn't want to teach you either.  His class was impossible to follow and he hardly noticed if you had questions or not.  Don't take this class from him!!!
he's so funny! He tells little stories to bring economics down to our level.
the big problem with this class is that teaches OLD material that is irrelevant to modern micro theory
He is allright and easy. He knows what he is talking about.
He must leave the department right now!
One word: terrible.
For the second midterm, the mean was 42% and the median was 34%!  Over three-quarters of the class failed!  But Miyazaki says this is a "good result".  He must be crazy!

Worst professor ever.  He shows no concern that students understand the material.  His exams are not at all representative of the material taught in class and are impossible to complete in the time given.  He is not receptive to student questions.
I used to like economics...until I took this class.  This prof is really that bad.
The average score on his exams is around 45%.  Grad school is supposed to be tough - but not so tough that two-thirds of the class fails!  His expectations are unrealistic for students.
Hajime is the Man! Sure, I get the lectures on a 3-week lag, but grad school's not supposed to be easy. Also, if it weren't for him, I wouldn't have a fellowship!
No Comments

summary_comment: The professor struggles significantly with clear communication, both in lectures and on exams, leading to confusion and frustration among students. Students recommend avoiding his class due to its challenging nature and the lack of effective support or resources provided. Overall, the professor's teaching quality is poor, and many advise steering clear of his courses.

Ratings.comment: Cant speak English properly. Wording on midterms dont make sense most of the times. Just avoid him overall. Never have I ever had trouble with a professor who was foreign until now. Literally every other foreign professor except him!!!
Very hard to understand, his mind is all over the place, 4 exams and a final make up your final grade.

He tended to rush lectures and one time tested things he didn't go over in class (but were in slides). That said, he was happy to stay after class or during office hours. Attendance wasn't taken but I recommend going to EVERY class, because that's when he gave practice questions. Not a bad class, just be aware that it isnt easy.

The powerpoints are online, but his lectures are poor. It seemed like a lot of students were confused and when someone asked a question, it took multiple tries for him to get the point across. His grading scale is confusing. There are 3 midterms which arent easy, and neither is the final. Overall, not a great prof and I would avoid this class.

3 midterms and a final make up the entire grade. He often teaches small bits of information that isn't on the power points but is important for tests. He also provides no practice questions for tests but asks ones in class. Attendance isn't mandatory but it'll make the class a lot easier.
DON'T TAKE HIS CLASS.

Do NOT take this professor. The only grades are 4 exams. The book for this class is not used. Exams are based off of PowerPoints from class from a book that is no longer accessible. He reads directly from the slides. Extremely hard to talk to. He doesn't leave time to ask questions in class. He rushes through class. Exams are hard to understand.

summary_comment: Professor Kim is highly regarded for his passion and willingness to help students, often staying late to assist those in need. His classes can be challenging and difficult to follow, especially during lectures, but students find his office hours and approachable nature invaluable. While the material is demanding, many students appreciate his encouragement to think critically and find the course manageable with consistent effort.

Ratings.comment: Professor Kim is great.  He can be hard to understand and has trouble conveying concepts sometimes, but he tries SO HARD.  He is so nice and genuine and is willing to help you out so much.  He literally says on the first day of class "if you try your best, you will get an A", which is completely true.  He is very funny and outgoing, take his class!

Prof Kim is super nice and always willing to help you out.  The material is definitely very challenging but he tries to explain as best as he can.  Go to class, you have to if you want to pass exams.  The problem sets he gives will help prepare you for exams, don't slack off on them!
It's almost impossible to understand anything in Kim's lectures. Do not take this class.
Professor Kim made it. After 30 minutes nobody understand anyhting what this guy is talking about. He is a very good somniferous though. Go Kim!!

Very passionate professor, challenges students to think. Always helpful if you go to him during office hours or after class. Tests are normal but become easier if you know how to do the homework and actually seek out help when you need it. He likes to help those students that are actually seeking help, so participate and go to office hours.
Good professor who encourages you to think. Exams are not easy but the class is not hard to pass.

I absolutely love Daeho. He is so sweet and you can tell he just loves Economics. Lectures are optional as long as you read the textbook (which just came out in 2014 and is super super super easy to understand). Yes he is unclear, but if you get past that then this class shouldn't be a problem. There is one mid and one final, and they were fair.
Professor Kim is great, but this course is not easy.

Attendance is totally optional -- few attend because he's very hard to understand. On the other hand, he's very friendly and helpful in his office hours. There are 4 problem sets and 2 exams and the second half of the course is tough because it doesn't come from the book, but rather from his own econometric notes which are difficult to comprehend.

Not the most interesting professor, but not the worst. Attendance is optional. H/w and tests come straight from his slides. 4 problem sets, 2 exams. Helpful if you go to his office hours. Tends to over-emphasize econometrics, but will help you if you don't understand. Overall, not bad.

summary_comment: This professor is known for challenging students with rigorous expectations and difficult exams, but many find success through diligent note-taking and utilizing office hours. However, several students criticize his teaching methods, citing confusion and unhelpfulness, especially regarding the required software, and advising against taking his class.

Ratings.comment: This is a tough class. Anthony is smart and expects a lot out of you. However, if you go to class and take great notes (essentially write down everything he writes on the board) you will have the materials for success. Office hours are the best way to get questions answered. Allows you to have a note sheet on exams, but exams are still tough.

I honestly feel as though he has good intentions, but he is not a good professor. Tests are extremely difficult and he does not explain the program Stats at all even though you use it for the majority of the semester. If you go to office hours he does genuinely try to help, but he is not very clear with his explanations. Would not take him again .

Class starts out tough. He seems to try and weed people out. However; if you stick it out he really allows for you to pull up your grade. I had a C- after the first midterm, but ende up with an A- lectures are tough, but if you go to office hours he will help and your grade will reflect it

His class was really hard like all the other reviews say but that wasn't the problem. The problem was that he was very unhelpful. Everything he said was very confusing and he makes you use this computer program that he never teaches you how to use. His exams were impossible, even after studying what he tells you to study. Bad teacher. Avoid!

Spent more time on this class than all other classes combined. More effective 1-on-1 than in class, but still not great at conveying information in a way you can easily understand. Homeworks rely heavily on comp program he doesn't teach how to use. Exams are next to impossible. Project worth 20% had the most ridiculously vague prompt ever. Avoid.
In all fairness he is not a great teacher. He is constantly suggesting you come to his office hours. Nobody has time for that! He needs to make econometrics more accessible to students.

in no shape or form is bradfield ready to be a teacher.  horrible at explaining, terrible with grading, and overall, mean.  will not help you.  homeworks are impossible, no curve, he is the absolute worst.  stay away from his classes

BAD instructor.  Doesn't teach well, class is impossible, and although i have taken hard classes before, i have never had a teacher like him who is happy to see his students fail.  Going to see him is a waste of time because he just laughs and sends you away.  Overall, worst experiance with a instructor in my 4 years at osu.  Do not take his class

Terrible instructor. His tests resemble nothing that was done in class and expects you to magically know material without him actually doing anything. No study guides, his HW and tests are designed so you will fail. He acts as if he has something to prove, being a grad student.

Not a great teacher. He is a PhD student so I think he's a little out of touch with how undergrad classes should go. I went to his office hours once, he told me what I was doing was wrong but then gave me no guidance as to how to fix it. His homework/exams have questions that are oddly worded and very confusing. Average on midterm was 56%.
Worst. Teacher. Ever. Hardest class ive ever taken. Least helpful teacher ive ever had. No point in office hours because he'll turn you away with more questions than answers.
Avoid if you can. Overall just not a good teacher. Doesn't explain the material well, always suggests going to office hours but is no help there, and the tests are way to hard.
horrible teacher, doesn't seem to care about students, class is very hard as he doesn't explain material well, doesn't curve when average is around 60 percent definitely avoid if you can
worst teacher i have ever had.  Avoid at all costs.  Does not teach material, hard tests, no help when you meet with him.

summary_comment: Professor Snow is highly regarded for his knowledge and ability to explain complex economic theories in simple terms, making his classes engaging and thought-provoking. While some students found his lectures less helpful and leaned more on the textbook, others praised him for being approachable, fair, and effective in ensuring understanding. Overall, Professor Snow is recommended for his deep expertise and dynamic teaching style.

Ratings.comment: Professor Snow is a very nice man, but he really did not understand Macroeconomics on a level on which he was prepared to teach a class on it. He was regularly confused, and his Austrian school biases definitely showed in lectures (though he admitted it). Tests were fair and pretty easy, but lectures were not helpful - the book was my best friend.

Nicholas Snow is a great professor who understands the material and is interested in the subject.  There were a significant amount of assigned readings, a presentation, a paper, and weekly quizzes.  He's easy to understand, and if you pay attention in class the exams are fine.  Leans toward an Austrian economic perspective.  Highly recommend.

This class was incredibly interesting and Dr. Snow is an absolutely fantastic professor, probably the best in the entire econ department. It is patently obvious that he is incredibly interested in the material and it really comes through in his lectures. This class is a must-take for econ majors.

Dr. Snow is one of the most knowledgeable professors in the area of economics I've ever seen. His best quality is being able to explain complex theories/ideas in simple and understandable ways. His lectures also make you think about a variety of subjects in many different points of view. You will not be disappointed with this class.

Professor Snow is one of the best economics professors I've had in my undergrad career by far. He is quite knowledgable on a wide variety of subjects (both economic and non-economic) and he always finds a way to communicate complicated ideas in relatable ways. Definitely recommended -- regardless if you are a economics major or not.
Dr. Snow was a fantastic professor. He's approachable and will do his best to make sure everyone understands the material instead of simply lecturing.

Dr. Snow is one of my all-time favorites.  Intelligent, interesting, funny, and easy to interact with.  I learned so, SO much in this class and got an A, and I'm not even an econ major.  Weekly quizzes plus two papers is the bulk of your grade.  Would recommend this Dr. Snow to anyone.
Wonderful professor. Young, easy to understand, and a very fair grader. Thought I was going to bomb both classes, got very decent grades instead. Must take for any Econ course.

Great great Professor. I had him for underground economy and Govt' and business. He's the real deal! Weekly quizzes which are based on weekly readings, a book review and a final paper. If you put the work in, you def will end up with an A.
Great professor! Very little outside homework, only one essay for the entire class really.  Focuses more on teaching students than grading them.  Very interesting!

I had him for ECON 2367 and ECON 4001. He is one of the nicest people I know and he really cares and help his student. He is an inspiration. His arguments made me change my point of view and the way I see things in a good way. I really recommend him.

Dr Snow is phenomenal. He inspired me to learn and brought the best out of every one in class. He's extremely knowledgable and loves to help. A true asset to OSU. Loved his class. I would highly recommend him.

In 4 years at OSU, Dr. Snow has been my best professor. He seems to care more about helping students understand economics than swamping them in work. Minimal writing for a 2nd writing course. Best part about him is that he has strong beliefs but encourages you to disagree and think for yourself. Highly recommended.

Dr Snow is an amazing teacher. By far my best teacher in college. His readings are a bit hard, but he does a good job explaining them in class. He will give you a new perspective to approach economics. Everyone should take at least one class with him. He isn't easy by any means, but if you want to learn and have fun discussion TAKE HIM !!

he insists on drawing everything on the board, yet repeatedly draws graphs incorrectly. He gets confused in every class and teaches things flat out incorrectly until a student corrects him. His tests, quizzes, and problem sets are entirely unrelated to anything he taught or recommended studying. Avoid him.

Great professor, a younger guy so he can really relate to students which you see in all of his examples he uses to teach. He gets excited when you ask for help. As far as grading this was a writing course but for the papers he grades more based on content rather than on writing ability.

summary_comment: The professor provides minimal feedback, giving mostly high grades with no tests, making the class less stressful grade-wise but offering little in the way of assessment or guidance. Some students found him helpful and interesting, while others criticized his teaching methods as unstructured and unfair, with poor content and no clear standards for evaluations.

Ratings.comment: Gives absolutely no feedback. The only grade you receive class is the final grade.  From what I heard from everyone else I think he basically gave everyone As. There are no tests. He is a very nice guy and pretty forgiving. Also he is a genius in this area and gives you alot of info on what he is doing. Not really a class to worry about grade wise.
He was very helpful and interesting

Poor content for his class. Never have patience for your trouble, and never understand what is understanding. A brutal guy and never have a standard for your essay or project. Take his class you may get a A or A-, but you can never study anything.

summary_comment: Ranajoy is highly regarded for his clear and concise lectures, which are complemented by detailed online notes that facilitate understanding and success in exams. Students appreciate his availability for help and the inclusion of bonus points through quizzes. While some find the homework challenging, they generally agree that his teaching methods make the class manageable and recommend him for economics courses.

Ratings.comment: Take macroeconomics with Ranajoy. He's a very nice man, and the class isn't tough at all. Posts detailed notes online that if you learn, you will do well on the midtermsfinal and you don't even have to go to lectures. Also gives 2 quizzes purely for bonus points. 3 HW assignments that aren't too bad.
His lectures are very clear and concise as possible. There were multiple times he let us out of class early. Very very good teacher.

One the best profs I've had.  Makes things as straightforward as possible.  Didn't use textbook once. He types up all of his lecture notes and posts them online, he doesn't try to keep anything from students who skip class. He accounts for class participation by having problems that you turn in at the end of class (we had 3 total).

Homework is very difficult and not very straightforward.  However, he is available often and more than willing to help on difficult assignments and test prep.  No feedback is given on missed points on homework
Responsible for my B+ in Econ 4002.02. Class is reasonably challenging, but he makes it easy enough to get an AB. Explains things really well and posts all notes online. Would recommend 1010
Very clear in his lectures and posts all his notes online. Pretty straightforward exams that don't try to trick you. I would definitely recommend him for any econ class that you take.

One of the best professors I have had at OSU. The course structure is very fair, the class notes and lectures are very clear, and he is incredibly helpful . I found him to be incredibly easy to talk to, and would strongly recommend him for Econ courses.

As a senior in Economics major, he's definitely one of the best econ professors I ever had in OSU. His class notes are clear. And my personal tip for you would be go to class and take his notes on board and listen to his lectures, because his lectures will be helpful for you to prepare for exams. And he gives extra credits for in class quizs

Ranajoy is my favorite Economics professor at OSU.  He is very organized and the lectures are easy to follow.  A good grade is virtually guaranteed as long as you go to class and do the readings.  I will strongly recommend taking money & banking with him.
first you think this class is easy but is not so if you take this class please easy hard
One of the best professors I have met in osu. The class is very helpful. You can learn a lot from him.

Ranajoy is extremely knowledgeable and well-spoken. He explains the sometimes-boring material in such a way that you want to pay attention. He is always willing to help. He grades very leniently, giving generous partial credit and applying a large curve to the overall grade. Ranajoy was a delightful man and a great professor.
He is so nice!
Best Econ professor I have ever had. Very easy to understand and super nice, willing to help, highly highly recommended!

Torn about this class. Ranajoy is extremely nice, enjoys teaching, and is more than willing to explain to you. But each exam has 20 questions, and the exam is worth 20% of your grade (final is 35 and 35%). A mediocre/bad exam can wreck you. Moreover, I did not find his study guides helpful. Advice: study more than you think you need to.
Great professor and explains things in a manner that is easy to understand. Class is easy and as long as you go and do the bonus quizzes you will probably get 85%+ on every exam. Highly recommend

Very nice guy. Comes to class with a bright smile on his face. He explains the concepts very well and is very relaxed overall. I LOVE THIS MAN. Please take him. He does a lot to help his students. Don't take this as an easy A, you still have to do the work, he is just a very good man though :)

Great professor.  Very clear lectures and provided lecture notes online.  Tests came directly from concepts discussed in lecture notes and homework.  Not cumulative. Great curve (potential for 6% through bonus quizzes)

He is awesome! I definitely recommend taking his class, he really goes over every topic, and is very approachable with office hours. He posts lecture notes online, and no use of textbook. He sparked an interest in economics in me.

Awesome professor, makes difficult concepts crystal clear, hardly any work outside of class, posts lecture notes online, explains to you exactly what will be on each exam; would definitely take another class taught by him. Nothing negative to say.

I LOVE THIS MAN. He is such a great teacher and makes it interesting. He is actually really funny and is very clear when explaining even difficult topics. All notes are online and there are bonus quizzes so getting a good grade is pretty easy. You can drop the lowest homework grade and he makes it easy to succeed with some work. Such a great prof.

Ray is an awesome nice guy, he explains everything so thoroughly and clearly, and then post all the lectures online too, and he is very helpful during office hours, so there is no reason for you to not understand anything even though the subject is hard.
very helpful guy, good lectures, posts excellent notes, no accent!

Wonderful attitude & nice guy. But terrified of students and/or public speaking! Spoke very fast & was nervous. Didn't explain math well but always answered questions. Class always ended VERY early - TOO EARLY. Loads of bonus points & a huge curve. Posted wonderful notes & practice tests - memorize them for MT & final.
Class is kind of boring but he posts all the notes online.  He is very nice and the class doesn't require much work.

Class is fairly easy, though some test questions are tricky.  Opportunity to raise your score by 8% with easy bonus point quizzes.  Puts notes online and very clear to understand him.  I recommend taking this class with Ranajoy.  He said he never gives grades below a C.
Great professor! Very clear and fair.
Great lecturer. Very clear, simple notes. Good practice exams. Very willing to help. Fair grader.
Amenable, laid-back, provides pretty thorough lecture notes. Wants to give good grades, apparently. Comprehensible lectures. Can't complain.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his deep knowledge of the subject matter but struggles significantly with clear communication. Students find his lectures challenging and often require additional self-study from the textbook. While some appreciate his availability during office hours, many describe his teaching style as confusing and ineffective in the classroom setting.

Ratings.comment: You can tell this man is truly intelligent and knows his stuff. But he cannot communicate it clearly. This class is over material that is tough on its own. If you take this class, you will have to teach yourself from the textbook.
it's sad that OSU can't find a better teacher for this class. awful experience.
Absolutely do not take him if you can. This is a serious material that requires clear explanation on undergraduate level.  You will have to teach Econometrics yourself with him.

Really not great at lecturing and the material is tough. Need to spend a lot of time to learn the conceptstechnical stuff, BUT he's absolutely fantastic during office hours. Go there to review the tough homework and get more involved mini-lectures before exams.

Prof. Cosslett did his best, but Econometrics II is just tough. He could have delivered his lectures with more clarity but he was helpful in office hours. Pretty much every BS Econ major has to take him anyway so you'll have to suck it up!
He is too smart .  Mumbles himself. Doesn't care if we getting or understanding it not avoid and wait for any other prof

Horrible professor, all he does is just spew random equations on the board while mumbling to himself. The exams/homework follow the text pretty closely though so it is possible to do well if you are proficient at teaching yourself. There is also a substantial curve so it is pretty much impossible not to get at least a B-.
I got an A and it was totally self-taught. The man mumbles and cannot maintain eye contact. He is too smart to teach this material.

Clear, well-organized notes. It's not an easy subject, but between the notes and the book its not too hard to figure out. Exams are challenging but straightforward. If you know the material you should have no problem getting an A.

The material was not esplained clearly. only about half of the class attend, but if you make a little effort there is that huge curve to make up for the exams which have nothing to do with the homework.

This professor was horrible. Neither he nor the TA are able to communicate clearly. They do not make themselves very available either. The material is not that bad, but unless you plan to teach yourself, don't take his class. When Homework assignments are handed out, the class may not even be prepared to finish them and he offers little help.
This prof taught a difficult subject that was painful to learn.  You don't really understand what you're doing, but somehow the curve comes in and you do okay.
Exams are tough, but there is always a huge curve.  I felt like I understood the material a lot better with Cosslet than with McCulloch in 641.
Super hard.  He talks to the board a lot and rushes through most topics.  I did horribly and got a B though, so what can I say...
Difficult exams but they were always curved quite a bit. Does seem at times to really just be teaching and not caring about the students. Overall a decent teacher.

Mumbles, rarely looks at students so many questions go unanswered. Doesnt structure lectures, the information just sort of flows out of his mouth and it is up to you to orginize it. Many long tangents that he tells you afterward wont be on the exam. He is however a flexible grader, often a 70/100 is an A.

This prof was a very indiffernt professor. He mummbled occasionally, however, he was overall, a decent professor. I rarely attended/studied the course and got a B. I can't imagine anyone who would try that would not get a A in his class.

summary_comment: This professor offers a unique and engaging classroom experience, incorporating Seinfeld videos and mobile games to teach economic concepts, particularly in a calculus-based context. While some students find her explanations challenging due to her accent and the difficulty of the homework, others appreciate the interactive elements and find the tests easier than the assignments. Overall, the class requires significant effort, and results can vary widely depending on individual study habits.

Ratings.comment: I don't understand why people don't think she's good. I had a great time attending class. We watched Seinfeld videos, played online games (Game Theory), and even though her accent made you pay closer attention to what she was saying, she was pretty clear. The class is calc based, and it is challenging, but if you put the work in, you'll get an A.

I don't know what the other students are talking about. Saeedi is not always clear (accent) but her homework is much harder than her tests (which helps) and she lets us play econ based mobile games for points and we watched Seinfeld episodes based on economics in class. Obviously this is a calculus based version so you WILL be using calculus.

Doesnt explain well, if anything makes the class harder than it has to be. I would try to avoid it at all costs. She tries to explain and be helpful but it is just not worth your time. I ended up having to teach myself from the book, and got a C. (
Too tough

summary_comment: Kirby is highly regarded for her effective teaching style, which is characterized by clear, organized lectures and a casual, engaging atmosphere. Students appreciate her ability to simplify complex concepts and provide real-world examples, making the material accessible and interesting. Her availability and willingness to help during office hours further enhance the learning experience.

Ratings.comment: I really like Kirby's teaching style. Her lectures are organized and clear, and the general atmosphere is rather casual.

Hear me out. At first, I didn't think Kirby was very smart, since everything she said sounded so easy and she speaks very casually. But then I went to see her in office hours and realized she's brilliant. She's just able to break down complicated things and present them simply. That's the true test of a good prof, in my opinion.

She did a lot of experiments in class to introduce concepts, and that was really cool. She also gave lots of real-world examples (one day in class we just watched a bunch of movie clips that had game theory in them lol). The material wasn't easy but she broke it down and that helped. She was really nice in office hours too. Recommend taking

Great lecturer. I never understand Econ classes with those old boring professors but she's easy to understand and super helpful. Answered questions in class and was helpful in office hours outside class. Accommodating (I had to reschedule an exam) and just explains things i ways that normal people can understand. Highly recommend

Great professor. It wasn't a blow-off class, but she was reasonable and funny and personable. Gave a chance to make up points on exams. I liked the in-class experiments and the movie examples. She's just really normal and cool and good at communicating. I definitely recommend her classes.

I only go to her recitations and review sessions for this class. I'm not even assigned to her recitation but I go anyway because she's infinitely better than any other TA and better than the professor. Explains things really well, easy to understand, and really seems to want students to learn. Definitely take if she's TA or prof

She was the grader for this course. Prof was really tough to understand so I started to go to Kirby's office hours and she seriously saved me in this class. Really helpful, always answered emails, would stay late or make appointments to make sure she could help. 4 or 5 office hour visits taught me the entire  course. If she's ever a prof, SIGN UP!

summary_comment: The professor is divided among students, with some finding her class well-organized and helpful, particularly for those who follow her instructions closely. However, many others report that she often struggled to explain concepts clearly, got confused during lectures, and was not receptive to student feedback, leading to difficulties in understanding the material. Overall, her teaching style relies heavily on students' independent study and self-directed learning.

Ratings.comment: Do not take this course with her! There are many other Econ professors that will teach you the content much better. She often got confused herself while she lectured. Not very open to student feedback and will go out of her way to prove herself.
She seemed confused half the time and it made understanding the material difficult.. Three exams, not hard. If you do all the work, answer the top hats, and go to class, basically an A.

Rama's class is well organized and she clearly explains how to succeed. You will get an A if you follow her instructions. She teaches with flipped lectures so you must do your homework before class. This practice helped me comprehend topics extremely well. She is also incredibly understanding and worked with me when I was sick and missed class.

I went to all of her lectures, did all of the HW assignments, and kept up with course content. However, in her lectures, she mostly read off of slides & just walked through problems; not really explaining her steps or breaking it down deep for us. Expected us to rely heavily on the online textbook/homework.
Definitely wouldn't take a class with her again. Went to her for help and she was kind of rude about it, acted like I was an idiot because I didn't understand what we were doing in class.

summary_comment: Professor Rossetti is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality, offering no busy work and a clear grading structure with six 1000-word essays and seven quizzes. Students find his class rigorous but fair, with mean scores of 87% on essays and 80% on quizzes.

Ratings.comment: Professor Rossetti is one of the BEST professors I have ever had. No busy work. DO NOT take this class with Dr. Cooper, seriously. There will be a total of 6 essays (1000 words each/100 pts each) and 7 quizzes total (40 pts each), with an added TopHat participation grade worth 1 essay. Mean scores: 87% essays/80% quizzes.

summary_comment: Dr. Nesbit's teaching style is polarizing; while some students find his lectures engaging and valuable, others criticize his lack of lecture notes and reliance on in-class note-taking. His exams often consist of multiple-choice questions and essay prompts, and he encourages critical thinking and application of concepts. However, his unstructured approach and lack of clear communication regarding assignments and exams have led many to struggle and express dissatisfaction.

Ratings.comment: Nesbit is terrible. Doesn't provide notes, just talks during lecture with nothing on the board and expects you to write his concepts down. Too many papers, quizzes have answers with vague explanations. The worst part are the exams. Two exams with over half the questions, "Consider the following statements..." Basically true or false with 4 options.

Must attend the course.  No attendance check but when you miss the class you won't get any lecture notes.  No powerpoints. Professor does not give any lecture notes for those who missed the class no matter what the reason is. Do not take his course if you can
Dr. Nesbit is awesome if you truly want to learn then choose a class with him as the teacher

Mr. Nesbit was very knowledgeable about what he was teaching. His lectures were very engaging because he connected with us very well. I went to his office hours a few times and he helped out a lot. He grades homeworks for completion. The textbook wasn't required, but I used it as a supplement.

He is very passionate about his research and he's very helpful if you reach out for help. I actually learned a lot from this class. Exams are 3-4 essay questions, so attending lectures and taking good notes definitely helps. 3 exams, 1 essay, 4 homework, and some quizzes (lowest HWquiz grade will drop).

I know many of my fellow students don't agree but I truly enjoyed this course. Students are encouraged to think for themselves and apply concepts to current events. 3 exams, all MC. 4-5 HW assignments (given a week before due date), 3-4 in-class quizzes (lowest 1 dropped if you missed class). no extra credit and no curve. absolutely would recommend

He uses no power point in a class of 75+ and prefers to write on the board that can be very difficult to see. His syllabus offers no course schedule, and gives short, to zero notice on upcoming homework and exams that leaves you to scramble, despite repeated request to give proper notice. Pop-quizzes on days he "notices attendance is low." What??

Todd Is the worst college Teacher I have ever had.. He acts like he is God and he is always right... He is not a normal teacher that you think would be willing to work With you.. All he do is talk about Is himself and research he did that no one cares About... Just because your a tEacherDoesn't mean you know how to teach and he doesn't realize that

He relays info in a very clear and precise way and makes sure that all questions are answered before proceeding. One word of advice is make sure you attend all the lectures and write down everything he says in them.  These will come in handy big time test day because they are usually in essay format. Copy those answers verbatim and guaranteed A!

Wonderful professor! Lectures were clear and interesting. Exams were in essay format, and he gives the possible questions beforehand for you to prepare. He tells you his opinions and welcomes constructive discussions. Overall, great class!
Great professor. Lectures are interesting and easy to follow. Exams are in essay format. He is opinionated, but does not reflect this in grading.
Even though we had differing opinions, professor Nesbit was a really awesome econ professor. Extremely helpful and funny!
I love this professor.He is  a wonderful and helpful professor.He is an educated and I have never seen like this economic professor.
This is very a good professor. He is very helpful. he will teach you and make you pass this class.

Todd was by far the worst economics professor I have had at Ohio State. He has a mindset that he was "superior" and his was was right. He was impossible to follow in lectures, commonly mistaking terms and misdrawing diagrams. He offered no exam practice examples until the third and final exam because the class average on the first two was a F. .

summary_comment: The professor delivers clear PowerPoint lectures that are readily available online, reducing the need for in-person attendance. However, the exams are significantly more complex than the lectures, leading to a class average of C-. Despite this, the professor's grading curve helped raise some students' grades, such as lifting one student from a D- to a C+.

Ratings.comment: The class is based on powerpoint lectures which he posts online and you honestly don't need to show up (he doesn't take attendance anyways).  The lectures make sense, but when you get to the exams everything is much more complex.  Our class had a C- average on the 3 exams.  The curve pulled me from a D- to a C+.

summary_comment: Dr. Farivar is generally regarded as an effective instructor, known for offering clear lectures and extra credit opportunities, though her explanations can be dry and theoretical. Students appreciate her availability and willingness to help, but some find her lectures challenging and her exams difficult to prepare for without prior knowledge. Overall, while her teaching style may not suit everyone, many consider her a reliable and supportive professor.

Ratings.comment: Easy, fair teacher for Eco 211. She's at UMiami now although it says she's at Ohio State. She offers extra credit for answering basic questions in class and the tests are what's on the lectures, which are uploaded for every class. There is homework every night, but as long as you do it you have a huge grade boaster. Overall a good prof

Her Spanish accent is very thick and hard to understand - and I speak Spanish! I often felt it difficult to stay awake in class, and her power points are straight from the textbook.  If you participate in class she will give you extra credit. Personally I never spoke in class and I mainly read the book to understand the material.
Just your overall average teacher.. Isn't great at explaining things, isn't awful.. Isn't too difficult, but not exactly a hand-out either.. eh.
If you have Dr. Farivar and don't get an A it is a you problem. Not a given A, but give general effort that can be expected in a college course and you'll be fine.

Her lectures are pretty dry but i guess its econometrics. Spends 2 much time on the theory and not enough on applying the stuff learned in class. At times when you get the quizexam scores and see how bad you did you become worried but she is generous with the curve. attendance is mandatory if you want to do well, as is the book.
Always available to help and was willing to stay after her office hours to make sure her students understood the material

I took her class for econ 4400 and 5410. She explains the basic well and is very helpful. Test are hard but extra credit helps to regain those points and preparing for test helps learning very well. overall very good teacher would recomend her to anybody taking these classes

I came into this class having already taken AP microecon in HS and that is the only reason I did well. She is incredibly confusing in lectures and gets confused herself sometimes. Her short answer questions on tests are equally confusing and impossible to prepare for as they differ from textbook questions. Do not take this if you want to learn

Class started off easy but got more difficult especially due to lack of clarity. We had 5 quizzes and 2 midterms were multiple choice was easy but the extended response were difficult. You would think you knew what to do but would get it completely wrong and only understand after she went over it when she returns the tests. Study plans are useful.

The class was easy as long as you kept up with the work and had a basic grasp of statistics. Lecture slides were available ahead of class and printing them made things much easier. Allowed me to take the final with another class when something came up during our scheduled time. Greatly enjoyed her class and would take class with her again.
It wasn't that bad of a class.  The tests could be tough, but she gave out a lot of bonus opportunities.  Basically got free points for in-class worksheets and online homework.

I will admit that sometimes her lectures are not helpful. I will say that her class is passable. The book is the best friend to someone in the class. She is really willing to help students. She is passionate about teaching the class. I would advise students to watch Mark Thoma on youtube for more help is some things that are not clear.
She is not that bad but she's hard. Lectures can be confusing sometimes.

She is incredibly scatter-brained, and not fit as a lecturer. I read her reviews here from 2012 and was deceived. Avoid her if possible, she overly complicates the class between sheer incompetence and bad instructional methodology. She will ramble and write all over the place, contradict herself (admittedly) and then issue a graded quiz.
She gives homeworks and quizzes which are a little bit time consuming but very helpful.
She is a good teacher, and she gives homeworks and quizzes to make us be familiar with materials. She is also very helpful both in and out lass. Take her if you can : )
Nice lady, stupid class. Loved to draw these oh so amazing graphs. Went strictly of this program online, made tests confusing, ultimately made my grade suffer. Shame.
If you can teach yourself you'll be fine. only went to class because of daily pop quizzes. generous grading scale, still do not recommend unless you already know econ well

Incredibly difficult tests for no seemingly no reason. She is also not organized at all and often has to backtrack on what she says in class making things more confusing than necessary. If you already know the material and don't need a teacher then she's not bad but if you don't avoid her class!

She is all over the place and changes what she says every class. She is confusing and confuses herself. You never know what will be on the test, it is always a surprise. Avoid taking her at all costs. Tests are not easy and you will never know what to study. She pulls questions from anywhere and everywhere.

Her assignments are hard and time consuming. She teaches too fast. I had to teach myself from scratch to be able to start doing her homework. Most of the people i know who have dropped her class said that the other professor is a lot more chill and easier.(take-home midterms and group project)

Awesome instructor. She did a great job in explaining materials and even gave chances to the students to challenge the grades. A lot of quizzes and you need to attend classes like mandatory but overall it is not that bad. However, she was quite boring but I assure you Econ 444 is an easy class if you take hers.
great professor

Econ 501.02 wasn't bad. Classes are pretty boring because she teaches straight from the book. Class is only "mandatory" because she gives short in-class assignments most days. Grade consisted of short daily hw, in-class short and long quizzes, one midterm and a final. Overall, you will learn what you need and not too difficult to get an A
Very helpful teacher. She took a subject I was very confused with and helped me to understand it fairly well. Her tests aren't easy but the curve is generous and if you study you should do just fine.

Hard Class, and hard professor, if you can avoid her I highly recommend it. Her tests are very difficult and even with a large curve it's hard to do well unless your an actuary major, then you'll probably do fine, they all seem do well in these econometrics courses.

summary_comment: Xin is an effective professor who heavily curves grades, making it easier for students to achieve satisfactory marks. Despite a thick accent, he compensates with detailed notes on slides and the board, encouraging students to copy everything. His courses, while challenging, are manageable with consistent effort and preparation.

Ratings.comment: I took Xin's course during the summer so it was 2 days a week but about a 4 hour long class. Don't worry - we took a 5 - 10 minute break as he got through material. His accent is really thick but he uses slides and writes a lot (COPY EVERY SINGLE THING HE WRITES). He grades on a heavy curve so if you don't get at least a C+, it's your own fault.

I HATE ECONOMETRICS! But Xin knew he was teaching a hard course. He greatly curves this class and lets you use cheat sheets on exams. His Chinese so his accent is a little thick but he writes a lot on the board and there a slides. Read the book and try problems on your own. If you can make it through Econometrics, you deserve to be an economist.

summary_comment: The professor is known for making it relatively easy to achieve high grades, though her lectures are often perceived as dull. She is supportive during office hours. However, some students note that she struggles with English.

Ratings.comment: Her lecture is kinda boring, but it's easy to get high grades. She's helpful in her office hour.
She can't speak english

summary_comment: Professor Peck is known for his challenging yet curve-friendly approach to teaching Game Theory. While some students find his exams tricky and unfair, others appreciate his willingness to help and his clear explanations during lectures and office hours. His grading system, with significant weight on the final exam, is generally curved to ensure fair grades.

Ratings.comment: Class was one of the hardest I've taken at OSU, but it had a curve at the end so my 88 ended up being an A. He has previous midterms with answers available on the course website, which are by far the best way to study. He does not post answers for the old finals though, and I highly recommend seeing him in office hours to learn how to do them.

Peck is a good professor, but the class (Game Theory) just wasn't for me.  I am a strictly A-B student and I REALLY struggled in the class.  Peck tries to be helpful in office hours, but he's just not very good at explaining things.  Good news is that there's a gigantic curve at the end.

This is an elective, so do not take this class. I don't like his exams. Basically, it seems like he tried to make them very easy for you to make a calculation error so that he can give you no credit. So his exams are not a reflection on what you know. There is a curve, but I haven't received my grade yet, but I expect that the curve is very good.
This course is really tricky and weird. It is really easy but he just want to make the exams very tricky to show his class is a higher level class
Gave a easy exam as a curve which is not fair at all, because people who actually know the material can't get a 20 out of 10.

Jim is really intelligent and cares  about students.  Go to the lecture, read the notes, go to his office hour to ask HW problems and old exam problems then you will be fine. What you need to learn is thinking ability, so keep asking questions why the hw problems come this way and compare different problems to get the deep insight!

He is friendly and willing to help students. I like him in personal but hate at the same time. Tests are way harder and he really does not provide much information in terms of preparing for tests with problems that are actually similar in real exams. Even if you can solve posted past exams, he won't give similar one. He changes the formats alot.

Prof. Peck is very nice and smart. He explains the concepts very well and he's always willing to help students. 15% homework, 35% midterm, and 50% final.  Final is harder than midterm but he curves the grade.

His game theory class, was mundane, but many classes econ classes are. However, he is very passionate about game theory because that is what he studies. Because he is passionate about teaching game theory as well being able to teach it so people understand it,I recommend taking his class.

Very nice and helpful; he definitely wants his students to succeed. The notes and old tests on his website are so clear that I tell other students taking the same class (but not from him) about them and they use them.

Lecture notes were very well organized.  He did a good job of explaining the more difficult concepts in class.  The tests were difficult, but if you put in some effort, they are manageable. The homework and practice midterms online gave you a good idea of what to expect on the tests.  Overall, very good professor.
Very helpful.  His notes and class lectures are well organized.  The midterm and final are quite difficult though!
No Comments
No Comments

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his dedication to student success, offering numerous opportunities for extra credit and flexible testing options. He creates a supportive learning environment where students can excel, with a significant percentage receiving top grades. While the course material is challenging, his approachable teaching style and willingness to provide multiple chances for improvement make the class manageable.

Ratings.comment: A great professor! The class can choose test online or in-classroom! Two times check attendance as for an extra credit, and he ALWAYS sent us an email let us know he would check attendance tomorrow. A lot of extra credit like answering question, designing a T-shirt. Besides, he give us 3% CURVE, and 36% of us got A!!
Really good lecturer. The econ4001 class itself was boring but he REALLY cares about his students' success in this class.
Sooooo lucky to take his class in this semester. Eric really cares about students and love to teach. He gives lots of extra credits and the exam is fair. Highly recommend to take his class!!

He seems to want everyone gets an A for this class. Exams and quizzes are online, no time limit. Theres a lot of extra credits. Each one counts towards 1%!!!!!of over all grade! Not 1 point it is 1%!!!! But the problems are hard, but you can always google since it is online.

Professor Chen is awesome! Be prepared for class prior to going! This is a very hard class and he tries so hard to get people to participate (they usually do not). He wants everyone to do well in the class; three tries to get the correct answer to the HW and plenty of extra credit. The exams are very hard but you have so much time and open book.

he is really knowledgable of the material and understands how dry it is. it is easy to get a good grade as he gives multiple chances on homework questions and he offers many opportunities for extra credit

Don't believe the other things you read on here. This guy's awesome. He's super nice and gives a ton of EC, online exams, and a curve. The material is hard but that's just the class. If you do the HW and Quizzes and know how to do those problems, you'll be fine for the exams.

The lecture is quite heavy. Each week covers one chapter about 60-70 Powerpoint slides. The homework and the quiz are difficult as well. Midterm and final are difficult though they are online exams. But he will give you 5-6 total extra credits.

He's a very reasonable professor who wants to give you a good grade (will offer possible curve). His weekly, online homework can take a long time, but you can retake them up to 2 times. Attendance only necessary twice for bonus points. Two online exams which take a long time. There is a small amount of calculus, but don't be worried about that.
Funny and truly cares about his students. Tough class, the content isn't the easiest but Eric is a really nice professor and very helpful if you ask for it.
He's awesome! Takes care of his students.
Nice professor! Anyone who took the class can learned a lot and he's taking good care of students!

Class was supposed to be algebra-based, but he often talked about calculus concepts. VERY math heavy on teaching. Online homework was difficult, more difficult than the midterm and final. He changed criteria for the number of homeworks and quizzes he dropped several times. Overall, save yourself the headache.

Hongyu only reads powerpoint slides during class so attendance is not necessary. Exams are pretty difficult and so are quizzes. Read the book and study the slides. Also, 4001.01 is the non calculus version, BUT HE USES CALCULUS. If you're not strong in math/calc, I definitely would recommend taking it with another teacher.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his exceptional clarity in explaining complex economic concepts and his willingness to answer questions. Students appreciate his accessibility and accommodation, especially during challenging personal times. His exams are fair, and he ensures students feel supported throughout the course.

Ratings.comment: Best econ teacher I could've asked for. He explains concepts very clearly and is always willing to answer questions. How he set up the class was very helpful. Took 3 exams, all of which were very fair. Bought a textbook for the class but have not used it at all. Slides are online, attendance not taken. One of the best professors I have ever had!!

Michael is so accessible and accommodating. I was going through some personal issues that was hindering my education and he was very understanding. He allowed me to take a midterm a day later because he wanted to make sure that I had a fair chance. After I took it, he made it a point to let me know that he is always there for me. Overall great guy

summary_comment: The professor is known for her straightforward and approachable teaching style, with light and simple assignments that offer multiple opportunities for improvement. While her exams are easier and she provides extra credit, her lectures can be dry and unengaging, and some students find her class rank grading system unappreciated.

Ratings.comment: Her lectures won't keep you at the edge of your seat. However, she's a sweet lady who wants to know her students. Her assignments are light and simple. You'll have multiple chances on questions, then multiple chances on the assignment. Exams are easier than most courses and you know what to study. Extra credit is given. Sweet & simple, just lil dry
Very boring class. Did not appreciate her class rank grading system.

summary_comment: Andre is a highly passionate and enthusiastic professor who dedicates significant effort to ensure students understand the material, often reiterating concepts and offering extensive help during office hours. His classes are challenging, with a focus on active learning and minimal reliance on textbooks, which requires students to be well-prepared and engaged. While some find his teaching style and exams demanding, many appreciate his dedication and supportive approach.

Ratings.comment: Andre is just very passionate about teaching. Some of my classmates complained because the exams were hard or not "multiple choice". He is funny and really likes to help those who struggle. The course is not an easy A, you gotta work for it. And he is very good looking (and I am a straight guy lol), at least that's why the front row was only girls.

Great professor. Hard class. He does a great job explaining the material and works very hard to ensure that all of the class is actively learning and understanding as he goes.  He has no problem reiterating material and is extremely helpful in office hours.  Be ready for pop quizzes, and ATTEND CLASS!

I love this class except he was a tough grader. Yes, he was unclear in certain things especially when it came to grading curve. You need to attend the class as no textbook is assigned but believe me the class is awesome! Read your notes before you come to class. Be prepared because there will be a mandatory "pop" quizzes every class.
Good prof. He is somewhat unclear in class, but he makes an effort to go over concepts multiple times if he senses confusion. Be sure to read the book and review your notes before each class.

I had him as my recitation TA and I can honestly say that without him, I would not have passed Econ. My lecturer was very boring and confusing and Andrezj was very helpful and nice. He didn't even grade our last homework, just gave us max credit if we turned it in. And on top of that, he's soooooooooo sexy. Take a class with him!

Really hard class, and I had a really hard time with his teaching. He thinks everything he teaches is easy and its really frustrating. No textbook so its hard to learn another way. You cant read his handwriting. Dont take this class.

Prints slides for you to write notes on, doesn't do a lot of practice problems, very enthusiastic and makes it easier to pay attention to then most econ teachers. Very important you read because it was 25% of the grade basically, otherwise class isn't that hard, not an easy A though

Difficult material and not a lot of practice opportunities. No book so if in-class examples aren't enough you have to go to office hours. Nice guy but not always clear and has high expectations. Tough grader.

He is very nice, but he is not meant to be a teacher. He cannot teach! He only gives us ONE example for materials and you have to figure it out on your own. No textbook to help you. He's far from being professional. Avoid him if you can. However, he's very cute, but it is not worth it.
BEST TA EVER!!!!!!

summary_comment: Justin is widely regarded as an engaging and passionate instructor who makes complex economic concepts accessible and interesting. His classes are known for being challenging yet rewarding, with a strong emphasis on understanding the material deeply rather than memorizing facts. While some students find his lectures and tests demanding, they consistently praise his enthusiasm and willingness to help during office hours.

Ratings.comment: Justin is a great teacher. Lectures are always interesting. There is no mandatory homework but there is extra credit homework. The tests are essay based and attendance is partially mandatory.

One of the best teachers I ever had.You know you've lucked out when you find a professor that loves what he teaches so much.  He was easy going,but his classes weren't easy.Some of the material was dry, but he made you excited about it anyway.There was a lot of material, but stuff that really made you appreciate the subject more. I highly recommend

Great Econ prof!  He has a passion for economics that he expresses.  The class is fun and interesting, but the notes are a little bit scattered.  You could get a B/B+ on test by just reading the book but in order to get an A, you have to go to class and pay attention.  He doesn't curve the class but has a benificial weighting scheme.

purposefully makes it very difficult to get an A, no matter how well you know your stuff. gets a thrill out of using mysterious wording just so you will get a question wrong. funny guy, but disorganized, read the text. i learned about macroecon, but the class was frustrating

Funny guy, if you go to his office hours he is more than willing to help. Re-write your notes because most of the essay part of the tests are based off of it. Only gripe is that some people have previous versions of his tests and make it incredibly unfair for those who don't. Avoid if you want an easy A, but take him if you want to earn macroecon.

He's a cool guy, not the most organized class in the world but you learn macro econ. If you have to have organization i wouldn't recommend coming to this section, but to each their own... pros: funny, smart, will weigh tests differently to benefit you; cons: unorganized, many tangents, rushes towards the end of the quarter, and doesn't like A's

Learned nothing from this class. Spent 1st 4 weeks going over aggregate demand over and over again. Always get out of class a minute after the bell. Notes in class are pretty useless. Bring a book or something to class because it will seem very long and boring. Tests fairly easy, though essays usually require graphs. Avoid this man.

really cool guy, funny, entertaining, genuinely cares. the class is hard though, and he doesnt like giving a's (this he tells you right away). you have to read a lot, and he gets really off topic and confusing sometimes, so reading is a priority. but the class itself is great to attend, and he really knows his stuff.
My only complaint is that I cant give him 10 million chili peppers.  Millions and millions of chili peppers for Justin, WOOOOOOOOOOOOO.  CHI-CHI-CHI-CHILIIIII PEPPERS!

Extremely unorganized & tends to go off on ridiculous tangents - then forgets what he was talking about in the 1st place.  Although he is very energetic in his teaching, & adds in a few jokes (which are only occasionally funny), I don't recommend taking his class.  He mentions he doesn't like giving out A's, (why?) and rushes till the end of class.
Fun, interesting class, but he doesn't really teach. he rambles, rushes, and then everything on the test is just from the text. basically to get a good grade, read.
fun class, though it's challenging. won't curve, but says he'll re-weight tests to help you out.

Justin was a very engaging and helpful teacher. However, if you are into a class with structure, not it. His notes follow no logical sequence,he is late to class,you leave late to class so he can make up for lost ground. His tests were pretty tough, but read the book for them. Get used to listening to the know-it-alls answering, he LOVES them!

Justin is cool but the way he runs his class isn't. He's always late to class, and holds you over rushing through at the end so you can't even understand it. He's very unorganized and it shows in the way he runs his class and lectures. He also doesn't grade his own tests. If you want a good grade, don't take this class. He doesn't like A's

Horrible. I've never been more turned off by anyone. He considers himself to be the funniest person in the world, and has to run his mouth incessantly. No real economics going on, and it's my major. Ironically enough, one of his favorite words seems to be "narcissistic". The very impressionable will consider him to be "dynamic" and "cool".
Dr. Elardo had very little focus in the class.  The course didn't really fit together.
class is very interesting. allows all different points of view.  he does sidetrack alot, but mostly for a reason. never will get out early. exams are very hard with reading the book.
Awesome teacher.  He makes his classes super interesting.  You will do well if you attend classes.

He's extremely intelligent and definitely respects your point of view even if it differs from his. he sidetracks for a reason, unless you want to close yourself to just the textbook and couldn't care less about relating the material to the real world, don't bother taking the class.
Elardo is a great guy who wants people to do well and is really interested in what he does.  Definitely take all the courses you can with him.
Hes a great teacher. Even though some of the material isnt that exciting, he tries his best to make it more interesting.  He talks alot so going to class is important.

Great professor/lecturer.  I wasn't particularly excited about econ before taking this class, but Justin really made it interesting.  His lectures are great and format of the class worked pretty well - 40% mid/60% final. If you go to every lecture and really learn the material he's teaching you'll be alright  - shouldn't need a ton of reading.

This class was taught as a critical reading class.  Expected much more theory.  A real textbook was needed.  Too much focus on history for a class that should focus on current events.  Not what the class description would have you think. But Elardo is a good guy.
Great Teacher, Full of Life, Makes class enjoyable, however there is tons of reading, Easy A if you keep up with the reading!
hes an okay guy. i didnt enjoy having him as a teacher tho. he thinks everyone should be as interested in the history of economics as he is. sorry dude, its just never gunna happen.

Justin, though assigns a lot of reading, is truly interested in economics and making sure his pupils learn.  He leans heavly towards socialism, so if you want to be on his good side pretend you are too.  Very knowledgable and helpful. Encourage you to take all his classes.

horrible. wasn't funny at all although he'd probably beg to differ. grad school class structure-- a ton of reading (5 books) a 12 page paper, and 2 essay exams. his grading style is very picky. i felt like I knew the material well and still got a poor grade. not cool. take someone else if you can!! good luck if you do take him!

Nice guy.  Has a  generous grading scale.  I probably got the lowest score in the class on the first midterm then did well on the paper (A) and final to get a B+.  Lectures can get a little boring though, especially when he tries to make jokes.

Alright, but not as awesome as I expected after reading comments here. Didn't find him funny at all, and he tries to be ALL THE TIME. Annoying.  Will encourage annoying buggers who raise their hands in class all the time and never shut up, so expect to lose some of your life listening to know-it-alls.
his classes were interesting and pretty entertaining but his exams were terrible. the multiple choice have about 3 possible answers so it was pretty much a guessing game. take someone else
Great professor. He knows his stuff inside and out.  Class was very interesting and while he is easy going and funny you will also learn a ton from taking this class.
A great teacher.  He knows what he is talking about, and keeps lectures entertaining.  Go to class, pay attention, and then you should be fine for exams.

Not worth it to take his class as honors. there are two tests (the final 60% of grade) and they are all essay and they are challenging. He grades really hard...the class would average a low B. We're supposed to maintain a 3.5 for honors? Justin's a cool guy but he'll talk up or past the bell every single class.
I think that he is a great professor. Makes class interesting where it might not otherwise be.
No Comments

Nice guy, can't stay on topic to save his life, though.  The class didn't require anything other than the three exams, so it wasn't that bad.  There was nothing that I found that made it an honors class.  It seemed like your basic intro to economics class.  Nothing special.
fun to listen to go on rants, but once it comes to grading and organizing ideas in your head, I had a tough time
Over all a good professor but when it comes to the essay questions on his exams he is not an easy grader.  Aside from that if you go to class exams should be a breze.

Recycles questions for quizzes and exams.  Gives really easy multiple choice questions, if you've been to class for the lectures.  Nice guy, but not a very good instructor, since he gets sidetracked quite often and doesn't make efficient use of class time.  Our class ended up covering about 2/5 of the material we should have.
This guy has such a passion for economics and makes you want to love it, too.  The class is not too hard, just show up and take notes.  But he made the subject fun and interesting for everyone.
Best econ teacher i've ever had, and i've had 3 other professors.  Go to class, take notes, and the exams will be easy.  I never got the book...

So enthusiastic about econ! He's a really cool, funny guy who's passion for the subject makes it far more interesting than it would otherwise be. The finals a killer so just make sure you do well on the first two exams.

Justin is fabulous!  I learned so much from him, and going into his class I really hated econ.  I am amazed with how much knowledge I am walking away from his class with.  Do the reading, go to class, and you will do fine.

he is having troubles balancing econ and inter'l studies in this class. wants to do a lot, but so little time. he is great to listen to. great professor, loves to teach, tells great jokes, and class is a blast. show up when no one else does and get "bonus" participaitin points. i hope he focuses more on econ in the future tho. assigns good reading
took this class last quarter....highly recommend

I believe this man was born to be a professor. He seems to love teaching and he makes the material interesting. He makes teaching ECON hilarious. Keep up with readings if you want to perform well on tests. Fair grader, is eager to help his students. Certain desis detracted from the class experience.
Funniest and most interesting class I have taken at OSU, yet.  Rants about random stuff sometimes and tells really funny stories.  Show up to class and pay attention and you will be fine.
He's freaking hillarious.
No Comments

Great guy.listens to Pearl Jam so how could he not be. He fell behind and then rushed through the end of the class, but only because hes so passionate about the topic. It helped me understand and also get excited about ECON. Justin kicks butt..nuff said
No Comments
No Comments

Hands down the most entertaining professor I have ever had. A very knowledgable and quirky guy. He is very passionate about economics and as a result tends to rant about various topics. If you get the chance take this class, it's such a good time. Read the book, pay attention and you will do fine.

summary_comment: The professor is generally seen as not friendly and quite prescriptive, with a strict grading policy that leaves little room for leniency. Students find his lectures hard to follow and often feel unsupported when seeking help, leading to a generally negative classroom experience. However, some praise his clarity and extensive examples, noting that attending class and practicing exams can lead to good grades.

Ratings.comment: not friendly and quite prescriptive
if passing limit is 60 and you got 59, you failed. No chance to pass, since he is really heartless. Maybe something happened in his past and he acts very rude about grades
Took around 2-3 Econ courses from him. Awesome lecturer and great person.   His squash skills need to be improved though ;)

This class was ridicilous. It was supposed to be an hour and 48 min. never longer than 45 min b/c he didnt teach. He gave us the definition and one example and expected us to know it. And basically everything else said by the previous person. But hes leaving for Botswana or some other country b/c he hates America.

Did not like this professor.  Lecture was hard to understand and when you need help he acts like you are stupid just for wanting to try and pass the class.  Not a fun class at all! He just makes it worse!!!!

This guy gives a bizzilion examples, but his exams are NOTHING like them. Do the practice exams; youll benefit GREATLY. He wont just do an example when you review, he requires a specific question to give an you an answer and wont finish ANY part of the rest of the problem: unhelpful! HE SUCKS.
Great teacher and great guy. Lectures clearly, does lots of helpful examples which help out alot on midterms. As long as you go to class and pay attention, you're guaranteed a good grade

summary_comment: The professor is generally considered engaging and knowledgeable, often praised for his ability to make complex material accessible through humor and various media. However, students note that the course is challenging, particularly the exams, and success heavily depends on the quality of the Teaching Assistant. The class is curved towards lower grades, making it difficult to achieve an A, but easier to get a B. Students also mention that attending office hours and utilizing resources like the tutor room can greatly enhance understanding and performance.

Ratings.comment: The professor is nice and funny, but if you want to get a high score, it depends on your TA. It is wise to choose a recitation with a good TA.
