Before every exam, professor will provide practice exam which is quiet similar to the exam. And there will be 10 pop quiz in the lecture, but you do not need to worry about it, it is simple.

Very hard to get an A. Easy to get a B. Class is curved to B's and C's. Study guide is not like exam. Midterms are very hard. Final was nearly impossible. Class average was a 65%. I snuck by with an 85 on the final. Hopefully class will get curved. He definitely makes the class interesting. Many types of media:video,audio,text.

An underrated professor for sure, tho certainly with his flaws. An obvious conservative bias, although he presented most material impartially. The homework was somewhat difficult, and even this econ major found it trying at times. But it got easier as the semester progressed, and I really feel I learned a lot.

This guy is HORRIBLE! He's always off topic. The material really isn't that hard, but it's annoying because he's teaching method makes it harder than it should be. I highly recommend going to the tutor room prior to homework deadline. If you can avoid taking this guy do it!

Go to his office hours, pick his brain. This man is tremendously smart and if you're trying to learn, he has absolutely no problem letting you ask question after question after question. If you pay attention in his class, you will learn a great deal. Listen, take notes sometimes, pretty easy class. Best prof I've had at Ohio State.
Decent professor. Dreadfully boring and I actually like the class. It's graded on a curve though, pretty hard to fail.
Good guy. Tells lots of jokes that are so stupid they are funny. He tells jokes because even he knows his class is kind of boring.

It is funny that the whole class was sitting for the same final exam but the ones who got the answer key sheet got a little higher than the ones who didn't. I wish he would have done a little something in favor of the ones who didn't get the answer key sheet. Very boring class.
He handed out a final exam with the answer key attached to half of the exams...
Very unclear. nice curve on midterms. difficult to see how youre doing in the class at any point in time however. lecture confused me more.

Dupor is the man! Very nice guy who makes lots of jokes. His videos making fun of himself are pretty funny, as well. I really enjoyed this class. He works hard to help students out. I highly recommend that anyone taking 201 takes him. All of his tests are all multiple choice. Homework is hard but helpful.

For an honors econ cass it was fairly easy, three midterms, a final and a group project. He has to curve a ton because my midterm grades were 66, 78, and 84, and got an A in the course. Jokes are so lame that they are funny. Good Guy

Not sure why he has so many negative reviews.  Although he may occasionally stumble with his words, he explains things fairly well. Has a very generous grading policy (graded on curve, top 15% get A's etc).  Has fun, tells jokes that are so bad they're funny (on purpose). Tries to spice the material up whenever possible

Dupour seems like a nice guy, but he really doesn't know how to teach.  Maybe on a personal level he would be better, but in a lecture setting he is god awful.  He has a knack for making the most simple explanation confusing.  The lectures I attended I just sat on my computer and messed around.  Study the night before the test and you'll get an A.

Dupor is a real nice guy, he's just boring when it comes to teaching.tries making funny jokes but fails. he isnt clear about what is on the exams, and he covers material that is irrelevant and unnecessary. BORING
A nice guy. Materials are a little deep. You need to pay attention to what he says in lecture.Sometimes he may not explain things clearly, but you can still learn stuff from him.

Awful teacher. I have interest in econ and would find myself constantly lost and bored in lectures. He stutters a lot and goes back and reteaches concepts a different way after he originally teaches them as to get students to understand them better, and you just end up more confused than you were in the first place. Find another teacher!

he is the worst teacher i have ever had. he stutters, is easily distracted, and tells horrible jokes. if you want an A that you are willing to work for need not apply bc there is no rhyme or reason to his curriculum. FIND ANOTHER TEACHER!!!!!
Quite possibly one of the most boring professors of all time, tendency to stutter, easily distracted by students leaving and entering.  My TA was amazing though.
I don't think he's THAT bad. He's not a very good lecturer but definitely not so bad that I was unable to do well in the course. Also, he's encouraging + responsive via email.

Dupor was a very fair teacher and i really enjoyed going to his class.  He always played really loud music before class (hey ya, welcome to the jungle), and was very down to earth and a good guy, even though he was a wisconsin fan.  I didnt work very hard at all in this class and got a B+, homework was very easy as were exams.

Was prepared to really dislike 201, but I found it meaningful & deep. Attendance not mandatory, but highly recommended.He gets distracted by students leaving lecture early, but is a good guy.  He cares about this course, you can tell.It all hinges on your TA, I had a great one. Highly recommend this Prof! You will learn very useful things.
His lecture has little help with the homework and exams. Slides make no sense. Try to find another professor really.
God awful. His lectures and homework are useless. He stutters, doesn't make sense, and is possibly the most boring guy on the face of this planet. Get another teacher.

Couldn't stay awake through the class at 2:30 in the afternoon. Boring. Hard to understand. Not interesting in the least. Couldn't manage to stay through more than 1 entire class. Found that reading the material and trying to understand it alone was more helpful.
Absolutely terrible! Words can hardly describe how much he sucks at teaching anything.
So bad I actually enjoyed economics before this class
he tried to make the material relevant and interesting

You are amazing if you manage to stay awake through his entire rambling he calls a lecture. He posts his powerpoint slides online but the only problem is that the slides have nothing to do with the homework or exams. This class is a waste of time, try to get another professor.
Please do not take this guy... maybe if no one signs up for his class they will fire him.
useless. waste of my time,

Not only are the lectures useless, everytime someone leaves the class he stops and watches them leave, which is even more distracting then the person leaving. Dupor needs to realize that he is the one that is distracting, not the person leaving. Grading scale is easy though. 25-75% is the B range.
Lectures are useless. He rambles and acts like it helps on homework or tests. Just read the book and forgot this class.
most boring, pointless 4 hours of my week
one of the worst teachers ive ever had here.  he has no idea how to teach at all.
No Comments

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as ineffective and unengaging, with many students finding the class boring and difficult to follow without attending lectures. Grading scales are perceived as unfair, and the teaching style is often described as disjointed and irrelevant to the textbook material. Students strongly advise against taking this course and suggest dropping it if possible.

Ratings.comment: This class is soo boring! This guy is awful and even if you go to class, you won't understand anything. I LOVED econ before I took a class with this guy.
exam is very difficult if you do not go to his class. Many conceptions never appear on textbook.
extremely difficult.not related to textbook.his ppt and former exam is helpful.

This class was not just boring but the grading scale is screwed up.  Ohio state sucks at screening scenile old men.  I attended 2 lectures due to lack of stimulation and never went to a recitation because of TA language barrier. Still got a B

Wasn't a big fan of this class.  While we watch movies (which we are doing 60% of the time) he sits at the front of the room, flips through papers, and just stairs at people with his crazy hair... he has tenure and doesn't care to teach apparently.  TA was much more helpful.  Be prepared to read 60-70 pages for each class w/ homework due each day.

This class was insane. You have to read the material before class to the homework then you go to class and he tells you what you already know, point less.  You have to go to both lecture and recitation because you need the bonus points to get a C.  The material was not difficult it was the way it was presented on the test. avoid!

Professor Fleisher is possibly one of the most worthless teachers I have ever had. The class was out of 112 total points. His grading scale was so screwed up that you could miss no more than 8 points to get an A- and if you missed 20 you were suddenly looking at a c- in the class. The guy is certifiably crazy and if you get his class try to drop it

Not only is Belton absolutely worthless as an instructor, he has an obsession with china and cats which borders on creepy. Worst professor I have ever had hands down. If you get him please please please please drop the class. DONT BOTHER STUDYING.grading system is completely messed up...I still don't know what I got and I took the class last year
this guy is pretty nuts. few screws a little loose i think, but oh well i suppose. he does give a good curve though...which is good since his exam questions come out of nowhere.

Very boring lectures, got an A only by doing homework. TA's will make or break grade, I learned a lot from the TA because professor had the most monotone voice ever. Exams were tough but you need to read the book and stay caught up!

The TA was doing all the work, and we watched movies 70% all the lecture time. You have to read (skim) the books, since HW is 30% of the grade. 20% for 8 page paper and another 20 for 10 min presentation. The final was take home. Overall is pretty easy class if you put minimum effort in keeping up with the material and staying up during the movies.
taught us at the regular level and then expected us to be able to test at the honors level. the exams had very little to do with the things we knew how to do.

Adds an occasional joke to keep students awake during lectures. Does attendance checks often. The review he provided for the final was misleading but he ended up giving a generous curve to make up for it.
The exams were fair, except for the final that had nothing to do with anything out of the text and was based mostly on a movie and some experiments which were optional...

His odd sense of humour and random powerpoint slides kept me awake in lecture. I can't remember how many times those woke me up from my slumber. The lectures were based off the book, but he communicated it well. His midterms are somewhat coherent with the book. The final is a different story however. He focused a lot on the experiments.

questions on test only very vaguely resemble anything you've ever seen. if you don't get the exact answer he's looking for on short answer questions he doesnt get you credit. the material in the book is easy and common sense, but he doesn't even use what the book says on his tests. dont even bother studying, it wont help
Very clear and coherent speaking, and is concise.  However, rather boring, repetitive, and odd.  Plays random music and talks of his vacations to Asia incessantly.  Not the greatest teacher.
Horrible teacher. Uses slides from the book and can not explain anything clearly. Has a horrible grading system.
explains things well

very unclear class, lectures were based on practice homeworks and thats it.  The online homeworks do not relate to the exams at all. Grading is impossible to figure out, worked very hard and still got bad grade. He also does not know how to used computers and is not helpful at all in office hours
he is a really good professor, and his issues are really interesting. Furthermore he is really a high potential, I can surely recommend him to everyone!

A boring teacher who goes off on tagents that do not relate to the material or class whatsoever.  Dont bother studying either, the test won't reflect anything in the book or online, or possibly anything thats been discussed.
He tried to make everyone do poorly on his tests, then his grading scale makes your grade lower then you would orginally have had
Very boring class, but econ is a boring subject. I do not like his grading scale. I got an 88% in the class, and only got a B.
No Comments
Boring guy for the most part.  However, he tries to make class fun and he is always willing to help.
Talks about nothing,boring

Eccentric, with fruity jokes, pictures, and sounds during lectures.  Grading is wierd but you'll get a good grade if you show up to the lectures.  He makes economics very easy to understand if you don't have any prior knowledge of the subject.
Class was a good time, the random pictures and sounds keep it fun. Going to lecture helps out a lot on your overall grade.

found the class to be pretty funny. 201 was a breeze for me. best part was when he yelled at some people in the hallway and left his mic on. funny stuff. then there was the frat prank with golfers "playing through" the lecture hall. comic relief!

had to go to lecture for the attendence points, but fell asleep almost every time. if i wasn't asleep i was playing games on my cell phone because the man talked about his wife and their vacations more than economics
This guy's brain must be rotting in his old age.  He has very poor examples and i'm not really sure he knows much about economics.

OK class but like the others had trouble with the TA, could barely speak any English. Grading scale is very different. Either get an A or dont even try because it really seems like you either get the A or you get some sort of C.

Confusing class, horrible teacher. I asked him a question about a midterm prob and it took him a long time to come up with what turned out to be a wrong answer. He later announced to the whole class that he didn't have to know the answers he just had to teach it - explain to me how that works??

I think Fleisher is a very smart guy and he really loves the topic...but you can only see it on certain days.  In this class, we spent 4 weeks doing Powerpoint presentations and probably 2-3 weeks watching movies.  There was very little instructional time...most of the learning was from the text.
I hate this man!!!!

This guy was pretty easy, but if you pissed him off...you'll wish you stayed home instead of going to Hitchcock 131 that day.  His grading system is really complex, but as long as you do the extra credit and the exams, it's an easy A.
pretty easy...not too bad of a lecturer...make sure you go to class to get the extra credit

A nice guy, but definitely getting close to retirement.  His sound effects on his presentations are hilarious.  Every other lecture something would go wrong with his computer or he would just let out early on a whim.  As far as class difficulty, this is about as easy as it gets.

nice guy, is very helpful for when you don't understand, extensive notes.  Some of the people in my class were complaining about the test being hard but they are morons... it's econ 200 if you can't get an A something is wrong with you.
the man is insane.  thats given.  the class was fair, took me about 15 hours to understand his grading system. easy b+

don't stay at lectures except to get extra credit then leave to go read the book.  lectures are confusing with annoying sound effects but midterms are very easy.  don't underestimate the final because of this though.  it's a little tougher than midterms.

This man is absolutley horrendous, his curve sucks and so does he. But overall the material is not that hard to understand. In his mind a 55/110 is a c-, but a 86/110 is a c+, so either try hard to get an A or do absolutley nothing.

First off he teaches econ 200, if you do bad DROP OUT OF COLLEGE. that being said fleisher is NOT a good teacher, but luckily you don't need a teacher for this class. read the book and do the practice exams, then get an A.
No Comments

This man is the mental equivelant of a teletubby. The tests aren't hard except from the standpoint that you're trying to decipher random bouts of what can only be undiagnosed ADD. Fleisher sucks, hands down.

This man is off his rocker with his sound effects in his power point presentations ... his curve also sucks ... but the fact that if you do better on the final then you did on your two midterms he will just double your final is pretty nice
No Comments
His curve is horrible, only 5% get As
Class was easy.  He takes attendance and uses it for your grade.  He throws in some bits of info that aren't in your book, but WILL show up on tests.  Overall a good prof.
The material is pretty easy, but to get an A you'll have to work fairly hard. I thought Econ 200 with Osman was certainly easier, but this class isn't brain surgery. Getting a B should be no sweat.

his class is beyond easy. he does everything to make sure everyone gets an a. its ridiculous. if you dont get an a you should be shot. he curves the tests according to the allignment of planets multiplied by your weight, divided by your bday, etc etc
Hate the man with a passion!!

****. But the class isn't that hard.  He would get mad at just the slightest problems with the audio equipment in Independence Hall and cancel class.  I saw him fall on ice walking into the building one day...made me laugh.
Hmmm. Mildly effective on stage. Not very personable one-on-one. Probably the best you're going to get for a subject like Econ 201.
No Comments
easy
Horrible.  He's a ****!
No Comments
The man is crazy....any loud noises or interruptions to his lecture turn him in to The Hulk...Hard class, boring lectures, but a good curve
Fair tester. Most boring lectures of all time. Everyday he wears a tie clip shaped like a different kind of bug. I think he even bores himself.
worst teacher ever...best hour of sleep twice a week in hitch****131...everyone who has ever had class there knows what I am talking about

Flips through the powerpoint presentations at the speed of light, however, he is entertaining and does like to talk about his extravagant vacations if that's what you're interested in.  Hope for a good TA.
No Comments
Not too hard of a class BUT hard to get an A or A-...very easy to get a C
He was ok...fairly easy B...pretty hard A
this dude is so funny!  he was a great teacher too.  glad i had him before 200.
No Comments
You will need to study, but if you have problems, he is very helpful
the class is really hard and he sucks
No Comments
Even though I did very well, he is a terrible professor.
sucks
He sucks alot and if I have to see one more picture of his wife ...UGH
pretty easy
I did not so good on the first midterm....but it is looking pretty easy
Good teaching, trys to relate to everyday life, makes some random funny jokes
extremely easy, dont read the lantern in lecture (or just dont get caught)
Posts every presentation online, lots of practice exams

summary_comment: The professor is generally regarded as less effective in his teaching methods, with many students finding his lectures redundant and preferring self-study or using available resources. While some find the class manageable with minimal attendance, others warn against his outdated teaching style and suggest avoiding him altogether. Overall, his lectures are seen as unnecessary, and his exams are challenging without sufficient preparation.

Ratings.comment: He is a nice old professor. Easy if you study the ppt and old exams.

He isn't an especially good professor, and there isn't much buffer to your grades (combination of midterm and final make up 90%, and 10% homework). His curve is also ridiculously strict. On the bright side, class was completely not mandatory. Frankly, you learn way more by doing the reading out of class. Don't get behind, though.

Class isn't too bad; received a B+ with moderate effort. Going to class is useless, he just reads off slides word-for-word. Just read the chapters assigned and look over the notes posted on Carmen. For the tests look over the practice exams available to you, they're very helpful and you should easily end up with a B after the curve.

Difficult class, just a lot of specifics to remember. HW is easy, tests are not bad. Evans is slow talking but wise. Just have to let him finish what point he is making before getting annoyed. He won't be teaching for too much longer, I think at least.
No need to go to lectures (which is SWEET). Lecture slides are up on his his websites. You can download and read them by urselves. Should make it to recitations thou. The TAs are helpful.
Really dont have to go to lecture just read the book and teach yourself.  He needs to retire and he is nuts. Who licks a dollar bill, really.

Seriously a shame that this guy is still teaching. I need to know this stuff and he does absolutely nothing to teach it. Worst professor at Ohio State. He is just too old and creepy and needs to retire. AND I'm getting an A in the class so this shows how bad he really is

This guy may be one of the creepiest individuals I have every met. He is so weird it truly makes it difficult to sit through his lectures. Which lectures are useless. He will spend hours talking about how formulas are derived. I would honestly avoid at all cost and just take it with someone else. You will have to teach yourself everything.
class is hard. he doesnt explain things very clearly. weird professor. book helps a lot. gives curve
this guy is a moron
Don't listen to the reviews...the class is not that bad.  You actually end up learning a lot.

His class is very interesting, but hard. It really does depend on your TA and the book does help ALOT!!!! My TA was great, GET VIPUL BHATT as your TA and your set. Just make your up with your reading and you'll do fine. I got an A- in the class and your grade is depended on how well you do in the class percent wise and not on points!!!
This teacher is pretty strange.  YOur grade literally depends on how good your T.A. is.  Tests were difficult, read the book.

I just had a midterm on 05/01/06. It was horrible and difficult. Lots of material that you need to cover for the midterm. Don't ever take this class with this professor. The lecture, itself, is so boring.

Lectures are rambling, off-topic, not consistent and definitely not helpful.  Gives good practice exam questions, but exam difficulty is very high given the level at which he covers material in class.  Obnoxious and hard to listen to during lecture periods.
Good professor.The content is fairly straight forward, he gives realistic practice exams to study with. No complaints here
Very entertaining!!!

summary_comment: Professor Harrington is inconsistent in his teaching approach, with some students finding him humorous and engaging while others frustrated by his unhelpful responses and difficult assignments. His teaching style ranges from being overly casual and off-topic, which some find amusing, to being harsh and demanding, particularly regarding homework and exams. Overall, his effectiveness varies widely depending on the student's perspective and tolerance for his unique teaching methods.

Ratings.comment: Harrington has no business teaching an intro class. Doesn't seem to understand that College Freshmen do not have the same level of understanding as higher level students and this seems to really frustrate him. Never gives a clear answer even to the simplest questions. Very rude to students. He sounds exactly like Mr. Garrison from South Park

He definitely loves his job. He has a lot of fun, is very funny, and keeps the mood light. This is definitely a good thing because the subject matter can get VERY dry. He does a great job of explaining concepts by working through examples.  Aplia homework can be frustrating, but will help you come exam time. I highly recommend his class

Okay, this professor is the most annoying guy I've ever met! He says RIGHT?? at the end of basically every sentence and the way he goes off topic made me never want to go to class. Horrible experience, I don't recommend this professor in the least bit!

Hard professor. Aplia homeworks are essentially impossible and will take several hours to complete. Midterms got progressively harder, and the final was unbelievably difficult. Even with a decent amount of studying, you'd be lucky to pull out a C. Otherwise, you need to work your butt off for an A.
Harrington was very nice and helpful.  Classes were interesting and usually pretty funny.  Don't buy the textbook, you won't need it.  Do go to class though as the lectures are very helpful.

Stated he made homework difficult to drive down class size so to focus on smaller group of students. Positive it was so his overinflated sense of worth could finally fit in the room. Guy needs to realize his style of writing isn't God's gift to Earth. Uninformed on class topics, very little help. C-

Professor Harrington is HILARIOUS! He really loves teaching Economics. Don't sit in the front unless you want to be talked to;he really enjoys talking to students during lectures. His homework on Aplia is a little challenging at times, but he's always available to help! I definitely recommend taking his class, you won't regret it at all!!!

Harrington was hilarious! He did have a warped sense of humor at times but I barely read the book and just participated in class and e-mailed him questions and he helped me receive an A.  Aplia was hard but didn't count for too much of the grade.
Great Teacher, easily the best teacher i've had at osu in conveying the principles to the students, really funny, makes class worth staying awake for, definitely recommend taking his class.
Great professor, a lot of energy and a outlandish sense of humor. He uses examples that make sense and really drills concepts into your head.
awesome teacher, really funny, tons of energy, and really uses good examples in class to hammer home the lessons
He is a good teacher, and you can feel his passion about teaching. He is a really nice person, and the HW Grade helped increasing your final letter grade. I suggest you taking his class.

I STRONGLY suggest a different teacher or taking it at a different college! HW is on a website called APLIA which is sometimes impossible to do(book,notes,lectures)sometimes don't help. & APLIA cost $35 to do. If it was not for the curve, there would be a lot of Ds & Fs instead of Bs & Cs! He also talks about DEATH a lot.

I thought he was a great professor.  He was really interested in teaching, and he definitely knew Micro Econ.  The homework wasn't bad, and the recitation teachers give you the answers to half the assignments.  I recommend getting the book, and reading it.  The book compliments his teaching nicely, and if you read it you will do well in the class.

Good professor. You could tell he was really interested in what he was teaching and made all the examples extremely relevant. You do not need to go to class because he puts all the slides online and you will not need the book at all unless you want to get more help on the subject.
decent class, i especially enjoyed his frequent sentence ending signature, "...right?" Once i counted 120 right?'s in 78 minutes... got a good kick out of it.

The Aplia HW online which is required for his class cost $35. The HW is almost impossible to do! you can read the book, go to class, and still have no idea how to do the HW or remember when he ever discussed anything that relates to the HW. I suggest find another professor who doesnt require u to pay to do impossible Homework!

He is a very nice guy and he really did have some intersting stories, they just didnt relate to the class very well though.  The aplia homework is very hard and not fun to do at alll.  His midterms are a lot harder than the final which half of it was old questions from midterm.  I would reccomend a different teacher for this course.

I absolutely loved this class!! I was nervous after reading the reviews here but he is my favorite professor so far.  Go to class, pay attention, and do Aplia and its an easy A. For once economics actually made sense.

Harrington is the man! because of him I went from taking Econ as a GEC to majoring in it.  you will read others on here who complain and you can blame them for the economic problems in our country because they are either complete idiots or have zero work ethic.  like any class attend it, do the homework and read and you will get an A no questions.

People need to stop bashing on Harrington. Yes, he is a scatterbrain.  Yes, all the books he assigns to read are useless to the class. HOWEVER, his class is highly interesting - he enables you to see Economics from a more interesting perspective - one which definately helped me in other classes.  He definately cares that his students do well.

Not an easy GEC class. I didn't go the lectures at 8:30am,but from what I hear they don't help. He makes up his own questions which renders the book useless. Aplia online hw is due every Saturday at 5pm, which is a pain. Honors econ is an easier class, take that instead.

The class isnt very well organized, but Dr. Harrington will bend over backwards to help you if you ask him to. He talks alot about off topic stuff but its interesting. Go to class and participate, if its week 5 and he doesnt know your name you are doing it wrong.
Everything about this class was annoying...

lectures really help with online homework assignments, which help with exams but don't prepare you anywhere close to well enough for exams. his exams are much more in-depth than the book covers or he covers at anytime in lecture or online homework. Overall, learned a lot from him, but his exams just went too indepth for how much he taught.
bottom line: not an enjoyable class. this class sucked! don't take harrington if you don't have to.
he says "right" very much. aplia homework helps so do them and understand them and you will be fine.
Never made anything understandable to me, PowerPoint slides were overly complicated, had to teach myself almost everything.  Gained nothing from the class.

Hard class. His lectures have nothing to do with the exams. They look like the exams, but go zero into depth as how to apply what it is you are learning. If you love to pay $$ to have really hard homework assignments, then I would take his class. His students have to pay $35 to do complicated homewrok assignments. Hardest class Ive ever taken.

harrington is a boss. dont ever go to class if you have a pulse. he puts the old tests online and the aplia (riiight) homework is a joke. study those the night before the tests and you will get an A. he is kinda sketch and when he rants and gets nervous he just says riight? after everything. (68 times in 23 minutes)

He knows what he is talking about but tends to rant about random things. Sometimes his rants are relevant, others times he is completely off. Lectures are very helpful in doing the homework and the exams are based off the  powerpoints and homework. It is hard to understand the powerpoint unless you go to class.

He's a good guy and a pretty decent teacher--kept my interest and I hate Econ.  He's scatter-brained as heck, but his class is very very easy.  One homework per week, takes 10 minutes.  Do the practice problems (they tell you the answers) and you'll get a 100% on homework.  Oh, and got 100% on first midterm and I'm not even that smart.

Dr. H is taking a bad rap on here.  I was afraid to take him after looking at these reviews.  Actually, he's a great dude, a little bubbley, but he's not a bad teacher.  Actually, his funniness is underrated, too.  His examples are crazy weird, but it's to make sure we understand.  The homework is easy as cake and takes 10 min.  Hardly any reading.
Print off the PowerPoints skeletons for class and actually go to class (he gives hints for homework in class). Aplia can be difficult and is graded at 5pm on Saturdays.

Not the greatest professor overall. The class is pretty easy if you do the online homework and go to recitation, just the same as all the other classes offered. The weirdest thing is going to lectures. He talks a LOT about his daughter and cremation (his personal studies), but if you can get past that it's not that bad of a class. Fees are bad tho

He is visiting from Kenyon this quarter and has been one of the worst professors i've had in my four years here!!! His examples and notes are outrageous, don't make sense the next day! All he ever talks about is cremation (his research), he is always late about putting the homework up. He is so scatterbrained it is ridiculous.

Dr. Harrington does a great job. Go to the lecture, spend time on both the recitation set and the online homework, and the exam won't be too hard--half of the exam comes VERBATIM from the practice sets!
Real good guy
Online assignments are very hard, same as the midterms and final. No weekley quizes which is kinda nice. Overall not a good professor. Only advantage is a large curve.

Not the greatest teacher.  Online quiz like assignments were basically impossible but I didn't find the exams too bad.  Buy the physical copy of the book and read it and take notes.  If you're lucky, your TA will tell you exactly what is on the midterms.  Read the textbook and if you're confused go to lecture, if you're not confused don't bother.

This guy is very friendly and fair. His lectures were sort of crazy and it didnt help they were at 8:30 in the morning. His online assignments were almost impossible as were his midterms....but he curve is HUGE!!! He is extremely fair. Dont take class looking for an easy A GEC, you will have to work hard.

hm the casket guy, It was his first quarter, and I understand it takes a few quarters to get the hang of stuff. Aplia homework was difficult,but he promised to make them easier in coming classes, he's pretty cooky, but not a horrible teacher provided you could stay awake (8:30)midterms were hard, but heavily curved and will probably get better!

The final was way easier than both his midterms. However, that does not make this class worth taking. The first couple of aplia assignments were easy but then they just got impossible. He should not be teaching an entry level econ class, he over complicates a lot of the concepts. Does not follow the book!

okay this class was at 830 am and he has these powepoints slides. if you go to lecture pay attention it will be helpful. aplia sucks but he didnt'count it against you. If you have the option buy the physical copy of the book. that's what i did. and actually read the book it helps A LOT

Ok, this class was NOT that hard. He "assigned" text book readings, but told the class that they weren't necessary for the exams, which was true. The talk about funerals did get old. Half of our final was verabtim from previous assignments (ones he told us would be on there), and he told us exactly what to study for the other half. Pretty easy.

the tests and aplia hw are impossible and ridiculous. he doesn't tell you what to study for the tests. lectures are interesting only when he goes off on rambles, but in the long run that's only hurting you. everything in econ according to him can be related to his daughter. really really hard. that's your warning.

Good guy. Bad teacher.  He goes on about pointless information and lectures about random goods.  It is tough to stay awake in class because of how far off topic he gets.  Midterms and HW are extremely hard.  Our curve for both midterms was 20% which is a little ridiculous.

The worst professor I have ever had at OSU. He rambles on and on about nothing. He does not follow the book at all and makes up his own information to lecture about (most of it is completely pointless). Midterms and hw=impossible. He is very annoying and you can't take notes because he talks too fast. Don't take him if you don't have to!

He is a nice guy... AWFUL TEACHER.  He is not very good at offering help or answering questions. The tests are impossible because all the questions are random and may have never been covered in the lecture or the textbook.  A lot of reading and homework is required for the class. Class Average on Midterm: 40%
Makes aplia assignments hard as hell.

WOW. class is extremely difficult. Here is just a preview of what is expected during one week: read 2 chapters of online book (each about 20 pgs), read 4-5 articles (each about 4-8 pgs), and one hw assignment due per week which usually has a corresponding 4-8 pg article also. Awesome, right? No. he should NOT be teaching an entry level class. AVOID

He is a nice guy who comes off very friendly....but his online homework assignment are nearly impossible as are his exams....He is not someone you want if you are planning on taking this class as an "easy A" GEC

Studying for exams is nearly impossible due to him not giving any direction on what material to study. The Aplia Assignments on the computer are dumb too(And no you probably haven't heard of this dumb program)

summary_comment: The professor is widely regarded as ineffective in engaging students, with many finding his lectures boring and difficult to follow. While some acknowledge his knowledge and willingness to help, most students struggle to learn from his teaching methods and prefer to rely on self-study or external resources. Attendance is mandatory and often seen as a necessity rather than a benefit.

Ratings.comment: His class was really boring and I think he is just not good at talking.. I almost can't understand anything from his lecture, I taught myself for every single homework and exam. But just read the textbook the night before exam you can do well, his exams can be easier than you imagine

Boring lectures. Do your homework and attend class and you will do fine. I used this class as a study hall, then taught myself the material later. Also, try doing a google search on this class. You might be surprised what you find.

I've never had so much trouble staying awake through a lecture. The man still uses an overhead projector, along with some of the least detailed notes you'll ever find. Exams were unfair and impossible to study for. Save yourselves the trouble and enroll with a different professor.

It's like there are two courses happening - one in the lecture, and one that actually dictates your grade. I have suspicion that he's using the same exams every quarter because groups of students walk out of class after attendance check - during midterm review!? You DON'T miss midterm review with this guy unless you've got an ace up your sleeve.

I can understand the low ratings, but honestly he is a good teacher. His tests are really hard and easy to do bad on, but he is better than these low ratings. He responds fast to emails, and clearly knows what he is talking about. He was a nice guy, just his class is hard. Go to all the classes and prepare to memorize. His attendance is mandatory.

One of the most boring professors ever and attendance is part of your grade so you're kind of obligated to go. As if that wasn't bad enough, 99% of what he says or does in class isn't even on the exam--it all comes from the book.

Professor on his way out, his so set in his teaching method that to ask him a question throws him off his game and messes him up. Constantly forgets things, super monotone and constantly puts people to sleep in his lectures. However, he tries to help students and odds are you have no other options for 502b, so get ready to teach yourself.
Worthless professor, unwilling to help and might as well mail his lectures in... Seems to be just biding his time until retirement. The worst teacher I have ever had by a long shot!
Boring class. I would recommend taking it with someone else. Not hard if you study lectures and do the homework. Just really boring lectures.

ungodly boring, and his voice is like nails on a chalkboard. actively does not like students - takes off extra points if asked to regrade something, doesn't take hw in his mailbox/slid under his door, if you ask him a question he'll just repeat what he already said. make sure you know all the algebra and graphs.

Lectures are hideously boring. Tests are borderline unfair. 40% of the exam will be based on a single 12 part problem. If you dont know part 1 you miss all 12.  Provides 20 page practice exams, but most of whats on the practice isn't on the actual exam.  I have never struggled more or enjoyed a class less than this one.  He is a subpar Professor.

This professor sucks. He is very knowledgeable but cannot convey the message. Attendance not required but gives one pt per day. You must use the book or no hope. He speaks to fast so you will most likely miss the extra problems he does in class that are not in the notes.

Very well structured class.  Reading book a great supplement to class.  Not the most exciting teaching, but not nearly as bad as his other ratings would suggest.  I guess if your looking for magic tricks or something, this professor is not for you  Class is full of information.  If you have a desire to learn, this is a good class to take.

Most boring professor I've had so far. I probably fell asleep 60% of the time but it is still important to go to class to sign in your name. I still got an A- just from reading the book and memorizing the examples. He teaches by the book and will mostly read his slides word for word in lectures.

He is an intelligent man, but he often used examples that were too abstract to follow and typically confused even himself. READ THE BOOK and NOTES. Go to class always. The professor was very confusing and quite honestly not interested in answering ANY questions, but overall the class was pretty easy. No papers! Just two midterms and a final.

He is boring as hec, but ALWAYS go to class and get good scores on the homeworks.  Obviously he gives a great curve...about 20points to your final grade, but do the homework and attend class and sign in to get the credit and you'll get a MUCH better grade that way. Honestly though, boring as hec but read the book and memorize the notes.
He is by far the most borring professor i ever had.  Hard tests, but great curve

I really liked him. Yes, the material is boring and he goes through it very quickly, but if you read the book, lectures should make sense. He is willing to help you understand the material, and going to his office hours really help. His exams are sorta difficult, but he grades really easily, and the curve at the end of the class is really nice.

Not easy to pay attention in this class, concepts seem  very open ended in this macro course, and there's a lot of room for mixed variables such as long term, short term, and how it affects the economy.  Didn't seem like there was a clear cut answer for anything, so you have to memorize each type of change.

He is a fine professor, just because people are required to actually listen in his class they automatically accuse him of being a bad teacher. I listen in class and I'm doing very well. Just be prepared for difficult material which requires some attentive listening and thought.

He is VERY BORING. Rarely makes sense in class and usually messes up and has to rethink everything. Go to class because you get participation points and you need them, but it usually doesn't help so sleep or play games. READ THE BOOK. MUCH more clear than he is. Curves A LOT. Got a B and C on midterms and still pulled off an A-.

He's retiring soon, and it shows. He could care less what he's teaching, whether students understand it, or what the hell is even going on. 75% of classes he tripped over a stationary desk on the side of the room.

Class was a joke -- and so was the professor. I got the impression he was trying, but he bumbled so badly I all out quit going to lecture about half-way through. Lost himself on overly elaborate examples, frequently confused himself, and had the annoying if hilarious habit of running into the overhead or tripping over the garbage can EVERY class!
I don't care what anyone says, I thought he was alright.  At times lectures/experiments were unclear, but it came directly from the text, so just read it.
Don't take a class that he teaches-period.

The worst prof. I ever had.He is boring,annoying and he can not explain stuff properly. He is so confusing that sometime in we all laugh on him. First he can not explain and if you ask second time he get annoyed. HE IS THE WORST PROF at the OSU and i wish that person gets fired who hired Steve McCafferty
Retire already....

He goes very fast and uses confusing equations, and even writes the wrong things or does problems wrong.You ask questions and he can't explain them-no one ever knows what is going on..be prepared to work really hard and still never know how well you will do.
You know when the average on the midterm is below 50% that this guy cannot teach. The tests are bogus because he tests you more on calculus than economics.
Nice guy, but not the best prof ever.  Kind of confusing and very difficult exams.  The final is comprehensive.
one of the worst professors at OSU. He is very smart and some kind of genious. but he is awful teacher.

One of the worst teachers I've had at OSU. Can't teach whatsoever, & doesn't even grade stuff accurately, he just skims exams (can be good or bad). Once he spent 10 minutes talking about how he wasn't going to go off on tangents. Just print off the notes.

summary_comment: Professor Kori is generally well-regarded for making the material accessible and engaging, especially through clear lecture notes and online powerpoints with fill-in-the-blanks. Students find him approachable and fair, with exams that are manageable if they attend class regularly and study the provided materials. While some find the class interesting and recommend it, others describe it as somewhat dull.

Ratings.comment: This class is a pre-req for my major. I didn't want to take it but I actually enjoyed the subject. Kori wasn't bad. The class was comprised of 3 tests and a final with homework used as extra credit. He puts the powerpoints online (with fill- in-the-blanks) and is easy to reach. With the curve and the extra credit, the class wasn't that bad.
Just go to class, get lecture notes. Study those, homework problems. Anyone who does this diligently should be good with the curve.

Took Econ 4560, didn't ever need the textbook. We had 4 exams, all pretty easy if you attend class,print out the powerpoints, and take a little bit of notes. He's a great professor that doesn't try to trick you on exams or make things extremely complicated. Would definitely recommend and take another class.

I took econ 4560 and it was kind of boring at the beginning but Korie made it very interesting! We had 4 exams; if you study the lectures thoroughly and attend all the classes you'll be fine! Also, he gives up to 5% extra credit just for doing the HW, and he gives a lot of bonus points/questions! I highly recommend taking his class! He is AWESOME!

Very easy 367 or writing for economy majors. Grades consisted of a short paper (4-5pg), long paper (7-10pg) and group presentation (3ppl 20 minutes total). If you do the work and put in the slightest effort I don't think you could possibly score below an A-
A really dull class

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as challenging and unhelpful, with many students finding her classes difficult and her grading harsh. Her teaching style is often described as disorganized and confusing, with some students feeling overwhelmed. While a few noted that she is nice and possibly cares about her students, the overall consensus is that her instruction does not effectively support student learning.

Ratings.comment: Micro is a hard class in general, however she did not make it any easier. She rarely gives out grades higher than a B. She is rude when you ask her questions that to her are obvious. I studied for hours and her tests were still impossible. Avoid her class at all costs. It killed my GPA. I was considering majoring in econ until I took her class.

I think she's teaching a difficult subject which makes it easy to criticize her teaching. It could have been a bit more organized and I think she kind of triangulates some of the info between the book, class and carmen...like you have to figure it out yourself. thats good in a way but almost overwhelming. could be better, could be worse

What a horrible teacher, the class is fairly hard but she makes it worse. She is everywhere on the board using the same graph to explain 5 questions while writing on it hence confusion herself $ the rest of the class, simply unorganized...Her grading is horrendous the final was 60% of the grade...avoid her!!!!

She was, for lack of a better word, a horrible instructor. She would make poor example, her homework assignments were tedious, her style of teaching was also tedious. I would not recommend her. On the positive side, she is nice and possibly cares about her students.

summary_comment: The professor is generally considered knowledgeable and organized, providing clear materials and homework that effectively prepare students for exams. While his lectures can be somewhat dull and reading from slides, he is fair in grading and genuinely cares about his students, often curving grades to help them succeed. Despite some students finding his classes boring, the overall consensus is that the course is manageable and rewarding.

Ratings.comment: He is nice to talk to and a fair grader. He could be boring in class but he cares his students and he curves the graph. His homework prepares us well for the exams. If you practice on the problems similar to the homework, you would be just fine for the exam. I'm glad I took this class, as I learned a lot of stuff.

His classes are very boring. He has a deep voice that can put you to sleep in the morning. But overall he's a good professor. Majority of your grade is homework assignments, and they are not too hard. Prepares you well for exams. Provides lecture slides online and is very clear with the material
Great class, great teacher! Pay attention and practice graphing examples of the situations and different events he discusses and you can get an A.

Professor Lewis might not have been the most boisterous presence in the classroom, but he did a good job considering the material. The two exams in the class are not bad as long as you study for them.
Most boring guy ever, reads from slides, only one midterm HARD! useless boring class...unnecessarily hard tests
This is the most boring class I have ever had at OSU.  I go to all my classes, but I had to skip this one several times because it was so boring.

He doesn't have a real good presence in the classroom but is very knowledgeable.  His lectures can be bland but they are full of good information.  He uses carmen very well and prepares slides for lecture that he posts online.  He gives you everything you need to get it done.
He is not the best lecturer, but he is organized and provides the slides before class.  He gives easy homework and exams, and is also a very easy grader.

Apparently a nice guy. Clarity in lectures is not his strong suit. Like most Econ professors, his lack of intrigue and creativity make for boring lectures. Go to class and participate, read the book and you should do alright. Lewis is a very fair grader, so don't mind the poor scores.

summary_comment: Rob is considered fairly inexperienced and ineffective in his role as an economics writing instructor, failing to address writing skills directly despite the course focus. His teaching lacks clarity, with unclear guidelines and no rubrics for assignments, leaving students uncertain about expectations. Additionally, he does not offer any form of feedback on submitted work.

Ratings.comment: Rob is fairly inexperienced. It is an economics writing class but he teaches nothing about writing. Assigns reading but does not relate it to writing a paper. His guidelines for the assignments are unclear. He has no rubric for the assignments so you have zero idea on what he expects. He does not provide feedback for any of your work.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and ability to help students learn and succeed. Students consistently recommend her classes, praising her comprehensive coverage of material and clear explanations, which lead to excellent grades.

Ratings.comment: GREAT teacher!!!! You will be fine if you have her. The most easy A I got! Take her if you want to learn something and get a good grade.

Great TA! I was able to miss lectures because she covered absolutely everything during recitations. She uses all of her time talking about what we should have learned during the lecture. Highly recommended!
Great teacher! I learned a lot from her!
great teacher.   i took her econ 200 n econ 520, its clear and i got 2 A in her class

summary_comment: The professor's teaching style is perceived as dry and unengaging, with an emphasis on rote memorization of formulas for tests that consist solely of objective questions, and no cheat sheets allowed, making the coursework challenging.

Ratings.comment: The class was boring and it was quite hard i think. The midter, final, and quizzes are all objective questions. A lot of formula to remember but no cheat sheet allowed during test.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his enthusiasm and willingness to help students, though some find him initially difficult to understand due to his teaching style. Despite this, most students appreciate his efforts and find his classes helpful and engaging once they adjust. However, a minority of students found the classes boring and challenging due to the presentation method and testing format.

Ratings.comment: Really, Really good! He is somewhat difficult to understand at first, but you get used to it. ALWAYS willing to help students. Super nice, and pretty funny
He is very enthusiastic and always ready to help students. Quite good.
His teaching was very helpful, interesting and inspiring. Though there's a slight barrier of communication (language), you will get used to it soon.

Awesome guy. A bit hard to understand at first, but he's easy to get used to. He'll bend over backwards to help students out. Just read the textbook and use lectures to reinforce what you've already read.
Hard to understand but uses a big curve.

I did not like this professor. He was difficult to understand. While the material was not overly difficult the way it was presented and the way that we were tested made it hard. It is a very boring 2 hour class.

summary_comment: The professor is widely regarded as ineffective and difficult to follow, with many students finding his lectures and slides confusing and hard to note from. Students struggle with memorization-heavy exams and often recommend avoiding him if possible. Notes are challenging to take, and the grading is based on a midterm, a final, and a lengthy paper.

Ratings.comment: Worst professor at OSU; incomprehensible. Has no interest in teaching... wants you to memorize a million numbers. Terrible. His slides even have funny noises in between them that are annoying as can be.

I'm going to try and be nice here, but I don't have many good things to say about Gill teaching Econ 201H. Boring, drawn out speaking. You're supposed to fill in these pre-made study guides from his slides made in 1990's and it's almost impossible to catch all the information. Textbook helped teach the main topics but didn't help on the exams.

If you attend lecture and keep your study guides filled in and organized, this class is at the very least an easy B. There are only 3 grades though- a midterm, a final, and a 10 page paper- so make sure you do well on all three!

Gill is a very absent minded professor, powerpoints and lectures are difficult to follow, he does not relate to students well, does not take the time to get to know students at all, test usually consist of multiple choice and short answer all consisting of memorization. Avoid this professor if you can.

Note taking is difficult and slides are not made available.  Do the study guide on Carmen and make sure you use the online quizzes and flash cards associated with the textbook and you should be fine.   Final grade consists of a midterm, essay and a final - that's it.

Pretty good teacher. Nice guy. Just taking notes in this class was TERRIBLE. Basically have to copy down the entire slides as he whips through them b/c he does not post his slides or give anything handouts to help takes notes (he really needs to do this). 2 exams, and one final paper make up the grade

Fairly decent teacher. Definitely knows his stuff, tries to make class bearable but can sometimes lull on. Nice guy, though. 88-100 is an A in this class, and 80%+ of the midterm questions are verbatim from the study guides, so look over those instead of the actual book, as it probably won't be needed.  Very easy for an honors course.
This was one of the most boring classes I have ever taken. The study guides have all but a few words filled in and you fill it in while he drones on and on.

Gill does not relate to students well, does not take the time to get to know students at all, very boring, all over the place, all you do is memorize a ton of information, and its very hard to stay awake in class, he would be nothing without his powerpoints

After taking 200H with him,I thought he was boring and I didn't like all the memorization.But after taking 201H with another prof,I have changed my mind.Consider yourselves lucky that all you have to do is memorize study guides,rather than read hundreds of pages in a book while trying to retain the important info.Easy A if you memorize study guides

Boring. Boring. Boring. Only real "plus" to the class is that all the notes and study guides are pre-written (i.e. just memorize the handouts he gives you, that is your exam). Other than that, he is BORING, papers prompts are vague and boring.

Boring as can be. Study guides and handouts cover everything that is on the test (so you don't need to read). Study hard for tests and shouldn't be too bad. Weird with papers... tough to get an A+ but didn't give out anything lower than a C+/B-.

Not a bad teacher, he basically gives you study guide notes during class, which you memorize for midterms. Assigned 3 papers, but if you write enough, you'll get an A on them. Make sure you print off all of the handouts, because he will make you re-write them on tests.

This class takes a LOT of studying. You DO have to basically MEMORIZE a book of notes for exams, but I ended up with A's on the midterms. Also includes 4 papers that have to be 5 pages each. He is pretty boring, but if you have a LOT of time, you can work towards the A. Also offers a 2% extra credit with the scale already at an 88% for an A. 5.5/10
This guy is so boring and the whole class consists of listen to and memorizing his study guides word for word. If Possible, do not take Leroy Gill.

This guy was ridiculous. Vague study guides that you fill out every class (after class I had to ask him about questions that he did not clearly answer). I have never been so pissed off in class. Tests are so hard. Expects you to remember and define everything. Really tests your brain's memory bank. Luckily an 88 is an A.

Nice guy, really boring, can't answer questions well. Powerpoint slides every day, you copy down what he says. Print out your own 15-pg note packets, write in them. You have to memorize a lot of lists for the tests, just memorize the study guide. Made econ boring (or is it inherently boring)?

I learned very little in this class and blame it on the professor.  He is boring and not interested in teaching.  He needs to update his power point slides.  He has examples from more than 10 years ago.  He gets really thrown off when someone actually asks a question (heaven forbid a question about ECON).  Do NOT take this professor!
You'll like the class if you like Libertarian anarchists with mustaches.

This MOFO is the hardest teacher at OSU. If you have him, drop the class now and go get someone else. People score in the 40% range on his tests. Your grade is not worth gambling on this dude. F'ed my GPA up. Went from a 3.9 to a 3.5 because of him.

He basically gives you a study guide, puts up some slides and reads directly off them. Nice guy, grading curve is awesome, but it's unlikely you'll learn anything besides random numbers. Also, his voice is rather droning. Don't take him for a class in the early morning.

This class isn't that bad. It's not that difficult to get an A if you're willing to work for it. He basically tells you what's going to be on the test, so if you memorize it then you'll get an A. He's a nice guy who is willing to help you.
2 mid terms and a final exam.multiple choice question.

Weekly 2 page papers, a 10 page term paper, two midterms and a final. Attendance is mandatory. Class consists of copying down his notes from a powerpoint, and the notes must then be memorized word for word. In addition, none of his notes can be verified in the book - don't buy it because you don't use it. I got an A, but I had to work hard for it.

I may be weird, but I actually enjoyed the class (probably because I have an interest in economics and the financial world). Dr. Gill is very educated and relates the ideas to current events.  Much of what he teaches is common sense, but the class is still thought-provoking. Make sure you completely fill out the study guides. Ask questions.

Learned very little from his actual lectures even though he requires attendance. If students miss more than 3 classes, final grade is lowered by 20%. My friends that had Mirzae absolutely adored her and I regret not registering for her course instead.

Dr. Gill may have been boring, but seriously the class was really easy.  You were pretty much guaranteed an A on the papers no matter what you wrote, and he actually did explain stuff pretty well if you could pay attention.  Lots of busywork with weekly papers, but overall an easy class.

The opportunity cost for taking this class was too high. I had a genuine interest in economics before taking the class, but Gill reduced the subject to a series of powerpoint slides. Writing of weekly papers required for the honors class. Ultimately, this class only tested your ability to memorize inane bits from a 2 hour lecture.

DO NOT take a class with Harley Leroy Gill.  He thinks he is so cool with his tablet PC, his cartoons absolutely suck, and his study guide questions are ridiculous!  Half of them he never full out answers, and you can never find the answers in the book. And the WSJ subscription??? Retire Leroy, we don't need you anymore.

I had seen the comments on here before taking the class, but I disregarded them. I wish I had not. The material isn't hard, but paying attention to it is. If you miss something in class, don't expect to be able to find it in the book. It is terrible. I would rather  donate blood at a Mexican Red Cross than take that class again with Dr. Gill.
boring. tests are tough and tedious, but study guides helps. mentioned a curve, but was vague and did not stick with it.

Prof Gill is the most useless, trite, degrading, self involved, and COMPLETELY UNAWARE teacher I have. He uses useless study guides and forces his students to look at his creepy drawings. His style of teaching was very unorganized. A class before our final, he went over 4 chapters and expected us to know everything. He is frankly the WORST teacher.

took a potentially interesting class and made it horribly boring. exam questions were taken directly off of the study guide, and would have to be worded exactly right to be considered correct. not very approachable or understandable. only plus was the generous curve-i learned nothing, did horribly, and still got a b (like half of the class).

I had him for H200 too, and let me tell you he is boring.  You don't really learn that much from him, but if you learn the study guide and figure out the graphs, you should be able to pull off a B or A.  Make sure you fill out the study guide well, and draw like all the graphs, or else you WILL fail. He could have been worse, or a lot better.
Easy grade if you just study the study guide.  It may be a boring class but it definitely isn't hard.

I've had worse teachers, but he's pretty bad. He doesn't follow the book, he follows the voices in his head. Then he constructs a copious study guide which he dictates to the class and then requires them to regurgitate for the exams.  Much of his data can't be verified by the book, but he is extremely resistant to answering any questions. Useless.

Lectures are terribly boring and very random / hard to follow. We had to turn in 15-20 page typed study guides. Midterms contained multiple errors that students had to point out to him. He claims all questions are taken from the study guide but many of them were pulled from thin air. Definitely not an easy A. Do not take Econ 201 with Dr. Gill.

Extremely boring.  Must go to class to fill out monotonous study guide.  Exams are just a test of whether or not you can memorize his study guide verbatim not whether or not you understand Economics.  Nice guy, funny cartoons, just not a good teacher
Very Boring

This teacher fails to provoke any independent thought on the subject of economics from his students.  He gives you typed study guides for which he will monotonously dictate the answers to.  Reguardless of how incomprehensible his answers are, memorize them and regurgitate verbatim on the tests for an A..  This class made me want to be buried alive.
Only teaches with power point. If he doesn't have his projector, he is pretty much useless. Only plus is his generous curves.
Extremely boring. Lecture is pointless and makes little sense, though his exams are pure memorization from whats on the review packet. Percentage grades are low, but curves are generous

Class was pretty boring, but its econ.  He makes typical dry econ professor jokes, and draws his own cartoons.  Read the book, I found out I should have after taking the midterms (opps).  He has a generous grading scale.

Prof. Gill was solid. His lectures were pretty clear and straight-forward, even though he seemed a little reluctant to answer questions during class. All of his assignments are really easy; weekly 2-page papers, 8-page term paper, exams...And his grading scale is probably the greatest known to man.

I've heard he's good for other classes, but he really shouldn't teach this one. He spent WAY too much time on history and iron law of war, and too little time on some very interesting topics such as the economic impacts of terrorism, nuclear, and biological weapons. This class could be a gold mine and he didn't even stratch the surface.

His teaching style is terrible. He uses UMM so many times in class and it makes coming almost unbearable. He also couldnt stick to the sylabus to save his life. We did 3 of the 11 chapters in the last class.

Overall i enjoyed his class.. the tests were really hard because economics has so much information that he only had enough time to fly through the material.  his voice is extremely monotonous and i often times fell asleep but he could care less because the class was so big. He curves grades alot and has an adjusted grading scale so thats nice
Very boring, but nice professor.
Gill doesn't communicate clearly.  Doesn't really care about students it seems like.

100% English speaking professor.  Pretty good speaker/presenter. Just goes over his slides with goofy pictures/drawings on them--some would find that boring but he throws in real world examples to keep it interesting. He can be funny at times as well.  Also, he loves his tablet PC a little too much, lol. And the Indiana Jones hat rocks.
Dr. Gill is the the man! He is a very good teacher and a really cool guy. He often shows up to class wearing a hat similar to that of Indiana Jones, proving how much of a badass he really is.
Very enthusiastic and clear teacher. He makes it interesting and keeps the whole class engaged.
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS... IF IT IS REQUIRED FOR YOUR MAJOR, SWITCH MAJORS!!!  Take Elardo instead... if you want to live to see 21.
No Comments
A really great professor.  Lectures were clear and striaght forward, test and grading were fair.

I dont think he is funny. He is a robot and every class is like an open discussion with one person talking. The only problem is, is that his tests are tough and if you dont read the book you are screwed. He is not a good teacher and please get someone else. I have a 3.33, worked hard, received my first D EVER! Please stayaway no reason to takehim!
He's a good teacher and its not that hard if you take the time to study.  You do have to read the book though.  He tries to spice up lectures but its hard to make econ exciting.

I would sit in the front of this class, dead center middle and still pass out. it was so boring. the material is dry. hands down, i didn't like it. got a B in the class tho.  guess i can't blame the class for sucking, but try getting elardo, he was a lil more upbeat when i had him for an upper level econ.

make you read the book and come to lectures to know the material for midterm. Makes you pay for online notes to collect royalties, very dirty trick on students. would suggest finding a different teacher
This man is hilarious.

Good teacher but his explainations are sometimes hard to understand. He moves VERY fast and is very demanding (large workload) but you learn a lot. Gives you exam questions in advance but mult choice is still difficult.
boring class, but if u go to class u should be okay

Very Interesting Class, It did get boring at times but Dr. Gill is a great professor. He explains the material very well and knows what he is talking about. I personally thought Dr. Gill did a great job with the material though some of it can be dry. I hold the class (economics of crime) and the professor in very high regards.

Most important thing for this teacher is to go to lecture and take note of the things he repeats. You will get an easy B+ if you just pay attention to him, if you want the A you are going to have to read the book which is terribly boring.

Entire grade based on 3 tests that everyone fails until the grades are curved. Going to lecture doesn't help because he rambles on and he sounds like Ben Stien. Seems nice but just doesn't know how to teach, out of my class of 250 about 15 people showed up... you'd think he'd notice.

Very demanding professor...will push you about as hard a you can go.  We flew through the textbook in about 7 weeks and then just went on to money and banking for the heck of it.  I have learned more from Dr. Gill than any other professor at OSU.

I was in tears after not doing well on the midterms, but somehow he gave me a B- when I was praying for at least a C.  He is very willing to help students.  Go to class, study, talk to him, and do the extra credit and you will be fine.
Great guy, went above and beyond to help students learn.  The WSJ stuff is annoying but interesting if you actually read articles.
Very hard class but Dr. Gill is very helpful in assignments. Fair curve for difficulty of class. Class is interesting. I would suggest the course and the prof. Very helpful outside of class as well

He is a really nice guy who really knows his stuff inside and out but the only problem with that is during the lectures I feel as if he assumes we all know what's going on.  Maybe it's just me but I am constantly LOST in this class.  However he does seem to be fair with grading.
Gill has a monotone voice that puts you to sleep, but he is an all-around nice guy and is willing to help those who need it.

Gill is a great teacher. Even though econ can be very dry, he made it somewhat interesting and definately knew his stuff. He's not too harsh of a grader and is definately more than fair. I'd say his class is one of the best I've taken at OSU.

he knows what he's talking about.  very timid and in a large lecture, it doesn't help.  a pretty nice curve that bumped my grade up a letter.  if you don't like econ, you won't like this class, but if you're at least partially interested, you can learn from this guy.

I thought Professor Gill was great. He's really into what he does, both the economics side and the teaching side. If you're into economics, you won't think it's boring like some people do. A lot of work but overall not to difficult. Just go to class and complete the assignments and you'll do fine.

really really nice guy, tries to make his material intersting even though its ridiculously boring... 2nd midterm is deadly, weekly papers are easy, final isnt too bad, term paper is kinda tough... just go to class and you will pass pretty easily cuz he curves rather well

Good class, lectures can be boring but it still is a very interesting class Gill knows his stuff. Weekly Paper but they are easy, term paper, two midterms and a final. It is a good class, work load what I expected in Honors class

This class gave you some work to do weekly, but it was easy.  He understands and explains material very well.  He was one of the best professors I've had.  His tests were pretty easy, there were no surprises.  He reviews most almost everything on theexams

Class was very boring, but you MUST go to class to get an A. Keep good notes for help with the essay questions. Look at the study guide multiple questions. Remember 80% of the grade is multiple choice. Wekly papers, 10pg term paper, 2 midterms, and final
HATED the class...EXTREMELY boring lectures, difficult tests, very hard to follow along...although the guy seems nice, he definitely turned me against even the thought of future economics classes.

Ok don't believe all the other people who rated Gill...he seriously sucks. His lectures make me want to hurt myself and I actually looked forward to taking tests because although I usually did horrible, I did not have to sit through that horrible lecture.

Seems like a nice guy...definitely does love teaching. He does make some jokes, which helps lighten the mood of the extremely tough and boring material he goes over. He is a good professor, but economics is definitely not my strong suit, so...yeah.

Busy work b/c you have a paper every week (but it's easy)& he's helpful if you don't understand. 1st midterm isn't bad, 2nd is hard! Read the book for the mul. choice and pay attention in class for the essay answers.Go to the rev. session. 10 pg paper

Good teacher, but read the book if you want to understand his multiple choice tests.  He gives a nice curve at the beginning of the class so you don't have to beat your head against the wall to get a good grade.  A fair amount of weekly work. Good Teacher

I didn't get credit for this class when I transfered, but I'm glad I had a good teacher the first time.  He is extremely dry and random, and not a very good teacher.  Good luck trying to make it through the lectures.

One of the most helpful professors I have had...He is a very nice person and has a genuine interest in teaching.  I think he really wants students to learn and do well in his class...like all other college courses...you have to do a little work.
He is a very nice man who knows economics.  You do have to work at his class, but if you need help he would be more than happy to assist you.  I learned alot in this class and found it interesting.
Lectures are VERY boring. Tests are all 75 multiple choice questions and very tedious. Try for Osmond. I hear he's easy.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for her clear PowerPoint presentations and willingness to help via email, though students find the course content and exams challenging and sometimes confusing. Despite these difficulties, she encourages attendance as key class notes are provided there. Overall, while effective in her teaching methods, the course can be perceived as dry and difficult, especially for those without a strong economic background.

Ratings.comment: She is a great Instructor however this course is a little bit boring.
Not bad, just make sure you go to class because that is where all the notes are. Also she is very help full when you email her. Wording on exams and quizzes can be confusing.

Maybe just because I'm not an Econ major and have no interest in Econ whatsoever, this class was very painful for me.  I don't want to blame Yuko for this since she outlined everything very clearly in her powerpoints, but perhaps her exams could have been easier.  The average for the final was a D.

summary_comment: The professor offers a relatively straightforward course with three short writings and one longer final writing, allowing for a mix of assigned and self-chosen topics. While he puts effort into his lectures, they tend to be somewhat boring and lack clarity in his points. Overall, the class is manageable with adequate effort.

Ratings.comment: This class is fairly easy if you put effort into the writings. There were 3 short writings (3 pages) and one longer final writing (8 pages). You are given a mix of both assigned topics and pick your own topics. Overall, he gives an effort for his lectures, but they are kind of boring and he is fairly vague in his points.

summary_comment: Professor Parsons is highly regarded for her clarity, humor, and engaging teaching style, making class material easy to understand and remember. She is very approachable and genuinely cares about her students' understanding, providing clear guidance on what will be tested and offering extra points for improvement. However, some students find her lectures fast-paced and her grading strict, noting occasional unavailability during office hours and difficulty catching up after missing classes.

Ratings.comment: TAKE HER CLASS. She is super helpful and really clear with everything she says, very straightforward, and you know exactly what you are going to be tested on. Has a great sense of humor and genuinely cares that everyone understands the material. Make sure you go to class (I didn't open my book once, and got A's on both midterms).

Very helpful, very clear, love her teaching style. She doesn't just want to get through the material, she wants you to learn it and she will help you. She'll tell you exactly what's on the midterms. Very straightforward. You do have to go to class though. It's possible to catch up after a missed class, but very difficult.

Professor Parsons was an excellent teacher. Her teaching style is refreshing and she definitely makes you think. If you follow along in class and ask questions, everything is very clear. You know what to expect and it's that simple. Definitely recommended!

She's funny and knows her stuff but she's a brutal grader and pretty unapproachable. I got a bad score on the first exam because she gave me no partial credit, so I was basically screwed on my final grade. She's pretty mean, and confusing with graphs.

She is funny and interesting to listen to but her lectures can be fast-paced. I found myself getting lost with all of her graphs. She told us we could talk to her after class but she didn't have office hours and seemed unapproachable to me. The midterms were hard but the final was easy and she gives extra points for improvement which I appreciated.
