She is hilarious.  Such an interesting teacher.  Sometimes her humor (which can be abrasive in a good way) makes her seem unapproachable but she is really nice.  Great teacher.  Write down what she says, listen, and practice and it's an easy A.  She says to read the textbook but you don't have to.  All tests are just on lecture material.

Prof Parsons is an expert in economics and is the most interesting and respectable teacher I have ever had. Class is never dull and the material she teaches is relevant and will stick with you forever. If she taught more classes, i would take them in a heart beat because I actually leaned useful information and enjoyed the lectures.

This class was absolutely awful! I do NOT recommend this class at all unless you are already amazing at econ. She takes off unnecessary points on exams and later when you talk to her goes "oh  should have given you more points". She doesn't help when you go after class and is rude about it.

Ms. Parsons is awesome.  She's fun and passionate about what she teaches.  She has lots of real life applications of the material.  If you have the chance take her, even if it's just for an elective.  She knows what she's doing and the tests are easy if you go to class and take notes.

One of my favorite professors at OSU. She is very fair, and prepares you for exactly what is on the tests. She's a complete genius, easily one of the smartest people I've ever met. She managed to make Econ 200 pretty fun with her own life stories. I'll take any class she teaches.  Very fair/easy grading scale. Attend class and take notes, easy A.

Parsons is a genius, but she has a dry sense of humor that takes some getting used to. She expects a lot of the honors class, so definitely pay attention and TAKE GREAT NOTES. Crystal clear notes/graphs will help you when it comes time for the exams. Exams are easy if you study;no trick q's. 3 exams, no papers or hw. book is helpful but not req'd

Very good teacher. She is very clear in lecture and if you take notes and draw the example graphs she puts on the board an study your notes you will get an A. Textbook use is not really required although it can help, but the class is pretty mug entirely lecture based.

Very easy class. Book is optional but I thought it helped me grasp some concepts. Parsons is a good teacher and I learned a lot. She does not try to trick you in her exams. The exams (2 midterms and a final) are the only grades in the class and come right from what she does in lecture.

Professor Parsons is a GREAT teacher!! Not only does she tell you exactly what's going to be on all of the exams, but her funny and witty commentary keeps the class interesting. You pretty much have to go to every class to get all the necessary info, though, and she pretends like you need the textbook when you really don't.

She is a great teacher and the subject material is actually very interesting. I'm an engineer so this was a GEC for me but i am really glad i took the class as it sparked somewhat of an econ interest in me. Just dont talk in class or make sarcastic looks when people cant do basic arithmetic in an honors level class. she'll call you out on it.

I thought this class was fun and interesting. She tells you EXACTLY what will be on the midterms. Its pretty much your fault if you don't get an A, because she goes over everything so much. Just take the time to study, and you'll be fine.

Parsons is phenomenal.  She makes everything crystal clear while making her lectures thoroughly entertaining.  I loved her commentary on anything and everything.  Her exams were very straight-forward, and I really did learn a lot in this class even though it was just a GEC.

Quick witted, funny, and knows what she's talking about! Don't be intimidated by lecture style setup of the classroom (no outlines, etc)--she repeats important points in various lectures. Try to keep up and take notes, especially Graphs! It pays off to ask her to repeat concepts and she's really helpful. For a solid base in economics, take Parsons

She is very good at explaining econ problems. her exams are straight forward. no book needed, just notes. If you don't attend class you will fail, if you attend and take good notes you will get an A. She ends class early and usually she rambles through random topics for 1 hour of the class and you learn for 30 minutes. Recommended to all
Awesome teacher. Best I've had at Ohio State thus far. Don't buy the book at all. Go to class and you'll do fine.

Parsons was a very knowledgeable, intriguing professor. She makes economics (a typically boring subject) very interesting, though you have to get used to her barking at you throughout the quarter. DON'T BUY THE BOOK! You won't use it, no matter how many times she says you will. Midterms were easy, final more difficult than expected. Great class.

Dr. Parsons is a very informative professor, likes to talk about economics and anything happening out there relating to econ. Basically straightforward information she teaches, midterms and final were easy. If I had a chance to take here again, I would, it was an easy A in the class and I barely studied for them. Book is not very helpful though.

Great prof with a great sense of humor.  Made econ about as interesting as possible.  GO TO CLASS.  She covers things from the textbooks but in her own unique way.  Exam questions are exactly like her examples from lecture.  I never opened my textbook.  Be sure to understand what answer SHE wants you to give, regardless of interpretation. Take her.

I liked this class overall, although it may get boring during last couple weeks of class but she has a knowledge about econ. and she tries to sink in imp. concepts in your mind..her midterms are hard cuz you don't know what is expected as part of an answer and she gives points arbitrarily...

This is the easiest class I have taken in college, honors or not.  That's not to say it wasnt incredibly boring, but I suspect thats what you get with econ.  Just go to class and write down her examples, because she literally does problems in class that show up on exams.  If you don't get a 100 on the first exam, its probably your fault, no joke.

You will either love her or hate her depending on whether you understand her teaching style.  She is very knowledgeable and direct but it almost seems as though she's yelling the material at you.  The book is not used, although she tells you to buy it. Attend every lecture and study her examples and you should do well.

In this class you will either understand everything or nothing. Make sure you go to class. The book is not that helpful. Ask questions, but this is not a typical class. You entire grade is two midterms and a final, and if you don't understand her teaching method you're screwed.
Go to class. The things she covers in class are the exact topics on the tests. 2 midterms and a final. I spent very little time outside class studying except for before tests.

She is a great professor. Her class is definitely tough, but she's helpful outside of class if you're struggling. Definitely make sure to show up to every class. It is essential to doing well on her midterms and tests because although the book covers the same topics, her tests are exactly like her lectures.

Good professor, interesting lectures.  She moves quick, and only has one way to explain things.  I loved going to class, but on "show work" midterms I tanked by not showing enough - however I am STILL unclear what I didn't show.  Still, I learned a lot, and I will probably retake her class to get a higher grade.
GREAT PROFESSOR....seriously take her if you have the opportunity, you will not regret it.  Go to class every time, do not buy the book and you will get an A.

Parsons is probably the best Economics teacher The Ohio State University has seen in years.  She teachers exactly what you need to know.  No essays.  Two midterms and a final.  No matter what she says, DO NOT BUY THAT BOOK!  She tells you to read it but trust me, you do not need to.  It is a great class!

A fairly easy class.  Tests are only 1 hour long, so make sure that you pace yourself.  Tests follow lecture material exactly.  If you go to class, you don't really need to read the book.  The entire class was very straightforward.  It is not worth arguing with her over weather you test answer is correct of not, you will loose regardless.

Highly recommended. I've never taken an econ course before and had no prior knowledge of the subject. Her examples and style of teaching made econ very easy to pick up. Did great on show work midterms but choked on the multiple choice final. Still ended up with a B+. You will not win an argument(she gives out some incorrect info on farm operation)

Personally, I thought Parsons was a great professor, simply because you learn the material very well. You have a working understanding of why econ works the way it does after you leave her class. Unfortunately, she sometimes grades on semantics. Thus, you'll either "get" the class, or not do so well and not really understand why.

prof.parsons is hands-down the most AMAZING professor EVER! do not miss an opportunity to be in her class. she's is funny, sarcastic & upbeat, & you "get" the material right away just b/c of her conversational teaching style. & aside from that, she has impressive personal experience which she brings to the table (she is a very high-calibre person)!

Horrible proffessor. Don't get me wrong- the class is easy as long as you pay attention and take notes. Don't buy the book, no matter how much she tells you to. She has a horrible personality. I hated this class because she is simply a bitter, angry old woman, plus she made a **** comment which was very offensive. She is too opinionated.

go to class!! you won't need to study much or read the book, but make sure you attend every class and understand her examples.  she's a little intimidating at first, but i loved her by the end of the quarter. 25% first midterm, 25% second midterm, 50% final (which is cake)

Great Prof, probably my favorite so far at OSU.  Go to class! Basically she will tell you everything you need to know to get an A so copy her examples down completely and don't leave out any steps on the problems on the midterm.  Don't buy the book, I didn't and still got an A but you will need to try hard.

At first she seems very intimidating and impersonal, but you get used to her bluntness and on verge of screaming voice that sounds like Katherine Hepburn. The two midterms are exactly like the problems and true, false, uncertain explains she goes through in class and the final is similar to the book in its basic concept questions.
at first I was thrown off by Prof Parson's teaching style-- she basically shouts at you. But  after my ears adjusted, i thought she was great. don't buy the textbook

Parsons rocked. She will not hand you a grade, and you will have to actually learn the material. However, she will teach you EVERYTHING you need to know. Just make sure you recopy the examples she does in class. She talks really fast, so be ready to take notes accordingly. Loved the political analysis'!!! :) A+++

I thought Dr. Parsons taught the subject matter very well, although she seemed to move quickly at times. It was the type of class where you'd be thinking "I don't understand this, I don't understand this" until you tried a few examples on your own, and then immediately everything fell into place. I liked the teacher and the course a lot.

Meh, I thought she was rather despondent and standoff-ish.  She didn't seem to care whether or not we understood, and when people asked questions she kind of shrugged them off like we were stupid.  It did not feel like she was pleased to be there.  Don't take as a GEC unless you're mathematically inclined, she assumes a lot.
Best Prof i've had at OSU!  She is so nice and helpful! Just Go to Class and study a little before the midterms and you will be great!  If you have to take an honor's GEC, take this one!
Awesome prof for this class, extremely interested in what she teaches and very helpful.

Go to lecture!  If she repeats herself, that's a test question.  She will grind the information into your brain.  She gets kind of frustrated when she asks a question and nobody answer, which is understandable.  As someone else said, don't bother too much with the book.  Maybe do the problems at the end of each chapter.

This was a pretty easy class.  All of the midterms were exactly the same as old midterms other than different numbers on the "math" problems.  GO TO CLASS.  Everything from the midterms is directly from lecture.  Little need to buy the book.  Two midterms (25% each) and one final (50 MC questions (50%) make up grade, 350/400 point = A,

This class could have been cut down to about 4 weeks once you removed all the repetition of the same concepts.  Kind of a control freak - stops class to make people move down to the front if there are empty seats, plus she stopped to yell at me once for talking quietly to the person next to me (in a 100 seat lecture hall).  Easy but not enjoyable.

Go to class, get a good grade. Most of her questions on the exams are things she has already explicitly gone over in class. She makes the class more interesting by discussing current events in economics as well. Very good professor.

Kind of intimidating but not so bad after you're there for a while. Good teacher--will hammer away at the basics, you WILL remember them. Go to class and get an A--it's that simple. I went to every class, studied 10 min per test and got > 95 on tests.
She is a brilliant teacher who knows her stuff and teaches with clarity and enthusiasm. Her only problem is the fact that she doesn't hand out review sheets for tests.

Tends to ramble off into different areas. Draws a lot of examples and they are pretty much whats on the midterms. Midterms are tougher than the final (fewer questions and higher point values per question, so if you get one wrong, you pretty much lost 15% of your midterm grade)

she's rude, condescending, and yells the ENTIRE time, but there's something humorous about the whole thing.  The grading is completely arbitrary and confusing, but it's pretty easy to pass the course.  it's also unbelievable easy to get a test score changed.  She knows a lot.  it makes 201 a breeze.  the finals one of the easiest ever.

A total witch.  Hearing her bark for an hour and a half will give you a splitting headache.  Lecture is unfocused and messy, she's unforgivably rude and biased, and you never feel prepared for her midterms.  At least the final was a piece of cake.  Avoid at all costs.

She is a great professor all around! She is great at teaching the subject and EVERYTHING that she puts on the tests is in lecture. I didn't even open the book and I got and A. If you don't like someone who kinda yells at you and makes you get involved in class then don't take her.
One of the best Econ Profs.  Absolutley hilarious and very knowledgeable.

I can't believe some of the comments on here about her grading unpredictably; it's very simple - if you go to class and take notes, you will get at least a 90 on each midterm.  Fiery and entertaining prof - kept me surprisingly interested with a fairly boring subject such as intro to micro econ.  Take Parons if youre taking Econ 200!!!
I loved this class. And I'm pre-med... She's great. She's tough and she'll challenge you, but I personally liked her teaching style. And be ready to be a founder of a cookie company : )
No Comments

LOL to the person two below...you must be in my class.  Yes, she is very rude and she did make fun of those majors.  She knows what she is talking about but she conveys it through a style of lecturing that may not suit everyone.  Her class will esp. suck when u have a kid in class that talks to much and disrupts every1 else's learning w/ dumb Qs

Professor Parsons is definitely one of the best professors I have had at Ohio State.  She is knowledgeable, funny and sincere about her course and students.  What more could one want. I have never had a professor impart so much material in such an entertaining fashion.

She is very rude!! First day of class we went around and asked our majors. She made fun of a Sociology major saying she knew the answer before even going to class and a Physical therapy major for massaging athletes for life and told them she it was a waste of an honor's degree. Those poor students were so embarrassed, I felt really bad for them.

Do not take this class with this teacher.  Our first midterm average was about a 59%.  Lecture is very unorganized and all over the place.  She basically draws graphs the whole time and is very very unstructured.  I am a pretty good student but left every class very frustrated.

This prof turned me into an Econ major, I wish that she had taught more classes other than 200 and H200.  I graduated last fall and was probably in the top 3 prof I had.  If you have questions just ask, she is more than helpful as long as you listen to her.  Don't need to buy the book just go to class.
Extremely unhelpful.  Insulted me in her office hours and accused me of not attending class, which wasnt true.  No way to know how she will grade ur midterm, not always how she explains in class.

YOU MUST GO TO LECTURE.  Her tests are based in the 90 percentile on her notes.  She is difficult though in that her midterms are all written out, supposedly to give partial credit, but it seems like she hardily gives any partial credit, normally if it is wrong but maybe explained partially correct she still won't give any points

If you want a breeze of a course, take her econ 200. I'm an engineering major and I got 95s on both the midterms. Expect to learn alot of very basic economic concepts in very little depth. She did make the course bearable with her enthusiasm.

absolutely worst teacher ever!  do not ever have this woman as your teacher.  i got a C- in her class but i managed to get an A in Econ 201.  explain that one.  she spent all the lectures going over very simplistic examples in class.  we didn't even learn half of what we were supposed to learn in the course.  terrible.

This is probably one of the best teachers I've had for anything.  She's very clear and she doesn't mind going over things with you 10000 times if you don't understand something. The grades are based solely on 2 midterms and the final.  That sounds hard but if you listen to her she makes it damn near impossible to fail.  PICK THIS LADY!!!
She made the subject very easy.  Her examples explain everything perfectly, and she made the class really fun for everyone.  I wouldn't take this class with anyone else.

Best professor ever!  I was so nervous to take this class b/c i know nothing about econ but she makes everything sooo clear.  A bit intimidating to some at first, if you make an effort you will find she in an incredible woman!  Go to office hours if you can.  She explains things so well and she doesn't beat around the bush.  AWESOME
A great professor, I learned a lot from her lectures.
Very opinionated, you will never win an argument with her.  Grading scale is not fair.  I learned more in my high school ecan class.
Worst teacher ever

She's the best professor ever! Her class is very difficult, but she explains things very well and definately makes sure you understand it. She's a bit scary at first, but very witty and makes the class enjoyable.

Holy Crap! She's really great.  Very intimidating so some people think she is a heifa but she's always talkin about her kids so she definitely has a soft spot. U just gotta not let her intimidation get to u and respect her and ull have the best time.
scary at first but fair and funny. helpful and extremely talented in her feild.  class is somewhat dull but she tries to make it better.  dont recommend the class but recommend parsons.

Tries to scare you for the first few weeks of class, but after that she is much nicer. There is no homework and the exams are straight out of the notes. I found the book very helpful, but many did not use it at all. She always kept me interested.  Very good professor.

Tough, but fair, and really knows her stuff!  Sarcastic and fun, she obviously enjoys teaching.  Don't bother buying the book - long as you show up to class and pay attention, you won't need it.  No homework - entire grade is based on exams.  Don't miss class - you'll be lost!!
decent prof.  class is somewhat dry, tough grader, but not too bad.  wouldn't recommend unless required.
Do not take this professor.  Only 2 midterms,and a final.  Does curve final grades, but midterms are graded very hard.

I don't like economics, and I still don't like it. She's an excellent teacher in a sense that she wants everyone to understand the material. I didn't get much help from office hours. Other than that, it's the best honors course I've taken so far - I actually learned something.

DO NOT TAKE HER!!!!!she is so mean and not even willing to help.  never gives particle credit her tests are harder than anyother econ200 teacher, take anyone else Help yourself now and do not take her
She was a tough nosed professor.  She didn't take any crap.  She explained things fairly well.  There were no surprises in the class.  Overall good teacher.

She really made me love economics.  Also, forces you to really understand what you are doing in class.  A decided plus in that there is absolutely no homework in this class.  One of the few very well taught honors classes.

She is a great teacher. It might seem like she repeats things a lot but it makes the midterms that much easier. She always tells us to do 5 of whatever she has done in class, but as long as you take notes you are fine! Easy exams!

Teaches like an elementary teacher. Repeats everything about 10 times. Extremely boring and everything you learn is common sense. Test grades are kind of shady; partial credit is almost non-existant. You can lose 15% on a simple arithmetic mistake.
Crazy class but it got you thinking.

If you go to class and take good notes, you'll have no trouble on the midterms. The final was harder because it was multiple choice, but overall she was a very effective teacher. She is loud and makes everything seem easy.
I thought the tests were graded kinda hard. She taught fairly well. I don't suggest taking it at an early time because it's boring. She's really mean acting.
She teaches well and gets her point across, but her grading is all over the place.  If she's in a bad mood or being picky expect to loose points if you don't go and fight for them.
She was by far the most effective professor I have had since I started college.  I have retained the knowledge I learned in this class, which I use regularly.

No homework. Never read book. Exams are the same year after year, so you can study off of other peoples' old ones. Tests are essay style, but she makes it clear what she wants to know. All you have to do is show up to class and you will have an A or a B.

Good teacher, but psycho underneath...nearly failed me because I couldn't be in class for a midterm. Sounds like Joe Pesci in class... "ok, kay, kay, ok, kay, n-kay..." Keep a tally of ok's one day, you'll be surprised.
No Comments
Great class for Honors students! She gives 50% of people A's and A-'s and you actually learn something (not much, though).

summary_comment: Based on student comments, Professor Gene Mumy is widely regarded as one of the worst instructors, known for boring and incomprehensible lectures that are often better learned through self-study or the textbook. Many students found his classes difficult to follow and unhelpful, with some even dropping the course. His teaching style and attitude towards student questions were particularly criticized, leading to a generally negative teaching evaluation.

Ratings.comment: Frankly one of the worst professors I have ever had. I basically taught myself the course material through the learning center. If his class isn't required, I would strongly recommend against it.

This is the first class I ever dropped (second to last semester). This class was impossible to follow. I attended every lecture and read every chapter. Gene Mumy gets annoyed if students ask questions in class and makes students feel bad if they do not understand the material. I do not recommend this professor- he clearly does not enjoy his job.
I thought Gene was a nice guy.  Econ can be very boring and he did not do a lot to spice it up, but it was still an easy class.

HORRIBLE professor. The lecture is VERY boring and not very comprehensible. I don't like the topic but he made me hate it. The TAs are kind of useless, they don't explain much and the tests don't relate to homework at all. I went to my TAs study session, thought I understood everything and still bombed the test. Lectures aren't helpful either
Lectures are very boring but you don't need to go anyway. He puts all of his notes on Carmen and if you look over those and the Book you should be fine for the midterms. Homework is also very easy.

So, I gave lecture a shot up until the first midterm. After that, I realized it was pointless. Lectures are posted online and the book is much clearer. Plus, it's impossible to hear him with his muffled mic. So, really you're just reading the slides in class anyway.  Keep up with reading and go to rec.

Gene Mumy is completely useless. He is arrogent and doesn't want any of his students wasting his time. He is the worst teacher I've ever had at Ohio State. Don't ever try to talk to him because he will act like you're wasting his time. All he does is read from the book. There is no point in going to class. Avoid him if you can.
Hard tests..really really confusing questions.  The Ta's are horrible, I spent 2 hours at a help session in silence while they tried to figure out their own problems.  Useless

VERY VERY boring lectures. I sit in the 3rd row and still have a hard time understanding his mumbling. just make sure you read the book and understand everything in it - and go to recitation. not that hard if you understand the material, but SOOO boring, I've almost fallen asleep in every lecture I attended (which weren't many).

Awful professor. Lectures are pointless since they barely relate to the homework, exams, and final. Lecture is long, boring, and is very difficult to stay focused. Just make sure to get a good TA, read ALL the assigned sections, and understand them thoroughly. Do not take him unless given no other option.

The class was interesting and he didn't lecture straight from the book, but he's kind of a dork and shows obvious preferential treatment towards athletes and preppy guys.  Plus he leers at the ladies.  I felt really uncomfortable during some classes because of his obvious staring.

He's pretty boring, and to be honest, it's not all that necessary to go to his class. Just read the book and do the assigned homework - the basic theme of economics is that all of it is the same problem, it's just got a different name. Mumy's not bad, and he's pretty easy, but it's just a boring class overall.

boring lectures.  he's lectures are straight out of the book but the book does a better job explaining things.  if you read the book you'll be fine.  the class is not that difficult it just takes your own time to understand the material.  get a good TA b/c that makes the biggest difference.
boring lectures but the note are all posted online. the tests are not extremely difficult and if you have a good TA it makes it much easier. overall its not a bad class to take just very boring

Easy class. All the slides are online so you dont really have to go to class. Need a good TA because they will explain everything to you much better than he does!! As long as you study your slides for the tests youll be fine.

Easiest class at OSU.  It is important to get a good TA, bc some of the material can be confusing during lecture.  It all makes sense after a TA explains it though.  Econ is just a boring class altogether, so you cant blame the professor.  Strongly recommend him, grades veryyyyy fair
Boring lectures..honestly probably some of the worst. He posts them on Carmen so you don't have to go all the time. Read the book, go to recitation and you'll be ok!
Boring class. Material not too bad though. I never went to lecture and still aced the midterms. Read over the book, memorize the sample midterms. You'll be fine.
BORING LECTURES, pretty easy tests, go to TA reviews and you should do fine
The most boring teacher I've ever had.  I usually never sleep in class, but I did everyday with him.  Also, he tries to be funny and crack jokes, but he's not in any way.  Do not get him.

He is a nice guy.  The class isn't too bad, just make sure you are prepared for the exams ( we got to drop 1 ).  Also, he posts the powerpoint slides from lecture on the internet so you don't have to go to class all the time.
boring class no matter who is teaching it. he seemed kinda cocky, but mostly it was bad just because the TA's were awful. I think one of them spoke clear english of the crop.
I'VE NEVER SLEPT HARDER IN A CLASS IN MY ENTIRE LIFE. MOST BORING MATERIAL AND PROFESSOR OF ALL TIME.
His tests are unfair...he specifically writes some questions to trick students into picking wrong answers.
he is so boring its hard to stay focused. this class just sucks.

the stuff you learn is fairly easy and you dont necessarily have to go to class if you know the stuff already. It is difficult for me to understand him because it was hard to hear him. He was like mumbling and his pronounciation is unclear.
THIS CLASS WAS AWFUL! I COULD BARELY UNDERSTAND HIM, MY TA WAS NOT HELPFUL, I DIDNT LEARN A THING
Boring lectures, just read the 9 pages in the book before your lecture and if you understand it then you can skip lecture.  Very easy tests, 25 multiple choice questions, thats it.  American!
AWFUL!!  Worst class I've ever taken.  Monotone and insanely boring, avoid taking his class at allllll costs!!
I could do the entire lecutre in 20 minutes and he takes an hour and 18!!
Very boring and the class is fairly difficult.

He's pretty good. The material is very dry but thats not really his fault.  All of his lectures are online powerpoint slides so you can just read them at home if you feel you know the material being covered.
Excellent class!

Was very boring but then again, econ itself is boring, not a lot he can do about that. He seemed like he was willing to help though, go to lecture and take good notes, then you'll be ok. The tests are hard but they're all multiple choice and it's curved.
BORING.  I need to make an audio tape of him so I can fall asleep better at night.  He thinks he is the smartest person in the world.
No Comments
His lectures seriously put me to sleep every time.
Very cocky, just liked to hear himself talk
His class is hard because there is a very small curve, but if you go to lecture and pay attention, he makes it very clear for you.
Pretty cool guy.  Makes Econ as fun as possible.
Not bad, entertaining for Econ.
Good professor, very clear and thorough, puts all the notes online. If you have him try and get Kieffer as your TA.
Very clear and elaborate.  I agree, he does think everyone is an ****
No Comments
Great guy, but he thinks all college kids are drunks
No Comments
No Comments

summary_comment: This professor is an excellent teacher who clearly explains concepts through thorough examples and is responsive to student questions, making class material accessible even for pre-readers. Despite her Spanish accent, she communicates effectively. However, her pacing can be slow at times, which may challenge some students' engagement.

Ratings.comment: She works through examples clearly and always does a good job of explaining herself and answering any questions. I would often show up to class already reading the material and that made everything very easy. She has a Spanish accent but is still easy to understand. While she is a great teacher, at times she seemed to present the content slowly.

summary_comment: Dr. Baldiga is highly regarded for her engaging and interesting lectures, particularly for students interested in economics and academic paper analysis. Her enthusiasm for teaching is evident, though her lectures can be fast-paced and her grading can be challenging. Students find her very helpful and the workload manageable, with some noting that attending lectures is crucial for success.

Ratings.comment: Very interesting class for those interested in reading/analyzing academic papers in the field of economics. Dr. Baldiga is extremely nice and helpful, and the workload she assigns is manageable and fairly graded. It also pays (literally; you do numerous incentivized experiments in class) to attend her lectures.
interesting class, difficult exams and homework. she definitely was an incentive to go to class.

She is a really nice teacher, who works hard and does her best to get the material across to students and make class interesting. However, her lectures move very fast and she is an incredibly difficult grader. If you're an econ major, you'll be fine, but if you like a good gpa, steer clear of this as a GE

Very enthusiastic about teaching and classes are always interesting. Homework assignments tend to be long, but are helpful in learning material.  Exams are quite difficult.  Overall, I would recommend this professor if you are interested in econ, but if you are just looking for a GE, your GPA might be worth protecting.

summary_comment: This professor excels in making the subject matter engaging and ensures that all test material comes from provided study guides and online quizzes, making it easy for students to succeed. Despite the general dislike for the subject among students, her teaching style stands out as exceptionally effective and caring.

Ratings.comment: I do not enjoy Econ in the slightest, and I had no problem with this class. She emphasizes the important topics and actually cares about helping students. Just don't over-think anything in this class, and you will get an A easily. Also, everything she tests on is from the study guides and online quizzes. Again, I hate econ, but she's my favorite.
She's great. Keeps everything interesting and has a genuine interest in helping students. One of my favorite professors of undergrad.

summary_comment: Dr. Osman's teaching style is widely perceived as ineffective and unengaging, with many students finding his lectures boring and repetitive, often focused on textbook material rather than deep analysis. Students complain about vague instructions, a condescending tone, and a lack of interactive or participatory learning opportunities. Despite some acknowledging his knowledge, the overall consensus is that his teaching methods are outdated and fail to foster meaningful learning.

Ratings.comment: I really liked Osman before taking this course. The material was boring and had very little to do with economics. He just went over outlines from the book telling you to look things up on your own. No attendance but random quizzes that you can't make up even if you have an excuse. 2 papers that have the strangest and most confusing format EVER!

I had Dr. Osman in his last semester of teaching at OSU. He was old, confusing, and cocky. I loved him as a person, but as a teacher he was god awful. Just read the textbook and show up for class. You'll do fine.

His teaching style is incredibly annoying. He hardly goes over the material you actually have to know and instead just tells anecdotal stories. He can be condescending and acts like every thing he talks about is common knowledge. His instructions for assignments are extremely vague and he even had to push back one assignment twice due to confusion.

Be prepared to teach yourself.  He reads slides made by the txtbk company & gets mad when you take in class notes.  Tests are basically identical to study guide questions if you purchase it.. but only helpful if you've already read the entire textbook on your own & taught yourself material.  Takes suggestions on how to run class but never uses them

Learn the material, don't memorize it. Osman knows a lot about economics and he tries to encourage students to do their best. A lot of people complain about his negative attitude towards note-taking in lectures,but the slides get posted on Carmen and you really do learn more if you are actively listening. The lectures can get dull; it is econ.
Lectures were a waste, he sped through slides and was angry if you actually took notes. Very rude but gave a ton of bonus questions for exams.
One of the most boring and easiest class in this university. Although he is knowledgeable, he is condescending and boring.
This class is very boring. He just repeats material in the textbook. Also, he requires participation and randomly evaluate it. The class size is also large. Do not take it.

Never went to lectures because he would literally read straight out of the textbook and yell at us for taking notes. All you have to do is read the textbook thoroughly and try to attend recitations. Tests weren't too bad considering he included a lot of extra credit but you have to know the information really well.

I never went to his lectures because he just flashes long, wordy slides the whole time. I only went to recitation and my TA was much more clear. Osman's tests are pretty hard. You have to really understand the material- he asks application questions; not just definition-based. Builds in plenty of extra credit though. Read the WHOLE book & get an A.

Terrible professor. Easy class. Lectures are mandatory but useless. He goes off topic all the time. Talks at a low whisper. Has terrible handwriting but writes randm stuff on the board and says it'll be on the midterm but it's not. You're graded on participation but he wants genius answers above and beyond what's in the book. Never taking him again

I'm taking macro economics with this professor and he is one of the most knowledgeable lectures I've ever had. The material is macroeconomics don't expect it to be some kind of action movie. And to the people who say he is insulting, you either shouldn't be in college or just don't have a sense of humor. Good professor overall!

Lectures are very dry, very hard to follow along. He tries to tie real world examples in but he can never get them out how he wants. He's also very rude and insulting. He makes you feel stupid and wrong if you are not an econ major.
He is very confusing and unhelpful.
This class is really hard to listen and pay attention because its very dry, but he tries to make it interesting. Offers a lot of extra points, so easy enough to get a decent grade.
Great professor. Very knowledgeable. Relates class concepts to real world events. Easy enough to get a good grade if you read the book and pay attention to most lectures.

Oppressively boring in class. Has hearing problems (be ready to speak up and repeat yourself) not particularly helpful or insightful on subject matter (dude loves the textbook and doesn't deviate from its content.) Mandatory participation is clunky. The grading's super easy, however. So if you want that, take it, just don't expect to enjoy it.

This guy is the man. He is literally one of the most interesting people I have ever met. Plus he's a great teacher. Very straightforward. You can get up to 2% bonus for going to every class, 2% more for doing a presentation, and on every exam you can miss 5 out of 30 questions and still get a 100% on exam. Take this class.

He is very knowledgeable, I took his Econ Development class and I really enjoyed his personal stories about helping countries. However, class is dry, tests are all based on the textbook so going to class wasn't necessary, around only 9 people show up consistently. I ended up getting an A just by reading the book. A lot of people failed the final.

Really knowledgable. Tests aren't that hard provided you read the textbook. His recommendation is that you don't take notes from his class, but from the book so you can actually listen to his lectures instead of frantically copying the powerpoints. I agree with this recommendation 100%. Read the book, take notes, pay attention, and study. Not hard.

Very dry lectures but follows material from book strictly. Exams have built-in bonus and help boost your grade. 3 MTs and 1 final exam (pretty easy). Rec. attendance = extra credit. Easy tests and homework. Do the reading and this is an extremely easy class. I ended up with a 105%. Remember there are NO grade exceptions, bumps, or curve.
Lectures are somewhat interesting, but READ THE BOOK. If you read and understand the chapters, you will be fine. Not bad at all.

If you go to recitation you get extra credit, but you don't need to attend lecture. Lectures are really boring, but he does let you leave early a lot.  Just memorize the book for exams and home works.  Extra credit available on all exams and the home work is really easy.

This class was more challenging than I expected. Dr. Osman is a very knowledgable instructor and is passionate about his field. His tangents about his experience in other countries are interesting. Not an easy A.

Super easy A Class. lots of bonus questions. lectures are not important, just read the text and do HW and it's that easy. 3 Midterms, each has 25 multiple choice +5 bonus. in every midterm! Wonderful (: Final 50 multiple + 10 bonus Wow
really just doesnt care. Boring classes and most of all hes just rude. I dont think I learned a thing from him other than to kiss butt.

Gives 3 midterms plus a final. You can stop going to lecture after the 1st midterm. Make sure you attend recitation, do most of the reading and the homework on Carmen and you'll have an A without much effort. Also, don't leave lecture early, he loves to engage the people that do.

His lectures are pointless. He uses the powerpoint that came with the book. He spends a lot of time talking about the graphs (easy to figure out on own) and irrelevant info. I never went because I had Econ 200 with him and I knew to just read the book and do problems in the study guide. All exam info is from book, NO SURPRISES. I got a 100.4%

All you need is 25 of the 30 questions and 50 of the 60 questions correct on the midterms and final, respectively, to get a 100% on them. The four home work assignments are easy and the lowest is dropped. All there is bonus for recitation attendance. Lectures are useless. Buy the study guide, read the book, and do the problems in the study guide.

Course is super easy. No reason not to get an A. Lecture can be a bit boring but he gives bonus on all exams and if you study the practice exams in the course text book and read the chapters, you'll be fine.

Literally speaks with the monotone of the "Clear Eyes For Dry Eyes" man from those 90's commercials. He's knowledgeable, but so boring. Almost nobody is able to stay awake for his class. Offers bonus on exams, but that doesn't make up for his lack of assisting students when asked.

If yuh can't get a B in here dropout. curves everything be a ridiculous amount. he is a rather awesome fella. don't go to class, ever. read the chapters and get some old midterms and you will be on your way to that easy A

he's a good guy, and will show geniune interest in any of your questions. his homework is easy and tests are multiple choice, with bonus questions. sometimes he makes me tired, he talks slow, but if you read the stuff and stay awake you'll do fine.

A demanding but also amazing teacher. He is really into helping you through the class, as well as into discusing any econ issues after class. 3 Exams, 4 HW, 1 term paper, 1 cumulative exam. The Book is mandatory. I recommend getting the study guide if possible. If you are willing to keep up with the work, I advice you to take Dr. Osman's Class.
very boring; he goes off on random tangents in class; if you read the book and go to recitation you can definately pull off at a minimum a C-; lots of bonus questions on exams.

Extremely easy class if you read the book. Don't go to class... its useless. He lightly covers the material but you still need to know the stuff in the book that he doesnt cover. I went to 2 classes and got over 100 on every exam. Lots of bonus Q's on exams. Take his class if possible and just show up to exams and recitation.

Most lethargic Honors Prof Ive had, even if he is a good guy. Only Honors aspect of the class is the work, his reasoning for a ridiculous amount of material.  Mandatory attendance, yet the entire lecture comes from the Publisher's slides.  He doesn't grade anything himself or write the exams.  Uninspiring in every way. 4 tests, 4 hws, 10 pg paper

Not a lot of work other than 4 homeworks, which are easy and lowest is dropped. Midterms and tests are really tricky. If I could do it all over again I would not buy the book and just buy the study guide. Apparently those are where the test questions are coming from. Study the slides he posts up right before the midterms.

This class was a tad ridiculous.  It wasn't that difficult, but with 3 midterms, a final, and a term paper... it was pretty annoying.  Everything in this class is straight from the book, lecture is useless.  He literally uses the slides that the publishers of the book created and reads them off.  Read the book and you'll do well

Started the quarter awesome, he was very interactive but after the first midterm he pretty much gave up on the class. just stood there killing the class with boredom.Made econ wayyy harder than it needed to be.
He was a good teacher with a nice accent

I'm usually an A or B student without trying too hard and I work my butt off for this class and have a C. I read the book and go to class. The professor is nice but none of it really helps with the test. His tests are multiple choice but the answer options are confusing. Grading is based 86% on midterms and final and 14% on 3 homework assignments.
Best Econ teacher ever! Show up to class and you will def learn something.
A very dedicated teacher. Open to discuss about economics with all of his students. Take one of his classes if you have the chance.

At first he can be intimidating (esp. in OH's-I went once and never went back) but I later realized that he is just trying to scare you into being more prepared and confident. An overall good teacher and I learned a lot but lectures can be kind of long and boring. Coffee will be your best friend!

Professor Osman's class is mostly based on the book and most of the lectures are simply to clarify and expand on the book. That being said, what he does add to the book is interesting and most of the time the class isn't too dry. His tests are easy, mostly because he builds in a lot of bonus points. Overall, a good teacher and a decent class.

You can either go to class and ignore the book or read the book and skip the class and as long as you pay attention and do the study guide you will get in the 90s on exams. Drops lowest midterm. Allows you to miss several questions and still get a hundred. Best econ teacher ever.
A very knowledgeable but sometimes hard to understand professor.  Recommended!

Once you get past his arrogance and realize he has a lot of valuable experience to share you will love this class. Uses real world examples to back-up his teaching. There is not a day that passes without using/reading something that you learned in this course from Alan.

I really liked Professor Osman.  He is really dry but he does a good job relaying and teaching the material.  His tests were somewhat challenging but there were plenty of bonus possibilities.  However he does not curve.  But if you read the book and come to class it is a really easy A.
Don't have to go to class and  he gives a high percent of bonus questions in midterms and finals

His 556 class was awesome.  The exams are a series of essays and they are always fair questions.  He purposely asks questions that benefits those who have read the required assignments and came to class WHILE frustrating the hell out of the slackers who skipped class and didn't do the readings.  AWESOME TEACHER, IF YOU COME TO CLASS
Dr. Osman is an excellent teacher. He simplifies everything and doesn't bore you with useless details. Would highly recommend taking another class taught by him.
Easily the best Econ prof i have ever had. Very smart man. Listen to every word he says. You will learn a lot in his classes.

This class is really easy. You can either not go to class and read the book, or you can go to class and listen and learn the same thing and do just really well on the tests. But you don't have to do both.

Very easy class. Attended two or three classes. I'd suggest the study guide/book if he makes one available, just take the practice quizzes in those before tests/finals and this is an easy A. His upper level classes are hard though...

pretty good teacher but relatively unsympathetic. Don't let him catch you looking anywhere but at his face or (heaven forbid) taking a note, he'll yell at you in front of the whole class. Read your book- especially the boxed material, that's where a lot of the midterm questions come from.

Painfully boring lectures.. then again the material isn't all that exciting. He reminds me of a Star Wars villain. 3 Midterms in essay format, two 5-page single space papers, and a MC comprehensive final.

Attendance is not mandatory, but is taken at each class. Max 1.5 bonus points added at end of quarter based on attendance. One oral report. Two 10-page papers. Three midterms, all essay. Final 50 question MC. Go to class, participate, read the text and you will get a good grade. My tip to you: Don't fall behind on the reading!

tips: don't go to class, you can teach yourself. read the book during the class time so you don't fall behind. do not cram for the exams, 18 chapters is a lot to memorize for the final. do the first 3 homeworks, last one is dropped so you can BS it. &be thankful for built in bonus questions! you can miss 5 on the midterms and get a 100%!

Starts off 20 min. of every lecture with current events related to Econ. Cares about student.All multiple choice exams w/ built in bonus questions, attendance=bonus pts. Exams are based 100% off the textbook. If you read the book & understand the concepts, you will do well. 4 homework (all essays); lowest homework score dropped.

easy easy class. you dont need to go to lectures just read the textbook and buy the study guide and do the problems and you should get an A.  He has built in bonus questions so if you get 25 out of 30 correct you get an A so pretty difficult not to get an A.
Very, very easy. Buy the study guide, do the problems, and you will get an A. Lots of extra credit/free questions on tests.

TAKE HIM!!!! Do not go to lecture.  Waste of time.  I felt obligated to go up until the third mid term however, even I gave up because his lectures are so damn boring.  I got an A just by reading the book.  Easy class, tests are straightforward and gives TONS of extra credit.  Learned a lot too.  Recetation is a must.
About 10% of all of his tests are bonus points. Never went to class and made an A+. Gives extra credit for attending recitation.

Osman's test are not too hard. They include 5 bonus questions on every midterm. The final included 10 bonus questions. However, the book is definitely necessary because his lectures are pointless so you have to teach everything to yourself. But the book is good enough to pass on every exam

Osman was a decent professor.  His Honors Money and Banking Class consists of 3 essay midterms, and a multiple-choice comprehensive final.  He relies a TON on the textbook, so does the reading and you'll be fine.  Sadly, although I felt like he cared about the material, he came off a lot of times as very unhelpful and lazy.  Just read the text.
He was a pretty good lecturer but he is very boring.You don't need to go to lecture if you don't want to. Gives you extra credit on the exams so that makes it easier.

I had him for Econ 200 and 201.  200: I attended every lecture and studied so hard, got a B-.  201: never attended class, never looked at his slides, just read the book, B-.  His lectures and PowerPoint slides are pointless.
very intellectual guy. normally wears the same outfit for lecture. reminds me of steve jobs (ceo of apple) who wears the same outfit for debuting products.

Very interesting guy.  Didn't like him the first few weeks, but once you get used to his style, he becomes a great teacher who really helps you and encourages student participation.  Read the books and raise your hand!  If you do that, the tests will seem easy.

I went to lecture once and was still able to get an A-. Lectures are boring and contain a lot of useless information that isn't on any exam. If you read the chapters thoroughly, you should do pretty good on the midterms and final. Not a free A, as the subject material can be pretty challenging.

Upper level Osman classes are very challenging. You will be expected to write 4 papers, each 3 pages single spaced, take 3 exams, and participate every day in class. In class discussions were very interesting and informative in learning how trade theory applies in the real world. Lecture slides however were boring and from the textbook.

Want to take a class where there is no real point to show up?  Take an Osman class.  He has no clue what's on the publisher's powerpoint until he reads it just after flipping to it, then he may decide to commment or go off on how great he is.  Stickler for attendence, and does not honor his own guidelines.  Can't trust his policies, and is a waste.

I had Osman for another econ class and god what a difference.  The other one I'd say he was border line easy, but 556 had four 2 page (single spaced) papers, four mid terms, and every class was like a test where he'd knock your participation grade if did not know the answer.  it seems unreasonable to mefor a 500 level econ class.

Professor Osman has an incredibly impressive resumé and it really shows in his teaching.  His lectures were intriguing and the exams challenging.  If you're here to learn, take a class with him.  No matter the course, you would have to be pretty ignorant to think poorly of his teaching.
nice teacher, just read the book and you'll be fine

I've had 3 classes w/ osman and meet w/ him numerous times. his lower level classes are easier, his upper level classes get more difficult, and attendence is manditory (he will drop your grade). he is extremely intelligent, and was very helpful in my case. he does expect you to read the books and put in you 2 cents in higher level classes

I attended 3 lectures the whole quarter so understand that you do not have to go to class what-so-ever. Everything is in the book! I need this for my business minor so I'm not too interested in economics as a nursing major--overall, it was an easy A! He gives bonus pts. on all exams. He seemed like a cool guy when I did go to lecture.

Don't bother attending lecture, everything you could ever possibly need is in the book. Exams are easy, there's really no reason for not getting an A as long as you have something resembling a pulse. Gives bonus points out the wazu, answering 30 out of 50 questions was necessary to receive a 100% on the final.

this class can be hard. it requires very little time and you don't have to go to lecture. however, his tests are pretty tough. he gives 35 questions and grades it out of 30. if you know your stuff, you should be fine.
easy course

He is one of the easiest professor in this school. He is very helpful. Hs exams are multipl choice nd he gives 5 bounous questions in each midterm (out of 35). In the final he gives 10 bonous qestions (ot of 50). Also, he gave each student 10 extra points due to surrevy that they fill in the final exam day.

Not good...at all.  Didn't put anything in layman's terms, therefore he didn't teach as if it was a beginning level econ class.  He didn't put the slides online and then flew through them during lecture, but said that he wanted us to interpret everything anyways.  Exams are ridiculous, my TA even admitted one was way too hard.
Horrible professor.  Never take a class from this guy. His tests are challenging, and the only things that you'll ever be able to learn from this class are found in the book.

Horrible Professor. If you enjoy listening to a guy talk about how lazy Americans are and how uneducated they are then take this class. He thinks he is funny and laughs at his own jokes. I recommend taking it with someone else.

No need to go to lecture, just need to read and take notes from the book throughly. I got a 100 on the first exam, and then they started getting harder. Don't let the easyness of the first exam fool you. Test have 35 question but are only out of 30 point so you can get 5 wrong and still get a 100. If you study hard you can do well

LOVE LOVE HIM. Best professor ever. He's very into what he teaches and makes it interesting to his class. Exams weren't bad as long as you read the book. No need to go to lecture, because his notes come start out of the book.

Professor Osman was a great professor. You don't even need to go to class but it helps. Read the book thoroughly, take the online quizzes, and get a hold of past exams and you will do fine. This is the most interesting class I have ever taken! Take this class!!

don't go to class, just read the book and you'll do fine. my only problem: i'm was having a hard time reading the charts because i'm colorblind. when i asked him for help he basically told me there was nothing he could do. it was frustrating trying to trace over the line graphs so i could makse sense out of them.

alan osman is outrageous on test days. He loves throwing candy at MLB type speeds but attending his class is almost discouraged because doing so helps not at all. Read the book and do the online quizzes (be wary of the incorrect answers) and you will do fine.

Class was easy because you can either go to class or read the book because he teaches from the book.  Do the practice problems on the textbook's web-site because those are exactly like the questions you will see on the tests.  Tests are 35 questions and he grades the tests out of 30.  Highly recommend.

Osman is the man, for a 500 level class this is very easy... All the notes are online along with sample quizzes and all his tests are 35 questions and he only grades 30 of them.  If you study its easy to get a good grade
I didnt go to lecture the entire quarter, i just read the book and got 100's on all of the midterms. they are MC, with bonus questions.

Osman is pretty cool.  You have to read the text b/c thats where all the test questions come from.  He throws in bonus questions on the tests which really help.  He's a cool guy who just talks about current events in Econ.  I'd recommend him if you can take him.
I recieved an A in this class and went to two lectures and no recistations. If you read the book and use the study guide before the test there is no need to go to class and you will get an A
Very nice, great stories, and really makes it fair for you to succeed

Incredibly boring and useless.  Refuses to teach any material in the book (he said that in class), so I refused to show up to most of the lectures.  What does it matter if he never says anything useful or interesting in class?  Spent a large portion of the class trying to convince people to go to a lunch with him to discuss econ major/minor...then
Terrible!!! Hard to understand, doesn't curve in a class of 500.
Pretty easy class. Tests are easy once you get a general idea of what kinds of questions he will ask. Teaches with enthusiasm. Did not find myself bored in class.

This is one of the best professors that I´ve had so far. Knows how to give good real life examples about the theories that he presentes. You don´t need to go to class to get a good grade but I highly recommend going!
I went to class the first 2 weeks and never went again and got an A. I taught myself everything by reading the book. Easy class.

He is a very smart man.  Many people have difficulty understanding him I think mainly because of their limited knowledge of the subject and prereqs.  However, if you study up getting an A is easily attainable.

Interesting class, I actually enjoyed listening to him speak. This class is easy if you just read the book and study his slides. He includes 10 built in bonus questions on every midterm which are a nice padding. Not very accessible, doesn't really care if you get it or not.

Offers extra credit on tests to make up for his inconsistencies in grading. The HW graders (TA's) are inconsistent compared to other classes. Reading/memorizing the book and doing online quizes are the keys to success on tests. Going to class helps solidify some concepts. His office hours are a time to learn about him, but he gives no free handouts, hints, or tips to your advantage.
relatively easy but you MUST read the book and try to understand the concepts on your own cuz sometimes he is just confusing to me. It helps to ask others for past exams paper. hehe

YOU HAVE BEEN MISLED AHHHHH please take some other teacher you will want to shoot yourself in his class monotone boring... save yourself now but if you can stand to go to two hours of boringness without sleeping and study slides you will get an A

Extremely boring... I was so bored that I ended up not going to class. I said I would read the slides, but ended up forgetting to do that. Basically, go to class and stay awake even though it is so boring, or else you might end up with a C+ in the class when you could have gotten an A.
never went to class, but studied slides online instead and got a 100% on all midterms and final...know slides well and you'll be good
boring and confusing... don't take this guy

Extremely boring and confusing.  Learn to read the book and teach yourself, because lectures are crap and TA's are all impossible to understand.  The only benefit is the built in curve on midterms (you can miss 5 out of 30 and still have a 100%)

puts the lectures online, makes his tests a possible 30 out of 25. Basically if you can teach yourself by reading the book you don't have to go to class and the bonus points on the tests makes it better too.
Terrible for honors.  gave huge pointless hw assignments worth 2% of the grade.  impossible essay tests, lied about curving grades at the end of the quarter, boring as hell
Enthusiastic.  Great at relating economics to life.  However, goes off on tangents and gets less enthusiastic as the quarter goes on.

Osman is possibly the most boring human you will ever encounter, you think his fake accent would be amusing but it's not. Also if you have a problem like perhaps a recitation teacher failing you by accident and ask him to possibly help you with the matter he will send you a quick cute little "I dont handle grades" back

Even though there were bonus points on the tests, some of the questions were still kind of tricky.  Not the worst economics class.  Questions come straight from the book or the website or study guides provided by the publisher.  Go over therse and some of the questions will be on the tests!
he is cool! atleast he is better than the other econ professors

yea he's not too bad.  tests are 30 questions but only the best 25 are graded so its not too hard.  anyone should get an A or B in the class cause he wants you to find econ interesting.  he's how most teachers should be.
Voice was very monotone. Couldn't hold my attention. Usually daydreamed or listened to music, when I went to class.

Pretty easy class. His exams are 30 questions, but they are graded out of 25 so there are 5 built in bonus questions. Basically you can miss 5 questions and still make a 100 on the exam. His exams aren't too difficult either. Shouldn't be hard for anyone to make an A or B in this class.

Easily the best class I have taken at OSU. Lectures were very clear and straightforward, and he offers great extra credit on all his exams. He teaches as a hobby, so he cares more about you liking the material than about making the class difficult. As long as you read the chapters and go to lecture, it's an easy A. I definitely recommend this class
Never went to class, got As on all the homework, got Bs on all the midterms, and took the final. Ended up with a C in the class!!!!! So boring. do not take this class.
Go to class. Read. You'll be fine.

I took Econ 200 Au Qtr and Econ 201 WI Qtr... Both were taught by Osman... Hes good... teaches well... Cant blame him for Econ being boring.. Most importantly his exams are sweet... gives Bonus questions every time... plenty of margin for error

Easiest class you will ever take. Test is 25 questions five bonuses questions added on. Final has 40 questions with 10 bonus questions added on. Don't need to go to any lectures. If you get less than A- you should drop out.
Not a good professor.  Boring and asks you to do way to much work.  But it is pretty easy to get an A if you do work, there's just a buttload of it to do.

this prof. was quite easy.  i never went to class an still managed to pull a B.  if you do all the homework and even glance at the readings it should be a piece of cake.  although class was usually boring and the ta might has well spoke in their native languages the class was altogether okay
No Comments
Worst professor ever!
class is a total bore don't even bother going. All his lectures are online. TA's are a pain in the ass because they can't speak english, but thats standard for OSU. Multiple choice tests are cake
No Comments

easiest class ive throughout my education.  madly curves too.  heard that honors class is harder with him.  did not go to a single class and still got an a.  just do all of the homework and read the book.
His class was the only class I failed in my entire college career! DO NOT SHOW UP TO EXAMS LATE, he has no sympathy for tears!!
This Professor was extremely boring and the worst class I have ever taken at OSU. All the TA's couldn't speak English and half the lecture hall fell asleep daily.
suck up to him (brunch sunday morning) he gives you an A, he finds out you are a Conservative C-!
He was bland, but pretty easy for Econ. Multiple choice tests, so that's a plus!
Beyond hard and beyond boring. No curve. Essay tests. Very hard honors class with arbitrary grading done by a TA.

Don't go to class, it's pointless.  Lecture slides online.  He has an awesome grading policy with built in extra credit on the tests.  If you don't get at least a B in this class you probably should not have been accepted here.  Easiest class I've taken.  Don't other with lecture though.
No Comments

By far the worst Honors professor at Ohio State. Extrememly lazy, incomprehensible, arbitrary grading, and no curve. He must be hard of hearing because if he weren't he would put himself to sleep. The honors program should be embarassed to have him on the payroll.

Basically this class sucked hardcore. I felt as if I did not learn anything because I couldnt understand him and my TA was terrible. I would never recommend him to anyone if they have to take any Econ classes.
Studying for the midterms in the class makes you feel like you are going to go insane and there is no way to know the information that he picks for the questions.
Never went to any classes except to turn in homework.  All you have to do is read the book and you will get an A in the class.  I never went to one class and I got an A.
Enjoyed the class, learned a lot, tests were fairly easy.
worst class i've ever taken.  None of the TA's were any help, and I never had a clue what the hell osman was talkin about.

This guy is boring. Plus you can follow what he is saying all you want in class, but on the exams you'll see that nothing relates to what he said in class. He is hard and many people that I knew in the class failed! I barely passed with a C-

Best class I've taken at OSU: why I decided to major in economics. Brought in awesome real life examples and told us how to stay motivated. However, my 501 experience was much different... (reviewed separately).
Boring but easy
Greatest Teacher at The Ohio State Univ
No Comments

I'm tired of people giving good ratings because they are a "3.3 or 3.6" student. OF COURSE IT'S EASY FOR YOU! YOU HAVE NO LIFE!!! On that note, had to take this guy twice because I'm in business and I have a 2.5 and I got B-'s so kiss my arse. (Had to keep it clean or else it would've been deleted).

This guy is increibly boring.  I stopped going to lecture.  But the exams are all easy.  I am a 3.4 student and I got an A on each exam- 95%, 100%, 98%.  The extra credit built in makes this class a joke.

Difficult class.  Lectures are boring and long.  Exams are not easy, even though there are built in bonus it is still tricky.  There was information on some of the exams that we never covered in class.  Good luck.
i loved this class and thats why i am taking another class with this guy again.
His midterms are BS.  No wonder the grades were so low.  I don't know what this guy is talking about half the time.

I don't know what the other people were talking about, but this guy was incredibly easy.  He gives bonus points for all the exams.  I'm a 3.3 student and I aced the midterms.  Very easy.  Althought they are right that he just reads off slides and is boring.  Worth it for the A.  Take this class.
very easy
Monotone voice; fake accent, obsolete, redundant class.  This teacher read word for word from his powerpoint slides (posted online).  If I wanted to be read to, I'd go back to Kindergarten!

"The quantity DEMANDED *voice booms* of students taking this course is less than quantity SUPLIED, and therefore I should never teach this class." Maybe it's just me but he seems to go off on tangents during lecture that never really relate to what he's talking about even when he says it does.
TERRIBLE prof!  his tests are unbelievably hard... everybody you talk to in our class hates him and would love for him to be fired!
Most unhelpful teach, once was trying to ask him a question, he said he HAD to run.  Dont let that mustache fool you, the online stuff is better than him!!! He should just be fired!

Funny guy, always has good side comments. Speaks a little soft, and if u're in a big lecture u can fall asleep. I stoped going to lectures after the first week. He curves all his exams with built in extra credit questions. Really nice guy, I took his class twice & told my friends to do the same!
boring and let me feel sleepy....
Best Teacher I ever had.  I miss him till this day.  He teaches not only Econ but life during his "fireside chats".  You could say I love him.
No Comments

The class is extraordinarly easy. I would rate it easier then most Gen Eds. Most of the material is old hat, assuming you did well in the intro courses (and attempted to really understand the material) you should find nothing new, rather dissapointing...
Easy A
Easiest class I have ever taken.
Forgetting the date for his first midterm was a problem and so was sleeping in class, but other than that, his class is a breeze.

If he didn't take attendance, there would be no need to go to class.  If you read the book and you are not an idiot, this is an easy A.  He gives ridiculously inflated grades, in large part because his tests are so easy.
His curving system makes it impossible not to get an A
I went to two lectures and read most of the book.  Gives a lot of bonus questions on midterms and final so he expects you to get an A and you should.

I only went to the first two lectures of this course and got an A. I had no prior economics experience either. Easy A as long as you do the homework assignments and read the book every once and a while. Horribly boring class/teacher though!
No Comments

EASY "A".  Do you know how its easy?  I went to class and read the book.  I bet all of the people who gave him a "hard" comment didn't go to lecture everyday or didn't read the book... easy A easy A easy A easy A!
Lectures are really boring. Tries to teach but is very hard to understand. Tests were really hard!!

Exam curve is friggin awesome, you can miss 10 outta 30 on the midterms and that's a 100%, and the final's curve is almost as good. He's boring as hell and going to his lectures is a complete waste of time. Overall an easy class, what else matters?
If you must take econonomics, be sure to get Osman.  His lectures are pretty boring, but he is very clear in the way he teaches.  An A is very attainable with the way he curves.
Terrible teacher! He is boring and as others have stated, just shows slides of stuff from the book! Very pointless and a big disappointment.
Very willing to help/communicate with students. Difficult exams, but very fair. Overall, a very helpful, good professor.
Horrible teacher! Don't go to lectures...it's pointless. And the final exam is a killer.
You will learn nothing about economics unless you apply yourself outside of class, yet you will still get A's on the midterms. The final exam is 10x harder than anything throughout the course.
The class was a cinch until the final, which seemed to jump many levels in difficulty. I got out with an A, but I was nervous after I left the exam room.

I didn't like his teaching style at all.  Look for trick questions on the test. I wouldn't take this professor again.  He makes what should have been an interesting class into something tedious. Don't even bother going to lecture.
The professor makes the test fair, however he simply runs slides of the material in the book. He has never actually shown the processes used to induce an answer.

Easy class, all he does in lecture is read the notes from the powerpoint online. Just skip lecture and study the online notes for the tests, they are somewhat rough. I rated the class bad due to the monotony and his repetitiveness.
Very difficult professor, tests are almost impossible.
don't go to class.  the study guide was the best way to get the material
Its not worth going to lecture...just copy notes off line if you want.  The final was surprisingly tough for me, but the first two midterms and the hw should all be easy A's with his hugh curve.
I thought he was very boring, but it was almost immpossible to not get an A...If you don't get an A in that class you will probablly never get an A in any class at OSU.
This class is easy if you study.  Lectures are useless.  Instructor is very willing to help students.  He likes patterns on the exams and don't let the trick questions fool you.

Since there were over 600 people in the class, it was pretty easy.  He had a huge curve.  I heard he's evil outside of class, though.  He told someone she might as well jump out of a window because her grade was so bad.
No Comments

he made an easy class a little harder because of the boredom factor....just do the homework, dont listen to him...he goes on random tangents that are potentially confused....i learned to stop listening pretty early in the class...
Once you get past his Dr. Evil accent, the class is pretty easy.  Lots of bonus.
the final is a KILLER
Easy A, Big Curve.  Don't go to class or check online notes.  Just do the homework and read the book.
midterms are easy, so don't worry about those.  I studied everything and the Final was impossible, I went in with a 100% for the class and got a B for final grade.
Insanely easy...lots of bonus on tests...no attendence
easy exams.  don't bother going to lecture.  read the book and review the notes on the web.
the best damn econ class in the land. What more can be said?
Could it get any easier?  I think not.  Example:  on both midterms a 30/40 was a 100 %.  Yes, you could miss 10 questions and still get an A.  Oh and the final was non-cumulative.  Enough said.
Easiest A in college so far! I only went to the midterms and got A+ on both of them. Really easy curve.
Easy Grading Scale
No Comments
don't take his 501 class--take P.H. Kim's if at all  possible
I like Osman.  His econ 200 class is easy and he tries to make it interesting.
No Comments
Osman can be funny sometimes, but his beliefs tend to be liberal.
No Comments
A little accent, makes it hard to understand what he's saying sometimes.
No Comments
No Comments

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as one of the poorest instructors at OSU, failing to effectively convey information and frequently needing corrections from students. Her lectures are often confusing, and students find they learn more from the textbook than from her explanations.

Ratings.comment: By far the worst instructor that I've had at OSU so far! Instructor speeds through lessons and is constantly being corrected by students. It often seemed like she had no idea what she was teaching! She says the textbook is optional but if you want to pass the class, you better get the textbook because you'll have no idea what she's lecturing about.

She doesn't explain subjects clearly, and was constantly being corrected by students in class, as well as correcting herself after completely explaining something so you have to start over. I learned more from the textbook than I did listening to her lecture.

summary_comment: The professor's teaching quality varies significantly according to student feedback. Some students found the microeconomic course easy with minimal workload and straightforward grading, while others described the class as boring and poorly taught, with insufficient engagement and overly challenging exams.

Ratings.comment: A super easy A for microeconomic. The section I took was no recitation. No quizzes and just HW (you can drop 1).
Good though. not that bad.

Boring class, regurgitates info from slides and puts too much of reading material on one exam. Don't take this class, this guy barely knows how to teach let alone keep you involved and focused. Terrible!

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her willingness to help students and her easy tests, along with offering extra credit assignments. She is not a harsh grader, but some students note that her English might be slightly challenging at times due to her Asian background.

Ratings.comment: She is a quite good one.Always willing to help students and tests are easy.She gives extra credit assignment too.Not a harsh grader.The only thing is that she is Asian and maybe a little bad in English.

summary_comment: The professor is generally well-regarded for his knowledge and care for students, though his communication in English is sometimes criticized. Students find the material dry but manageable, with clear guidance on exam preparation. However, some find his teaching style monotonous, and the difficulty of exams varies, with one being notably easier than the other.

Ratings.comment: He doesn't seem to know English well enough to communicate his ideas to students.  The whole class would bring their computers rather than listen to him drone on.  The textbook serves as the real teacher.  The midterm was ridiculously easy but the final too hard to get a decent grade.  This class is far too easy for the low grade you will receive.

I took Econ 200H. He is a really good professor. The material can be a bit boring and challenging, but he knows what he is talking about and he really cares about his students! If you want to be challenged (not too too tough though) take this.

He is such a great professor!.. still my favorite. He genuinely cares about his students and takes time to explain confusing concepts so that all students are able to understand. Although the content was at times somewhat dry, he makes the most out of it and is a great guy!
