The class is 2 midterms and attendance. Material is dry, but easily comprehended. Hashimoto is a nice guy, a little funny. He tells you about 20 problems to study for the tests, so it is easy to study for them. If you need a 600 level course, I would recommend this class with this professor.
He is a great teacher. Really knows what he's teaching. Exams are a little difficult.
I really liked him. He was helpful and experienced. I think he genuinely wanted the students to do well.
He is so boring it is mind-numbing.
Great professor, has experience and knows how to communicate with the students.  Make sure you go to class he is strict on attendance.  One of the best profs at ohio state.

Excellent professor.  Explains tha material really well and makes sure students are prepared for the exam.  He wastes 10 minutes every class taking attendance in the most inefficient way possible for some reaosn.

summary_comment: The professor is consistently criticized for her poor English proficiency, which hinders communication and understanding. Her lectures are described as confusing and monotonous, with poorly worded questions and a lackluster delivery that fails to engage students. Students strongly advise avoiding her classes.

Ratings.comment: She is horrible. Her English is criminally bad. Her questions are poorly worded. Often confused and dazed when asked questions. Avoid at all cost. Her class was a waste of my time, money, and effort. Also, I believe she is quite aware of that.

She is a terrible lecturer.You wont be able to understand or hear her the majority of the time.The info isnt difficult but her questions are terribly worded.Lectures are boring just uses the slide provided with the book and puts them on the projector.Give ec if you got to class.Often is really confused when asked questions

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded as one of the top instructors in the economics department at OSU, known for delivering a challenging yet rewarding course that covers relevant current issues. Students find his willingness to assist extensive and the material both interesting and engaging. Overall, his teaching quality is excellent, making it a valuable choice for those seeking a strong educational experience.

Ratings.comment: Well, he is the Chair of econ department, thus one of the best instructors in the OSU. This course is challenging but extremely helpful. Those who want to get a solid recommendation letter should take this one without hesitation.

Fabulous teacher! One of the most interesting classes I have taken to date at OSU! Incredibly willing to help as much as possible. Challenging, but the content is so interesting you won't have too much trouble keeping up. Uses lots of current issues in the class

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as one of the top teachers at Ohio State, known for his exceptional ability to explain concepts clearly and his availability to help students whenever needed. While some find his classes dry, most students appreciate his fairness, genuine interest in their understanding, and willingness to go above and beyond to assist them.

Ratings.comment: honestly the best teacher i've had at ohio state. he explains everything perfectly and is always willing to help, as in he will take emails until 2am and will meet you any time, even on the weekends. great guy.
Nice guy, but dry, soul-sucking class.
Very nice teacher! Highly Recommend

Extremely helpful, fair, and genuinely interested in the material and students' understanding of the material.  Attendance isn't mandatory, but he does go beyond the book in a few cases.  Quizzes, exams, and homework assignments were more than fair.  If your homework scores and quiz scores aren't 100%, you're not meeting him halfway.
Excellent TA. Friendly and very helpful. Knows his stuff and willing to take extra time out to make sure you understand everything. Highly recommended.
Great TA.  Very clear.  He explains stuff more careful than the prof.  Highly recommended.
BEST TA FOR MUMY...reviews are extremely helpful

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his engaging teaching style and interesting subject matter, making economics accessible and enjoyable. However, some students found his approach to class management inconsistent and confusing, and noted that grades were only revealed near the end of the semester.

Ratings.comment: This guy is an amazing teacher! Subject matter is all really interesting, especially for an econ class. There were four fairly brief homework assignments, and he provided all the website links you needed to complete them. No textbook!
He was all over the place with teaching class and I swear he didn't know Algebra. I got an A in the class but hnestly had no clue what grade I had until the last day of class.

summary_comment: The professor has mixed reviews, with some students finding him difficult to reach and unresponsive to emails, while others praise his clear communication and helpfulness in teaching. Students note that his lectures often include qualitative information, but tests tend to focus more on quantitative problems, leading to inconsistent performance on exams. Overall, opinions vary widely, with some considering him excellent and others warning to avoid him.

Ratings.comment: worst teacher ever he now teaches at webster university.i think he should not teach at all, never replies on emails and that is the only way to reach him.horrible avoid him completly
He was decent.  He didn't really care that much, which was pretty evident.  The midterm and homeworks were easy, but the final was ridiculous.

EASY class and Mark's definitely the guy to take it with...  interesting material and he relates it to current events.  If you can't get at least a B in this class there's something wrong with you.  To the previous comment, since when were you able to figure out stock and bond values without math?  AND he didn't take attendance for my section once.

I didn't like him at all. He only responds to emails of people he personally likes. His lectures are mostly qualitative information, yet his tests are mostly math problems. Has random attendance checks, so you have to go. At least I will always remember that Zimbabwe adopted the US dollar as its currency. It's his last quarter teaching though!

He teaches at Kenyon College now. No homework, practice problems not representative of midterms. class average was 46%. always tells his stories... 'when I was an investment banker'..that are not relevant to class material.. gets off topic usually.

He is a really cool guy and he leads you on in a sense that you kno what will be on the midterm and final but the curveball is that its not what u expect...went to class almost every time and got a B- only because of the midterm and final...whole class did terrible on them

Excellent teacher!  Communicates the material clearly, and will work with you so that you understand it.  Go to class and pay attention and you will do fine on the exams.  Reviews for exams,(pretty much tells you what will be on them).  Overall the best teacher I have had at Ohio State in 2 years!
gives helpful examples and practice exams. buying book is not a must. Take good notes, and anyone can do well in his class.

Longbrake was a great teacher...would explain anything until you understood it. Very helpful in office hours and willing to meet you outside of office hours to help. Would review before each midterm. Makes econ interesting.

summary_comment: Rob is an effective instructor who makes the material more manageable despite the challenging nature of the course. He provides valuable assistance and makes an effort to engage students, particularly those with an interest in the subject matter. While the class itself is demanding, his approach helps in understanding key concepts and performing well on exams.

Ratings.comment: Rob is a great teacher for this class. the class itself sucks, but he helps you out a lot. the homeworks take awhile, but they get you easy points. the practice tests are close enough to the real one so study those well. glad i took him over others.

This was a tough class, I worked hard, gave up almost my whole weekend to do homework assignments, earn roughly 70 of the percentage points and got a B from the curve. I don't really think the teacher matters for this course, its just simply hard. But he does have personality, and hes nice about asking questions during lab times, I would recommend.

Homeworks and in-class are completion and make up 40% of your grade, but tests suck. They have a lot of definitions and explanations and aren't close to the homework. Make sure you really understand the stuff in your statistics classes before taking this class. It will help a lot on the first exam. That's how I got an A in the class.
Cares a lot about students who show some interest in the material.  Made boring material bearable and focused on current macroeconomic events.

summary_comment: No comments available

This professor is highly regarded for making the material engaging and easy to understand, often using humor to keep classes enjoyable. Students find his classes straightforward and manageable, with clear slide materials that prepare them well for exams. He is described as approachable and willing to help, ensuring that attendance leads to good grades.

Ratings.comment: Easy A if you just go to class.
He's pretty cool and kinda goofy, but his class is enjoyable and he rarely keeps you the whole time.
He's pretty cool and kinda goofy, but his class is enjoyable and he rarely keeps you the whole time. Easy A if you just go to class.
makes boring material interesting.  Honest and cares about students.
easy class to get an "A". just go over any slides before exam.
Andreas is awesome, a great guy that knows what he is talking about and keeps it fun.

fun class. awesome dude. easy to follow. p.s. his jokes aren't lame if you have an opn mind! willing to help. go to class, you get an A. simple as that. He also understands attention spans of most people, especially late night classes.

awesome dude. easy to follow. p.s. his jokes aren't lame if you have an opn mind! willing to help. go to class, you get an A. simple as that. He also understands attention spans of most people, especially late night classes.

Very easy class!! Book is not required, all test questions are from powerpoints or study guides. Class is pretty boring,he attempts to use humour to increase the class interest. He wants everyone to do well and will give additional help if needed.

funny instructor, he has stupid jokes in class though. never wants to fail you. Very easy as long as you really study before the test~ The textbook is not necessary. He has the ppt online at the last minute. But my suggestion is to buy the book, because most of the things in tests are in the book.

summary_comment: Professor Nan Li has a wealth of knowledge but struggles with engaging teaching methods, often reading directly from slides and not covering exam material adequately. While some students find her resources helpful and appreciate the course's challenging yet fair curve, many find the class dry and unenjoyable, particularly for upper-level economics students.

Ratings.comment: nan li could not back 4 weeks from UK due to Visa problem--waste of tution fee, and Econ Dep. did not know what should do. She knows a lot of stuff, but class was boring. She just read her slide only. exams are not from text at all. she helped white only, but others at all. not fun class as an upper econ class. Take other classes for fun~!
nan li rocks socks. thats the end of it. she has slides up on her carmen so you can print them out and as long as you find the exact sentence in the book or slides your homework will go fine.

Course material builds on itself, so don't slack off in the beginning. Things tend to blend together and get confusing, especially during class, so go back over stuff every once in a while. Homework and test questions are very picky; the difference between the right and wrong answer is often a subtle difference. Curve is awesome, ~15%

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for introductory Honors Economics, offering a balanced approach that includes PowerPoint presentations, oral lectures, and class note-taking. Grading is based on fair assessments through essays and exams, and he provides comprehensive pre-written notes for students to fill in during class, enhancing exam preparation.

Ratings.comment: Excellent professor for introductory Honors Econ. Has a good combination of PowerPoint, oral lectures, and reading out of class. Grades based on essays and exams, which I found to be fair. He provided our class with pre-written notes where we just filled in the blanks in class, which was very useful in studying for the exam.

summary_comment: Dr. McCulloch's Econ 200 class is perceived as challenging, with a focus on quizzes and exams that are significantly harder than those in other courses. Students find her lectures difficult to follow due to her accent and handwriting, and some report feeling condescending and discouraged when seeking help. While some students suggest it's possible to earn good grades with diligent study, many advise avoiding her class altogether and seeking a different instructor.

Ratings.comment: Dr. McCulloch's Econ 200 class was easy. If you do the homework, read the chapters and go to lecture her class is an easy A.  Her exams are reworded homework questions but her quizzes are a little tricky.  She is a tough grader but that just means your answers need to be thorough.

She was the hardeset Econ class offered at the 200 level. The curve is built in-class based on 4 quizzes and 1 midterm and 1 final. Useless in office hours. Knows a lot about the subject, but can't clearly convey the material. Gives book examples which are more simplified than her test questions. Switch out!!!
would love to make sweet, sweet love to her while she explains allocative efficiency in the labor market.
Horrible, don't take her. Can't understand her accent or read her handwriting, not helpful at all

Beware of this class. She is extremely rude, and makes you feel stupid if you have a question. Sometimes I couldn't understand her. Her quizzes and exams are 10X harder than all the other Econ classes.Switch to another class you shouldn't go through h*** for a GEC class. She is one of the worst professors I had at OSU.
The entire grade in the class consists of 4 quizzes, a midterm, and a final
Avoid like the plague.  Extremely rude and condescending, tests are very difficult.  Expects prior knowledge for economics and does not treat like a GEC course.

Try to get a different professor! Her tests are hard and she expects way too much for a GEC class. Her accent makes her hard to understand sometimes and her notes which are only on a chalk board are hard to read. From what I've heard, other professors that teach this class are much better.

DO NOT TAKE HER!!! Professor McCulloch is cold, rude, and expects way too much from a 200 level class.  She forbids cell phones so text at your own risk of being kicked out of lecture.  The quizzes are only 10 minutes and she will literally rip them from you if you dont hand it in promptly. She is seriously frightening.  BEWARE!!!!!
She is extremely rude...ALL THE TIME. She constantly treats you like an idiot and makes an easy class way too difficult.

I thought she was absolutly awful. She is very hard to understand, and her lectures do not help at all. She is also very mean when you ask questions. Her tests suck and she is awful at grading and takes off points for the most ridiculous things. My advise is to try to avoid her as a professor!

This class isnt hard if you go to class and pay attention.  She assigns hw, or suggested practice problems, that are straight from textbook that is not due.  Quizzes are from hw, and exams are from quizzes.  Do suggested problems from book and its an easy class...if you can get by the boring lectures.

I took Ms. McCulloch in the 80s.  I've since earned an MBA and worked on Wall Street, and I can tell you that you will not find a better prof than her.  If you plan to have a professional career, you should not just take a class from her, but pay very close attention to what she teaches you.  You will not regret it.

I got a B in the class, but I would still reccomend that you run. She wasn't very helpful when I went to ask her questions and sometimes I couldn't understand what she was trying to say. I went to every class and still had to study. I found the class boring and useless
Quiz came from homeweork and exams came from her quiz. If you attend the class,it would be an easy one.

Not too bad, but the point is: try to sit in the front few rows and pay attention by communicating with her eye to eye; do homework (she will go over the correct answers) and try to attend all the lectures, then even you sucked at all quizs&midterm, you will still get a very decent grade.

Not as bad as some people say. If you're willing to go to class, pay attention, and work hard on the homework (which there's not alot of), you should get an A no problem. The quizzes and tests are straight from the homework, so if there's a homework problem you're not sure of the answer to, just ask her to go over it. Like I said, she's not too bad
Shes ok, the quizzes come straight from the HW, which she goes over in class, know the definitions, and the tests are like the HW, put some effort into it

Somewhat erratic when it comes to grading, her tests can be harder because they aren't multiple choice. Her definitions often don't match what's in the book and must be written word for word on tests and quizzes to get full credit.
Just wasnt clear enough to understnd and did nto explain things well!

she gets you bored to death during the class, but if you do the homework she gives you, here class becomes REALLY easy. The quizzes are identical to the homeworks. This course was the easiest A for me.

I thought she was a great professor.  If you go to class everyday there is little studying you have to do.  Do the homework problems, they are not that hard, and the exam is very similar to them.  Go to class the class before the exams she goes over a practice exam which is the exact same as the exam (just slightly different numbers).

She is so hard! And not very helpful at all. Very mean. One of the only professors who doesn't make multiple choice quizzes/tests. I learned nothing from her, always had to go to the econ tutor help room instead (which is an excellent resource by the way).

This prof knows her stuff but makes this class much too hard. She tends to fly through material not covered in the book; be prepared to write fast and decipher your notes later. She is willing to help if you come to her though and if she knows you're trying. Overall not terrible but seems to expect a strong background in Econ.

After attending her office hrs I was convinced she was a B****, but after taking her 1st midterm she asked me how I thought it went. I said "Horribly", I thought I failed (ended up wit a B+ on it). She said "Im sure it wasn't that bad" & it wasn't. I literally only went 2 class on quiz & test days & got a B. Make sure u read & do hw problems

I didn't think she was so bad.  She kind of comes off as a Euro snob, but she's really nice actually.  Tests and quizzes are easy and straight from the book!  It's impossible to fail her class.  Can pass with as low as 40%!

terrible. very boring, makes you feel like a complete idiot if you ask questions, gives no mercy on exams or quizzes and honestly makes you feel like a waste of space. avoid at all costs. no lie. worst teacher at osu

While she might not be the nicest teacher out there, she really knows her stuff. If you go to class and pay attention, you will learn a lot. She also has a nice grading scale.  You could get a 40% as a final grade and still pass.

This woman is rude, not very helpful, and very old-fashioned. She will make six lines on a graph all in black and white chalk and expect you to understand them. She does not type anything, everything is hand written and photocopied. She also does not use Carmen. This class is much harder than it should be because the instructor makes it that way.

I don't know what all these people are complaining about. I took her for a 500 level econ class and thought she was a very nice professor and was always available to answer questions. She can sometimes give you too much of an answer, but she is only trying to clarify the material. If anyone is interested in Labor Econ...take this class. It's good.

She was totally rude to the students and talked down to us whenever we asked questions.  I could barely force myself to go to class but she had a quiz every freaken week so I kinda had to... DO NOT TAKE HER, YOU WILL REGRET IT!!

Do not take this class. For all the tests you have to write out everything, from definitions to graphs. This is a lot harder class than Dunn's Econ 200.  Dunn has multiple choice tests.  once again, if you want an easier class, take Dunn's not McCulloch's.

I understand this is college, but an intro class shouldn't be as miserable as hers.Midterm Final and quizes are only grades.no multiple choice-which is fine, but you have to explain each answer to get credit.Need to draw all graphs and understand. lectures BORING(maybe boring subject,still).Made smart ass comments to students.if GEC, don't take her
Worst teacher i have ever had

I think people are being WAY too hard on her. I agree her class is so boring I want to run out screaming, but it's the subject mostly. She is very "old-school" as someone said, but the only students I see her come down on are the ones who are goofing off and disrupting the class.

This lady is a terrible teacher her weekly quizzes are a real pain and she has a bad attitude toward any questions students have, don't raise your hand or you'll get reamed! She may know her material but she is one of the worst teachers i've ever had.

I thought she was a very nice and knowledgable teacher.  The class was tough and she didn't teach everything very clearly, but I still enjoyed having her, she is very old-school too, but not in a bad way.
She was a wonderful teacher and contrary to others that have reviewed her, I felt she was very helpful and compassionate. She took additional time with me and made me work very hard for my modest B+
Just not a good prof. A very elitist Euro attitude as well.

She was probably the worse teacher I have ever had. Every lecture she would tell the class that we were stupid and she felt like she was trying to teach "elementary school children." Not to mention her tests were really hard. Avoid her class at all costs.
No Comments

First off she is a crazy German lady who would make people move to see the blackboard better and talk for the first 20 minutes about stuff no one cared about like the windows. She talked forever on graphs that we didn't need to know, but when we asked about problems from the hw she refused to help.
She was extremely unhelpful and was unwilling to help a student out.  I did not enjoy this class and do not recommend it at all.

People who were in my class complained a little too much about her, I felt sorry.  It was her bad T.A. who graded harshly.  If you read, no sorry, scrutimize, the textbook, you should be fine.  Funny, she's nicer when she is sick.  She wasn't difficult.

While I didn't do bad in the class or end up with a ruined GPA, she did make me want to stab a screwdriver through my head. She was very demeaning and condescending. Don't try to ask her a question, it just makes it worse. Definitly avoid her at all costs

She never explains anything and the tests are impossible.  The average for the midterm was 40%!!!  She's rude and mean all of the time and makes comments like "I feel like I'm teaching 1st graders".  She ruined my quarter and my GPA.  Beware!

This professor completly ruined my quarter. This is by far the most difficult class i have taken in my life. She gives written exams and quizzes. SHe does not belive in multiple choice unlike all of the other economics teacher. Stay away from this class!!
She is by far the worst teacher i have ever had.  She's not very nice at all and doesn't explain anything!

I think he is intelligent and has knowledge on the subject but unfortunately he cannot teach which is sad. I heard the same kind of comment from the fellow classmates so I am not the only one I think like this.
This is absolutely the worse class I have taken and she sucks as an instructor. Avoid this one.
The worst teacher ever.  Avoid at all cost.
She was terrible.  You never knew what she was talking about or how it related to the book.  Avoid her at all costs!!
No Comments
Total ****, nasty too
worst teacher since i've been here, try to drop this one and get another teacher!

Was pretty good at the beginning of the quarter, then started to get off subject more, and not explain the material.. I understand the first half, but I feel like I have no understanding of the material from the second half of the quarter..
Do whatever you can to avoid taking her class.
not a nice person. impossible tests
class was hardest econ class i've taken--and i feel as if i learned nothing.
She can be pretty boring and her tests are much harder then most other economics teachers. Find someone else if you can.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his engaging and interactive teaching style, which encourages student participation and critical thinking. Students appreciate his passion for the subject matter and find his classes both informative and enjoyable, despite occasional boredom from repetitive lecture content. He is known for being approachable, helpful, and easy to grade, making him a standout instructor in the economics department.

Ratings.comment: Very interesting class... gets opinion from the class, and is not just throwing facts at you. Gives you a lot of freedom on what you want to write about. Would highly recommend taking a class taught by him.

He's a very passionate teacher and always gives interesting examples. His in class activities are actually pretty fun and helpful. His lectures are word for word from the book-which makes it kind of boring if you read the book. He does take some attendance but its random. I would definitely take a class taught by him again.
Great teacher! always helpful and caring to his students. If you like to think, he will reward you. congrats on the PHD dr Lucas.
This is the second time i have had Lucas-as far as an econ teacher he is great
He's a great professor. Obviously really passionate about the subject and interested in teaching. Easily my favorite professor in the econ department.
Smart guy, very tech savvy and his external interests complement the lectures well.
Very helpful teacher.  Pretty easy when it comes to grading
Excellent teacher, knows and truly loves what he's teaching, very approachable and helpful. As long as you go to class and pay attention, you should do fine. Recommend any class he's teaching.
Great guy, knows what he is teaching.I will recommend any class he is teaching.!
Dude is a good guy, fair grader, interesting, no midterm! He is definitely in my top professors so far i highly recommend him. O ya and dude LOVES his water

Lucas is by far the most interesting Econ teacher at OSU.  He doesn't "take attendance" but does have you hand in a short answer question about the lecture for participation.  His enthusiasm makes you want to learn and keeps you engaged in class.  If you go regularly and do some of the readings the class is very easy.  I strongly recommend him!
One of my best professors yet! Soooo nice! And really cute humor. Definitely knows what he's talking about, always willing to help, fair grader. If you don't love him, you're crazy.

This teacher uses power point for lecture, never use textbook. and he gives minute paper during class and end of class, so he checks attendance.his class is very funny and helpful. I learned a lot from him. I absolutely recommend him:)

One of my favorite professors I have ever had in my several years and many major changes at OSU.  If I could take every class from him, I definitely would.  Work hard for him and he will do his best to help you succeed.

He is very helpful on the homework assignments and will spend the time helping you understand it. The multiple choice is extremely hard. The application of class material applied to the questions on the test seemed very abstract and was the most difficult. The grading and weight of the material was appropiate. Enjoyed the class!!!!

This guy loves to teach, and cares about what he is doing.  His office hours are immensely helpful.  Unfortunately, after he gets his PHD (which should be at the end of Spring quarter) he will probably leave OSU, so hurry up and get a class with him while you can!
Awesome teacher and dapper dresser. The guy is also a great speaker.

Difficult course - he's very clear about explaining the material. so you think you know it better than you really do. also, there was a bonus option and I didnt really realize it until it was too late - keep your eyes open for that - just in case.

Awesome and knowledgeable teacher.  By far the best in the econ department.  Lucas makes the class fun and entertaining.  Class isn't easy, but if you need help Lucas is more than willing.  Hoping he continues to teach at OSU.  Highly recommend!!
One of the best teachers I have ever had! His passion for teaching is so refreshing and he is  super helpful. The material is tough but going to his office hours is a huge help!
class can get confusing but he is a tremendous help when you go to his office hours.

Lucas was a entertaining teacher to learn from. He was very helpful when asked quesstions. He makes it clear that the class is not easy, but at the same time he gives you the resources to understand the material. He is a funny, entertaining that helps you understand the info. I would recommend him to fellow students!

He is definitely the real deal as a professor...from his approchability and uber-friendly demeanor to the rigor of his course.  His exams (1 midterm and 1 final) are quite tough, and not easy to prepare for, since he does not provide any "sample exam" or anything like that...but there is a ginormous curve.  TAKE HIS CLASS!

Incredibly nice and helpful; very passionate and just outright fantastic at teaching. Very good at relating concepts to real life examples.  It's very much a lecture class, but more room for discussion than with most.  One of my favorite teachers at OSU.

One of the better Economics teachers I've had. I was able to pay attention more...but that may be because he scurries across the room for the entire class; he's enthusiastic about it!  The only "negative" comment I can come up with is don't expect to leave class early or take any breaks because he loves to teach and uses the entire class time.
great teacher if he is teaching the class its almost guaranteed to be a good class. Would highly recommend taking any class he teaches

The best professor I have had - ever.  Very knowledgeable and very passionate about his subject.  Crazy sense of humor.  As long as you do the homework, quizzes will be easy.  Midterm and final required a bit more work.  Definitely one of the best classes I've taken.
Real Cool Cat. Very energtic and always willing to help. If the class is hard he does everything in his power to pass you.

lucas is by far the best teacher in the economics dept. class was very interesting and he knew everything! willing to help each and every student. very passionate about teaching. Quirky in a good way with a sense of humor. If you do the homework and pay attention you will do fine! He will double your final if your midterm was bad. BEST
This prof is the BEST. No dbout at all. This prof is def the prof you guys should take. SO nice so laid back easy grader.
This prof is the BEST EVER!!!!!You will not regret at all.

He's a great teacher. Extremely clear, concise, and entertaining. Complaint is that he made the class a bit 'too' easy. Lucas I know you will read this, so my suggestion is to not give the answers to the homework. It sort of turned the class into a memorization game

Lucas's enthusiasm is unrivaled from a teaching perspective.  My only complaint is he made the class too easy.  By providing solutions to all the homeworks (which were subsequently quizzed and tested on) it was easy graze over the material with little thought.  That is OK for some students, but it's not the best way to actually learn the material.
Great teacher. Do not buy the book. Tests on hw (which answers are given) and what he lectures on. Best Econ teacher I have had at OSU!
Class wasn't the easiest and its tough to always follow along but hes willing to help if you need it
Gives you everything you need for a good grade, just need to study a little bit and definitely do the homework. Nice guy, passionate about what he teaches and fair.

Lucas is a great teacher. It was great to have a professor who actually cared about his students. The class assignments were not too difficult, and if you went to office hours he would gladly answer any questions. Kinda quirky and weird, his sense of teacher was terrific.

Lucas is a great teacher.. As long as you go to class you should do well. Has quizzes but he pretty much give you answers to them. If you do better on the final then midterm he counts it as double.. Overall great teacher!

LUCAS IS SIMPLY.....THE BEST EVER. HE KNOWS WHAT HE IS TEACHING, IS VERY RESPECTFUL, DRESSES UP NICE ALL THE TIME, GOOD IN GRADING. I WILL GRADUATE SOON BUT WILL NEVER FORGET HIM. HE IS THE TOP OF THE LIST OF THE BEST PROFESSORS I EVER HAD. I EXTREMELY RECOMMEND HIM.

Great professor, very fair and always willing to help. I learned a lot from him, but you do not necessarily have to go to class(he is interesting to listen to sometimes). Overall just wants you to understand and learn the material. I would definitely take another class with him and would recommend him to anyone.

Very fair professor; do the work adequately and you'll get a good grade. Attending class and buying the book are optional since lecture outlines are online. Very passionate about economics and wants students to learn. Final was slightly difficult, but not too bad if you prepared for it. Gave out essay prompts in advance. Overall, awesome professor.

Great Prof. Knows the subject very well and is enthusiastic about teaching it. He also enjoys pacing across the classroom and scratching behind his ear (nervous tick?). Besides that, he knows what he's doing and is fair with his grading.
Pretty solid teacher, good at explaining difficult concepts and always happy to help.

Lucas is a really nice guy. He is very helpful and gets back to your emails right away. The lectures were pretty boring and not necessary to go to because he gives out an outline for each lecture.He gives you all the info you need to do all the assignments. Overall, the class was easy.
Great teacher. Really interested in teaching and had a lot of knowledge about the subject. Always explained concepts until they were clearly understood. Would definitely recommend him to anyone.

Engelhardt is one of the better professors I've had. He's so theatric with his lively hand gestures that even boring topics aren't bad to listen to.  He truely wants his students to understand his lessons and goes above the norm to make things easier on everyone.  Everytime he wore his bowtie it made me smile.

Pretty easy class with the best curve ever in college... went from what a normal C- would be to having a B+ and barely ever went to class... but class was fun, u can tell he loves his subject, and he has fun bowties.  If ur a business major and need an econ option... this is the class to take with this prof
His best quality i believe is his clearness on his guidlies.  if you fail this class you are seriously pathetic

Engelhardt knows his stuff! He's a very knowledgeable professor. He can make the most difficult Macroeconomic concepts comprehensible. Ask questions! Tap into his head! Keep him talking off script-it's much more interesting that way. At times the lectures are monotonous but it's more the content. Overall, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

A really nice guy and caring professor who loves economics. Engelhardt will anxiously help you with anything econ related, he even edited an econ article for me. The class is not as hard as every makes it out to be, just do the readings and go to class you will be fine. Most exam material comes from HW and sample exams. He is fair and prepares you.

Not the most interesting course I've ever taken, but E. ran an incredibly fair class that treated college students as responsible young adults. Attendance isn't mandatory, notes ARE posted online, but his explanations will pay major dividends, so I recommend going. If you must take 502, he's a good prof to have. Good curve, reasonable exams, bowtie
good teacher
Not too difficult... go to class, pay attention, take notes and you'll do well. He really tries to make things interesting, even when it's nearly impossible.
Great instructor, you can tell he really like economics and he is always willing to help the students with anything they do not understand.

Lucas is great, always willing to help. Is very funny. Class is intense, but everthing that is taught is usefull. Recommend having Lucus has an instuctor, he is the best Econ instructor I have had yet.
hilarious and loves to get chalk everywhere besides the chalkboard!!!!
The best professor Ohio State has to offer.   Take his course.  He cares about his job, but cares about teaching more.  Exteremely fair and helpful.

instead of calculations, he concentrates more on graphs and explanation, which is really useful if you want to practice your logic and  learn real economics. there are only a few homeworks but need to be done carefully. midterm is a little bit hard, but he will offer a huge curve. final is fair. if you want to get A, just work hard, and it deserves
He is excellent!
He was very fair.  This class wasn't cake nor impossible.  The format of the class/his teaching pushed me to try harder as a student.  Good student experience.  Would recommend Lucas!

Very good professor, Hw's due on tuesdays, Quizes are on thursdays for BONUS points.  Midterms are tricky but fair, learn lecture material and read book.  At end of class if you do better on the final, he will split that grade in half and use it for your midterms... 25 of 50 questions on the final were VERBATIM from midterms 1 & 2,answers switched.
Really encouraged students learning. Very good teacher.
Draws out lectures to pass time, inevitably repeating himself.  Some may find this helpful, but I'd rather sleep.  Do the homework and understand it, easy A!
Very nice Professor! If you just study a little bit and you will get A~ Highly recommend to everyone!
good teacher,care if students understand materials.
Helpful and care about teaching you what he feels passionate about. Great teacher in my words.
post notes online, very helpful, lucas really wants everyone to learn and understand. he gives opportunity for extra credit. i would recommend him to anyone who is taking economics

Lucas is a pretty sweet dude.  He's rather quirky while giving lectures, however, that makes them enjoyable (it beats sitting through a 2 hour monotone lecture).  His tests are rather easy - if you do the homeworks and quizzes, you should have no problem getting an A on the tests.  In 4 years at OSU, he's one of the best teachers I've had.
Text book is highly recommened. All stuff shown in lecture is from the text book. The exams are ok. Final is easier than the midterms.

The greatest class format, and the fairest prof. Students are not babied nor are their grades.  Two incredibly fair knowledge fests and a final megafest. 25 and 50 points, respectively.  Homeworks and quizzes are extra point bonus points. If you want to learn Economics, Engelhardt lays it out for you.  And he's hilarious.
Cool professor

only one big term paper, but a final which is weird. also, the six short papers are only worth 6 points each, but he makes it very hard to get full credit. that can hurt in the end, as the points missed add up and it also makes the final and the term paper less importnat relatively. i still got an A though. i recommend the teacher after all!
a lot of interesting topics covered throughout the quarter.  Much more stimulating than supply and demand graphs.  Fun class overall.

Overall, Great teacher. Very interesting course. As mentioned very difficult to get an A since the curve is only top 20% with 40 people. Definitely go to classes for quizzes. Quizzes are based on readings so at least skim the chapters. Very enthusiastic and extremely interested in students. Only prof that ever asked us to use ratemyprof

The prof is very fair with the grading and is very willing to help students.  If you do your work and go to class (though not mandatory, quizzes can make a big difference in your grade) you'll at least come out with a pretty good grade.  Getting someone to edit your papers is the surest shot to do very well in the class.
Basically if you do all of your work, you'll get a good grade

Very difficult to achieve an A, however, he is fair. Don't miss any quizzes, a couple points can make the difference between an A- and an A. Ask for feedback on everything, especially term papers so that you know what is expected. Start Strong and finish strong to be successful in this class.
Very interested and knowledgable in economics. GO TO CLASS, otherwise your fellow classmates will get a quiz based on attendance! The GRADER IS A LIE!
Dedicated prof who is very interested/knowledgeable in economics. He is a very nice guy who is concerned with helping students. Would take another class with this prof if possible.

Great Professor, actually speaks english...really helps with your writing, i know personally i learned a lot about my own writing after i took this class.  we also had numerous debates that were typically a lot of fun to take part in.  if you have a chance to take this class with this professor i highly suggest it
Well organized and knows subject matter well.
Pretty good proffesor loves to help students out and loves when you come by his office hours. His classes aren't too hard but they're not easy either generous on grading.
Good Guy. Willing to help when you need it. Any semi-committed student should recieve the grade they want.
Good debates, refuses to give perfect grades on anything though.
fun class, he is open to all sides of the debate not just liberal side of things

summary_comment: Professor Sungu is widely regarded as either one of the worst or one of the best depending on the student's perspective. Some find his teaching methods challenging and his grading strict, while others appreciate his helpfulness and the opportunity for extra credit. His lectures are sometimes criticized for lack of practical examples and clarity, though he emphasizes attendance and class participation.

Ratings.comment: Literally the worst professor I have had in FSB (Miami U).  Class was 100 points, giving no room for messing up.  "Curves" the exams, but then does not state the curve.  Loved to hear himself talk in lectures and gave no practice problems ect.  Exam reviews not similar to actual exams.  List goes on.  First C in college & not happy about it.
Burak is the best, too bad he's not teaching here now
a lot of work but all graded loosely
the 2nd writing class, so it's kind of hard.. but Prof. Sungu helped every student a lot~!
If you attend all class with taking class notes, you are all right. Attendance is mandatory, so people who complains are mostly did not attend most of the class. Prof. Sungu is very helpful.
Says he is easy but think again, worst professor i have ever had.

Says he is easy all the time and tries to console people on how easy he will grade midterms. If you really want a good GPA write the bonus paper, but it might not help much. The text book contradicts a lot of what he says, but when it comes to the test write what he says if you want it to be considered correct.

One of the worst professors I have ever had.  Literally had no knowledge of the material he was teaching.  Often gave false information that was disproven by entire chapters in the textbook we did not use.  Anyone should be able to get an A in the class, but that is because he encourages you to cheat.  He should be fired.

Super easy A class! He gave 2 midterms and dropped the lower. Study the mid-term practice test because a lot of questions are comming from that. No paper, no presentation, yes homework. Final was comprehensive, but don't worry about it. Visit his office 'cause he's so helpful. Everyone in my class loved him! I wish he teached more classes.

EASY EASY EASY EASY. pretty much tells you you will get an A if you can breath. urges you not to come to class because he signs to many people into his full class (everyone wants to take it cuz its sooooo easy) good sense of humor. overall i just want to stress how EASY this class is. what a joke. LOVE IT!

summary_comment: Professor Alex is known for being very helpful and approachable, but his class is considered challenging due to its heavy reliance on two midterms and one final exam for grading, with a total of only 60 points available. This makes it difficult to recover from mistakes, as there are few opportunities for additional points.

Ratings.comment: Alex is really nice and helpful but his class is somewhat difficult. There is no homework; your only grades are the 2 midterms and the final, and the course is only 60 pts so there's very little room for error. I wish there had been some other points to balance out the grading.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her clear and organized teaching style, demonstrating deep knowledge of the subject matter and an ability to simplify complex concepts effectively. Her anticipatory approach to addressing students' questions and potential difficulties further enhances the learning experience. However, some students find her lectures challenging to follow due to her focus on writing on the board, which can make it difficult to understand her explanations.

Ratings.comment: Very clear and organized TA. She knows the material really well and makes complicated problems much easier for me to understand.
Great TA, with a flair for the dramatic. Knows the material very well. Anticipates our questions and problems.
Have 5 quizes throughout the semester,and she is very hard to understand. She talks to the board and all the work is hard.

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as subpar, with students finding his classes monotonous and the material challenging. Despite some achieving good grades, many feel they did not gain clear understanding or practical knowledge from the course.

Ratings.comment: What an awful professor, boring on class but attendance is mandatory. The tests are difficult! An sordid professor doing underground monetary transaction no one can tell.
worst professor ever. make sure you never take his class.
Worst professor ever. Although I got an A- I was not sure what exactly I learned in last semester. No answers to problem questions and he wasn't willing to help.

summary_comment: Professor Steckel is highly regarded for his passion and knowledge, making complex subjects engaging and ensuring students learn effectively. While some find his grading stringent and the workload demanding, particularly with the group project, most agree that attending classes, taking good notes, and creating detailed outlines are key to success. His clear presentations and straightforward tests contribute to a generally positive learning experience.

Ratings.comment: The class was extremely interesting at the beginning of the semester, but it got progressively more boring. However, Steckel is an awesome teacher, very passionate about his field, and I learned a lot. He makes a rather boring (at times) subject enjoyable, manageable. Fair (maybe generous) grader. Take notes, make good outlines, and you'll do fine.

This professor is extremely knowledgeable and communicates his points clearly. However, he is one of the toughest graders I have encountered. In order to achieve a high grade, you must write EXACTLY what he said in class--no deviation. I missed too many points due to this.

One of the best teachers I've ever had. Steckel knows the material well and presents it in an interesting way. I really enjoyed this class and would recommend this professor to anybody. If I could take another class of his, I would.

Take this professor! You will learn a whole lot. Prof. Steckel is brilliant and his lectures are very interesting. Essay midterm and final are great tests, make good outlines and you'll do fine. However, the group project is a bit of a pain. I would have preferred it to be worth about 15% of the final grade instead of 30%. Steckel is a class act.
Very clear, attend class, pay attention, and make good outlines for the essay tests and you will do just fine.
He is a wonderful teacher.  He knows his materials and clearly presents them.  His midterm and final are simple essays.  Each question is taken from the lectures.

This class was pretty good.  There was a lot of interesting, useful material, and the tests were straightforward.  Group project was kind of annoying, but just do your work and study for the tests and you'll do fine.  But I guess that's true for any class.

I was interested in the material for the first class and a half.  After that, I couldn't stay awake in class.  He's a really nice guy, but a hard grader.  If you're here to get a good GPA, then don't take his class.  If you can't take criticism, then don't take his class.  If you really want to learn the material, then I suggest you take it.

He really knows what he's talking about in this class.  I found it interesting.  Make sure you go to class and pay attention to details.  You need to be able to quote numbers and examples on the essay exams.  The group project is a pain.

I took two of his classes and he tests the same in both: you must say EXACTLY what he wants anything less and U will get ripped up.Hard grader. Dont take this class unless you have to. Go into his extra hours and havem HIM write your "outlines".  If you dont, ur GPA will slide.  Dont be misled b/c hes nice in class.

Tough but fair grader. Did tend to go off on tangents but if you think about it they always related in some way to the topic at hand. Knew the material really well. The class coudl do without the research paper or be better off with some modified version of it, Very tough to coordinate times to meet for such large groups I would take him again
His class isn't that bad once you figure out how to take his tests.  We studied in groups, which helps a lot.  He's a very smart guy and really nice.

TERRIBLE! He totally rips you on tests unless you say exactly what he wants. The outlines are a stupid way to grade the essays.  He harps on little details and takes off HUGE if you forget any in the essay. He made us do group papers on a pre-assigned topic, & the topics didn't relate to class at all. Class is a total waste of time & money.

HORRIBLE! worst professor i have ever had here. his test are set up so hardly anyone does well and then his reasons for grading you poorly are that you did not have 1 little detail in your essay.  i would not recommend him to anyone.  if you like a good GPA, take someone else. awful...just...awful.

STAY AWAY!!! Horible teacher!!  His lectures always stray off topic and he mumbles the important parts.  Looks for key words in essay final and if you dont have the word but have the concept, you still fail.  Imposible to relate to him.  Other teachers are amazing at teaching 515/516 but he sucks!!!

his test are a scam. if you can figure out the formula, you get an A, otherwise you get screwed. I went to a review session and he gave us outlines for each essay on the exam, when i followed them, i ended up with a horrible grade.  very boring and only cares about his research project. try to avoid
VERY VERY BORING. Nice guy but staying awake in class was a real strugle. Plus your grade was 40% midterm and 60% final which sucks.
Boring to listen to.  He goes over details slowly and a lot of people sleep and he doesn't seem to notice.  He doesnn't realize that no one can pay attention even if you try hard.  Boring...

summary_comment: The professor is generally considered effective and easy-going, with clear explanations and a focus on practical application rather than theoretical concepts. However, some students find the class challenging, particularly those without a background in calculus, due to the heavy reliance on mathematical models. Overall, the class is recommended for its ease of grading and manageable workload, but requires consistent attendance and engagement with the material.

Ratings.comment: This class was not what I expected. As an econ major I thought this class would be an easy elective but I was very wrong. I would not recommend if you haven't previously taken calculus. There's a ton of math involved and little theory based questions. I wouldn't recommend as an Economics elective.

You will not pass if you dont attend because the models are explained in class. The models are what you are tested on. When he proofs the models, he can be confusing due to his mathematical aptitude, but he will stay to help. This class is basically game theory intro. Some calculus is needed, mainly the power rule. Gov regs for bus. are explained.
Very Easy.
This professor is awesome! I recommend taking his class. No textbook, easy grader, two papers and a final.

I took econ 583 and 2367 with Ross, and they were both easy A classes where you learn a lot! In the writing course we had 2 papers (5 pages each), 4 current-event assignments (1 page each), a group presentation  and a final.. If you do all that he asks you to do (which is not that much!) there is no reason to get less than an A!

Ross explains everything so clearly, and he is also helpful and easy going. We have some pop quizzes so people will show up in lecture, and his exams are mostly from the slides. I have no idea about sports and I did very well in that class. If you don't manage to get at least A- in this class, then maybe college is not for you.

summary_comment: This professor at Ohio State is consistently rated poorly for their teaching quality. Students find the lectures difficult to follow due to soft speaking and unclear explanations, and the lack of practical examples further complicates understanding. Despite some positive remarks about the textbook's companion material and occasional grading curves, many students feel frustrated and confused, ultimately struggling to grasp the course content.

Ratings.comment: Worst I've had at Ohio State. Speaks very softly, runs through slides in class. Very difficult to understand. Works problems out on the board but rarely plugs in numbers for realistic examples - not much clarity from equations loaded with variables.   The textbook had online companion material (for $80) that was very helpful & got me through.

Took this class to fulfill Economics Minor requirement over the summer. The class is hard and grade averages were frequently in the "D" range, but there was a nice curve at the end. If you stick with the class and don't drop, you'll be fine.

Absolutely awful teacher, mutters through the slides he reads to you, occasionally does work on the board that leaves you more confused than when you started. Had to drop the class at the last minute because I was barely managing a C.
Not helping... not encouraging... confusing... literally have to teach myself through textbook reading... did not communicate course materials clearly... makes me feel upset to go to class.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for her engaging lectures and fair testing methods, with many students recommending attending class and utilizing the provided resources for extra credit. Her clear and organized PowerPoint presentations are often sufficient for exam preparation, and she offers substantial extra credit opportunities through recitation attendance and participation. While some find her lectures dry and boring, the overall consensus is that her teaching quality is excellent, making the class manageable and rewarding for those who engage with the material.

Ratings.comment: Her lectures are not boring at all and usually her tests are extremely fair. If you use the student guide she recommends you will do very well on the exams. Do all the homework and take all the quizzes in recitation for extra credit! It got me to an A!

Gives many extra credit. Sit in the front row so you can hear. Extremely nice grade distribution. Very kind lady. All lectures for the entire year is posted online from day 1. Materials very direct and easy to understand. Would recommend.

Has all the lectures online, but that doesn't mean you don't have to go to class. She is honestly like your grandma, she cares for you dearly. Make sure to go to recitation because you get extra credit! Class is out of 100 points only, and you can get up to 7% EC! Either takes 2 Midterms & Final, or Final x 2, depending whichever one is higher.

Professor Dunn is extremely passionate about the economy and is good at making concepts relatable to students. Content was often dry and hard to make interesting, which led to long lectures, but they are still worth going to. I did fine on the two midterms without reading the textbook, and all homework and quizzes are extra credit. Would recommend.

Very clear and organized lectures, she says that you should read the text book but it's not necessary because everything on the exams is from her power points. If you go to lectures or just print out the power points you will be fine.  There is no need to even buy the book so don't waste your money. Extra credit for going to recitation too.

This class isn't bad. Simply show up to lecture, take notes, and study for the two exams and one final.  I bought both books recommended by her, but I only ever used them once or twice. It's a huge lecture, but she's a focused lady, and she's fairly entertaining. Easy class for me.

Incredibly boring lectures. If you decide to go, bring something else to do so you won't fall asleep. Don't get the two books either, I never opened either of them. There are quizzes and homework in recitation, but both are extra credit.
Boring lectures, aren't necessary, study the power point and u'll be fine. She puts them online and all questions are derived from powerpoints. Only 3 grades, 2 midterms and a final

Lectures can seem boring, but are packed with clearly-presented information. Grading system maximizes the opportunity to do well and rewards improvement (midterms won't even count if 2x your final grade is higher than midterm 1 + midterm 2 + final, and midterms can be dropped if one midterm x2 is higher than adding them together). Extra credit too!

SP15: 90 min. class twice a week. No recitation. Homework is extra credit. No quizzes. 2 Midterms and a Final. If you do bad on midterms, the final can be counted as 100% of your grade. Lectures are boring and a waste of time. Just read her PPTs and the book. I only went to lecture to hand in my homework. Tests can be tough(know PPTs inside out)
She's a very sweet lady who genuinely likes micro economics. However she's a very boring lecturer. I generally didn't go to lecture and did just fine.

The lectures can sometimes be long, but it is microeconomics. She is a good lecturer who cares about her students. When I went to office hours, she was incredibly helpful and was otherwise one of the most compassionate professors I have ever been lucky enough to talk to! If you're taking micro, take Lucia Dunn.

Only went to class for the midterms, final and to turn in the homework. Read the textbook and follow the schedule of the course syllabus. Also, make sure you do all the homework (extra credit) because it can add 4% to your grade. Review the PowerPoints the day before the test and you should be fine. Midterms are pretty easy. Final is a bit tricky.

Lucia is adorable and seems to love teaching. Very little work compared to other micro classes. Just 2 midterms and a final plus weekly extra credit problems that can add up to 4% on your final grade. Lectures are kind of long and dry but you don't have to read if you take notes.
She is really boring and has a weird accent. But overall it is an very easy A to get.

Easy class, good lecturer. Went to lecture 5 times. She just goes over powerpoints. If you can AVOID Independence Hall, do it. Offers a lot of extra credit on top of a curved grading scale. To get an A, do the practice probelems after taking your own notes on her slides. Go to recitation. Tricky wording on midterms and final. Rarely used the book.
She is very helpful and be sure to make every concept clear .Midterms are easy but final is a little hard.

The material is extremely easy if you just read the book and follow along with her slides. I went to lectures rarely because they were hard to take away from. She's really incredibly boring and wastes a ton of time trying to settle the class (of 700). It's truly ridiculous. Nice lady, terrible teacher.

Such a big class with just this one little lady in the front. Even though it can be hard to pay attention in lecture sometimes, it is beneficial to still go though. Just two midterms and a final and optional homework and optional quizzes.

Don't waste your time going to the lectures, it's impossible to stay awake. Take notes on the powerpoint slides and go to recitation. She wastes a lot of time on getting the class to settle instead of actually lecturing. Study your slide notes.

I really enjoyed her as a teacher! Sometimes hard to focus because the material was somewhat dry, but she explained everything very well and the exams follow very closely with the notes. Attend class, pay attention, and you'll get a good grade!
Incredibly boring class. I struggle to stay awake every time I go. The exams are way harder than they need to be and her slides are not very clear. The class was just way too big to do well in.

She wasnt too bad as a teacher, but having a class with 700 people was extremely difficult to concentrate. Her class was soo boring. And Her notes werent clear and havent been updated since godknow when. They were full of graphs and not enough explanation. The grade distribution system sucked. Take a smaller class if you can.

Friendly, gives a curve, will to work with you, attendance is not mandatory but if you dont want to buy the book (b/c you really never use it) it recommended you attend all lectures and recitations. Would take her again if i could.
She was nice, but the class was 700 people and she is deathly boring and hard to focus on

In class, everything was easily understandable when she spoke. You never had a problem with comprehending since the book assigned is simple but elaborated reading. The midterms are pretty clean cut as long as you study the powerpoints and reading and final is cumulative.
Really easy class. She's pretty clear when she lectures, but she goes off on tangents sometimes.

I'm afraid she's getting too old. She often misspeaks, saying the opposite of what she means,  leaving it to the few students actually paying close enough attention to correct her. Nice lady sure, but teaching skills are declining. Also, careful picking your TA, mine was pleasant, but barely spoke audible English.
Prof Dunn is the best and super nice professor in my four years at OSU. She is so elegant and well-prepared and so nice to every student, especially the disabled student. I like her soooo... much!!!
There's only 3 grades in the class and the recitation quizzes are for extra credit but a very slim amount. Just read the book and download the slides from carmen.
Midterms & final were harder than necessary
Great professor. Buy her power point slides, go to lecture and recitation, and you will get an A.

She is a good professor.  Her lectures are boring but she give a lot of extra credit and curves the class and you do not need to attend lecture.  Make sure you get the study guide for the course because if you do the questions in it before the midterms or exams then you should get an A.

Very knowledgable, makes tests fairly easy. Textbook is helpful, but she posts all Powerpoints on Carmen, so you can get by without it. Large auditorium, so be prepared for constant talking around you. She tries to maintain order, but the class is just too big. Recommended for majors or GEC.

Oh my gosh, first of all this class material is boring. Second, she just mumbles on about stuff that makes no sense. I didn't take econ in high school, so I was completely lost coming into this class. Her tests are fair if you keep up with the work but UGH someone needs to reconsider the content of this class. It's incredibly boring.

Very nice lady. She genuinely knows her stuff and is passionate about it. Class material is very organized but take good notes on top of the slides because a lot of the things she says are important! It's a boring class but to succeed in this one, really pay attention and don't fall asleep! She explains things so well you might not need the text!

She goes over everything so thoroughly its boring, but if you can manage to pay attention you'll learn the material. She teaches straight from the book, so either lecture or reading will keep you up to date. Pretty simple tests if you do the practice ones. Lots of easy extra credit and no essays. I'd take her again if I could.

Professor Dunn realizes that the 500 people in her lecture are there to meet requirements and not to completely master economics.  She provides examples of all of the questions that you will be asked to solve on exams.  She provides her old finals on Carmen as well as her notes (the notes you actually need, not every word in the book).
I changed my major to ECON after this course. Lucia is amazing she made the topic interesting, easy to understand and relevant all in a 500 person lecture hall format!
Decent teacher, lectures are available online so going to lecture is unnecessary. Exams mirror the "old exam" packet that is online, use that to study. Very easy class.
Pretty boring. Hard final too.

She was an ok teacher.  I think the subject matter in itself was rather boring and most people fell asleep in class.  If you are able to stay awake in her lectures you will do fine but be prepaired to read the book or borrow someones notes if you can't.  Only thing I didn't like is you only have 3 tests which make up your whole grade.

Even though she usually mostly read her powerpoints in lecture, she also explained them in detail and had interesting examples that went along with the main ideas. It is a good class to take to learn some basics about how markets work every day.
A little boring but a fair class. Always willing to help. Easy to get an A if you want it.
Went to class twice all quarter and easily got an A. She curves the class so the top 20% get A's. Therefore you cant argue that shes not fair.  Go to recitation for the extra credit.
she just reads her powerpoint EVERY DAY
She was a good teacher, very optimistic and did a decent job teaching a large class on a boring subject. I thought Dunn was very nice.

It's hard to distinguish if Econ 200 itself is terrible or if it's just Lucia. Avoid this class if you can. Only grades are 2 midterms and final, very minimal extra credit opportunities (20 hw ?s for a whole 1/5 of a point), curved which is nice, but exam questions are VERY confusing and difficult. Subject matter absolutely sucks. good luck.

Easy class, no need to really attend if you read the book. She pretty much just goes over the powerpoints which are online. Exams aren't bad either. Do the extra credit and go to recitation to get the quiz extra credit points.
Rob, the TA, should be teaching this. Rob?? Rob??

She was a very good and fair teacher. The first professor that I have had at OSU that actually taught me some of the material, without me having to learn it all myself. Her exams are very fair and well written. Using the textbook study guide is helpful.  Overall, a very good professor who is interested in and passionate about teaching economics.

pretty easy teacher. just go to class and all the test qs come from lecture. don't bother getting the book, because if you go to class you'll get everything you need to know. her class kinda sucked and a lil boring, but it was easy enough to make it worth takin it with her.

pretty easy teacher...just go to class and all the test qs come from lecture. don't bother getting the book, because if you go to class you'll get everything you need to know. her class kinda sucked and a lil boring, but it was easy enough to make it worth takin it with her.

Went to all but 1 lecture and I think it helped because she explains the slides rather than me trying to teach it to myself. Boring to listen to but if you go to class, it's easy to get a good grade. Go to recitation and get the extra credit!

ECON 200 is a breeze, but it was no thanks to Professor Dunn.  Her long lectures are very hard to get through and she gets off topic quite a bit.  Her slide shows aren't all that helpful so listening to what she says is an unavoidable hazard of the class.  Her grading scale is AWESOME though!  Tons of bonus added in after they set the curve.

horendous. if you feel like lowering your GPA, go for this class. maybe if you have a liking for mumbling professors and watching every letter pop on the slide shows one at a time you'll like her. her grading system is beyond horrible and is most likely the worst teacher i've had at ohio state. ha, good luck taking this class.

shes ridiculous. her exams are straightforward, but only if you understand anything about econ before taking the class.  she doesn't explain things very well and her slides only show the concepts and nothing about application, which is whats on the tests. good luck if you have to take her.
I like professor Dunn, love her class! She is really good at teaching,her slides is excellent, making everything quite straitforward, easy to understand! Because of her, I become interested in Econ.
excellent professor, great slides
This professor was awful- hated listening to her twice a week. Rarely attended lecture. Learned mostly everything from the book and just read over her power points. With a curve, got a B+.
Usually held in a large large lecture hall..my class had 750 kids in it, so if you don't like being overwhelmed and listening to a proof speak from a microphone this isn't the class for you.

I suck with math or any kind of formulas but she made it pretty understandable. She is pretty good at explaining everything, the lectures are just so boring because of the subject. One suggestion is to go to the review sessions held by TAs before the tests. The one before the final helped a ton

She doesn't know how to explain anything. She pretty much just reads what's on the slides. You don't have to show up. Don't bother buying the book. Just print off the slides and study them. Do the extra credit and show up for recitation and you should get an A.
I though that this class was fairly hard, although I did get an A without going to class. I studied outside of class which helps, and get all the extra credit points.

its all about Guns and Budda. ha.  great professor. dont waste your money on the book and buy an older edition for 10 bucks online. you wont look at it anyway. dont bother with the study guide. all you need is to ocme to class , extra cred , and pp slides. Most TA's only speak fluent chinese, except  Banerjee -he's cool. Take it.

I didn't really go to class, since everything is online. Not hard, but be prepared to memorize lots and lots of graphs. Go to recitation, there is extra credit almost every week. It'd be nice if the test were written without mistakes everywhere

Going to class is optional but helps to understand the graphs.  Lectures are boring but she seems genuinally interested in teaching.  Tests are fair, study from old exams.  Take advantage of the extra credit homework.  Also if your TA is bad change it right away, it can make a big difference.  Go to the review sessions.  Pretty easy class overall.

Dunn is the way to get through Econ 200. Never used the book. All exam material is straight from the slides she teaches from, also posted on Carmen. Grading is very fair and usually a curve. It is clear she loves to teach so her class is easy to get through. Recommended
She is the coolest professor I have had, especially for an older woman.  Her class is easy to understand and the exams are staright-forward.

anyone who says this class was hard is probably a retard.  I didn't read or even show up for classes and i still got an A. You only have to study her examples to get an A.  Make sure you buy her slides with the Previous Exams included. Really made the class easy.  If you have logic, you don't really have to know the answers to the question

after the first week i would read the relevent chapters once in a while and show up for tests. i couldnt stand listening to her talk about guns n budda anymore. still did fine in the class. an easy gec
class was a joke, i went to lecture maybe 6 times all quarter, never even opened the book and received a B+ ... if i actually tried i probabl would've received an A

Dunn was a very nice professor.  Lectures were boring and some of the material was hard to understand. The TAs provide minimal help, but they do their best. If you want to succeed in the class, read the book as much as posisble and don't be afraid to ask for extra help.

Econ and my brain do not mesh well, so I actually had a hard time comprehending some of the material, and my TA sucked.  BUT...Dunn really is a very understanding helpful good proffessor.  I showed up an hour late to an exam and she stayed late w/ me so I could take it.  Make sure to read and do the recommended study guide problems.  They help!
SHE IS AWESOME
This class was SO boring... but not exactly hard.  Just try to pay attention.  You can pull it off without going to class if you read the book.
Lectures are boring, but not a hard class if you can pay attention. I would say take AG Econ, though.
Has a great curve system to help you receive an A or B. Try to get a good TA.

Slides aplenty! I hardly was awake for this class because it bored the pants off me. But if you could sit and study slides and memorize graphs it was all easy. Very easy to talk to. Everythink you had to know she told you.
Very easy class. Study the slides and do the practice exams and you should make an A or B no problem. Gives extra credit quizzes to boost your grade as well.
Lectures were dreadfully boring.  The class is not horrible if you get a decent TA (mine sucked!).  Do not expect her to be helpful outside of class she is cofusing and rude.
No Comments
Boring lecture, well organized. TA's not bad.. but not good either. Midterms and grading fair. Lots of opportunities for review
Lectures boring and easy to fall asleep in. Keep on top of the work and you should be fine, just don't fall behind after the first midterm.

Boring lecture.  Very nice but for such a large class you don't really ever talk with her unless you go in to see her.  Class is easy, midterm is realitively easy as long as you skim over reading.  TA's suck.
worst class to ever sit through. lectures off slides. boring lecture. couldnt stay awake. nice lady and very helpful, but not a fun class
No Comments
She teaches only from slides, which all mix in your head after 1/2 hour. Monotonous class, but exam not too hard.
Very nice lady, and very fair. I'm a History major, and I had no trouble getting a B in the course. Offers a ton of extra credit and practice for exams, which have a gigantic curve.
if i could stay awake in her class, im sure she would be a great teacher, but I cant.  She likes to repeat herself alot and thats just annoying.  I hate teachers who cant just get to the point
had a hard time staying awake in class (for the times i actually went).  her powerpoint slides are over the top but she explains well and offers office hours.  go to recitation and you'll be fine

I love her accent, she's straight out of the Ya Ya Sisterhood or something - I can totally picture her sitting on the porch in Georgia drinking a bottle of Southern Comfort. Hard class, nice teacher, go to lecture and read the book!
I enjoyed this class. It wasn't too hard and I learned. SHe also provided plenty of test reviews and practice test problems
Very helpful lady.  She knows what she is talking about, but the lecture was pretty boring.  I skipped class often and still got a B+.
Lectures seemed long but she does really know her stuff. tests were on the difficult side had to study more than i thought but as long as you are really prepared you will be fine.
Nice lady, boring class.
very nice teacher
There are a lot of resources available to students who want to do good in the class. She gives great power points that make (what I found to be) a boring subject seem bearable...and I learned!
One of the better professors at the university in my opinion.  She knows her stuff, and conveys the information well.
She explains things several times over and over again which makes her an excellent teacher.  She does get boring because of this, if she learns how to balance this out, she would be excellent
I have a very hard time stayin awake in that class
Annoying teacher! Never lets class out early. Class is not a breeze, but it aint to tough.

I really liked this class. It can be boring but she is a really nice teacher and insanely easy too. All you have to do is go over her notes the night before and just do your best to understand the concepts. Her exams are easy as hell.
The class is so boring and it sucks taking tests with 700 people but she gives you old exams which are nice!
No Comments
I liked her in general, class is pretty easy
She really wants to help, if anyone needs help, call her and you can see her later that day. Her explanations are clear and she makes the material make sense.
SHE CONFUSES HERSELF AT TIMES WHICH IN TURN CONFUSES ME BUT SHE IS QUICK TO GET LECTURE CORRECTIONS ON THE WEBSITE.
she knows her stuff and her tests are easy
boring, but smart professor...teaches straight from the book that she helped write. lectures are somewhat boring, but covers all material to be on exams very well.
Easy tests but BORING class
No Comments
Very boring all she does is talk
Get that easy GE out of the way.  She will taken your final grade from the final
I was one of those that never showed.  B-.  Annoying voice, dont bother going.
No Comments
Her name is actually Lucia- easy class, but boring at times.
No Comments
ive never gotten an easier C in my life, I took 1 test.
Huge curve.  No one scored lower than a "C", even people who never showed.

summary_comment: This professor offers a class with exceptionally lenient grading standards; students found it nearly impossible to fail, with a minimum passing grade set at just 35%. The grading curve was extremely forgiving, as exam scores could reach 100% with only a 60% performance, and most students, if not all, achieved at least a B- or higher, with many securing As.
